review:
1) It's is mobile game, not a PC game.
2) You can't rotate camera.
3) UI is bad (not terrible, just bad).
4) Enemy AI is bad (just run straight at you).
5) Item Price made no sense; dagger 10 gold, shortsword 12 gold, and torch... 15 gold!!

Not recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198416760533', 'num_games_owned': 486, 'num_reviews': 431, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1662292762}
review:
[h1] Blackguards [/h1]

[h3] Pros: [/h3] [b]üé≠ Deep and Engaging Story[/b] Blackguards boasts a deep and engaging narrative, immersing players in a dark and gritty fantasy world filled with intrigue and moral ambiguity. The story unfolds through captivating dialogues and meaningful choices, keeping players invested in the outcome. üìñüåå

[b]‚öîÔ∏è Tactical Combat System[/b] The game features a robust tactical combat system that challenges players to think strategically and adapt to various encounters. With a diverse range of skills, spells, and equipment at their disposal, players can approach battles in creative ways, adding depth to the gameplay. ‚öîÔ∏èüéÆ

[h3] Cons: [/h3] [b]üîÑ Steep Learning Curve[/b] Some players may find the game's mechanics and character progression system daunting, leading to a steep learning curve, especially for those new to tactical RPGs. The complexity may deter casual players looking for a more accessible experience. üìâüéì

[b]üé® Visuals and Presentation[/b] While the game offers a rich storytelling experience, its visuals and presentation may fall short of modern standards. The graphics lack polish and may appear dated, detracting from the overall immersion and atmosphere of the game. üñºÔ∏èüëé

[h3] Other Drawbacks: [/h3] [b]üéµ Limited Replay Value[/b] Despite its branching narrative paths and multiple endings, Blackguards may have limited replay value for some players. Once the main story is completed, the incentive to replay may diminish, as the core experience remains largely unchanged. üîÅüéÆ

[b]üïπÔ∏è Interface and Controls[/b] The game's interface and controls could be more intuitive and user-friendly, particularly during combat encounters. Some players may find themselves struggling with navigation and interaction, leading to frustration and immersion-breaking moments. üéÆü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

[b]Bad Points[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3869, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1705774129}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand‚Äîthe hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed‚Äîthe hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561199533203036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1705955017}
review:
Should you love the game or hate it? A very difficult decision for ‚ÄúBlackguards‚Äù. The story and the fights are actually quite well implemented. But the details and the surroundings are somehow not consistent. For example, due to the random factor, the fights are sometimes quite difficult and can only be mastered at the second attempt. But what is the reward for victory? There's hardly enough gold to buy even a healing potion and the items you conquer are almost always the same junk. And what to do with the experience? Now with 50 to 500 points, increase one of the more than 50 skills, spells or talents by one point in order to..., yes, to achieve what at all? Ah, a new armor with 2 out of 10 properties better and only one worse than before... is it actually really good now?

In summary, the game hardly rewards the inclined player and instead confronts him with a confusing number system, the actual benefits of which remain largely inaccessible to today's spoiled player. Especially when developing the characters, you hardly know what you are doing and what this will ultimately achieve.

If you're interested in role-playing games, you're welcome to take advantage of the sale, but I can't recommend the game for the full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970958620', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1706275688}
review:
[h3][u][b]CRASHFEAST in 2024[/b][/u][/h3]
After the tutorial the game keeps crashing near every 5 minutes... and no, not ‚Äûonly‚Äú to desktop, it freezes completly, Alt-F4, Task Manager... dont helped anymore, the only soulution left was to push my reset button! I can't remember a game where something like this happens soooo soo often...

[h3][b]? ![/b][/h3]
I tried different graphic and game settings but nothing helped! Maybe i need an old ‚ÄûToaster-Pc‚Äú from the junkyard to play this game??? After a quick research I found out that such problems existing since launch in 2014...

[u][b]Final words[/b][/u]
I only paid about a ‚Ç¨uro for it bundled with some other games and now I wouldn't even take it for free. In my case it is nothing more than a kind of screensaver that freezes the entire PC to be on the ‚Äúreal safe side‚Äù...
I can't recommend it, because it is a game you maybe cant even play.... anymore in 2024!

author: {'steamid': '76561198074085825', 'num_games_owned': 4477, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 2116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2116, 'last_played': 1594592593}
review:
A wolf has torn apart Princess Elanor's body. At least that‚Äôs what I remember. Even though I managed to fight off the wolf, I was arrested and tortured, accused of killing her. Torturer Muratori tried to force some name out of me that I couldn't possibly think of. But I managed to escape, and while I flee my pursuers I have to find out what really happened to Eleanor, prove my innocence and revenge my dead friend, the princess.

Blackguards is a tactical role playing game with an emphasis on turn-based combat. You build a team of up to five different protagonists. As player, you can take on different classes, such as warriors, magicians and hunters.

Your path leads through the Horas Empire to the Aventurian southern metropolis of Mengbilla, into the jungles inhabited by forest people and to the ruins of an ancient lizard civilization.

The game offers a lovingly designed map on which you can move freely. There are towns and villages where you can accept quests, buy equipment or heal yourselves. You will enter dungeons, fight in the wilderness and discover mystical islands.

Blackguards received positive feedback when it was released in 2014. I actually bought Blackguards in 2014, but my start was difficult, so I only played the game briefly. One or two years later I tried again and stopped again. Maybe I wasn't in the right mood. I don't remember.

The start of the game is a hurdle. You escape from prison with a group of three, with weak weapons, and almost naked. You have to take time to carefully upgrade the right characteristics and talents. You need to get used to the turn based battles. After each battle, you gain adventure points that you can use to upgrade skills, collect gold, weapons and armor. Buy additional equipment, clothes, armor, poison, bandages and health potions in shops.

The role playing aspect is a lot of fun. The battles are excellently designed, and the story is great too. Voice acting is superb, in German and English.

The third time I started the game was this year in 2023. Nine years after release! Silly me.
This time I was fascinated by the game. I managed to win the initial battles, carefully defined my group by deciding how to shape each character. A ranger with a bow, a dwarf with two axes, a native with a spear, a noble magician and womanizer, and a witch.

Often, battles are not easy, but I enjoyed the challenge. You can spread skills any way you like, but it's important not to do that. Make sure you upgrade each character in one, or later two, directions. That's the key to success. Create experts in their field.

I read that there are 180 battles in the game. Some of them took me 60 to 90 minutes, just for a single fight, including retries. My play-through took me 85 hours.

Blackguards is a great game that I would not have wanted to miss. I am really glad I played this game. After surviving the first hours, I was hooked. A wonderful game, even if the graphics are outdated. The game still looks very nice, especially the sepia colors are beautiful.

Please note that a couple of achievements are broken.

Also note that the game often starts with a black screen. You only hear the music. In order to fix this, you have to press CTRL+ALT+DEL and then ESC. After that, the game runs fine. No technical difficulties whatsoever during the game. But when you finished the game, about 50% of the time the game freezes. Use the task manager to log out of windows. I assume the game is not fully compatible with Windows 10 and Windows 11.

Pros
- excellent design of battle maps
- player decisions influence the game
- superb voice acting
- realistic dialogues
- very good music
- great sound effects
- great, dark atmosphere
- exciting battles
- addictive
- creates a strong attachment to your characters
- complete freedom of how you want to shape and upgrade the characters in your group
- mature world and story
- comes with a comprehensive manual like in the old days
- runs fine once the game has started

Neutral
- challenging, some battles can be tough but this is based on your tactical skills and the way you trained and equipped your protagonists

Cons
- difficult start
- outdated graphics in cut scenes
- broken achievements
- technical problems when you start and end the game

author: {'steamid': '76561197975270396', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 529, 'last_played': 1703798768}
review:
Mess of a game - avoid.

Why ?
Crashes:
1) Boots with Black screen 50% on time. Requires PC reboot.
2) Other hard crashes regularly.
3) MInimizes game randomly at times.

Game play:
1) Broken RNG _ 90% success skill fail 50% of time.
2) Absolutely terrible Line of sight rules
3) Miserly economy - Potions insanely expensive (1 heal pot = chest armour cost), poor loot 
4) little loot and poor quality and variety.
5) Byzantine stat overload - hard to figure out what stats means what and what is an improvement.
6) Grossly unbalanced scenarios wherein one miss can equal 30 min battle fail 
     - you will re-roll a LOT - NPCS will always hit for 2-3x more and 2-3x your number 
7) Semi-open world with tough unavoidable gatekeeper battles
8) no ZOC - you get zerged.
9) terrible UI - double or triple clicking to get something to work 

Summary - the game is glitchy and unbalanced  - avoid even if free.,

author: {'steamid': '76561198145360860', 'num_games_owned': 218, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 2971, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2971, 'last_played': 1699992342}
review:
Blackguards √© um RPG t√°tico baseado em turnos que busca oferecer uma experi√™ncia imersiva e estrat√©gica. Desenvolvido pela Daedalic Entertainment e lan√ßado em 2014, o jogo tem como objetivo combinar uma narrativa envolvente com combate t√°tico desafiador.

A trama de Blackguards gira em torno de um protagonista personaliz√°vel que se encontra envolto em uma trama de intriga, conspira√ß√£o e magia negra. A hist√≥ria √© contada atrav√©s de di√°logos e escolhas morais, adicionando camadas √† narrativa. Embora a premissa seja intrigante, a execu√ß√£o da hist√≥ria pode ser inconsistente, e alguns personagens podem parecer pouco desenvolvidos.

O aspecto t√°tico do jogo √© uma de suas maiores for√ßas. O combate baseado em turnos exige estrat√©gia cuidadosa, pois os jogadores devem posicionar seus personagens de forma eficaz no campo de batalha, considerando terreno, cobertura e habilidades espec√≠ficas. A variedade de classes e habilidades oferece op√ß√µes t√°ticas interessantes, incentivando a experimenta√ß√£o.

Os visuais de Blackguards s√£o razo√°veis, mas n√£o se destacam. Os ambientes e personagens s√£o representados em um estilo mais sombrio, condizente com o tom geral do jogo. No entanto, algumas texturas e anima√ß√µes podem parecer um pouco datadas em compara√ß√£o com t√≠tulos mais recentes.

Uma desvantagem not√°vel √© a curva de aprendizado √≠ngreme, especialmente para jogadores menos familiarizados com jogos de estrat√©gia t√°tica. A interface do usu√°rio tamb√©m pode parecer um tanto complexa inicialmente.

Em resumo, Blackguards oferece uma experi√™ncia s√≥lida para os f√£s de RPG t√°ticos que apreciam desafios estrat√©gicos.

Nota: 4/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198014492379', 'num_games_owned': 851, 'num_reviews': 500, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1656596112}
review:
General Tips

Plan ahead and specialize, this is not a game where you can spread your ability points all over and come out fine. As a Mage, pick out a few spells you want to focus on and get them up to a decent level (usually 8) before branching out. As a Warrior, pick no more than 1 or at most 2 weapon styles to start with and get real good at them.
Making the main character a spellcaster allows for more flexibility in your group than a Warrior as having more Mages means they can initially specialize on different spells. Later on it'll allow for more castings of the most useful spells. Archers are another solid choice as their Triple Shot is an extrely potent source of damage.
In the Weapon Talents screen you can adjust your characters' melee weapon focus between Parry and Attack. Mages don't usually need the latter, so going full Parry gives them a small survivability boost. Warriors will probably want to do the opposite and go full Attack as landing hits is of critical importance to them.
Have multiple damage types ready, don't fight skeletons with piercing weapons. Keep an eye out for Infantry Damage weapons in particular as few enemies have resistance to it, often making them stronger than they might seem.
Remember to restock potions and other items on your item belts before battles. Larger belts which allow for carrying more items into combat should be your top priority when buying things, followed by the potions themselves.
While most fights happen one at a time, watch out for chains of multiple battles which don't let you rest inbetween them. If it looks like a battle might lead to another, leave one weak enemy alive and spend a little time healing and regenerating your Mages' mana before ending the current fight.
Most characters can only go for one parry attempt (which increases their odds of avoiding a physical hit) per combat turn. Before trying to land a powerful but hard-to-hit physical ability on such an opponent, it can be worth trying to bait out the parry by attacking them with a weaker character first.
You can always purposefully cast lower ranks of spells, which is particularly useful for mana conservation purposes when finishing off low HP enemies.
Remember to update your hotbars with higher rank spells as you learn them. Most spells change functionality on Rank 4, so you'll probably end up with Rank 3 and Rank 4 copies of the same spell on your bars later in the game.
The starting Mage companion Zurbaran starts with Fortifex Arcane Wall on level 2, which allows him to create impassable force fields on the battlefield. Don't underestimate its usefulness! The ability to block enemies from moving through tiles of your choosing can often be far more valuable than any damage spell.
By far the best sources of damage in the mid- to late game are Hammer Blow (for heavy weapons users) and Triple Shot (for archers). Throw your offensive buffs on characters with either of these abilities and watch them wreck the opposition.
Don't bother buying spell books from stores, they cost astronomical amounts of gold and the same spells can often be learned from trainers.
At certain points the game will give you flashback missions where you will only have access to the skills and equipment you get from character creation screen. In some of these you will need to fight skeletons, so starting the game with a source of bashing or fire damage can save you some frustration later.

Talents

Willpower and Body Control are very important on frontliners, but they shouldn't be completely neglected by your backliners either. Body Control in particular can save you a lot of frustration from chain knockdowns which often come from sources your frontliners can't prevent.
You should get Perception to maximum rank on one character somewhere during Chapter 3 as it will then reveal every hidden trap and object on the entire map when used in combat. Just don't forget to actually use it, and make sure to add it to your hotbar.
Warcraft is another priority skill to max out on your Warriors. Most enemies in the game are humanoids and Rank 4 allows for weapons switching without skipping your turn, giving you much more flexibility. Animal Lore is less important but not by any means useless.
Streetwise and Survival are worth learning for everyone ASAP for the +1 Speed they provide, but actually leveling them isn't that important. Traps and Treat Wounds are not especially critical.

Spell Recommendations

Balm of Healing - The most reliable method of healing in the game, get it for all your spellcasters. Remember that healing a character whose HP has hit 0 brings them back to battle. Rank 2 will serve you fine 95% of the time, but sometimes Rank 3 can be useful for wound removal.
Clarum Purum - While only useful occasionally, it's very cheap to level and being stuck with high-level poison can be a pain. Just make sure you don't get poisoned again right afterwards. Don't bother getting it on more than one character.
Ecliptifactus Shadow Force - While not necessarily worth it for its "intended" use, having this spell at Rank 2 allows you to cheese a few levels as the shadow you summon can for example interact with levers and pressure pads. Be creative!
Fastness of Body - Solid survivability boost, particularly in the early game. Offensive buffs become more important as the game progresses, but since the early game is the hardest part it's worth getting to at least Rank 2 early on.
Hawkeye Marksmanship - Definitely worth picking up on someone if your player character is an archer, this + Triple Shot will make short work of practically anything. Otherwise your points are better spent elsewhere as the sole other archer you'll get can cast it themselves.
Ignifaxius Burst of Flame - Solid and reliable damage which bypasses magic resistance. Rank 4 has the same range as the other ranks but can hit up to 3 characters at a time. A few enemies are fire resistant, so you can also grab Thunderbolt for someone as backup if you like.
Karnifilo Frenzy - Probably the strongest spell in the game and every caster should get it to Rank 4 sooner or later. Makes any enemy attack the nearest character, and works on damn near everything. Use it on spellcasters and other enemies in the backlines and watch them kill each other for you.
Magica Infracta - Maybe not as useful as you might expect from a dispel as it also removes your own buffs and debuffs, but having it on one character can be worth it in a few battles.
Move as the Lightning - Rank 3 is the strongest buff in the game, doubling a character's actions per turn and giving them a hefty speed boost on top. Get this on at least two casters and cast it on your Warriors to practically double their effectiveness. Rank 4 is skippable.
Standfast Catlike - Increases your characters' chance to hit in melee, which is absolutely critical for reliably landing powerful but hard-to-hit melee skills like Hammer Blow. The dodge bonus is just gravy.

I wish that Blackguards' character progression system wasn't such a mess, because if it worked, I'd be delighted to recommend the entire low-fantasy role-playing package without hesitation. But character development is such an important and defining part of any RPG that this cluttered and confusing system has a big impact on what is otherwise an excellent tactical game with well-designed battlefields.
Except for its muddled progression system, tactical RPG Blackguards gets a lot of things right.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067538134', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1014, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1014, 'last_played': 1699028215}
review:
There are already many reviews you can read and choose if you want to play this game or not but I'm going to write down my experience with this game, in the slightest chance that it may help someone or even find people that agree with the statements that follow.

First of all, the good things. There is a lot of story and lore behind this game, which is actually intriguing and it was one of the things that made me want to try and finish this game, just to see how it all connects. Don't get me wrong, the story isn't something new that will ripple the waters of storytelling, but instead it's a plot that has been used many times in the past and it works. Considering that I didn't even make it to Lysander gives you a rough idea how early, possibly, I quit.

The second thing that I enjoyed is the talents/skills/spells etc. Especially the part where you have to find a teacher to learn new talents for your characters. This made me take mental notes of different teachers in order to find them again when I have the AP (Adventure Points, you collect them after fights and they are your way to "level up" your character) to learn a new talent for a specific character. Also I liked that you had to be fairly considerate as to how you want to spend your APs (Increase an attribute / Increase a Weapon Skill / Increasing the level of a spell etc.) which could eventually lead into trying different builds for your characters if you wanted to replay the game. 

That about sums up the good parts of the game for myself so let's dive into the negatives.

So, first things first, the most frustrating thing is the ultra mega titan slow combat. I don't know if my PC had an issue with processing the moves of the enemies, but considering that your party almost always has at least 4 people, if you encounter a group of enemies with 4-5 mobs or more, just grab yourself a snack cause you can't make the combat go faster. Apart from that, the thing that made me quit is a fight with a 2 star creature called Iribar Lily ( 2 stars is like an epic monster with the 1 star being a rare, I think, don't quote me on that). In this fight the Lily is in the water and if you approach it it spawns tentacles that poison your characters and on the other hand on the land part of the map there is a wooden troll that is immune to damage. The thing that tilted me off is that after 3 rounds of fighting this Lily and dropping its' health bar to 1/5 it suddenly becomes immune... or to be precise, your characters can't hit it. The spells or the arrows aren't even registered in the battle log. I don't know if this a bug, I searched in the steam forums for any solutions and people just said be prepared it's a damn long fight. I don't know if I should wait a couple of rounds because we changed phases or something but we indeed went into a second phase LET THE PLAYER KNOW! Also in this game, you don't have a couple of rounds to spare. I restarted this fight 7 to 8 times, the RNG was still against me and I was already tired of this game from the previous segment of it, in which my party had to fight 9 battles, with 3 battles between rests, so I just had enough and uninstalled it. 

To finalize, this game isn't worth 10$ imo ( I got this game from a steam bundle ). Yes the story is the good, yes there is a thought behind the stats of your characters but that is pretty much it. The combat could be better, the items could be much better but yeah it gets kinda boring and tiring after a while. If you played this game and you enjoyed, by all means I'm glad! I saw that there is also a blackguards 2, I might check it out later, in the hopes that they fixed certain things and it's a better game in general.

review:
Un jeu de r√¥le tactique dans le monde d'Aventura avec les r√®gles de l'Oeil Noir.

Vous √™tes face √† un jeu qui se d√©roule dans un univers assez basique avec des personnages qui ne brillent ni par leur originalit√© ni par leur profondeur. Pas de r√©elle d√©couverte du monde : les villes sont des cartes postales de jeu point and click et les itin√©raires ne permettent que de relier les lieux d√©bloqu√©s par les qu√™tes.
C'est tr√®s lin√©aire, tr√®s convenu, tr√®s ennuyeux.

L'aspect tactique est, lui, int√©ressant avec de vrais d√©fis. Certains combats sont tr√®s difficiles et supposent que l'on tire le meilleur de l'environnement, de l'√©quipement et de la construction des personnages. Et on peut trouver son compte dans cet aspect du jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009516023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 3640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3640, 'last_played': 1695596480}
review:
This game doesn‚Äôt deserve to be on mixed category. Even the ‚Äúcelebrated‚Äù Metacritic is unfair to the game. Blackguards is a blend of RPG and tactical game that utilizes German ruleset, known as The Dark Eye.
Playing it remembered the classics from Sierra, like Betrayal in Antara (oh those times!).
It‚Äôs a great addition to any fan of RPG and Tactical games. People talk about repetitive battles, but I (and you) can see the game developers tried to increase the variation of the objectives, adding variation and no linear thinking.
Personally, I really liked the voice acting and the interactions between NPCs and companions. There is another feature that I noted:  in combat, the soundtrack adjusts itself depending on your performance: normal at the beginning; dramatic when you are in danger; and, epic when the tide of battle is on your favor.

Added to my favorites, without hesitation.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983740996', 'num_games_owned': 736, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 5084, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5084, 'last_played': 1694729182}
review:
A wolf has torn apart Princess Elanor's body. At least that‚Äôs what I remember. Even though I managed to fight off the wolf, I was arrested and tortured, accused of killing her. Torturer Muratori tried to force some name out of me that I couldn't possibly think of. But I managed to escape, and while I flee my pursuers I have to find out what really happened to Eleanor, prove my innocence and revenge my dead friend, the princess.

Blackguards is a tactical role playing game with an emphasis on turn-based combat. You build a team of up to five different protagonists. As player, you can take on different classes, such as warriors, magicians and hunters. 

Your path leads through the Horas Empire to the Aventurian southern metropolis of Mengbilla, into the jungles inhabited by forest people and to the ruins of an ancient lizard civilization.

The game offers a lovingly designed map on which you can move freely. There are towns and villages where you can accept quests, buy equipment or heal yourselves. You will enter dungeons, fight in the wilderness and discover mystical islands.

Blackguards received positive feedback when it was released in 2014. I actually bought Blackguards in 2014, but my start was difficult, so I only played the game briefly. One or two years later I tried again and stopped again. Maybe I wasn't in the right mood. I don't remember.

The start of the game is a hurdle. You escape from prison with a group of three, with weak weapons, and almost naked. You have to take time to carefully upgrade the right characteristics and talents. You need to get used to the turn based battles. After each battle, you gain adventure points that you can use to upgrade skills, collect gold, weapons and armor. Buy additional equipment, clothes, armor, poison, bandages and health potions in shops. 

The role playing aspect is a lot of fun. The battles are excellently designed, and the story is great too. Voice acting is superb, in German and English.

The third time I started the game was this year in 2023. Nine years after release! Silly me.
This time I was fascinated by the game. I managed to win the initial battles, carefully defined my group by deciding how to shape each character. A ranger with a bow, a dwarf with two axes, a native with a spear, a noble magician and womanizer, and a witch.

Often, battles are not easy, but I enjoyed the challenge. You can spread skills any way you like, but it's important not to do that. Make sure you upgrade each character in one, or later two, directions. That's the key to success. Create experts in their field.

I read that there are 180 battles in the game. Some of them took me 60 to 90 minutes, just for a single fight, including retries. My play-through took me 85 hours.

Blackguards is a great game that I would not have wanted to miss. I am really glad I played this game. After surviving the first hours, I was hooked. A wonderful game, even if the graphics are outdated. The game still looks very nice, especially the sepia colors are beautiful.

Please note that a couple of achievements are broken.

Also note that the game often starts with a black screen. You only hear the music. In order to fix this, you have to press CTRL+ALT+DEL and then ESC. After that, the game runs fine. No technical difficulties whatsoever during the game. But when you finished the game, about 50% of the time the game freezes. Use the task manager to log out of windows. I assume the game is not fully compatible with Windows 10 and Windows 11.

[h1]Pros[/h1] 
- excellent design of battle maps
- player decisions influence the game
- superb voice acting
- realistic dialogues
- very good music
- great sound effects
- great, dark atmosphere
- exciting battles
- addictive
- creates a strong attachment to your characters
- complete freedom of how you want to shape and upgrade the characters in your group
- mature world and story
- comes with a comprehensive manual like in the old days
- runs fine once the game has started

[h1]Neutral[/h1] 
- challenging, some battles can be tough but this is based on your tactical skills and the way you trained and equipped your protagonists

[h1]Cons[/h1] 
- difficult start
- outdated graphics in cut scenes
- broken achievements
- technical problems when you start and end the game

author: {'steamid': '76561198106908375', 'num_games_owned': 256, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1645563246}
review:
This game saved my life.

I am 44.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am now am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube.
So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died.
This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well.
This game reminded me that my gambling addict friend said if I post a review on Blackguards and it gets 350 likes and 150 Awards that he will buy me a case of beer and some vodka So im just gonna leave this here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046123043', 'num_games_owned': 2545, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 4243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4243, 'last_played': 1692849443}
review:
Poison !

Love the game, has its problems, not teaching much is the worst one, but the combat and progression is very satisfactory. But after 70h, I finished the gaming looking for a new game plus to continue playing, It doesnt have one :(
The writing is very funny and clever, not too much ambition for the budget, so overwall very much recomended if you like tactical RPGs.

PS: The game is hard, but has a easy mode, for people that like me already is punished enough by life.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992557240', 'num_games_owned': 679, 'num_reviews': 170, 'playtime_forever': 1918, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1918, 'last_played': 1411491046}
review:
For 30+ hours I tried to get in to the game, hoping it would get more enjoyable as characters are levelled up. No luck. Character builds can be tweaked and adjusted quite nicely, but due to ZERO tactical flexibility in fights (basically only one correct way to approach the fight), all this potential is wasted. I wonder if the game would actually benefit from completely removing "RPG" character development aspects and becoming essentially a puzzle game with pre-made set of characters with which you need to "solve" given scenarios. It's 90% there already...

Another gripe of mine (and countless other players') is the blatant unfairness of every battle. Ranged enemies somehow have longer range than you in many situations and there are usually several waves of reinforcements right when you feel like the tide would turn in your favor.

I think many players DO like their games a bit on the difficult side, but I still maintain that even if balance would be improved, the overall fun factor would still not increase due to the puzzle-like nature of many battles. You feel like your character builds simply don't matter.

The price is not too bad and the game is often on sale, so there's no harm trying it, but I suspect for most players this would not be the first choice of hex-based tactical turn-based combat RPGs.

Hey there! What's up with the random chance of success when using a bandage?

For those who don't get it, a character has quick slots where you can put healing potions, mana potions, or bandages for binding wounds. I can understand when your character, swings a sword or an axe and misses. That's the mechanic. I can also understand when your mage fails to cast spells two turns in a row. no mana wasted, no effect, turn wasted. That's the mechanic too. BUT seriously, a bandage? How can you fail at wrapping a piece of cloth around a body part? What are they smoking over there?

author: {'steamid': '76561198131313706', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1689466191}
review:
I have a brand new gaming laptop, and the game kept lagging.
Besides that, the combat is very clunky, and the game play is just being forced to go through a prescripted story, chapter by chapter, with a  battle in between, Making it feel like there's very little freedom.
I don't care for video game writing -- it's almost always super sophomoric. I don't mind a little background, and lore sprinkled in to get a feel for the world. But I prefer not to be forced to play a subpar narrative with fights. If that's your bag then you may dig this (if it runs properly that is). I'm more of a battle brothers kind of fella.
I would just keep the game because it was on sale for 99 cents -- but the lag is unacceptable. So im gonna ask for my pennies back.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015376233', 'num_games_owned': 427, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 5182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1567, 'last_played': 1689932020}
review:
To anybody who is considering purchasing this game: If you like "western" cRPGs such as Baldur's Gate, Atom, Wasteland III, or Solasta, etc., you'll like the combat very much. And combat is the main part of this game. It comes as a neat surprise though, that the game isn't as much "only tactical combat" as other people sometimes make it seem in the forums. There's a fair share of adventuring, equipment management, sometimes even choices about how to deal with quests. To be completely honest, these elements aren't nearly as prevalent as in the named cRPGs, but still, they're there to a noticeable extent.

Other than that, you mustn't expect some shiny, next-gen graphics; game's somewhat dated in that regard even for its time, if you follow my drift. But it traditionally goes without saying that these things can only add to the unique charm if you keep an open mind. Anyway, you can see the graphics in the gameplay videos, so see for yourself.

I liked the characters and the stories and it felt like a nice bonus. Also, the game's pretty long. I really didn't expect it to be. Again, some people here would say that it is monotonous.They might have a point or two, but I myself wouldn't say so. More than that: the stories differ, the main story surprises with some RP shenanigans, other modern games wouldn't dare to impose on a player nowadays, and the battles tend to propose refreshingly different scenarios and goals from time to time. Things like using the environment to your advantage, or specializing in builds to your liking are also present. In that spirit, I'd argue that 'monotonous' isn't a defining phenomenon.

All in all, I really recommend this piece, it kept me--a guy who's played nearly every "western" cRPG since the dawn of PC gaming--engaged for almost 20 hours straight, and that's a damn great feat in today's "questionable and proper cRPG starved" isometric RPG scene.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961662710', 'num_games_owned': 400, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 801, 'last_played': 1469327738}
review:
Juego malo y malvado.

Fallar, fallar y m√°s fallar.

Juego desnivelado y descompensado, no voy a extenderme mucho m√°s pues creo que ya est√° todo dicho en rese√±as de otros compa√±eros que jugaron mucho m√°s que yo. Simplemente si no quieres sufrir de una manera injusta no lo juegues.

El azar esta demasiado enlazado en la victoria o derrota de los combates, casi nunca depende de la verdadera habilidad del jugador, en mi opini√≥n esta es la gran cagada del juego.

Daedalic acaba de cerrar como productora de juegos para ser solo publisher y no me extra√±a, nunca deber√≠an haber salido de las aventuras gr√°ficas que era su punto fuerte.

Un saludo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198250049674', 'num_games_owned': 328, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 4311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3831, 'last_played': 1695187971}
review: The story was quite compelling and it got me more and more interested as the game progressed and it became more open. With that mentioned, you can't free roam and every location has it's meaning and is connected with some quest, which did feel a bit linear at first, but then it does open up a lot and feels and there is a whole bunch of side quests to explore. The feel unique as well and each adds a sense of misfits journeying together. As for the difficulty, I played on Hard first playthrough and it was indeed quite hard, but still enjoyable, because I got to play around with different strategies and the game rewards you and encourages you to find weakness you can exploit. On the other hand, replaying the game on easy, was very easy and easygoing. There is quite a lot of ways you can improve your characters, but they all use the same currency/xp to upgrade, so requires an extent of planning, which on easy is not really punishing. And the few cons, that I do hope get fixed, is most importantly there's about 6 completely unobtainable achievements, and another handful that some people have managed to get, but they don't pop up for others, and there's minor issues, such as the quest text being wrong (don't remember exact example but it was something of the sort that you just killed a bunch of wolves or zombies and the quest says you just killed ogres) and the icons for characters sometimes don't match the model of the actual NPC. Mainly hoping that the achievements get fixed as it is the major issue, but besides that the game was quite fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082052049', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 2267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2267, 'last_played': 1687822985}
review:
No, just no.
The core tabletop mechanics are fine, but the way the game is carried out makes everything suffer, especially you, the player.
The only way to improve your character is by getting AP to spend on EVERYTHING you can upgrade. you have to distribute it among all the things you can try to get, whether its stats, spells, weapon proficiency, and any special abilities and passives. Each mission will give you roughly 25-50 in the early game, and you need several hundred jut to upgrade one 'attribute' that is only  a 'fraction' of a stat. that, and there is NO free roaming fights or encounters, all fights are fixed and predetermined so you CANNOT try to make minor improvements to your party if a fight is too hard just to take some of the edge off. You are fully stuck with that you see if you have already done all the missions on the map.

Another big gripe is this 'injury' system that reduces your unit's stats based on number of injuries. Yes, they can be cured but the chance is abysmally low. How low? 3% apparently and even if you fail it consumes the consumable item, which there is a limited number of because shops have a limited, fixed number available. Each injury can really hurt your stats, each one reducing your effective accuracy or 'attack' if you're more familiar with dnd/pathfinder styles by 10% injury. and its  not only your attack, its also other stats like your dodge, so at 3 injuries you're down 30% most of your stats, and resting doesn't remove them. it will literally cripple you.

I'm at a mission where you have to rescue a certain npc within 5 turns, which means i have to cross a certain point in the map with any character to clear the rescue side objective. yes, it is possible to finish the map even having failed the rescue and move on, but why are the requirements this absurd? the map is literally a chokepoint bridge where they put down barricade to impede movement, plus traps that, if stepped on, immediately stop your unit movement and forcefully end their turn, plus enemy units can step on them and be perfectly fine. The entire map is literally a genshin impact abyss stall tactic that tries to force you to separate your units to race as quickly as possible to the other side, and then even if you make it, the mission itself still requires you to kill the remaining enemy mobs to actually win, with units that are likely missing half their hp because you had to race for a side objective. 
Why is a side objective this punishing? who benefits from this? do I get a free BJ for completing it because these requirements are absurd. And before you mention "just don't do the side objective' then why is it there in the first place and why put these requirements on steroids?

I cannot recommend this, this feels like a rerun of 'darkest dungeon' levels of "it's stupidly punishing, therefore it's good"

author: {'steamid': '76561198402521885', 'num_games_owned': 623, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1683089414}
review:
Hard to recommend this game.
It has nice art, solid music, characters are likable. But combat, UI and character development is bad.
considering the nature of the game it more upsets you than entertains. I tried to start fresh for 3 times because my character felt bad. You can't grind for XP and have comfortable difficulty level, you'll always suck because with limited skill points you won't be able to cover basic start efficiently. You can start with any class and you'll get mage and tank at the beginning. Mage runs out of mana after 2 hits and misses more than hits. tank is pretty much similar snobby imp (or gnome) who protests every time you heal him. your only chance to survive first part of the game is to make hybrid (bows + magic for healing) so your petty mage will have mana for 2-3 fire spells per battle. That could work, so you add all points into fire skill and bow skill just to find out there's also poison and traps you have no skill to avoid. no big deal you might think, but here comes the worst feature of this game: puzzles. developers want you to complete each fight in a manner they want you to, otherwise you will be swarmed by endless hordes or just will die to much stronger enemy with god skills. each fight has annoying task you should perform: cut the rope, close holes with boulders, reach target in 4 turns, lure troll to gas pit and fry him with fire spell etc. instead of fighting you're running errands for developers. that's so lame. not to mention flashbacks or special missions where they strip you off your gear and force to fight with weapon you're not skilled with.
there are so many things I dislike about this game, it has potential and you can see how developers put an effort to create it, but it's not for me. 

technical:
issues on windows, had to play on Linux (wine with dxvk 1.91) and had stable 60fps without issues. no idea if it will be consistent with Proton results.

review:
[b]Blackguards[/b] to bardzo dobry tytu≈Ç z gatunku turowych strategii rozgrywajƒÖcych siƒô w niezwykle mrocznym ≈õwiecie fantasy, jednocze≈õnie przedstawiajƒÖca g≈ÇƒôbokƒÖ i wciƒÖgajƒÖcƒÖ fabu≈Çƒô w kt√≥rej gracz wciela siƒô w wiƒô≈∫nia skazanego za morderstwo. Wraz ze swojƒÖ pokrƒôconƒÖ dru≈ºynƒÖ indywidu√≥w wyrusza w niebezpiecznƒÖ podr√≥≈º by walczyƒá ze z≈Çem trapiƒÖcym ten ≈õwiat a w ostatecznym rachunku uratowaƒá go przed nadchodzƒÖcƒÖ zag≈ÇadƒÖ. Od gracza wybor√≥w bƒôdzie zale≈ºa≈Ço jak to wszystko siƒô zako≈Ñczy i z jakim skutkiem.

Jest to tytu≈Ç idealny dla ka≈ºdego gracza, niezale≈ºnie od wieku czy posiadanych umiejƒôtno≈õci, rozgrywka poch≈Çonie was na d≈Çugie godziny.

[h1]Ale do rzeczy:[/h1]

Jak ju≈º zdo≈Ça≈Çem nadmieniƒá na samym poczƒÖtku tej recenzji mamy tym razem do czynienia z tytu≈Çem z turowych strategii rozgrywajƒÖcych siƒô w niezwykle mrocznym ≈õwiecie fantasy, opowiadajƒÖcy fabu≈Çƒô w kt√≥rej to gracz wciela siƒô w wiƒô≈∫nia skazanego za morderstwo ‚Äì kt√≥rego poszczeg√≥lne prawdziwe motywy sƒÖ owiane mrocznƒÖ tajemnicƒÖ, kt√≥rƒÖ sam gracz bƒôdzie musia≈Ç rozwik≈Çaƒá.

Nad ≈õwiatem zbierajƒÖ siƒô ciemne chmury, z≈Ço zaczyna wychodziƒá z ciemnych zakamark√≥w, terroryzujƒÖc ich mieszka≈Ñc√≥w. RozwiƒÖzanie zagadki przesz≈Ço≈õci naszego bohatera kryje siƒô w tym mroku dlatego te≈º wyrusza razem z ma≈ÇƒÖ grupkƒÖ wojownik√≥w w niebezpiecznƒÖ podr√≥≈º aby przeciwstawiƒá siƒô nadchodzƒÖcej zag≈Çadzie.
 
Rozgrywka w tym tytule polegaƒá bƒôdzie na szerokiej eksploracji mapy ≈õwiata, konwersacjach z napotkanymi po drodze osobami, wykonywaniu zlece≈Ñ za kt√≥re bƒôdziemy nagradzani r√≥≈ºnymi nagrodami i fundamentalnej, taktycznej walce z przeciwnikiem ‚Äì wszystko to otulone w motyw fabularny kt√≥ry rozwija siƒô wraz z naszymi postƒôpami w grze i podjƒôtymi w jej trakcie decyzjami.

Gracz posiada du≈ºa dozƒô swobody dzia≈Çania, eksploracji obszarowej, jak r√≥wnie≈º mo≈ºliwo≈õci podejmowania i wykonywania misji pobocznych ‚Äì system gry nie narzuca sztywno co powinni≈õcie zrobiƒá i kiedy, to zale≈ºy od was samych. 

[h1]Dalej:[/h1]

W grze postaƒá gracza ma status neutralny, od niego samego bƒôdzie zale≈ºeƒá kt√≥ra ≈õcie≈ºkƒô rozwoju postaci wybierze i czym bƒôdzie walczyƒá ‚Äì tworzƒÖc wariacje szalone idealne dla swojego stylu gry, nie koniecznie sztywnie trzymajƒÖc siƒô schematu wojownika, maga czy ≈Çowcy. A w dalszej perspektywie rozwijajƒÖc poszczeg√≥lne ich umiejƒôtno≈õci, orƒô≈º w taki spos√≥b aby najlepiej zgrywa≈Çy siƒô ze sobƒÖ walczƒÖc dru≈ºynowo.

Walki z przeciwnikiem przypominajƒÖ te z gier X-COM i temu podobnych taktycznych strategii, w kt√≥rej to naprzemiennie decydujemy o ruchu, dzia≈Çaniach poszczeg√≥lnych cz≈Çonk√≥w dru≈ºyny, przy mo≈ºliwym wykorzystaniu obiekt√≥w otoczenia. Przeciwnik komputerowy dzia≈Ça w ten sam spos√≥b ‚Äì wygrywa ta dru≈ºyna kt√≥ra jako ostatnia pozostanie na arenie, bƒÖd≈∫ zostanƒÖ spe≈Çnione inne kryteria zwyciƒôstwa (np. dotarcie do wyznaczonego miejsca / ewakuacja itp.). 

Oprawa audiowizualna jest w tym tytule dobra, choƒá kamera potrafi czasami majtaƒá figle, a samo jej umiejscowienie w po≈ÇƒÖczeniu z t≈Çem otoczenia bardzo czƒôsto siƒô zlewa ‚Äì uniemo≈ºliwiajƒÖc widoczno≈õƒá wszystkich jej miejsc. Zw≈Çaszcza jest to denerwujƒÖce, kiedy przed aktywnƒÖ postaciƒÖ jest pu≈Çapka kt√≥rƒÖ nie mo≈ºemy dostrzec bo kamera zlewa siƒô z kolumnƒÖ, drzewem (itp. rzeczami) otoczenia, maskujƒÖc jej dostrze≈ºenie. Sterowanie jest banalnie proste, bazuje na myszce komputerowej.

[h1]Podsumowanie:[/h1]

Blackguards to bardzo dobry tytu≈Ç z gatunku turowych strategii rozgrywajƒÖcych siƒô w niezwykle mrocznym ≈õwiecie fantasy, przedstawiajƒÖcy g≈ÇƒôbokƒÖ i wciƒÖgajƒÖcƒÖ fabu≈Çƒô owianƒÖ tajemnicƒÖ.

Polecam!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006514188', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 3890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1264, 'last_played': 1682360160}
review:
Would give a mixed recommend if I could.

"Normal" Difficulty is pretty much unbearable.

I consider "Easy" the normal difficulty in this game.

It is still hard in "Easy" only getting "easier" if you passed the middle of the game.

"Easy" does NOT give the enemy less powers - just less HP and magical energy.

Anything else stays the same.<

So giving a 4/10 for "Normal" gampeplay

and 5/10 for "Easy" Gameplay 
(even on easy you hit a wall end-game when you skilled not like the two spells you need on a certain level to win a neckbreaker fight to even get to the end fight)

Pro:

-Nice storyline
-likable group of scoundrels
-interesting side quests (though everything results in a battle)
-Elaborate Skill system to build you group how you like
- Build your own party with interactive skills
- After a harsh Chapter 1+2 as for choking no booty, no money and no skills it gradually opens up and mid-game turns a bit around as for difficulty.
Still "Normal" is way to harsh. Playing it on "Easy" and then it becomes a "good" experience feeling like normal difficulty.

Negative:
- VERY Negative: Game breaks it's own rules.
Example:
Your archer are limited as for range and sight hindered by terrain, barrels etc. and cannot shoot
ENEMY NPC Archer ignore siight hindrance and shoot from one side of the map to the other
Same goes for mages PC vs NPC
Which has devastating effects
If a game breaks it's own rules for the other side - really HARD no-go
- enemies are always there in masses - due to the given mechanics above this is just unfair fighting
Also they are on NORMAL difficulty better, have tons of healing or astral potions which you cannot even afford most of the time 
- There are traps - literally EVERYWHERE
Take a step - welcome! TRAP! You are hit hard, most of the time even wounded and/or poisoned
- Due to the one action per turn limit you are severely messed up
Example: Someone trips while surrounded. You need ONE TURN to stand up and do nothing. But when you are surrounded by 3 foes and the next one trips you also (they mostly spam same atteack) - surprise! You are down again and eat between one and two attacks and can do nothing as the other group members are also beset by 2-3 foes. Same goes for healing. You need one turn for it. So if you heal a companion either of poison or giving HP you lose a vital turn where you can take down one foe.
- Enemies HP bloat while low DPS output
You need 2-3 well placed hits to kill one enemy. But the damage output is low. So you scraping by while often enemies hit you with 3 to 5 times (!) more dps output. Add to that they outnumber you...well, you guess how it goes.
- Wounds are totally crippling
If you get too much Vital Damage there is a chance to get a wound. ONE gives you -2 to everything. But it is not uncommon to get 2 or 3 with one hit. Given you are totally outnumbered you struggle to heal your characters but are peppered all the way. Plus the mass of traps...you try to retreat walk into a trap. 
Wounds are often game breaking as you have battle "chains" where you can't heal or rest in between.
You get a totally fresh batch of again enemies outnumbering you (or if you are lucky the numbers are even) and your group starts crippled
- "Normal" difficulty is lie
"Normal" difficulty is a totally stacked against you. Level up? Welcome the mobs you meet also level up ans are slightly better than you plus break the rules as above. "Easy" is Normal for me. And even there you are frustrated due to the rulebreaking for NPC.
- Loot is miserable and you can barely equip yourself
Also you lose your whole equipment several times during the game and need several battles to even get it back. Yeah, right. Totally motivating when I barely got my "good" gear together and POOF - it is gone. Due to story reason.


So again:

A game hampered by mechanics stacked against the players. 

Every step - be it low loot, nothing to buy in stores, low XP, Mechanics that are not for NPC while they hinder you group, Difficulty "NORMAL" which is anything but Normal, totally overstacked numbers of traps each map.

Will play it through but only on EASY.

That is bearable - but even there you grind you teeth in frustration as you are hindered and hampered by rules limiting range and with sight hindrance.

And which do not appy for you enemies which great you from one side to another whatever sight hindrance or range it is with withering spells and ranged fire.

And you cannot reply as...for you there are "rules".

As I said:

No go.

If there is a combat system same rules need to apply for the enemies.

Especially as they outnumber you every time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972650789', 'num_games_owned': 956, 'num_reviews': 195, 'playtime_forever': 1123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1123, 'last_played': 1393634341}
review:
2014: In the midst of the Great CRPG Depression. I remember being so desperate for a decent RPG at this point I'd play nearly anything that came out.

This game was decent enough, but the story, combat, and skill progression didn't do it for me.

Not a strong recommendation unless you're positively desperate for a some turn-based hex combat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060116331', 'num_games_owned': 277, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1631, 'last_played': 1679983747}
review:
I am a big fan of tactical, turn based combat. I went in really wanting to like this game, and I'll say the story has me intrigued, and the characters are likable, but gameplay-wise, skip this one. The slow animation, the boring and unfair combat, the lack of variety in NPC classes.

There are much better games out there doing the same thing.

review:
Vorne weg, ich bin ein DSA Nerd und spiele DSA seid der Zweiten Version.
Warum ist das wichtig?
Viele Negativen Rezensionen bem√§ngeln den Zugang zum Rollenspiel, vergessen aber leider das Blackguards, kein reines Rollenspiel sein will und genau da sehe ich den Pluspunkt des Spieles. Denn f√ºr ein Strategie Spiel holt Blackguards eine Menge aus dem DSA Kanon raus.
KLar sind einige Missionen (gruftasseln) m√ºhevolle Flei√üarbeit und grafisch ist auch nicht mehr Taufrisch. Daf√ºr finde ich die deutsche Synchro sehr gut ausgesucht und dadurch sehr stimmungsvoll.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201246082', 'num_games_owned': 3221, 'num_reviews': 1486, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1654874926}
review:
Blackguards, Alman oyun st√ºdyosu Daedalic Entertainment tarafƒ±ndan geli≈ütirilmi≈ü bir taktiksel rol yapma oyunudur. Oyun, Orta √áaƒü Almanya'sƒ±nda ge√ßen bir karanlƒ±k fantastik √∂yk√ºy√º anlatƒ±r ve oyuncularƒ±n zorlu bir d√ºnyada hayatta kalma m√ºcadelesine odaklanƒ±r.

Oyunda, oyuncu bir grup kahramanƒ±n liderliƒüini √ºstlenir ve d√º≈ümanlarla dolu bir d√ºnyada sava≈üƒ±r. Oyuncular, kahramanlarƒ±nƒ±n yeteneklerini geli≈ütirir, e≈üyalarƒ±nƒ± y√ºkseltir ve stratejik sava≈ü taktikleri kullanarak zafer elde eder. Blackguards, turn-based sava≈ü sistemine sahiptir ve oyuncular, kahramanlarƒ±nƒ±n pozisyonlarƒ±nƒ± ve hareketlerini dikkatlice planlamalƒ±dƒ±r.

Oyunun en ilgi √ßekici y√∂nlerinden biri, karma≈üƒ±k ve detaylƒ± hikayesidir. Oyuncular, karakterlerin arka planlarƒ±na, niyetlerine ve √∂yk√ºlerine daha derin bir anlayƒ±≈ü kazanarak kendilerini olay √∂rg√ºs√ºne kaptƒ±rƒ±rlar. Oyun, ayrƒ±ca karanlƒ±k ve yeti≈ükin temalarƒ± i≈üler ve oyuncularƒ±n kararlarƒ±, hikayenin gidi≈üatƒ±nƒ± etkileyebilir.

Blackguards'in grafikleri, detaylƒ± karakter tasarƒ±mlarƒ± ve zengin ortamlarƒ±yla dikkat √ßeker. Oyunun atmosferi, Orta √áaƒü'ƒ±n karanlƒ±k ve acƒ±masƒ±z d√ºnyasƒ±nƒ± yansƒ±tƒ±r. Ayrƒ±ca, oyunun sesleri ve m√ºzikleri de atmosferi g√º√ßlendirir ve oyuncularƒ± oyuna daha da √ßeker.

Ancak, Blackguards'in bazƒ± dezavantajlarƒ± da vardƒ±r. Oyun, karma≈üƒ±k ve derinlikli hikayesi nedeniyle bazƒ± oyuncular i√ßin aƒüƒ±r olabilir. Ayrƒ±ca, oyunun zorluk seviyesi y√ºksektir ve bazƒ± oyuncular i√ßin sƒ±kƒ±cƒ± hale gelebilir.

Sonu√ß olarak, Blackguards, karma≈üƒ±k hikayesi, zengin karakter tasarƒ±mlarƒ± ve atmosferik d√ºnyasƒ±yla RPG oyunlarƒ±na ilgi duyan oyuncular i√ßin ideal bir se√ßenektir. Ancak, oyunun y√ºksek zorluk seviyesi ve bazƒ± oyuncular i√ßin aƒüƒ±r hikayesi, herkes i√ßin uygun olmayabilir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044747787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4105, 'last_played': 1676211288}
review:
As a lover of games like Neverwinter and Pathfinder, this game is NOT enjoyable. There's far too many battles with stupidly frustrating mechanics and rng, and the amount of times I've misses with 90-95% accuracy attacks CONSECUTIVELY makes me want to punch a brick wall.
Do not recommend, your money is better off spent elsewhere, even if this game was free.
*Edit: My archer also missed a 100% shot on an inanimate object..

author: {'steamid': '76561198075672651', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1486259948}
review:
I am reviewing every game in my library and this is the 28th. I remember getting this game around the time it released or a year after. And to be honest this game is rough. 

I have played this game several times, and I mean several. I have lost count of how many times I have tried playing this and enjoying it. But I just simply do not find the interest. There might be something about the art, or the gameplay or the way the combat system works. But it just does not do it for me. I have seen reviews of people liking it saying there is content while others bashing it. 

I in the end cannot recommend a game, specially of the Fantasy RPG genre that I have tried to like and play several times but never managed. I'd generally say don't buy this game and look for something else to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060733782', 'num_games_owned': 636, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 2126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 217, 'playtime_at_review': 1329, 'last_played': 1709804768}
review:
Dogshit game. How did i even play it for so long in past? No idea. Maybe for the sentiment of Dark Eye system and maybe i played on normal difficulty which was somehow balanced. For long i didn't get so much fucking frustration out of a game. I spit on this. I'll try the 2nd installment as it was better, compared to this travesty.

I'll give but one annoying and imbalanced scenario:
6 enemies vs my 4 allies - 1 of which is basically useless because it's forced to be placed behind a river that ALWAYS knocks you down and makes you useless for two turns and then repeat that cause the river is two turns wide. By that point that significance makes the fight lost. 
Now with the 3 characters i need to focus on one enemy and PRAY i can kill them in one turn, otherwise A HEALING CRYSTAL WILL GET THEM BACK TO FULL OR CLOSE TO FULL HP AND TREATS THEIR WOUNDS. Meanwhile in one turn enemies are able to take half of one of my characters HP if not more and my healing doesn't cure wounds and healing here only prolongs the loss cause the fucking crystal restores them fully anyway, while i'm getting weaker. Even if i kill one enemy it's still 5 vs 3 and in 2/3 turns one of my fighters dies and then outpacing the crystal healing i can kiss fucking goodbye. Not to mention WHY that crystal is indestructible??? Even immune to some damages wow! Not that i haven't triend using 6 attacks on that thing, where that would kill even the stronger enemies. Very thought out game and balanced. Fuck this piece of shit.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973304427', 'num_games_owned': 256, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1674490668}
review:
Blackguards es un juego de rol y estrategia que ofrece una experiencia emocionante y desafiante. Una de las cosas positivas del juego es su sistema de combate, que es t√°ctico y requiere una planificaci√≥n cuidadosa para vencer a los enemigos. El sistema de desarrollo de personajes es tambi√©n profundo y personalizable, lo que permite a los jugadores adaptar a sus personajes a su estilo de juego.

Adem√°s, la historia es intrigante y bien escrita, con una gran cantidad de giros y vueltas emocionantes. El dise√±o de los personajes y los escenarios tambi√©n es impresionante, con un gran detalle y una gran variedad de entornos.

Sin embargo, una de las cosas negativas de Blackguards es que puede ser un poco dif√≠cil de entender para los jugadores menos experimentados debido a su complejidad en cuanto a mec√°nicas y sistemas, especialmente en el sistema de combate, puede requerir un tiempo para dominarlo completamente. Adem√°s, algunas de las decisiones en la trama pueden resultar predecibles y poco sorprendentes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198205118005', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 855, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 855, 'last_played': 1673693198}
review:
Pues otro a√±o, otro intento y sigue sin convencerme. 
Creo que es la cuarta vez que intento jugar y pasarme este juego, pero una vez m√°s se me resiste. No es un mal juego, supongo que los fans de este genero les encantar√°, pero para mi tiene varios puntos que lo hacen aburrido. 
La historia es totalmente lineal y con pocas opciones de roleo. El sistema es desconocido, tienes que aprender por prueba y error y en lo que se refiere a las capacidades de los personajes, te puedo obligar a empezar desde cero. La historia es lenta y tosca... las ciudades carecen apenas de inter√©s. El modo de aprender habilidades no esta mal, pero al ser limitados los encuentros, no tendr√°s oportunidad de aprenderlas cuando realmente quieras. El tema experiencia y oro... o lo haces todo perfecto o te faltar√°n todo el tiempo. 

Me gusta la m√∫sica, me gustan los mapas, los enemigos, los personajes... pero al final es tan tedioso, lineal y limitado, que se me hace aburrido. Una pena, por que de verdad me gustar√≠a que me gustar√°, pero no se pudo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198321902368', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1673316542}
review:
This game has all the ingredients of a classic Turnbased RPG. At least as far as combat goes. 

It is very unforgivingh though. If you do like a hard game this is the game for you. If you do like it a bit easier and being easily guided into a game, well, then this is not the game for you I guess. 

After the short introduction, a kind of tutorial, all you have are some weak armor parts and some more or less useless torches that uses the skills of maces to be wielded. Maybe a bow as well, however you will end up missing with that one unless you spend points into building up using a bow. You will have too small amount gold to buy any sword. The few coins you have you will need to spend on a belt. That is the only way you can have any healing poition or bandages with you in combat to use. Your spell casting character will run out of the equivalent of mana and be useless after a few spell castings, unless you have built up his bow skill. You keep missing blows even with a 75% or even a 90% chance to hit. 

Already at the first missions combat I failed, failed and failed. It took me 5 attempts to finally beat the AI opponents, grave lices, in one of the battles and yet two of my charcters were knocked unconsious and only the last one barely survived and managed to kill the last opponent with just a small amount of life left.

You need to go back and spend coins on resting at the inn, to rebuild that "mana" between each combat at the starting location. Once done with the last combat the innkeeper is gone so you can't replenish that way before venturing out. That is just how it goes. As I said, a very unforgiving game design. Might be too stressful and frustrating for some. It's rare that I feel stressed and frustrated at a turnbbased game, since after all you have time to think and act, but with this game I feel frustrated and tempted to just rage quit a lot. So if that's your cup of tea, then I recommend this game for you. However it is not for the faint of heart. 

I recommend that you read some class guides and hints before jumping into the game. Just to make it a bit less punishing to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202174298', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1670391177}
review:
Meh, this is not the game for me, although maybe others will like it, if they have the patience to learn all of its obtuse mechanics and the tolerance for its difficulty spikes.

I don't like when games teach you mechanics via "tutorial dumps." Sure, it works in a way, but it's not natural, and it comes across as lazy. Blackguards dumps way too much information on the player at once, and it's simply overwhelming. Which is unfortunate, because my impression is the game has some interesting ideas. I don't play games so I can be treated like a scholar with too much time on his hands; I play games so I can feel like I'm actually playing something. 

One thing I absolutely cannot abide is abrupt difficulty spikes. Unfortunately, Blackguards has one of the worst ones I've ever seen, and that's why I decided not to continue. Sorry, it's just not worth it. I start out fighting groups of 3-4 enemies. Okay, that's cool. And then all of a sudden, I'm fighting 6 enemies who deal twice as much damage as I do, and somehow have higher accuracy than I do. There's nothing I can really do with the terrain, either: no crates to knock over, no traps to trigger, no chokepoints to take advantage of. It's just an unfair 3v6 fight where I'm outclassed. What's the fun in that?

The story, as with most CRPGs, is run-of-the-mill stuff. Wooden dialogue, cliched and tired fantasy worlds with the same predictable humanoid races. Not very compelling if you ask me. 

Maybe there's some cool stuff in this game if you have the patience for it, but I don't. There are lots of games to play, and in my experience, games don't usually start off as lukewarm and suddenly become amazing. As far as hex-based SRPGs go, I'll stick with the tried-and-true Katauri King's Bounty games, which start off excellent and remain excellent throughout.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022142284', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 1124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1124, 'last_played': 1669590080}
review:
Wow, what a bargain I stumbled into.  I just got this on sale for 99 cents and can't believe how much fun it is.  Put in 18 hrs and still just made it to chap 3, and the end is no where in sight still LOL.

The banter is my favorite part, the two companions you get at the start are very lovable and writing/story is pretty good.  The combat system is very nice, grafix are totally fine for this kind of game.

Its Certainly worth the full asking price if you ask me, I am thrilled I happened upon this during such a low sale price.

If you are a fan of turned based RPG and overhead view, you should try it out.  Their is a demo so no risk and if you buy it, you get to even save your progress.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116647017', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 520, 'last_played': 1668945992}
review:
Leider sehr unfair, mit hohem Frust potenzial und verbuggte Errungenschaften.

Die Story ist besser als bei Blackguards 2, aber nicht gut.

Die Umsetzung ist bedauerlicherweise sehr unfair, der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist recht hoch, die Trefferwahrscheinlichkeiten der eigenen Helden l√§cherlich gering und man ist st√§ndig pleite.

Die Ausr√ºstung, die man durch K√§mpfe von Gegner erh√§lt, ist meist nur wenig brauchbar und noch weniger wert.
Ausr√ºstung bei H√§ndlern gibt es nur wenig und das, was es gibt, ist sehr teuer, sodass man entscheiden muss eine m√§√üig gute R√ºstung f√ºr einen der Helden zu kaufen oder je einen Heiltrank f√ºr jeden, denn mehr kann man sich nicht leisten.

Die Gegner sind immer in der √úberzahl, sind deutlich besser ausger√ºstet (aber man bekommt diese Ausr√ºstung nach dem Sieg nicht) und treffen deutlich besser als die eigenen Helden.

Die angezeigte Trefferquote ist nie zutreffend.
Selbst bei einer angezeigten Trefferquote von 100% (sehr selten) gehen Schl√§ge, Fernangriffe und Zauber daneben.
Meist liegt die Trefferquote zwischen 45% - 80%, aber darauf ist kein Verlass, selbst bei 80% gehen auch mal gerne 3 Angriffe hintereinander daneben. Nat√ºrlich nur die der Helden, die Gegner treffen meist sogar mit maximalen Trefferpunkten.

Die Sicht wird oft erschwert oder ganz verdeckt in den Arenen.
Im Men√º sind l√§ngere Erl√§uterungstexte verdeckt und nicht zu lesen.

Zudem sind offenbar immer noch einige Errungenschaften verbuggt und somit nicht oder nur mit Cheats erreichbar.

Das mit installierte Handbuch ist nur auf Englisch.

review: The game is very linear.  It is a very basic tactical, turn based, fantasy combat game.  If you take the time to save often,figure out the right order to clear each area and you like more turn based tactical fantasy combat, you might like it better than me.  If there was a neutral vote, I would have taken that before a positive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118082520', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 6158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1679, 'last_played': 1667532925}
review:
Good.... Seriously great on sale!
Not the easiest game to play through, without having to redo it again... and probably again. As there is a bit of a learning curve and a very over complicated skills/attributes tree. It's not obvious at first, that you need to upgrade a spell or skill by eight times to get to the second level of it... That could have been clearer and I've distributed the action point quite evenly and hit a wall in a fight at the end of chapter three - beginning of four. which has two ogres and three wizards to defeat in a limited number of turns (Less than 15% have the achievement for chapter 3 completion, but it's after that, when it gets hard).  The first 4 hours of game play are exceptionally slow and the most linear, but I found it got better as the characters started to build and the challenges became more dynamic and interesting.   

The game is very well made however and the fighting is quite change-able... making it both fun and challenging. I feel a bit restricted in the path of the adventure and following the main quests will find yourself doing the wrong mission too soon and getting stuck. As the game states, regular saving is very important despite the auto save feature. The personalities of the other characters is great and the background music is fine. It has puzzle elements to the battles, as there are environmental factors in the battles, which adds nicely to the combat. It is slow paced but I'm enjoying it, but unless you use your action points very wisely it is frustrating and obviously a game that most don't finish without the use of a guide to stats, spells and special ability allocation. Solid 7.5/10 will be a shame if I don't complete it. There are more modern games out there and the story does meander with a lot of travelling around in circles.... this isn't an RTS like Original Sin but it is 79 pence on sale and obviously made with a lot of love, it requires patience and a love of turn based combat.

[u]les - :[/u]

     - √ßa ne sert √† rien d'avoir des armes √† deux mains, les d√©g√¢ts suppl√©mentaires √©tant n√©gligeables par rapport √† la perte de protection du bouclier.
     - les comp√©tences dans l'arbre ne sont pas claires sur leur effets (combien de d√©g√¢ts suppl√©mentaires ou de chance de toucher par niveau de comp√©tences d'arme par exemple)
     - dialogues: la photo/avatar du personnage qui nous parle ne correspond pas du tout √† sa vraie t√™te quand on le voit sur son stand ( ex: photo d'un jouflu riche de la cinquantaine habill√© de soieries quand le perso du stand est un barbu commun de la quarantaine max qui est habill√© avec du cuir, typ√© chasseur...)
     - histoire qui se veut myst√©rieuse, mais qui donne surtout l'impression d'√™tre flou. √ßa TRAIIIIIIIIIINE en longueur.

[u]En somme[/u], une ambiance, un gameplay et un arbre de comp√©tences plut√¥t sympas et coh√©rents g√¢ch√©s par une rigidit√© lin√©aire, un al√©atoire mensonger, un manque de clart√© des effets concrets des comp√©tences et la platitude non pas tant de l'histoire mais plut√¥t de sa narration.

Blackguards ne m√©rite pas un pouce rouge, ni un bleu, mais un gris.
En promo, √ßa reste un achat convenable qui peut passer un peu le temps sympathiquement d√®s l'instant o√π l'on n'en attend pas trop.
