{'steamid': '76561198061169258', 'num_games_owned': 615, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2179, 'last_played': 1569231174}
review:
tl;dr "[Character] must roll a 19 or lower to hit, rolls 6, attack misses" 5.5/10

This review was really tough for me, I honestly wish there was a "meh" option. But ultimately I've decided its on the lower end of meh, thus I cannot recommend this to the average person. This game is one where its player must be highly tolerant of glitches and general wankery. I thought I was that person, I play a lot of eurojank, and I played the steam ports of the first 3 fallouts without the patches. But apparently this game was my limit.

To elaborate further, the biggest glitch I run into is that this game seems to lock up about every 5-7 loading screens, requiring a restart, which is pretty frustrating, but not a dealbreaker for me, thats only a few seconds. And then another bug after another after another. Another one that stands out was where I lost a battle because my final two characters who were both at full health got knocked down, not out, by a spell that did 4 damage. Ordinarily this would just mean that they would get up after a turn, but the game for whatever reason decided that I had lost, requiring a restart of a rather lengthy battle. The third and final standout was one where doors wouldn't open. Cutscenes are also pretty frequently bugged as well, overall the game is in need of a bit of love.

On to the review proper.

Story/Setting: A lot of people are touting it as the games main draw. I'm inclined to disagree, the story is a fairly standard campaign length rpg module kinda story. If you've played any tabletop you'll know what I mean. The setting itself isn't as alluring as people make it out to be either, I don't know if its just this games portrayal or not, but the Southlands kinda seemed like a Forgotten Realms esque generic fantasy place, designed to be malleable enough that you could run into anything. I mean, the systems main play setting is literally called "Aventuria". This is probably a personal thing, but I usually prefer my fantasy settings to have their own flavor, aesthetic and themes and stick to them (think Lordran, Middle-Earth, the Witcher) The story itself is basically a flavor of the week apocalypse cult. Its not bad by any stretch of the imagination, its not memorable either, you'll probably be a step or two ahead of where the plot wants you to be. It also seems to be going at the angle of a morally grey group of adventurers, kinda of a rougeish band, but it never really delivered on it. I never felt like I wasn't doing the right thing, I never even felt like I was doing something that morally grey.

Characters: I'll put these guys in their own separate category because the characters are much better than the story they are in. Each one is a lot of fun, and is pretty colourful, even if none of them are very ground breaking. Even the MC seems to have a personhood thats completely independent of you. Some interesting combinations you don't see too often like a pothead elf and your bizzaro aristocratic wizard are nice touches and pump much needed life into a standard fare story.

Non-Combat Stuff: Navigation is a series of menus, going from one place to another on a world map is watching a dot move, going through cities is essentially just a series of option menus and dialogue boxes, dungeons consist of clicking on what room you want to go to.

The Dark Eye RPG Adaption/Combat: Its... okay. I read early on that you had to build your characters very specific ways to make them viable, which is true enough I suppose, maybe its the German half of the family but I had little trouble intuiting how to do it. Magic doesn't play as huge a role like it does in DnD and pathfinder, which are my standard fare, which is fine by me, and I usually had by mages doubled up as marksman, which is what they were doing most of the time. The talent point thing was a little confusing at first, but I began to understand it with time, I can imagine its a pain in the ass to do on tabletop though. I had all the details open in the battlelog because I like to see what is making me miss. Speaking of missing, I don't really understand if its just a bug, or something the battlelog isn't reporting, I seem to miss often in spite of rolling well under the target number to hit an opponent. Which leads into my next issue, the battlelog itself has a few issues with how it conveys information, and a  lot of the time it seems like I can't tell whether its trying to tell me the chance of something happening, or not happening. 
My biggest issue is with the initiative system. There are several encounters in the game where you have things rapidly dropping in and out of combat, and frankly, this system was NOT designed for it. For example, in one mission you have to fend off giant flying lizards harassing some poor sucker in the swamp in the last act of the game, the lizards leave when they take over a certain threshold of damage. But they come in random numbers at fixed intervals, and this is where the problems start. They come in at the end of your turn, though sometimes in the middle, and get a free action, then next turn starts, and they get another action. So you have something dropping in and getting two free hits on an escort mission, multiplied by up to three spawning simultanously, and you have basically no way to plan against or prevent it except praying the numbers roll lucky, and that isn't a a good thing.

Role-Playing: Basically non-existent, you have a few choices about how nice or mean you are, doesn't do much of anything, other than maybe affecting the loyalty of a single companion.

Overall, I want to like this game, but I can't recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118676399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3252, 'last_played': 1569440238}
review:
Ich verstehe die ganzen negativen Kommentare nicht. Ich fand das Spiel super. Witzige Dialoge und interessantes Kampfsystem. Normalerweise mag ich keine K√§mpfe, aber bei diesem Spiel hat das Spa√ü gemacht. Man muss halt ein bisschen √ºberlegen, was man macht. Hab das Spiel auch nicht auf Hard sondern auf Normal gespielt. Mich interessiert mehr die Story. Konnte auch alle K√§mpfe erledigen mit maximal einem zweiten Anlauf. Also war v√∂llig in Ordnung. Klar, die ganzen fehlgeschlagenen Zauber nerven am Anfang, aber wenn den Charakter dann √ºber die besonderen Talente aufgelevelt hat, geht das alles ganz ausgezeichnet. Aber klar, w√§re es auch sch√∂n, wenn auch mal die Zauber der Gegnerseite versagen w√ºrden. 

Ich habe einige angefangene Spiele in meiner Bibliothek, Blackguards ist das einzige, das ich spannend genug fand, bis zum Ende zu spielen. W√ºrde das Spiel auf jeden Fall nochmal kaufen und hol mir auch den zweiten Teil. Hab schon mehrere Daedalic-Spiele gespielt. Sind bisher alle sehr gut gewesen. Blackguards geh√∂rt dazu. Wer gerne taktisch vorgeht, ist hier gut bedient.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087734465', 'num_games_owned': 162, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 909, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 777, 'last_played': 1568883405}
review:
Wow.
***DO NOT PLAY THIS GAME***

I have been gaming since the 80's floppy disks. This is by far one of the most frustrating games I've ever experienced. I'm not sure of the system they use to determine hit %(random number generator from what I read) but the system is absolute TRASH. I've never seen so many spell and hit failures IN A ROW when the chance to hit is 90-95%. Oh but I'm supposed to take in to account the enemies skills and buffs?.... How do you explain those same failures on buffing yourself? LOL 2-3 times  in a row spell failure buffing yourself at a 75-90%???

This does really apply to the AI enemies it appears. 

The only reason I've slogged this far was that I paid so little for this game. Im winning and advancing but man is this tedious and not fun. I've found myself laughing in disbelief after spell and hit failure streaks. I think I continue to play just to see how often my characters fail. Maddening.

Save yourself 99 cents and don't buy this game. Time is money and this is a complete waste of your time. Holy crap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198257119525', 'num_games_owned': 747, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 3741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3741, 'last_played': 1568595001}
review:
Ce n'est pas un mauvais jeu, mais est-ce pour autant un bon jeu ?

  Il y a de bonnes id√©es, c'est certain. Des critiques portent sur les graphismes, mais √† mon sens, ils ne sont pas moches non plus. Pour un jeu au tour par tour, avec des combats sur grille hexagonale, c'est m√™me plut√¥t relativement joli. Et de toute mani√®re l√† n'est pas le principal (dans un tout autre registre, je joue toujours aux Combat Mission et l√†, √ßa pique, pourtant c'est toujours un r√©gal !).

  Non, le principal, c'est l'histoire. Or, l'histoire, on s'en bat vite le plexus (ou autre chose, √† chacun ses vices !). Le principal, ce sont les personnages. Sauf que l√†, les personnages on s'en contrefiche vite l'escarcelle (√ßa ne veut rien dire, mais √ßa sonne bien pour un jeu m√©dieval-fantasy). Alors quoi, le syst√®me de jeu ? Ben, c'est pas si mal et c'est l√† que sont les bonnes id√©es, avec quelques trucs sympas quant aux options de combats, aux techniques que peuvent mettre en oeuvre tel ou tel personnage selon les armes qu'ils tient, etc. Malheureusement, √ßa fait peu alors qu'on attend justement une alchimie entre une histoire dont on se souvient en cours de partie, des personnages auxquels on s'attache. Juste un syst√®me qui pourrait le faire pour un jeu d'escarmouches.

  Pour ne rien arranger, c'est tr√®s punitif, trop au regard du d√©faut d'√¢me. Pas d'√©quilibre et m√™me en facile, certaines √©tapes doivent √™tre r√©p√©t√©es avant, enfin, de trouver le truc. Quand en plus le hasard s'en m√™le, l√† aussi, de trop. Plus j'ai avanc√© (au-del√† d'une soixantaine d'heures, quand m√™me !) plus j'ai compris que c'est finalement tr√®s rigide. Il n'y a pas toute une flop√©e de solutions possibles. Il faut faire √ßa comme √ßa √©t√© pr√©vu. Point. En cons√©quence, au fil des heures, √ßa perd en int√©r√™t. On ne cherche plus √† "inventer" la manoeuvre qui va fonctionner, mais √† se focaliser b√™tement sur la seule mani√®re qui fonctionne. Un peu comme d'ouvrir des portes c√¥te √† c√¥te. La premi√®re est pas bonne, tu recommences. idem pour la seconde. Tiens, la seconde s'ouvre sur la victoire. T'as gagn√©. Super. En r√©sum√©, au bout d'un moment, √ßa devient casse-bonbecs.

  Le joueur n'est pas cr√©ateur de son histoire.

  Autre truc aga√ßant, cette fois-ci √† propos des personnages... J'adore quand il y a des tas de stats, que je me perds dans les comp√©tences, les qualit√©s, les points de savoir en cuisine kramkrout (un pays dont tout le monde ignore l'existence, Conan l'a visit√©, mais c'est une autre histoire), ceux pour l'habilet√© √† combattre en tutu de mailles avec une hache √† un bras (pour ceux qui en ont perdu un). Donc, l√†, il y a de √ßa, n'emp√™che c'est ballot d'arriver relativement loin dans l'histoire et de se rendre compte que bah en fait,  on a compl√®tement rat√© un personnage ou deux en les "montant" avec des capacit√©s qui ne servent pas √† grand chose, voire plombent le potentiel du groupe pour tel affrontement. Et comme il n'y a pas 36 mani√®res de gagner ces affrontements, on commence alors √† r√©aliser que pour avancer sans que le jeu devienne crispant, il faudrait tout recommencer du d√©but...

  Je n'irai pas √† la fin du premier : trop fastidieux sans la moindre satisfaction. Encore une fois, l'int√©r√™t pour une histoire ou l'attachement aux personnages pourraient att√©nuer les d√©fauts. Mais comme il n'en est rien... Pourtant, j'ai vraiment tent√© d'appr√©cier. Je suis d'ailleurs revenu dessus apr√®s deux ans d'interruption ! Je testerai peut-√™tre le deux, mais sans conviction. 

  Pourquoi le pouce bleu ? Sans √™tre un bon jeu, comme je l'√©crivais en introduction, il n'est pas mauvais du tout. Il y a quand m√™me du travail de la part des d√©veloppeurs, √ßa n'est pas b√¢cl√©. Et puis, cela peut plaire √† certains joueurs. J'ai la certitude que le c√¥t√© "puzzle tactique" peut s√©duire. Je comprends d'ailleurs ceux qui appr√©cient et l'expriment ici. Reste qu'il n'y a pas d'excentricit√©, de folie. Le pouce bleu parce qu'il n'y a pas moyen d'en mettre un gris. Ce qui serait mon choix.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126881530', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 10624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10462, 'last_played': 1568436948}
review: I am a casual gamer and this game fits me well.  The turned based strategy allows me to pause and think or pause and take care of real life and come back.  Unlike many of the genre this has a story-line that lasts through to the end, so many rpg strategy games are big on strategy and light on the role.  The characters are deftly defined by stereotype and developed in dialog. Play-thru felt rewarding and challenging.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089494976', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 5997, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3550, 'last_played': 1571526092}
review:
If you are looking for a good Turned Based Strategy game, then you have come to the right place.

There are RPG-Lite elements, but the focus of Blackguards is the hex grid turn based battles which are abundant. I have logged 60 hours according to Steam,  but only about halfway thru the game, so there is a ton of content here. Normal difficulty is difficult enough for me - I seriously considered quitting and starting over when I got to the Louse Queen, but finally got past her. 

The artwork gets the job done.The 3D charactor models are about the same quality as Skyrim, which is to say not great. The females are downright homely, although your DonJuan-like mage will say she is the vision of beauty.

It starts out very linear, but I like how the game opens up later to be more of a sandbox style world. The battles are very challenging but not impossible with proper preparation. I like the in-combat movement and tactics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061606765', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 899, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 899, 'last_played': 1568394556}
review:
Blackguards is a game that is fun...for about a Chapter or so. Then the game feels like it was designed by someone who doesn't want any player to ever win it unless they know the RPG system in their sleep. I gave up in Chapter 4 when enemies never missed (or so it felt like), always got the drop on me, and outnumbered me in every battle. Sorry but that's just not fun at all. Plus, how is one supposed to survive Cold Shock (level 4) + Lighting (Level 4) + Wrath of Elements (Level 4) + 6 snipers firing at you before you even get a turn! And, if I do I always hit like the enemies appear to do? Or course not, I got like a 50% chance of my spells working even at level 18 in the spell, which means you pray to the RNGGoddess that your spell goes off else you will not survive turn 2.

Overall I quit when it became pray to the RNGGoddess that you even survived turn 1 and that your attacks work and that you can even live long enough to make the numbers manageable. I feel that for the developers to improve this game they need to:

-TONE DOWN THE FIGHTS.  Seriously. Not every battle needs to be 10 vs 5 and they get the drop on you and can KO 2 of your characters from full health before you even act.
-Add a way to grind in the game. Right now there are a fixed number of fights, so you can get stuck as there is nothing for you to grind on. 
-Make sure enemies don't feel like you are fighting everyone with 18's in all stats. That is what it felt like in Chapter 4.
-Enough with the enemies doing 1/2 my HP in one hit. Too many encounters in Chapter 3 enemies could hit for 30 HP and my max was 54. And they did this constantly.
-Make sure the mechanics apply equally to the enemies. I felt like they didn't as the number of times an enemy actually missed on an attack was really low, to the point I felt like they got 99% hit rate no matter what their skill was and my parry skill was.
-You need to completely redo how your characters are added and removed from the party. Right now the only way to have a chance at this game is to know in advance who leaves and who dies, as there is no good replacements for those that go away. Maybe give the player a choice of a couple people they can add? As it is I feel like the game really wants you to be an archer, but that is not communicated to the player when they create a character, which makes the character creation choice what I call a false choice as choose anything else...good luck. 
-The wound system needs to be removed. I've never found it fun once it was added in Drakensang and it is still not fun here. Time to axe it in my opinion. 

Overall with some changes the game could be fun, but right now it is just frustrating. I'll just go play more Blade of Destiny instead (the 1993 version), at least that game was balanced with this same RPG system (or at least better balanced than this).

author: {'steamid': '76561198038861259', 'num_games_owned': 444, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1539077949}
review: The combat feels clunky and unfair. Maybe the story is good but after losing to the same encounter for an hour or so I just couldn't take it anymore. The opponents feel overpowered and your guys are barely doing any damage.

author: {'steamid': '76561198827379096', 'num_games_owned': 333, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 2780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2780, 'last_played': 1566603443}
review:
Not gonna lie. This was a hard game for me, especially in the beginning to mid game. It takes some patience to get through. It might just be me, but it felt a little bit too unbalanced and unfair for my liking. I wasn't really sure how I was meant to build my character and companions and didn't fully understand how the levelling system worked in the early stages of the game.  

Then the tough battles started to happen and plenty of those you will hit the try again button, I admit I got quite frustrated because I just wanted to win first time, every time, but that wasn't the case for me. It's all about that learning and what you can do better from the first time you tried the battle. From there on I did start to enjoy it. After learning from mistakes and learning the battlefield, you tend to do a little better each time. I stuck with it, because I knew I could win, it was just a matter of when.. haha!

Learning more about how the levelling system worked, gaining new gear, understanding combat, I felt like I was making progress. At the same time I was really growing to the characters and enjoying the dialogue between them all and how the story was unfolding. Not the greatest of stories but still Ok. It was good to have plenty of content throughout and I put more hours in than I ever thought I would, granted that I did retry battles quite often.

Overall, I enjoyed the game. It was great getting to the end and finishing, even though it was quite tough. I really love turn based games. But for me, this felt like you have to be quite hardcore turn based gamer to really enjoy it from start to finish.

Blackguards is just over halfway there for me.

5.5/10 Naurim's.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032401793', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1568104923}
review: Less of a game, more of a combat simulator. The design seems to be to get you to lose interest as fast as possible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024120757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 7151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5790, 'last_played': 1569313710}
review:
Vraiment un bon jeu assez difficile m√™me en mode normal, on doit bien comprendre les r√®gles d'√©volution des personnages avec les attributs, caract√©ristiques, d√©g√¢ts des armes etc.. sinon on risque de se retrouver avec des personnage trop faibles.
C'est un jeu ou on se d√©place directement de ville en ville ou sur des lieux donn√©s au cours de qu√™tes qui m√®nent la plupart du temps sur une carte de bataille. Et les batailles sont particuli√®rement bien faites, chaque bataille est particuli√®re et n√©cessite une bonne r√©flexion et utilisation de tout le mat√©riel (potions de soin, de poison d'armes, d'augmentation de caract√©ristiques, pi√®ges etc..) et des sorts (syst√®me de sorts tr√®s bien fait on peu les augmenter jusqu'√† des sorts de masse sur toute la carte, attention de bien les choisir au d√©but du jeu)
Pour moi c'est vraiment un tr√®s bon rpg tactique, sinon le meilleur auquel j'ai jou√©.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969189785', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 210, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1567982566}
review: Don't like it. No learning curve. No exploration. You're given only a few places you can click. When you click, it takes you into a dungeon with no exploration and you're immediately in battle. I can't really understand the roles that my characters are playing, and there's no real explanation. I'm pretty confused on how to proceed, so I don't want to.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042140373', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3338, 'last_played': 1567360055}
review: Cannot really add anything to the other comments other than my estimation that this is a game that appeals to power gamers but not the casual gamer. Even being very familiar with the Dark Eye as a tabletop and with the genre in general doesn't help - you will replay some of the battles into the double digits. I actually had to give up close to the end because of the absolutely punishing way the game develops in terms of story as well as mechanics. It is by all means an interesting world, with interesting characters (even though the actual RPG elements are few and far between), but when your time is limited and one battle takes you three hours to complete, this is just not a game to recommend. I will try my hand at the sequel in the hopes that the massive criticism the original received actually caused some changes, particularly in the balance of combat. And yes, I am aware there will be players who will belittle gamers like myself and will tell you they completed the game at Hard setting multiple times without problems, but there are some people who love getting into games to a degree that I am simply not prepared to invest. After 50+ hours of gameplay and scores of comparable and successfully completed games under my belt, I believe I am entitled to an opinion. Unfortunately, it is not favourable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054441755', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 3960, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3960, 'last_played': 1535928271}
review:
Enjoyable game with a respectable story arc and engaging characters, I actually ended up liking the turn-based combat, which is not for everyone. The missions and environments varied, which prevented a feel of tedium, although many battles were decided with the same repeated strategy on my part as soon as I found a suitable one. 

I would like to recommend the game, but some achievements were highly bugged, and although I eventually worked around this, it was cumbersome and detracted from my overall experience given how much I enjoy achievement-hunting

author: {'steamid': '76561197990994295', 'num_games_owned': 477, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 984, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 524, 'last_played': 1566386668}
review:
Unbearable combat.
Excellent voices, story nice enough thanks to the well scripted dialogues. Graphics and music create a coherent atmosphere.
Most of the game is combat, no free exploration of the world. Cities are static scenes. The map is a static drawing of no interest whatsoever, you move by clicking on the next destination. Because combat makes up so much of the game, it must be the best part of the game, but it isn't.
RNG means you can miss five times in a row at 90%. 80% means missing every other turn. All your characters can (and will) miss the same NPC at two life points, then a mage replenishies its life. As a consequence combat last forever and is an exercice in frustration. Developers did understand how much frustrating the game is, as the message reminding you to save frequently shows so well.
A sadistic form of combat for people who have a lot of free time and like to suffer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052246164', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1565289659}
review:
Shows promise but quickly falls flat. After being disappointed with the combat system, I read some in-depth explanations online and understood it a lot better, but still didn't end up liking it. It's needlessly convoluted in some places and purposefully obscure in other, and considering my backlog is always filled with good games I still haven't played... there's no need to bother with this.

Hard pass from me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042735698', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1587551044}
review:
This is by a landslide the absolutely most frustrating computer game i have ever played, going back as far as 1983. I am very unhappy that there is just NO way to recommend this game. What a pity is though!

It could be a great game. It would have the potential to really be good, but it is just puzzling why the developers mess everthing up so much. 

1. The game doesn't explain anything, and it is not easy to figure out. There is a tutorial, but it does not help in any way.

2. You are totally left alone on how to skill your character. It is no help that you ONLY have a SINGLE way of upgrading EVERYTHING. Only AP and you can skill everything with it- That leaves you at a total mystery to WHAT actually to skill. 

3. The fights are not self explaining and you don't get to know why you do damage or not or how much or which type of damage is good against certain enemies or stuff, you might be supposed to just try and error i guess. Come on! Really? Guys. 

4. Even smallest actions like using bandages or potions is extremely difficult and NOT explained. No hints or tool tips and if they are there, they are sometimes more misleading than anything. It just is really annoying if you take hours to even figure out the handling of the game. To heal another character? Not so easy at first, as your mage always targets himself. Eventually you might find out that you have to right click your other champ and then use the healing spell... why does the game not explain things like that to me in the first place? It is not only with this one thing, but with EVERYTHING in the game.

5. I stopped the game now when i have a fight where i want to save the baroness. It tells me what i have to do, but only for a fraction of a second. I cannot read the text because it is only visible for maybe 0.15 seconds. If i could read that i would maybe work as a secret agent for MI6 or something. So i dont know how i can save that bloody baroness at all. The game does not want me to know i feel. 

6. This has nothing to do with games having a steep learning curve, as i am really into games that take a long time to figure out, look at those paradox games f.e. HOI or Crusader Kings are not easy to learn as well, but it never gets this frustrating like in this game here.

7. The fights are just WAY to hard. I can not win against any of those i have left open right now with normal difficulty. I could switch to easy diff, but i have my pride as well. Besides, i dont want to play noobishly without knowing what i am doing at all. I wanna have a strategy and see how i can improve my quality of play. Nothing is possible here, because i can see that it would take me like 20-30 hours more before i would get to the point, where would start to understand what i am supposed to do here to optimize a stategy or to even know what is useful here and what isn't.

They have really messed it up on the possibility to create a really good game. This is what adds to the frustration: The game itself is there, one can see that this game could be really great, but the developers just fell short and missed out on some essential and crucial things. As a result, it is just no fun to play unless you are a real expert on this "dark eye" thing maybe.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994487069', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1784, 'last_played': 1564991464}
review:
I really want to like this game but after a few hours of game play I always shut it down extremely frustrated. I have tried playing it off an on for a couple of years and recently uninstalled it because life is too short to waste on things you do not enjoy and being endlessly frustrated is something most sane people should not enjoy.   

I have played some brutally difficult games in the past but when you combine random roll with brutal difficulty it really turns from a feeling of challenged to a feeling of relentless punishment. The game basically forces you to play certain encounters over and over again and no amount of pre-planning and strategy will save you once that dice starts to roll the other way since the deck is stacked against you to begin with. At least with other difficult games you have a chance to counter the challenge with some level of skill but when it comes to random dice rolls...can't do much except face plant into the keyboard.

I have had encounters where your front line tanks are basically all poisoned within 1 round of engaging in combat (and this poison causes knockdown, which makes your tanks sitting ducks) and pummled to death over and over again. Your casters are then put into a position where they have to spam heals and dispel the poison (so your tanks can just get off the ground), which does not help because every npc has the same poison on their weapons and they just reapply it next round. 

I mean I get it...it's a hard encounter but man...there is a zone between fun, hard and frustrating and when a game gets you to the point of frustration almost every time you pick it up there is something wrong with the design. I think this is especially true if you have obligations outside of playing video games and don't have time to replay encounter numerous times. I am sure I would have been less critical when I was 10 years old and had all the time in the world. 

So I guess I do not recommend the game if you got adult responsibilities and are more of a casual gamer. If you are hardcore I am sure there is some sadistic part that might appreciate it and if you are in between I would imagine you might go back and forth between quiting and coming back to it. Having said that, any game that forces you to reload this many time has something terribly wrong with it. Besides the whole point of video games is to give you a break from the day to day grind...which is pretty much this games defining feature...I guess what I am trying to say....might as well go to work...at least you get paid for the pain and suffering :)

review:
Gra, kt√≥ra mog≈Ça byƒá naprawdƒô dobra, lecz zosta≈Ça pociƒÖgniƒôta przez bugi i niedor√≥bki techniczne.
Sam system Dark Eye by≈Ç dla mnie nowo≈õciƒÖ, ale gra≈Ço mi siƒô w niego przyjemnie - niekiedy jednak wielokrotne pud≈Ça przy 90% celno≈õci frustrujƒÖ. Blackguards ma s≈Çabo wywa≈ºony poziom trudno≈õci, poczƒÖtkowe walki sƒÖ niedorzecznie trudne na posiadanych bohater√≥w i dostaje siƒô potƒô≈ºny ≈Çomot. Dalej jest zdecydowanie lepiej, w miarƒô jak dru≈ºyna ro≈õnie w si≈Çƒô kolejne potyczki idƒÖ g≈Çadko. Niestety same starcia sƒÖ na d≈Çu≈ºszƒÖ metƒô nudne, jest kilka modeli na krzy≈º (zabij, przebiegnij, naci≈õnij).
Fabu≈Ça... jest. I w zasadzie tyle. Nie wadzi, nie wybija siƒô.

Humor jest du≈ºym plusem gry, nie jest nachalny ani g≈Çupawy, raczej cyniczny i w tle. Nie wybija z rytmu.
Muzyka jest w porzƒÖdku, mimo niewielu ≈õcie≈ºek pasujƒÖ klimatem do gry i stanowiƒÖ przyjemne t≈Ço.
Niestety, niedor√≥bki... Niedzia≈ÇajƒÖce archievementy, zadania pojawiajƒÖce siƒô w z≈Çej kolejno≈õci (Ciliego!). Na szczƒô≈õcie ominƒô≈Çy mnie zwiechy wspomniane przez wielu, ale bardzo niepomocny system zada≈Ñ czy b≈Çƒôdy ortograficzne (na planszach ≈Çadowania!) ju≈º nie.
Suma summarum grƒô oceniam na 6+/10 - dobre chƒôci, przyjemna ≈Çupanina (czasami powtarzana po wielokroƒá...), humor i postacie nie czyniƒÖ przechodzenia jej mƒôczarniƒÖ. Nie kosztuje fortuny, a dla mi≈Ço≈õnik√≥w heks√≥w bƒôdzie ca≈Çkiem przyjemna.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995071697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1563264028}
review:
I bought this game a while back in a bundle, and pretty much forgot about it until I was browsing through my games the other day.

I sort of expected an isometric CRPG, but this game was quite different. The battles take place on a hex grid map, with an isometric view that can scroll through nearly horizontal to vertical; towns are basically a menu disguised with an animated scene with the various service NPCs dotted throughout; the rest of the game takes place in maps and character sheets. Not quite what I was hoping for, but the trimmed down, simplified gameplay works just fine if you're not a CRPG purist.

The combat system might also take a bit of getting used to. While largely the DnD/d20 inspired combat system you might expect, magic is still different enough that you'd want to familiarize yourself a bit before committing to it. My first character was a mage, and finding out that most spells are tied to specific attributes was a rude awakening when my mage was utterly ineffective since I spread her attributes and spells too thin all around.

The devs did make a few concessions to take away a few things many players might expect, such as removing a home base or storage space. The whole premise is that you're a party of fugitives on the lam, so you sleep where you can and keep only what you can carry. It's a little annoying at first, but you grow to appreciate the detail when you keep getting ambushed by bounty hunters and a determined lawman.

The one thing that makes playing this game a chore, and why I can't recommend it in its current state, is that it keeps freezing. I believe it's because Blackguards is an old game not optimized for today's OS, and the dev stopped supporting it. The game will freeze up at the worst of times, and since it's on permanent fullscreen, I have to resort to opening up a new desktop and running Task Manager from there to shut down and restart the game.

It's otherwise a decent game. Maybe people with another setup will have better luck than I do, but I can't recommend it in this state.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042888760', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2834, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2834, 'last_played': 1562345735}
review: Challenging but fair. Character development is complex, but might be confusing at start. This game is mostly about improving characters and tactical battles (in this regard more like Icewind dale than Baldurs gate). Story is Ok but nothing special. Tactical battles are great though, each is designed by hand, so you don't fight the same battle over and over. If your party is good and tactic sound, then the RNG is not really issue. You might need to fight some battles few times, but that is to figure out how to win, not for rerolling RNG. One advice - de-buffs and buffs are lot more important than damage spells, which might not be apparent early, but late game could be almost impossible without them.

review:
I mean, its a nice game to kill time but there are other and better games to play. 
-- Story (both main and side) is uninteresting. Cliche at most and not memorable.
- Some spells are completely useless. Need to research what spells are worth for mages.
+ Tactical combat (personal preference, I like tactical games)
+ Fully voice acted
Definitely not recommended for the full price of  $13.99 CAD. Just buy it when its on sale for 90%, which is quite frequent, if you really want to play. I will be not buying/playing the sequel

author: {'steamid': '76561198393471696', 'num_games_owned': 124, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1655530114}
review:
At the time I bought this game it was a bundle containing some others. Honestly I didn't give this game much of a chance, playing it for a couple of minutes and then leaving it. Recently I played it again and all I can say is it's surprisingly good!

The dialogues and especially the voices are really good. The measure of difficulty is great, and it compels you to improve your characters to keep up with the challenge.

The map and story are also good, and overall it's a turn-base RPG I totally recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561197985754629', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1561285761}
review:
As I'm trying to clear out my steam library i stumbled upon this game and decided to give it a try. I'm not sure how it turns out later but from the start this game is plagued by 3 things. 1. awful voice acting. 2. RNG. 3. a over-complicated level-up system that gives far too many options too quickly. The story is awfully generic too which doesn't give the game any favours with a typical "clear your name" storyline, at least from the start.

As the story didn't catch me, the RNG forces you to restart combats sometimes multiple times and you'll spend probably more time trying to figure out which ability to pick rather than doing combat, I decided that this game isn't worth my time.

If you enjoy turn-based tactical combat with RNG elements and huge skill trees with tons of options, you'll probably enjoy this game, if you don't, I'd skip it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994149540', 'num_games_owned': 478, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2275, 'last_played': 1560203096}
review:
I really wanted to like this game but I've come to realise I'm not invested enough to want to bother finishing it (I've reached the start of chapter 4 out of 5 total.) I also wanted to go into more depth in this review but that was just talking boringly about a boring game. 

As an RPG it's railroaded, there's a lack of interesting NPC interactions and nothing you do seems very meaningful. As a turn based tactical game it's... fine, I guess, but it's nothing special and the combat really starts to feel like a chore. There are no random encounters and little, if any, variation to the scripted ones - this isn't a game that's going to reward replays (after hitting chapter 4, I restarted with a new build just to see if that was the reason for my lack of fun. For me, it wasn't.) The story is okay but nothing special and there's a lot of people saying things that don't seem to mean much - it may mean more to someone already familiar with the Dark Eye universe, but it doesn't feel like a good introduction to it.

I'm not overly familiar with the world of turn based tactical fantasy RPG games but I'm pretty sure you'll be able to find something more worth your while than Blackguards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008091739', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 3308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3308, 'last_played': 1530843556}
review:
Blackguards is a turn-based tactical game where you create the main character from scratch and inherit a team of story-driven characters one-by-one. 

Pros:
[list]
[*] Though not immediately intuitive, I really grew to appreciate the way in which characters are upgraded.
[*] Story was OK.
[*] Semi-ability to pick missions. I like the feeling of progression when previously unwinnable battles becomes doable (assuming you reload after you realize the battle was too hard for you to initiate).
[*] Though I typically prefer games where I can define my team from the start, as opposed to games where unique characters with set roles join ready-to-go, there was good synergy between the characters (assuming you built them somewhat competently).
[/list]

Cons:
[list]
[*] Internet (or extreme patience via reload) is required to navigate through story dialogue in a way which will result in the preferred outcomes for your party. Some people like RPGs where "choices-matter", I don't really. I play to build a team with great synergy and to experience fun tactical battles, not to guess as to which dialogues the develop wants me to pick to make certain characters stay with my squad. YMMV of course.
[*] Damage and even spells are only successful (in a binary fashion) based on RNG. Of course, you can raise these chances by raising the corresponding stats. I prefer softer methods of implementing randomness.
[*] Unless you plan on playing this game more than once, you do kind of need to read some spoilers in building your party, as [spoiler] a character you plan on filing a certain role dies at some point [/spoiler]. Pretty irritating actually.
[/list]
Overall: I really enjoyed this game, particularly the level-up system. You can get it super cheap (I think I got it for 2$) and more importantly I think it was good use of my time. (Though it seems I may be in the minority here, so read other reviews carefully).

Rating: 8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197988534641', 'num_games_owned': 415, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 2224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 889, 'last_played': 1560218855}
review:
I will say this,

This game is frustrating as hell.  It's confusing as hell.  It's just...well, actually pretty fun once you get used to it's FRUSTRATING AND CONFUSING SYSTEM.

That being said, allow me to explain if you are seriously thinking of playing this game.

The stats are convoluted as hell, it's really hard to know just how effective boosting something is by the "AP" points you get from every battle.  Also AP are "Adventurer Points" ...why they didn't call it EXP is beyond me considering that countless other systems refer AP as Action Points.  But then again this game tries so desparately to be different sometimes it's almost cringey.

I was struggling a lot at first because I had no idea what to prioritize when it comes to character building, but it seems you build heavy into weapon skills along with one page of skills that revolves around passive effects like "Willpower" and "Battle Knowlege" and stuff to basically not cripple you when you get injured (because Injuries will screw you over).  Then just pile up onto base stats for a while till you find the right "Trainer" to boost various skills like "Armor" and "Dodge" and knockdown...  or spells.

Combat usually comes when you have your spell casts bombard things while your melee guys position around some vantage point and spam knockdown/deathblow/powerblow (after knocking down) and then it's pretty rinse and repeat for the most part but pressing V at the beginning of the battle to see what's interactable.  Once you get a hang of your battle strategy (with some variations) and get into the habit of fishing for side quests and stat buffing - the storyline starts to become much more manageable and the battles a lot less impossible.

But I think this is where the beauty and disaster of this game comes from, it tries really hard to be different, almost too hard.  Whether it's the "Drugs/Sex/Rock and Roll" incorporated into the storyline or it's the need to make the system as "different" as possible from traditional RPG or Tactics games it just takes some getting used to.  The cast of characters are alright though sometimes will leave you  internally screaming "WTF" especially with one of the mages.  Some of the characters are just downright awful.

So if you take time to play this game, be prepared to try to understand it's weird system and maybe get the gist of it, it's the only thing that will help you survive the playthrough.  I had fun with it, but only after the 2nd attempt when I stopped trying to play it like other games I knew.

[Spoiler] Don't invest too much into that Elf Girl, they literally kill her off early in the game on the account that she's kinda useless anyways.  No it's completely unavoidable [/Spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198068594364', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 855, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 855, 'last_played': 1557351014}
review: Wow. This game is a pain in the *ss. First of all. The story builts up quite well, but the core of the game is broken. If you have a chance to hit of 70%, it's a 90% chance to miss. Never hit something, if you haven't min. 80-95%! Mages are so damn weak. Why? Because they cast 2 times and are out of mana an the potions are expensive like hell. I never had to reload so many times as in this game. I play it on normal difficult but sometimes the fights are so damn hard. I don't have something against rng. I love the x-com games, but this is just broken. The Game isn't even challenging, because to be that, you should have an opportunity to do something against the odds that are against you. But not in this game. In this game the fight starts and with bad luck your first char is lying in the dirt before you can even do a thing. Try it if you like to be frustrated.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972146100', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 202, 'playtime_forever': 1039, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1038, 'last_played': 1558038420}
review:
Blackguards is obnoxious and tedius. Avoid it if you value your sanity.

I started out liking this game: played the Demo, bought it, put in another 20 hours or so. Instead of being tactical, you end up playing a battle 5 times, figuring out the trick or gimmick to winning, then moving on. It feels completely unsatisfying. The game is always punishing you for not knowing what comes next, but really giving you no clue as to what to expect. The whole game is based around save scumming. 

There's horrible RNG for spells. Even with 99% chance to cast, your spell will fail 5 turns in a row, and then you restart hoping to get better luck next time. Mage's feel really lame in general, and are basically just there to buff your fighter. The whole system is pretty obscure and takes awhile to learn, and when you do, there's just not enough to feel satisfied.

Also, there's really only an illusion of character creation: you're pretty much railroaded into a limited number of choices you need, because gameplay is so rigid.

It's not that I don't like challenging games: I've played x-com iron man on the most difficult setting. I've done the same with Divinity. It's just that the challenge here isn't really fun.

I really wanted to like this - it's playable, but just not a great game. You might like it if you're a hardcore fan of the pen and paper system it's based on, but for everyone else, there's better games to play.

La difficult√© du jeu dans l'ensemble est vraiment bien √©quilibr√© car vous avez une palette d'habilet√©s vraiment vari√© pour vous aider √† bien progresser.

Les combats tactiques deviennent de plus en plus int√©ressant lorsque l'on avance dans le jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963778820', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 5275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5211, 'last_played': 1554629555}
review:
En tant que grand amateur de jeux de r√¥les orient√©s strat√©gie/combat, et ceci depuis bien longtemps, j'ai tent√© ma chance sur Blackguard. 
Malheureusement, je l'ai trouv√© tr√®s peu int√©ressant : le syst√®me de combat est moyen et peu vari√©, l'arbre de talents est √©galement moyen y compris au niveau des sorts disponibles (sauf quelques-uns). Les graphismes sont corrects √† d√©cevants. Les objets et armes sont √©galement sans int√©r√™t. L'interface, et d'une mani√®re g√©n√©rale la logique des statistiques des personnages, ne sont pas bien con√ßue. Les ennemis sont la plupart du temps √©galement sans int√©r√™t (zombie, araign√©e, squelette....). L'√©quilibrage est tr√®s perfectible. Aussi, aucune possibilit√© de modifier la composition de son √©quipe d'aventuriers.

L'histoire est correcte, et les personnages relativement r√©ussis (seul point positif √† mon avis), mais cela ne suffit absolument pas √† rattraper le reste. Certaines qu√™tes sont int√©ressantes mais on est tr√®s loin du niveau des standards actuels ou des 10 derni√®res ann√©es. La difficult√© est correcte.

J'ai voulu donner sa chance √† ce titre en investissant 90 heures de jeu pour l'explorer, en me disant qu'il pouvait tourver son int√©r√™t au fur et √† mesure, mais je le regrette.

En conclusion ce n'est pas un tr√®s mauvais titre mais il y a certainement une bonne dizaine d'autres jeux de ce type qui sont beaucoup plus r√©ussis, √† commencer par la s√©rie Divine Divinity ou Pillars of Eternity.
Je ne recommande pas, y compris en soldes (sauf pour ceux qui n'auraient vraiment plus rien √† se mettre sous la dent).

author: {'steamid': '76561197964133534', 'num_games_owned': 393, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 3119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3119, 'last_played': 1553283529}
review:
Whats going on with these reviews...

I guess many people have bought Blackguards expecting something, which this game is not. Honestly I have no clue why reviews bash both Blackguards 1 & 2, because both are actually pretty good games. Sure, it would be nice to move camera freely, but it's not really even needed. Would also help, if game would guide and tell you all the basics, but it doesn't. Yes, both games are unforgiving and sometimes it may feel unfair. Blackguards is one of those games, which first forces you to learn how everything works. For the same reason experience is either rewarding or plainly frustrating (pretty hard to play "chess" without knowing rules).    

So, don't buy this game, if you expect sweet motherly hand holding (with kisses and honey pancakes). Do your research and then things won't be that hard. It's really the pre-setting for enjoying Blackguards. Otherwise... Well, just don't play this game.

If you have any background with pen & paper RPGs  or in general patience to learn, then with given fantasy setting, you might like this game. Otherwise, maybe, you want to play some other games (nothing wrong with that either). Blackguards is just not for everyone, but those of us who like tactical, puzzle like, old school battles and decent story. Well, then this game is a gem, which is honestly worth of playing. 

I wouldn't put too much value on negative reviews, because most of them seem to miss what this game is all about.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971880699', 'num_games_owned': 2839, 'num_reviews': 418, 'playtime_forever': 2489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2488, 'last_played': 1552193137}
review:
Duration: 41 hours. 

First time played. 

This was a very fun RPG with tactical combat.  Yes most of the story is there just to link combats together, but the combats had a good variety of elements and variation to keep me interested and thinking.  Some were very difficult, particularly in chapter two, when you need to fight 3 combats in a row without resting up in between.  For added variety, there were also a number of backflashes where you need to fight solo, or with a friend from the past.  Overall an enjoyable game. 

The story was good and really surprised me with a twist or two. The cut scene animations were decent for an indie title and rendered, not QT, so your characters actually are wearing the armour that they are dressed in. 

The learning curve felt a bit steep at first.  Really the first chapter is learning the game and second chapter lets you hone your fighting skills.  By chapter three, where the world opens up with a myriad of side quests, you're armed with comprehension and understanding to take on the world.   

A fun RPG if you have the time to delve into. 

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198002590083', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 17496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14707, 'last_played': 1550082780}
review:
Beware when buying this game! It is nice, but made for hardcore, masochist players only!

CONS:
- Countless hours of retrying the same brutally unfair battles, especially in the first half of the game (even on Normal difficulty).
- Barely enough characters to be able to build a strategically viable party (and some of them will leave without warning, breaking your whole strategy!)
- Experience points (AP) are very scarce (you cannot train by farming xp)
- Many skills and spells are completely useless, wasting points into them will break your game.
READING GUIDES FROM OTHER PLAYERS IS A MUST! Or you'll have to learn by yourself and reset your game twice like I did...
- This game is all about making choices, and some will make you miss the best items. My OCD got hurt in every hour of play.
- Worst ending I've ever seen in a game (kill the boss, useless video, no explanation, credits...)

PROS:
- Nice, dark, deep and cruel world based on a D&D-style role playing game, with countless moral conundrums
- Many situations made to trap/ surprise the player, forcing you to innovate through chaos to survive. :O
- Many cool puzzles... though you'll have to die 5 times to understand how to solve them!
- Nice skill mechanics, giving many character build options, but not all are viable...

So yeah, very nice and original game, with extremely frustrating moments. Eventually you'll get tired of playing and rush to make it end, then the ending will disappoint you... -_-
I will keep both great 9/10 and horrible 4/10 memories of this game... so let's give it a 7/10...?

author: {'steamid': '76561197975622745', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 19550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4150, 'last_played': 1693078287}
review:
Un jeux tactique et RPG merveilleux.

La difficult√© et bien normale, n'√©coutez pas les commentaires de joueurs peu patients. 
La personalisation des PJ est inmense ce qui donne un plus de rejouabilit√©. Chaque personnage peut se sp√©cialiser, ou pas, sur pleins de talents/habilit√©s en faisant des tas de combinations. Un healer/archer, un tanque/pi√©geur, un guerrier avec lance all off sp√©cialis√© en attaquer depuis le deuxi√®me rang proteg√© par le tanque, un mage sp√©cialiste en booster le tanque/lancier et qui peut bloquer le terrain avec des mur magiques, un chasseur/archer/verineux..

Facil √† jouer, difficile de maitriser. Un PJ dans un champ de bataille a tellement d'options qu'il faut vraiment songer et planifier tants les mouvements, comme les upgrades. En pleine bataille, que faire avec le magicien? Je tire avec l'arc, j'essaye d'enchanter un ennemi, j'attends voir que font les autres, ja lance un heal, je change l'arc par le baton pour avoir plus de r√©generation de magie, je mets du poison dans mes fl√®ches... Avec le guerrier, j'attends, je charge, j'attaque avec un coup puissant, ou bien une finte rapide.. Peut-√™tre pourrais-je reculer et poser un pi√®ge dans une case strat√©gique...Peut-√™tre le meilleur serait de reculer quelque pas avec le guerrier et le mettre en mode d√©fensif, ainsi je pourrais aussi chopper quelq'un qui essaye de passer a mon c√¥t√© pendant que le magicien lance un spell qui me permettra d'avoir 2 actions les tour suivants... 

Voil√† seulement un petit √©chantillon de tout ce que vous aurez √† faire √† chaque combat et qui fait de Blackguards un jeu tactique tr√®s complet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273353243', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1549166564}
review:
I'm very glad i bought this game on such an absurd discount, no one at Daedalic will be able to even lunch with my money. This game is poorly balanced, unimpressive writing, laughable worldbuilding (the reward for the Nine Hordes, the hardest gladiator event presented to the player, never beat before by any group of gladiators is... a night with a girl. And that is in a country where slavery is very much normal and, so the game implies, if you have what it takes, you can basically take anyone you see on the street and deem them your slave, so sex, or should i say, RAPE, isn`t hard to come by)
Seriously, don`t waste your money here, this game has nothing to offer in gameplay or story

author: {'steamid': '76561198110977352', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 3155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3155, 'last_played': 1549153557}
review:
About 40-50 hours for a complete playthrough - finishing every sidequest, fighting all the battles, and I enjoyed it for the most part. At the moment, overall and recent reviews are [i]Mostly Negative[/i], and I'm not entirely sure it deserves that. Some of the common criticisms are: 'it's too hard,' 'rng's completely unfair,' and, 'it's too repetitive.'

It can seem a little difficult early on, and a lot of times you feel outclassed by opponents, but as you play, your characters catch up pretty quickly. I think anyone with less than 10 hours who complains about it being too hard possibly just didn't get far enough.

Same with the rng. Early on, your characters' basic level abilities and spells combined with enemies' higher level stats, gear, and skills means certain kinds of attacks just aren't hitting as often as you'd like, but it's definitely not broken. If anything, the rng is a lot kinder than table top tends to be. No, [i]broken[/i] rng is something like Realms of Arkania: Blade of Destiny, and this is nowhere near.

As far as repetition, that's kind of up to the player. You can potentially have three magic users who can be taught all the same spells, and two physical combat specialists you can teach the same exact skills, and that's certainly a recipe for monotony. Having magic users specialize a bit in different spells, and meat heads in different skills and weapons - not to mention actively using items like traps and poisons - spices things up a bit. But yeah, characters tend to use their most powerful and reliable skills and spells, but that's true of most any game, isn't it? I thought the developers did a pretty decent job of mixing things up with traps, hazards, enemies, objectives, and subtle differences in map design. Out of all the encounters, I can only think of one that I thought was really badly designed. Anyone who enjoys table top games will probably enjoy it. 

Still, the game does kind of drag at times. The story's odd and relies on a number of cliches. 
Also, I ought to mention that the UI could use another pass. I don't know what's wrong with it, but occasionally I spent way too much time wrestling with it trying to equip an item or gear on someone. Whoever was in charge of QA in that area really dropped the ball. Oh, and some of the achievements are apparently still bugged.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033025796', 'num_games_owned': 597, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2714, 'last_played': 1547001830}
review:
Well, that is one of the most bugged RPGs I have ever played.... I didn;t get achievment for saving Aurelia, even tho she stand by my side till the ending. NPCs appearing 2 chapters too early? Yep. Useless Tomes? Well, not as long as you need money. Giving you the only rogue in the game and killing him without any possibility to save? Totally. Oh, and if you save, be careful, because the game loves to write on ur latest save. Some spells should have 2 hex radius, but no, in some positions it's just half of a circle, refusing to shot all targets (even if they are standing on plain ground, next to each other).

Something about spells
4th lvl of fire shot completly useless since it prefers to hit chair or chest than enemies. Or ur friends even if they are further.
First 3 levels of lightning bolt seems to stay for 3 turns, so you get ur 3k points to develop it and what? And it just disappear after one hit, going to the closest target. Thankfully 4th lvl is usable somehow. 
Poison skills seems nice on paper too, but in the end it appears to only deal poison type damage, not by turn. Sleep from this skill almost doesn;t work also... so you will find it completly useless.
If you develop ur great fireball to max lvl, you will be disappointed too. It deals around 20 dmg only to target in the centre, 4-5 dmg to the rest.
In the end it's all about descriptions. In my opinion, they are bad.
Oh I had one more problem. In one part of the game I couldn't complete the level, because one of the mages used blizzard instead of any spell I casted, even with 0 mana. It just drained mana with nice 4th level blizzard effect, but without dmg...
The same for our little friend with axe. Sometimes I couldn;t destroy crystals or fight the dragon, because the game started to see his melee axe dmg as... fire dmg. Guess what, dragon and crystals are fire resistant.
There should be any mechanic letting you to get closer to higher value described in spell. In fact maxing anything after learning spell gives you only bigger chance to hit the target...

Charisma should be giving us more choices, but I can;t feel it.

I miss having life bar with all statuses in one place, so I can at least read my buffs and debuffs while waiting for very SLOW enemy moves (especially if you used blizzard on snails or ghouls). Instead I had to run around bars jumping in the que.

Sneaking parts are one of the most annoying, not sure why somebody implemented it with such a bad mechanic. AI is dumb as hell, entering all ur traps, fire etc. Not even mentioning that traps work just one way, so AI can run through 5 their traps without any problem, but trap will damage them if I step near one.  Ending dissapointing... it's more like there wasn't any. I bet someone had a lot of great ideas, but it looks like something happened in the middle of creating. Out of money, skill or what?

After developing ur champions in wrong way, you might get stuck in the middle of the game or at the end without any possibility to restart your points and complete the game, so choose wisely.

Not sure if it is pros or con, but anytime you restart the battle, it might go different way, because enemies will use different spells on different champions. It might be your 1 in 20 (restarts after first enemy turn) chance to not give up, but try again :v

I find not being able to let you decide where your trops will start as a big con. They could at least give a skill letting us swap between each champ. A mage starting as frontlane near 3 1shoting him enemies and tank being placed some tiles to the left or back, enough to not gather their attention made me reset so many times, just to let mage run away or heal. Frustrating.

As pros, it have some interesting solutions. You need a tactic for some enemies, certain species of weapons or spells. There are many levels that you need to pass with brain. Game let us end some levels with bruteforce or by thinking well. I find some graphics just lovely. Many portraits for enemies (but still not enough).

In the end, it's good for first few hours. Then you are starting to get a little irritated, then loading screens, then bugs and then you just decide to keep playing just to bring it to the end. The end that looks like written on the knee in bus.

Still, I was having fun like 30 hours before I got to the point "I just want to end it finally", so it's not that bad. If not mentioned bugs and wrong descriptions (did I say, that some pros getting by developing stats are not even mentioned? leveling up cleverness helps targeting enemies with spells for example) it would be very good game, but now it's just average.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046407276', 'num_games_owned': 6089, 'num_reviews': 233, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1519978386}
review:
[h1]Not Fish, Not Meat, but still...[/h1]

I like RPGs in general, but this one isn't really a RPG in the widest sense of the genre. It's more a tactical game, that's round based, with some slight "RPG" influences. Still the game isn't half as bad as the script is going to tell you. The game has a lot of shortcomings, which makes the game not very endearing to hardcore RPG fans.

It's not as grindy, which is pretty good, as some other titles - yet it also lacks the real charm of a game that wants to draw in the player. Yes you can develope your character, but it's not as deep as it could have been... the roles of the characters are... well chosen, but still not as versatile as the game wants us to believe. In general the whole game has some gaming issues, that disqualify it being it a classic RPG...

Deadalic creates a lot of really good games, some of them are classic gems like the Edna Series, or Deponia. This game isn't classic, and it isn't perfect - I even doubt that it's good... and another time where I have to mourn about the missing "informational" option on recommendations... It's by a small margin a not recommended, mostly because it plays like the now discontinued series of "DSA-Junior" or "Aventurien-Junior Edition", which was created in the eighties, with more "youngster", "Teenies" or "Kids at play" scenarios...

Another thing that was kind of a let down, for the game was the "casualisation" of RPGs... sure, it's a game on rails, and that's what you can bemoan... but for the story of the game it surely is a plus... nonetheless, it's not my kind of game in general, therefore I can't recommend it out of personal bias...

[h1]Not Recommended[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198075234627', 'num_games_owned': 1012, 'num_reviews': 348, 'playtime_forever': 467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 467, 'last_played': 1546606623}
review:
I tried to give this game a chance, reading that early on it is hard and unfair. Well, 7 or so hours in, I don't see that changing. Ever complain about missing a 95% shot in XCOM? Be prepared to do that non-stop in this game. Combine that with the feeling of constantly fighting the UI and the overall mechanics of the game, yeah I'm just not having any fun at all.

Technically the game runs well in Proton on Linux, too bad it's not worth playing.

review:
Es injusto cuando quiere, va perdiendo fuelle y hay veces que ante tant√≠sima lentitud te dan ganas de arrancarte los ojos de las cuencas por tener que repetir una misi√≥n.

Pero est√° bien. Tiene un saborcillo a√±ejo que da buenas sensaciones. 
La atm√≥sfera est√° conseguida y el hecho de que tu elenco de personajes sea una panda de soci√≥patas inadaptados es un plus cuando toca verlos charlar.

Por resumir, CRPG de estrategia relativamente accesible en cuanto a aprendizaje con una trama m√°s o menos interesante que decae poco a poco y tiene partes malas mal√≠simas. Buena pesca de rebajas.

review:
Dieses Spiel ist unterirdisch schlecht. Es gibt so viele Baustellen die zu beheben sind. Logikfehler, Gamefehler, fehlerhafte Programmierung, vergessene Programmierung, L√ºcken in der Hauptquest, schlechtes Balancing, ... etc

author: {'steamid': '76561198168409304', 'num_games_owned': 524, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 3893, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3839, 'last_played': 1546124907}
review: Pior jogo de RPG em turnos q j√° joguei (sou f√£ do genero). O jogo √© bonito, tem bons mapas, uma historia q justifica. Mas complicou demias em coisas q n√£o precisava e foi muito superficial em coisas q comp√µem o g√™nero. As √°rvores de habilidades, talentos, spells... s√£o muito, muito grandes, cheias de coisas in√∫teis. Poderia ser muito mais simples. Sem falar q como o jogo n√£o possui batalhas alea√≥rias (q permitem vc farmar xp), √© muito dificil montar as √°rvores. Os equipamentos s√£o muito simples, mas acho q n√£o compromete. O q compromete mesmo √© a montagem do time. Q simplesmente n√£o h√°. S√£o aqueles personagens e pronto. Eu toleraria tudo isso se parasse por ai. O problema q mais irrita √© o sistema de combate. √â ridiculo. Com uma varia√ß√£o de dano absurdo. Um mesmo ataque pode gerar dano entre 3 e 16 (por exemplo). E o tempo todo varia absurdamente. O sistema de estatisca de acerto √© uma piada monumental. O n√∫mero q aparece n√£o representa nem de longe a realidade. √â quase impossivel acertar um ataque com 50% de chance. Em 3 ou 4 ocasi√µes cheguei a erra 4 ataques com 90% de probabilidade seguidos. A estatisca permite isso (n√£o √© impossivel), mas essa frequencia √© absurda. A soma da varia√ß√£o de dano com os erros absurdos tornam impossivel q esse jogo n√£o seja programado pra vc se dar mal. A occorrencia desses coisas esdruxulas aumenta significativamente perto do fim das batalhas. Al√©m disso, √© ridiculo a quantidade de vezes q seu ataque tira justamente um ponto de hp a menos do q vc precisa pra matar o advers√°rio. Se ficasse por ai eu at√© poderia acreditar em "teoria da conspira√ß√£o". Mas em algumas batalhas, quando sua estrat√©gia encaixa, magicamente a ordem de ataque dentro do turno muda. Sem q haja qualquer mudan√ßa de status, clima, nada. S√≥ muda. Seus personagens q atacariam em seguida v√£o mais pra frente na fila e SEMPRE aparece como proximo um mago adversario. Teve uma side q precisava vencer em 7 turnos q isso ficou ridiculamente √≥bvio (foi nessa batalha, no fim do 4¬∞ capitulo, q decide q minha analise seria negativa). Jogos de RPG em turnos s√£o contruidos para q vc desenvolva sua estrategia de ataque. Planeje a sua sequencia antes mesmo da primeira execu√ß√£o (xadrex). Erros acontecem. Muitas vezes o q vc planejou n√£o d√° certoc por n fatores. Mas esse jogo extrapola. √â impossivel trassar qualque proje√ß√£o. Efim, se n√£o quiser passar raiva, n√£o jogue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072363142', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 2877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2497, 'last_played': 1546095019}
review:
Blackguards is a D&D style RPG wher you control upto 5 party members. It does not however, have any baldur's style running around the city in the gameplay, the gameplay mostly revolves around combat. Combat in the game is turn based, anyone who has played a D&D game should be used to it by now. The combat however, was punishingly tough even on normal difficulty for me, I had to play it on easy for me to proceed further in the game.

The story, while not outstanding, is decent enough for an RPG. You play a chracter who has amnesia and is accused of murdering the princess. You then embark on a journey to clear your name and naturally get sidetracked by the nearest side quest. Sound and music are decent, voice acting isn't that great, but nothing really to put me off. I am currently playing chapter 5, whic his the last chapter in the game, and I already have about 40 hrs logged in the game, so it is definitely worth your money. Get it on sale for best value for money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090204078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 819, 'last_played': 1451754729}
review:
Esperaba muchisimo mas de este juego, tanto en su jugabilidad como en su historia. Mecanicamente no aporta nada nuevo o mejorable a otros juegos de su mismo genero, su historia es irrelevante ya que sus personajes son muy planos lo que no ayuda a una historia para nada interesante, un buen ejemplo es la saga fire emblem con sus historias simplonas pero que se salva por sus buenos personajes, ne este caso nada le salva. Finalmente su estetica es la ginda del pastel que te hace no querer jugarlo a gritos. Eh de decir que le di varias oportunidades y no pude con el.
saludos

author: {'steamid': '76561198016189649', 'num_games_owned': 2240, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 2699, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2699, 'last_played': 1544305204}

What a fun game! Real gem of a turn-based combat. You can really personalize your gameplay and characters. With the The Dark Eye Universe Bundle steampowered.com/sub/44166/ It's a steal to get these great games for the price of a nice beer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198204883727', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 729, 'last_played': 1544250823}
review: Bueno,lo compre en rebaja,pense que seria entretenido,pero me acabo de dar cuenta que no tiene mucho que ofrecer para mi,tiene si sus puntos fuertes lo cual te hace tener que pensar en varias estrategias,pero a la hora de ejecutarlas no saldra muy bien sin administras esos puntos de "experiencia" en cada personaje y bueno,definitivamente es mas complicado cuando mas avanzas y mucho mas cuando no estas preparado,Lo recomendaria solo para jugadores que les gusta los retos,pero no a quienes desean una aventura "casual" o relajada.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040919135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 578, 'playtime_forever': 2314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 797, 'last_played': 1544505157}
review:
I've had a lot of fun with this game, the combat is traditional hexagonal grid turn based fair but the exploration is done through set backgrounds that you click your way through instead manually walking around with your character and this lends the game a story book feel that I really enjoyed.

I also appreciated that rather than playing as yet another group of heroes out to save the world the companions in game are murderers, thieves and drug addicts just trying to get enough coin to travel to the next town.
