author: {'steamid': '76561198004917635', 'num_games_owned': 190, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 1349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1195, 'last_played': 1542923106}
review:
I can recommend this game only with good discount. Its a little bit boring, repetative, have no tactic and have no variativenes in story or your heroes progress. Interface not friendly and just sucks. Many aspects of this game dont thought as well.
After Chapter I fights become easy, and as i said, repetative. Range and mage stay behind and make range damage, mele force enemies and make mele damage. Its all what you need to win any battle.
This game doesn't give me disgusting feels like new "Star Control", and i can play and sometimes enjoy it. But my resonable mind tell me - its just waste of time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979940363', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 1305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1305, 'last_played': 1457855325}
review:
Enjoyed this game for what it is: and older feel tactical RPG with a modernish engine. There's criticism of the mechanics, but that's largely due to people being impatient and unwilling to deal with honest probabilities of RNG and rely on luck. If you hate RNG, tactical games with hit ratings that can miss shouldn't be a thing you should pursue.

It is very good for its price, especially on sale. Pick it up and enjoy a good chunk of hours with a game that has fun tactical depth and an interesting role playing background.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049632429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2689, 'last_played': 1542381922}
review:
Das Spiel hat sehr viel Potential, allerdings gibt es doch auch sehr viele Frustmomente.

Die Characterentwicklung finde ich sehr gut. Es gibt jede Menge M√∂glichkeiten, seine Party aufzubauen.
Die Geschichte ist nicht neu, aber gut und teils sogar lustig erz√§hlt. Wie z.B. der ehemalige R√§uber, der gern seinen Zeh  wieder haben m√∂chte und gar nicht gemerkt hat, dass eine Niere sch√∂n l√§nger weg ist.
Die Grafik rei√üt nicht vom Hocker und in den St√§dten w√§ren sch√∂nere 2D-Hintergr√ºnde evtl sch√∂ner gewesen, aber insgesamt gibts nix zu meckern.
Die Musik ist stimmig, wenn auch etwas arg eint√∂nig.
Auf den Kampfkarten gibt es oft diverse Interaktionm√∂glichkeiten. Hier F√§sser umwerfen um Wege (kurzzeitig) zu versperren, Deckungsm√∂glichkeiten, Brennbareszeugs-/Giftf√§sser zum zerschie√üen oder auch mal einen gro√üen Kronleuchter, der mal eben
2-3 Gegner zur Ruhe bettet. Man k√∂nnte auch Fallen stellen, macht aber mMn nur wenig Sinn.
Es ist wichtig, sich auf verschiedene Waffen, also Stich *und* Hieb zu spezialisieren. Z.B. sind einige Gegner komplett immun gegen einzelne Schadensarten.
Ich spiele auf normal, es gibt noch "einfach" und "schwer", wobei ich keine Ahnung habe was sich da √§ndert.

Spielprinzip:
man wandert fr√∂hlich auf der "Weltkarte" herum und folgt der Hauptstory und nimmt diverse Nebenquests von den Bewohnern an.
Anschlie√üend klappert man die Markierungen ab und schnetzelt sich durch die Gegner.
Teilweise gibt es mehrere L√∂sungswege wie durch Bestechung einen Kampf vermeiden.

Leider gibt es viele Probleme, hier ein paar Beispiele:

Eine Karte, in der keine R√§uber entkommen d√ºrfen.
Die Gruppe kommt zur T√ºr rein, steht aber seltsamerweise im Raum verteilt.
Je nach dem wer zuerst dran ist, ist die Karte entweder sehr leicht oder nicht schaffbar, weil einer der R√§uber als erster, zweiter oder dritter durfte und einfach durchrennt.
Das gleiche gibt es dann noch mal sp√§ter mit einer Alarmglocke.

Karten mit Iribaarslilien sind mMn auch extrem nervig. Wer hier nicht optimal geskillt ist und Gl√ºck hat, sieht ganz schnell sehr alt aus.
Das ist durchaus teils durch reines Gl√ºck zu schaffen, allerdings d√ºrften viele lange vorher das Handtuch geworfen haben.

Auch schon sehr fr√ºh im Spiel, ein Duell als dritter Kampf gegen zwei Zwerge, einer mit vergifteten Waffen.
IdR ist man von den vorherigen Karten schon angeschlagen, was die Sache etwas schwieriger machen kann.
Auch schaffbar, aber idR sieht man erst mal sehr h√§ufig das Men√º.

Nervig fand ich auch den Arena Kampf √ºber 3x3 K√§mpfe.
Eine M√∂glichkeit zur Heilung gibt es nach jedem dritten Kampf. Ein Mitstreiter ist in den letzen zwei K√§mpfen auch noch unp√§sslich und macht den dritten gar nicht mehr mit.

Ein Massenkampf mit einem fremden Magier auf eigener Seite, der sich f√ºr eine Feuerschleuder h√§lt.
Dummerweise wirft der seinen Ignifaxius Flammenstrahl am liebsten auf die eigenen Leute.
Au√üerdem wiedermal eine Map, in der niemand der Gegner das Feld verlassen darf.

"T√∂te 27 Zombies" (G√§hn). 1 Karte, Fl√§chenzauber wegen Haufenweise Deckung nicht m√∂glich.
Stichschaden (B√∂gen) bringt nix, die Biester sind langsam, weil Tote Dinge eben nicht rennen. D.h. der Kampf ist nicht sooo schwer, aber allein deshalb schon sehr lang. Zombies hauen kr√§ftig zu und vergiften dabei. Langweilig.

Karte mit Kampf gegen Waldmenschen, 7 Runden maximal Zeit.
Die Karte ist weder schwer noch irgendwie interessant.
Durch Fallen auf fast jedem zweiten Feld und viel Heilung und Gift ist das einfach nur d√§mlich und langweilig.

Karte mit Nekromant.
Auch nicht schwer, aber hier zeigt sich die AI von ihrer besten Seite.
Obwohl oben ein ganzer leerer Raum ist, l√§uft der Idiot an die Stelle, wo ich ein Giftfass zerschossen habe.
Ich komme wegen Untoter niemals an ihn ran weil die mich sofort einkesseln, es sei denn, ich bleibe in der T√ºr stehen umd schlage stumpf auf ihn ein. Trotzdem habe ich nach ein paar Runden gewonnen weil der Depp zur T√ºr und direkt wieder zur√ºck ins Gift latscht.
Die Untoten kann man bek√§mpfen, bringt aber nix, die sind auf jeden Fall in der n√§chsten Runde wieder da.

und hier h√∂re ich jetzt auf mit dem gemeckere:
Treffer/Zauber: hier ist es ein wenig wie bei XCOM: 60% Chance ist verflucht wenig. Selbst 97% f√ºhlt sich noch sehr viel weniger an.

TL;DR:
DSA Fans und Leute mit Geduld k√∂nnen hier zugreifen.
Wer "Die Nordlandtrilogie" (1992-1996) oder Drakensang zu schwer fand, f√ºr den d√ºrfte der Frustfaktor einfach zu hoch sein.

author: {'steamid': '76561198347076892', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2396, 'last_played': 1552427744}
review: Das Spiel ist sehr gut gemacht. Super Grafik, gute Geschichte und auch die Steuerung beim rundenbasierten Kampf ist sehr gut gel√∂st. Um so entt√§uschter bin ich, dass das Spiel ausgerechnet an dem letzten Tag der "neun Horden" pl√∂tzlich rumspackt. Mitten im Kampf verschwinden die Gegner oder sind unsichtbar. Die Steuerung setzt aus. Ich kann meine Helden nicht mehr bewegen. Wenn ich es doch noch irgendwie schaffe einen Gegner anzuw√§hlen, schlagen/schie√üen meine Helden in eine komplett andere Richtung. Der Kampf ist ohnehin nur mit M√ºhe und Not zu gewinnen und dann die Bugs noch dazu, vermiesen einem echt den Spielspa√ü. Wenn das Problem behoben wird, kann ich das Spiel nur empfehlen, doch so leider nicht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053448662', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 6224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5498, 'last_played': 1545598544}
review:
I RECOMMEND, although now at the end of 2018 I don't expect many people to read this.
I am so positively surprised with the game, that after a long time I decided to write a review again.
IF You read this, then BUY Blackguards NOW. 
For many years, I was like You reading reviews, and because of the MIXED feedback I never decided to buy. 
Recently I bought  the Daedalic - Gigantic Bundle and started to play and it is a VERY GOOD GAME!
Now I would even pay full price, but definitely RECOMMEND if at discount!
Dont be fooled by the reviews who complain about the "randomness" and how hard it is - trust the reviews with more hours played. 
Due to the specific dice rolled fight system it is wise before starting the game invest half an hour and read 1-2 nice short guides (even on steam) so that you "understand" the mechanics and that you invest your experience points in the right  way.
Although there are more right ways ...and my 2nd play through I played different class, different style ... 
On normal difficulty, you can just enjoy playing without to much additional researching ... just intuitively having a good experience...

author: {'steamid': '76561198127637261', 'num_games_owned': 180, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 11007, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10461, 'last_played': 1547503310}
review:
Wirklich schwierig, mit nur 5 Helden und Schwierigkeit normal das Spiel durch zu spielen.
Generierung der Helden und deren Stufen Aufstieg/e, halten sich an den mir bekannten Regel Werken. Das freut mich sehr.
Anders, als in Blackguards 2, wo Attribute nicht ( zumindest zu Beginn des Spiels ) gesteigert werden k√∂nnen ( Attribute nicht mehr auf der Charakter Seite vorhanden ) und Ausdauer mit ins Spiel kommt.
Doch auch das neuere, wenn auch nicht so sch√∂ne System wird wohl lernbar sein.

Leider blieb das Spiel mitten in der Nebenquest Mission Charyb'Yzz im Kampf gegen 13 Tentakel, um den D√§mon zu besiegen, dauernd stehen.
Wom√∂glich muss man den Kraken Molch zuerst in einer anderen Mission der Story besiegen, um den zweiten der Nebenquest zu besiegen. 
Und siehe da : Mit genug Konstitution und anderen Attributen, meisterlichen Zaubern, schweren R√ºstungen und nur einer Falle, wurden alle 13 Tentakel in nur 0,5 Stunden beseitigt.

Schwierige, aber nicht nicht m√∂gliche K√§mpfe.
M√∂glich, dass Nebenquests nicht immer auf der Karte markiert werden ( wurden ) und so deren √úberblick etwas lau ist.
Dann und wann kommen neue Missionen in schon besuchten Orten dazu.
Da man auch f√ºr Eink√§ufe sowieso immer wieder schon besuchte Orte bereisen muss, kann man sich dann √ºber neue Belohnungen neuer Nebenquests freuen.

Au√üerhalb von K√§mpfen, kann ein/e Held/in nur an sich Wunden verbinden; man braucht also auf der Karte, au√üer in Ortschaften, mehr Verb√§nde.
Auch zu empfehlen : Charakter in bestimmten Talenten und Zaubern auf Stufen 3 und 4 zu meistern, andere nur auf 1 und 2.
Denn daf√ºr werden genug AP gebraucht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147635606', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1564946143}
review: Unplayable. Can't get past the first few missions. Vastly outnumbered, and can't ever hit anyone. 90% percent chances get blocked or miss more than 3 times in 10. One hit took my character to half health, which gives him wounds, which is a debuff that decreases his already meager combat stats to near nothing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987977449', 'num_games_owned': 800, 'num_reviews': 261, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1540138248}
review: If you love turn based combat over hexes, you might like this game, it adds some clever variations to the battlefield, but at the end of the day the only usefull tactic is to survive. The combat overwhelms the gameplay, and slows down the adventure telling to a total crawl, making it almost meaningless as a "game", Blackguards gets 3 stars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014970534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 5353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5353, 'last_played': 1539099132}
review:
Je recommande vivement ce jeu aux fans du genre. L'histoire et les combats sont un peu moins riches que dans Divinity mais le theorycraft est bien plus complexe. Je l'ai achet√© √† 3‚Ç¨ avec le DLC lors d'une promo et c'est vraiment une bonne affaire √† ce prix.

Bien sur le jeu a des d√©fauts: 
-inventaire lourd √† g√©rer 
-cin√©matiques vraiment crades (mais osef !) 
-les combats ne sont pas clairs (on est oblig√© de passer la souris sur chaque unit√© pour voir les pv restant par exemple)
-quelques combats sont vraiment tr√®s durs et pas fun. Les maze par exemple
-apr√®s chaque combat on doit aller √† l'hotel, au healer et remettre des fl√®ches dans les mains des persos (il ne savent pas piocher dans le sac...)
-pas de coffre pour stocker son matos, on est oblig√© de tout vendre car il y a de grosses p√©nalit√©s quand on est encombr√©. D'ailleurs je vous sugg√®re vivement de tout vendre au m√™me marchand, il fait alors office de coffre payant, on peut racheter le matos vendu si besoin sans chercher partout

Et des qualit√©s:
-le syst√®me de stats et de skill est tr√®s complexe, il faudra chercher des infos un peu partout pour ne pas faire d'erreur car on ne peut pas resper. Ca peut √™tre un point n√©gatif pour certains mais pour ma part j'adore
-on sent vraiment bien la mont√© en puissance de notre groupe, surtout quand on d√©bloque le Coup de marteau pour les guerrier et le Triple shot pour les archers
-les sorts sont tr√®s vari√©s et on peut d√©volpper beaucoup de strat√©gies diff√©rentes lors de la construction des builds
-on peut faire les d√©placements en plusieurs fois: avancer de deux cases et avancer de nouveau si on est toujours pas bien plac√©

review: Lousy UI (right-click fidgetyness) has a deleterious impact on gameplay.  Hit rates across the board are far too low, which makes battles drag on, and prone to long miss streaks. author: {'steamid': '76561198038132122', 'num_games_owned': 1747, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 11945, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11873, 'last_played': 1535833893}
review:
[h1]Rating: good (7/10)[/h1]

[b] Introduction [/b]
Blackguards is a turn based RPG where by leading a party of 4-5 members you try to save the land from the madness of the Nameless God spread by the prophets. To do so, you have to travel through different locations and fulfill multiple quests on your way.

[b] Gameplay & Story: 7/10 [/b]
The story is overall not superior, but it does contain some plot twists and multiple cut scenes that while you progress further in the game fill out the story gaps caused by memory loss. If is especially interesting to find out what happened to you at the start and every character joining your party has some minor story and quest line to tell as well.
The gameplay consists of about 85% fighting on hex-based strategic fields, where in a turn based combat using either attacks of magic you have to either kill all opponents or finish some minor objectives like opening chests for more rewards after the battle or reaching certain hexes to exit the fighting area. The other 15% of the time are spent on the world map shopping, talking to NPCs for quests or spending skill points on your characters.

[b] Combat & Challenge : 8/10 [/b]
The combat is actually great in this game - its challenging, requires good tactical planning (on hard difficulty), positioning, decent build on your team and has a great variety of weapons and enemies to use them on. Playing it for the first time it may seem quite hard, since there are multiple different damage types with armor types against these damage, lots of spells that you have first to actually read and understand before skilling, talents that improve your quality of life on the global map, etc. There are certain builds that work much better than others, so in a way it is somewhat unbalanced, however on hard difficulty the enemies receiving quite some advantages so every matter is justified.

[b] Graphic & Interface : 6/10 [/b]
The graphic looks quite aged in some places, while others are full with detail and feel alive. It will not throw you off your chair, however it fits the kinda southern style of the game with deserts, oasis, arabic looking cities, etc. The interface is well structured, has enough details to not overwhelm you but still provide needed information. It is similar to oldschool RPGs where you increase your main stats that do increase your secondary attributes like attack, dodge, etc.

[b] Progress & Mini-Games : 7/10 [/b]
Blackguards takes quite a while to finish on hard difficulty and provides a lot of side quests, that do not feel like simple time fillers, but actually provide background stories to your characters or the world. The chapters increase the strength of the enemies by a lot so each time switching to a new chapters you can ready yourself for a higher challenge. At the same time your team gets stronger so the fights do not simply feel longer, but actually more tactical and you have a bigger variety of weapons and spells in your arsenal. Some quests are connected to each other and certain battle fields have different objectives that can be considered mini-games since main purpose there is not to just simply kill the enemies.

[b] Audio & Immersion : 7/10 [/b]
I really like the music in Blackguards. It has a great variety of tracks, orchestral, drums, southern styled music combined with good sound effects of combat. The hits, especially crits felt impactful, the spells had fitting sound effects as well. The voice overs were not superior but still decent of a quite unknown game. Some cut scenes were even well voiced.

[b] Side-Notes [/b]
[list]
[*]This game offers a single player long campaign with 50+h if you finish all the side quests as well.
[*]This game contains steam achievements that are sometimes quite hard to get and require either replaying of re-saving.
[*]This game offers minor replayability since its heavily story based.
[/list]

[b] Summary [/b]
Blackguards is a good single player RPG with an oldschool feeling, turn-based hex combat and deep character progression system. The music as well the graphic style and interface fit the game really well and the cutscenes implemented along the side quests provide some deeper story than you get from most othe RPGs. The characters are great and some dialogs between them are enjoyable. The combat is challenging on hard, so you might even have to replay it if you mess up your character on the first try. Overall, definetely enjoyable game that you might expect to dive for longer time into.


I hope this review helps you making the decision if its worth buying and installing this game. Rate and leave a comment if you enjoyed reading it.
~ForestWolf

author: {'steamid': '76561198078996445', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 263, 'playtime_forever': 2802, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2802, 'last_played': 1535148074}
review:
The dice rolls in this game are ridiculously fake.  For example, I had a character with a 95% chance of successfully casting a spell, a key spell I used to start every battle that hurt the stats of all enemies on the map for a few turns.  The only way to fail that is to roll a 20 (on a 20 sided die roll).  Rolled a 20.  Reloaded the battle from the start.  Rolled a 20.  Reloaded the battle.  Rolled a 20.  Reloaded.  20.  Reloaded.  20.  Reloaded.  20.  It took until the seventh try to not roll a 20.  The odds of that happening by chance are too low to seriously consider.  And junk like that happened ALL THE TIME.  I can't remember ever getting a roll on any attack or spell check below 10, never, not once.  If the game is so badly balanced, then fix the balance and tell the players what the real odds are, don't infuriate the players by consistently cheating the rolls instead.

The die roll cheating was really annoying, but, whatever, I got through 99% of the game fine just learning to never bother trying anything that didn't have at least an 80% chance, which in reality was more like 30%-40%.  The real slap in the face instead came in the very last boss battle.  Going into the last section, the game took away my main healer with no warning and no going back at that point, so my party was already struggling a bit.  But I made it through a series of fights in the final section to the last battle, which then basically requires archery to win without a ton of hassle and retries.  I never once used archery the whole game up to that point (aside from an archer specced NPC party member that disappears very early on) and never needed to.  Now I find out I have to have high level archery to finish the game without probably many failed attempts and retries in a battle that is filled with extremely slow moving unkillable zombies taking forever to do their turns.  F that and F this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968471816', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 831, 'last_played': 1534606689}
review:
Just horrible. Ugly, boring, linear, too random, terrible UI and controls (non-rebindable, of course), cheesy voice-acting with extra cheese (can I have cheese on that?) performed by school drama group rejects, story/characters are just one big clich√©e, tedious, convoluted, sucking-the-life-out-of-me irredeemable drecky dredge poo.*

Everybody involved should be stripped of their rights and property, removed from their families and be free for us to be whipped naked through the streets till their skin comes off in ribbons.

Then, maybe someday, we could talk about letting them design a sequel and, provided it is an improvement, they may apply for readmission to the human race.


*On a bit of a serious note, a game like this was what I was looking for. It's just that Blackguards does everything it can never to let this gain any traction and it just sucks the will to live out of me. 3 days. 3 long, hard fucking days of slogging through this sh.ittymcsh.it.tyshi.ttsh.itfestbur.gerc.ra.psandwich.

I cry salty, bitter tears thinking about the 10 minutes of happiness with a kebap that the money would've bought...

author: {'steamid': '76561198175324822', 'num_games_owned': 548, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 1646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1646, 'last_played': 1534427701}
review:
I got it for ¬£2 and I still feel ripped off. I can not decry this game hard enough. Something is terribly wrong with it's RNG, such that your 95% hit chance, misses half the time. I honestly missed 4 95% in a row. 

Your mage is fucking useless, unless you go throw Astral potions like your alcoholic father, he runs out of juice around the third wave, and does not regenerate anywhere near close to what he expends.

Two of your characters are taken away from you with no chance to stop their death and no foreshadowing or the slightest hint you could stop it. Second one is so obvious espeically after what happens with the first one. And if your party is built around each of them, then you are thrown into turmoil with their lost.

author: {'steamid': '76561198279853244', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4190, 'last_played': 1615004330}
review:
Missed at 100% hit chance just kills me. This game is also kind of buggy. As there is no way you can save during a combat, you need to redo the whole fight if there is any bugs.

Pros: 
Super catchy story, magnificent storytelling (yes it's a different thing from story itself).
soundtrack is a masterwork. I like it. If the publisher offer a separate DLC for the soundtrack I would buy it.

Cons (I have always been a DND player so this is kinda biased)
The dark-eye based system is pretty intereseting but simple. Compare to your ordinary DND or DND-alike system, this one is kinda limited in terms of character development and stragety mangament. All of your chars, including spell casters, have to invest at least one weapon class. The spell system in this game was very limited. Buff/ debuff is way too powerful, compared to direct damage spells. The best way to use a fireball spell is to ignite an area of wood and lure your enemies into fire.
As I mentioned, the program is buggy. I encountered five bugs that totally crushed the entire game during my 40 hrs play, which I redeemed as intolerable. The AI is disgustingly stupid that they will attack any nearest target with no focus or priority.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973112890', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 4282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4199, 'last_played': 1531886773}
review: Buy it at full price. It is very uncommon for me to say this, but it's a really good game that's pretty cheap. DEFINITELY read how to make a character if you do it manually though. I played BG2 first which is way more simplified on stats and skills and limped with a weak character for awhile. Pretty neat story, but man, it goes on and on. This is an incredibly long, full length from the late 90s tier game. It's also incredibly difficult in places so it really is a genuine challenge you actually have to walk away from and figure out how not to reload again from an encounter. Graphics, audio, all that stuff is good, very good voice acting, memorable characters although I would advise you play it in order (playing the second first kinda spoiled the stories of your companions). It's a turn based tactical RPG in a hex grid that reminds me most of Heroes of Might and Magic but more a Diablo inventory with health and mana potions etc. It's set in a German DnD alternative called Dark Eye that's also a pretty interesting setting. Definitely recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022980827', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 244, 'playtime_forever': 3547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2992, 'last_played': 1423844211}
review:
Blackguards is a 2014 tactical RPG set in the world of Aventuria and based on the German ‚ÄúThe Dark Eye‚Äù pen and paper game. You are jailed for the murder of a princess, and control a band of murderers and misfits as you try to clear your name and figure out what happened and if you are really are to blame.
 
I liked the story of blackguards as well as the characters. It‚Äôs a really dark and dirty universe where there isn‚Äôt much sympathy for your character (or the company he keeps). All of the companions are fleshed out and have unique personalities, and although some of them are near useless in combat their banter and quips at each did make me chuckle. Each character has their own motive for joining you, and although they won‚Äôt (willing) leave they provide enough quests and input to the situations that I wanted them to hang around. The story does branch into 3 possible directions depending on how you treat one of your characters and the choices you make throughout the game, though I have been unable find anything on the requirements to do so. While I wasn‚Äôt impressed with the end boss, the story meshed very well, and contained a good amount of twists and turns. You do have a good amount of freedom to be as mercenary as you want, and optional battles are required as you will want the extra XP. The memory sequence where you can recover your memories if you keep digging was very good, though I can only think a very experienced character will be able to progress through it as the enemy spawns are very difficult.
 
Having played a good amount of Dungeons and Dragons I felt I had a good understanding of how the game would play (how different could it be?), and got demolished because of it. The base gameplay is quite different, which results in a high difficulty spike very early on until you know what you are doing, this isn‚Äôt helped by the fact the games base difficulty is hard. Each character takes turns based on initiative. Characters can move to any hex tiles they can reach, where you can then attack, use items, cast spells. Combat plays different as well, with your weapon mastery determining how much you put into attack and how much into parry. Some weapons (like spears) can attack from 2 tiles away, allowing you to bottleneck enemies on gangplanks and walkways which is the only way to stop you from being rushed and killed. Magic is completely different to what I am used to, with direct damage spells being almost useless, and buffs and hexes really making or breaking combat. Ranged attacks are very good, however ammo is very limited and I found myself always out. Stores don‚Äôt replenish stock, so once you are out a ranged attacker can find themselves useless in all future battles until a new store is found.
 
The class up/character creation system while varied needs a good tutorial. It‚Äôs more than easy to make a completely useless character that will require a restart to fix. Each of your companions really has a set role, and while you can make them deviate slightly it‚Äôs not enough to truly make them something they weren‚Äôt already. The exceptions to this are Aurelia (who can lose her magic for a good portion of the game), and Zurbaran, whose offensive magic is better spent moving towards ranged attacks or buffing magic. As your character can be anything I would highly recommend reading a guide on the character progression and possible skills, this game wants you to specialize and it will help in focusing on a long term character that won‚Äôt end up like a jack of all trades and be absolutely useless.
 
The maps are designed quite well, with many interactive objects usually littering the stages. These can be enough to completely remove enemies from the map, poisoning them for ongoing damage or opening extra routes you can use to escape or flank enemies. They each look very nice, with each map being quite detailed.  A good music score accompanies the game, and while it doesn‚Äôt have that zip or intense tones to drum up suspension it does its job admirably.
 
All of the above said the game does have some issues. The first as mentioned before is its difficulty. This is a hard game which I suspect will turn some people off. I found some fights come down to knowing when and where enemies are going to spawn, so you can get in first. Stats won‚Äôt mean much to you if you don‚Äôt know the system, and this game doesn‚Äôt do a great job of explaining them. Many of the later game enemies have high dodge rates, so even with a high attack rating my characters were missing quite often. If you don‚Äôt have a buffing/de-buffing mage ready you will die. Many of the games achievements are broken, and simply don‚Äôt pop. Although I really liked the story, I wish there was more world lore available in the game, from the creatures to how the world works. It was a missed opportunity to introduce more people to the pen and paper game behind this one. A little more polish and this game could have been magnificent rather than good.

The DLC doesnt really add to much to the game, other than setting up a few extra missions and the background for the least well explained companion. That said his story is good and the battles are hard. It does give you access to the soundtrack if you liked listening to the music.
 
If you are chasing 100% achievements then it‚Äôs impossible as a few are bugged.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129008638', 'num_games_owned': 32, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 6348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1767, 'last_played': 1618868107}
review:
Having played 2 different types of hero characters so far I understand all the negative comments concerning out-numbered battles, too many foes etc......   If you go into this game with a typical gaming mindset than yes the battles are going to drive you up a wall.   On the other hand, if you've wargamed in the past the battles (or tactical puzzles as they call them) aren't that bad.

Equip your party right, know how to read a battlefield, position your troops and you'll find winning isn't that hard.

While the story is only so-so and not worth buying the game for, the series of tactical battles more than makes up for that.

The character voices are engaging, a nice mix of dry humor keeps it interesting.  I'm not usually big on games that use voice overs, but I didn't mind this one.

Starting off in the expert mode helps you get off on the right foot as it allows you to craft your hero character the way you want them to be.

All games have bad parts and this one does too.   I disliked how on some maps you need to open chests or break things in order to increase your loot.  In most games you'd clear the map and then loot.  BG's on the other hand requires you to take care of those things while you fight.  Once the last foe goes down, the map closes out, zippo, period, you're done.  No more looting.

The other thing is I found the percentage to hit is sometimes baffling.  Hit chances would go from 85% / 95% to hit down to 65% for my melee character;  same type of target, positioning, nothing I could see was different, but the game thought so.  Minor, but like I said baffling.

A good game, fun to play and seems to go on sale alot.  Very recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090899901', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 1998, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1998, 'last_played': 1532368952}
review: A tactical rpg with point and click story telling that has given me a lot hours of joy. The makers of this game are point and click experts, so the art and placement of characters are really well done. After playing a few hours and making up my mind for the builds of my characters, I embarked on this adventure. After gaining a lot of perks and skills, I managed to hit a point where I thought I could beat anything in this game. Until I faced enemies with immunities and came across the crystal that heal and fought again multiple rangers and mages that decimate my party and maps full of traps and maps full of obstacles and maps with alarms bells and pits and spiderwebs and beehives and swamps and and and... This video game has fantastic battle map designers that have worked on it. The things you can do with mages is just a joy to behold and dreadful to play against. Trust the reviewers with high playing hours. This is a unique game that I very much recommend to anyone who enjoys tactical rpgs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198359666207', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 3670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3670, 'last_played': 1561742153}
review:
EHI TU . SI DICO A TE. HO FATTO QUESTA RECENSIONE SOLO PER TE. quindi...gentilmente...leggila.

VUOI COMPRARE UN BEL GIOCO CON UNA BELLA TRAMA? NON COMPRARLO
VUOI COMPRARE UN GIOCO CON UNA BELLA GRAFICA? AHAHAHAHAAHAHAHAHAAAHAHAAH
VUOI COMPRARE UN GIOCO CON UNA BUONA IA? AHAHAHAHAHAHAH NON COMPRARLO PASSA AVANTI VAI VIA .

 ALMENO TU...SALVATI.

Apparte gli scherzi, parliamo seriamente:

Vediamo per prima cosa i punti di forza di questo "meraviglioso" gioco:
-Niente
-Personaggi carini
-Niente
-Trama sufficiente
-Niente
-Ancora Niente
-Grafica pressocch√® accettabile.

E ora andiamo ai punti negativi, sei pronto? Sono davvero pochi:
-IA inesistente , giocherellare a sasso carta forbice con le proprie mani sar√† pi√π divertente...
-Missioni Secondarie che non hanno n√® testa n√® coda. 
-Mappa enorme con tante citt√† ma puoi benissimo aver visitato anche la met√† di esse.
-5 capitoli uniti con colla e scotch *(Non ricordo come si scrive e siccome sono un recensore professionista non pu√≤ fregarmene di meno).
-Equipaggiamento che equivale al tuo stesso armadio di casa. ( Qui l'esperienza di gioco cambia mio caro lettore, se tu hai un armadio con 3 magliette ti ritroverai nella situazione di Blackguards se tu ne hai di pi√π...no non cambia niente, le armature sono quelle , punto e basta).
-Un boss finale che equivale alla somma di tutti i boss della trilogia di Dark Souls, Bloodborne e Sekiro.
-Nemici sbilanciatissimi, posso avere anche buone caratteristiche ma √® il gioco a decidere se vinci o meno.
-Caricamenti cos√¨ lunghi che forse finiscono prima la √πSalerno-Reggio Calabria
-Un casino di Crush insensanti e non intendo Bandicoot ( Ditemi che avete capito la battuta... lo so la mia vita √® triste)
-Sistema a turni completamente casuale. ( Il gioco i spiega che agiscono prima coloro che hanno una statistica , di cui non ricordo minimamente il nome, al massimo...bene ...non serve a un emerito cazzo)
-Non lo comprare.
-Ancora stai leggendo?
-Vattene via.
-No ora vai via...sono serio.
-Il bello √® che uscito pure il sequel , boh.

Vabbene, sei arrivato alla fine.
Penso di essere stato abbastanza chiaro, se avessi domande. Chiedi pure, sono pronto a sfogarmi .

review:
Juego realmente malo. La poca "estrategia" que puedes poner de tu parte se va al suelo cuando por azar la IA saca de la manga tiradas incre√≠bles y acaba contigo. Esto no ser√≠a un problema si los niveles y los encuentros en dichos niveles estuvieran bien hechos. 
Por otro lado la composici√≥n de tu grupo te permite crear tu manera de enfrentarte a los retos como mas te guste. Dicho esto hay encuentros en donde prima demasiado que hallas escogido ciertas habilidades/conjuros para no tener que repetirlo veinte veces y rezar a la diosa fortuna.

En cuanto a la historia y personajes, hay historias mucho mejores (argumento de la trama muy b√°sico hasta donde he llegado que es el capitulo 4) y personajes que no puedes llegar ni a odiar porque no transmiten nada (se limitan a usar t√≥picos de otros mundos de fantas√≠a). 

Me compr√© en pack el 1 y el 2 muy barato en oferta. Pero a d√≠a de hoy pasar√° mucho hasta que intente siquiera probar el 2 en vista de lo que he le√≠do de √©l y lo que he experimentado del 1.

P.D: Para el que lo entienda. He jugado much√≠simas horas al XCOM (en ‚Äúlong war‚Äù y m√°xima dificultad y he disfrutado much√≠simo a pesar de los disparos 95% fallados en momentos claves y perder soldados a los que s√≠ llegaba a coger cari√±o y eso que no tienen historia propia debido a alg√∫n Sectoide borracho que con un 13% de posibilidades de acertar no fallaba ni a la cabeza de un alfiler). Buen dise√±o de niveles y enemigos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050023700', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1531388495}
review:
It's an okay game with passable mechanics ruined by the worst scenario design I can remember. The vast majority of complaints about this game are from people who've played quite a lot longer than I have, but the problems they have with the game surface very early in it.

To put this into perspective, about 2 hours in [spoiler] there's an optional fork in the game where you can rescue a baroness or leave her to be hanged by the Bailiff who said he was gonna burn out her eyes.... not fucking hang her. The Bailiff is a crazed maniac, very obviously mentally unstable man who for some reason which I'm sure will never be explained in a way that makes sense, made it into a position of power and is trying to kill the Baroness because she's sat on your party members face and anyone who does any crime no matter how insignificant is deemed a murderer by the Bailiff and anyone who shags a criminal is also a murderer. It's already dumb. [/spoiler]

The level where spoiler above takes place is just poorly designed. You have to make it across two bridges in 5 turns to rescue her. The bridges are three spots wide, there's 7 enemies, there's 6 guarding both bridges (3 per bridge) and one dick with a crossbow peppering the squad. When the level kicks off, two enemies always have to initiative and will block the first bridge with boxes and then stand in your way, you can't move them, you have to kill them, get really lucky or waste half a day trying to get past it only to realize when you finally do, this is how the whole game is going to be presented to you.

Almost insurmountable challenges that take ages and then realizing you didn't enjoy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072130676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1478331877}
review:
My first miss

Blackguards might look like nice title. Turn-based tactical combat, RPG, fantasy - what‚Äôs not to like? Well, nothing to like if everything is F‚Äôd up. 

Plot is boring, generic and uninspiring.  Protagonist accused of a murder of princess or something like that, no one really cares. How to? Voice acting is ridiculous, as it was developers themselves (like good ol‚Äô days, yeah?). Visual style is mundane, and animation is way worse than early 2000s RPGs.

Combat is turn-based on a hex-gridded maps and monotonous as hell. No tactical options, no environment to use and your options are confusing mostly useless abilities in that terrible-terrible radial menu. 

Maybe the worst thing in this game is a roleplay system. It is too much bloated with numerous stats, talents and abilities, and at the same time so empty, that character becomes one of three timeworn archetypes: caster, archer, warrior. Well, I‚Äôm no stranger to getting my head around different RPG systems, but horrible UI made it impossible this time. 

All the gameplay consists of boring fights with horrible animations on mostly empty arenas, moving between dots on maybe the blandest looking world map and clicking on a static picture called ‚Äúcity‚Äù to hear more laughably bad dialogs.

Well, you can try it, but you‚Äôve been warned. Price tag is ridiculously high for that garbage, but at least it has 90% discount more often than not.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022058877', 'num_games_owned': 102, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1630, 'last_played': 1530048290}
review:
4/10

Playable, has a decent (if bland) story, but gameplay is tedious, frustrating, and often boring.

I'm not familiar with the Dark Eye system this game is based on, so this was my introduction. After playing this though, I can say with certainty that I don't like it. 

I can handle a some RNG, and I realize that the game wasn't actively screwing me, but by the gods sometimes I swear...

But I digress, the main reason this gets a no from me is that I felt more annoyed than anything while playing it. 

The game is entirely battle focused. There is a world map and point and click style locations to visit, but these only serve to get you into the battles. 
The battles themselves are slow, drawn out affairs. While this isn't necessarily a bad thing, it makes a bad RNG roll all the more frustrating since you have to wait what feels like hours for the next chance. (it's really actually less than a minute, but it adds to the annoyance factor). There are also a number of very annoying things about them: 
- Low level spells are literally useless, requiring virgin sacrifices to whatever capricious god holds sway in this world to even cast them (this includes basic healing spells), while the enemies have near 100% accuracy from the get go. This isn't even due to the RNG gods not smiling on me either, the game actually lists the chances of successful casts at welll below 40% until you either upgrade the spell, or get your casters the appropriate skills. 
- Enemies employ poison more often than not, and using the counter measures such as antidotes and spells is pointless since the next enemy strike will just poison you again. (and now you've wasted a turn to boot).
- When it isn't poison, it's traps. But usually, it's both. And traps that poison you. Great.

There are a number of sidequests, but the questlog often forgets to tell you where to go. For instance, it wanted me to go to meet Madavar, but didn't say where he was. ( I eventually just googled it rather than wasting time checking everywhere).

The story is OK. Nothing special.

Basically, the battle system just annoyed me to the point where the story no longer held my attention. I got partway through the final chapter and just decided to uninstall. 

If you like the system it's based on, you'll probably have more fun with it than I did. If you don't, then wait for an 80%+ sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198261510448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 10294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4429, 'last_played': 1698278727}
review:
I certainly took my time to finish the game and even though it was repetitive i loved playing for the most part, except for those bullshit part where i fought that plant and those tentacles who sometimes dealt 20 - 30 damage to me and my characters didn't seem to be able to hit that plant at all. -_-

I was playing on hard all the way, i just tuned down the dificulty to easy to complete some fights, and overall i really enjoyed the game, i just wished i had a way to speed up the fights since there was some battles who had more than 20 people on the screen and it took way too much time on that.

But even with those faults, i really liked the game. The story, characters, world navigation, the quests and the freedom you have to use the environment to help you win some fights.. I loved setting the grass on fire with Zurbaran and have the enemy sitting there and taking damage every turn.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046232770', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1208, 'last_played': 1453848667}
review:
I picked this game up thinking that i'd be a great introduction to a new world, and built on a strong pen-and-paper mechanic.

I have only ever been this wrong twice before: My mother not doing meth, and my ex girlfriend having a side piece. 

This is a half-made game with a great voice cast, solid grid and terrain system, and not much else. The combat difficulty is an oscilliscope. No information is provided in game as to why it fluxes with such dynamic, brain-busting frequency.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168190542', 'num_games_owned': 289, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4007, 'last_played': 1556070753}
review:
Received this game as part of a bundle I purchased, and didn't know anything about it.  Decided to play a few days ago, and found that I'm really enjoying it. The game mechanics are really different from other RPGs I've played, but that's not a bad thing. I find that I actually like the hex-tiles and turn-based combat. It is a challenge to build the skills for my character and the companions so that they compliment each other and produce a solid team that can survive really tough fights. On harder settings, some of those fights are really rough. 

Best thing I can say about the game is that to me, it really has this "feel" to it - it's like playing a tabletop RPG with a bunch of friends but without quite the level of drama produced by a large group. :-D  

I'm still figuring out the story and I've only just finished the second chapter out of five, but it's keeping my interet and providing me with genuine enjoyment. I would recommed giving it a go if you like solving mysteries, adventuring for adventure's sake, and don't mind having your character die in combat and producing a need to go back and try something different.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003032109', 'num_games_owned': 156, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 560, 'last_played': 1527276243}
review:
I really like turn-based games like Shadowrun or Fallen Enchantress, but this one falls very short.

- The game is uninteresting, the storyline is boring. There is no world exploration, just click until you get to the next fight.

- All the places look the same, and all the battles look the same (with some monster variations.)

- All the battles feel like you're grinding for hours, there is no dynamism to it, and there is no way to fast forward or accelerate the enemies' turns. Even the fucking static traps and machines have unnecessary long turns you have to wait for.

- Even though it "seems" you have many choices for your characters, you can't really develop many different tactics, so every battle plays the same.

TLDR; I really want to like this game, but sadly it is a bore-fest.

review:
Un juego de estrategia por turnos de fantas√≠a √©pica que no destaca realmente en nada. Armas y armaduras, magias y habilidades suficientes, personajes suficientes, historia ni fu ni fa.
El juego te deja una sensaci√≥n de 'ha sido lo justo, ni m√°s ni menos'. Para nada es un juego de rol como dice en sus etiquetas, es, sin m√°s, una aventura. Una aventura decente.
Pero me ha gustado. No es ninguna obra maestra, pero me ha gustado. Y m√°s aun si lo veis de oferta, compra obligada para echarle algunas horas, que est√° tirado de precio.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084313112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 4480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4473, 'last_played': 1649970328}
review:
Ich war im Grunde ziemlich zufrieden mit dem Game. Ich habe beide f√ºr insgesammt 3‚Ç¨ und ein paar kaputte gezahlt, denke aber ich h√§tte im Nachhinein auch bei 10 Euro nicht dem Geld hinterhergeweint.

Mein Preis Leistungsverh√§ltniss ist da vielleicht ein anderes und es mag vielleicht stimmen das die Characterentwicklung selbst nicht die beste ist, dennoch hat es f√ºr einige entspannte Stunden gereicht und war seltsam befriedigend an einigen Stellen. 

Zumindestens mit dem DLC zusammen, vermutlich auch ohne, kommt man gut an alle F√§higkeiten ran, sodass mann sich nicht unbedingt panisch geben muss wenn man das Gef√ºhl hat mann h√§tte sich verskillt. 

Das Ende fand ich jetzt vielleicht etwas weniger befriedigend, (SPOILER)!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Ich stehe nicht so auf " Ich opfer mich f√ºr das allgemeinwohl enden, oder wo das Abenteuer mit dem (augenscheinlich) eigenem Tod belohnt wird.

Naja was kann ich nun eigentlich sagen...es ist wohl ganz gut selbst f√ºr nen skeptiker wie mich, aber wohl nicht den Vollpreis wert und erfindet vermutlich auch nicht irgendein Genre neu. Ich meine die breite Auswahl an Waffen, Skills, Talente und eigentlichen F√§higkeiten die sich nochmal unterscheiden ist schon net aber trotz mancher nett gestalteten Schlacht fand ichs jetzt auch nicht so innovativ.

Kauf es euch vielleicht einfach billiger, vorallem wenn ihr Drakensang mochtet und die DSA Games m√∂gt.

Ich hoff mal ich war einigen deutlich genug, ich schreibe das Review hier nach ner kleinen Party und sp√§t Abends also habt nachsicht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004963609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1526493605}
review:
You sort of click until you get into the next fight. There is no exploring or looking at the world. The game so far could have just as easily taken place in room (heal, buy/sell stuff, get quests) and you click on next level once everything is prepared. Its comparable to the map mode of dragon age origins. Only that once you get into 3d mode the levels are laughably small.

Fights are an RNG fail mess. Probably 50% of my 95% accuracy attacks just simply missed. Healing spell with 79% success rate works maybe half the time as well. Its the same for the enemy though. And if you hit numbers will vary wildly. Normal attacks will do way more damage then power attacks often enough that i felt there is no real point in using abilities. Maybe it gets better later on...? I dont know but im not sticking around to find out.

review: Âàù‰∏≠Á¨¨‰∏ÄÊ¨°Áé©ÔºåÂ§ßÂ≠¶‰π∞‰∫ÜÊ≠£ÁâàÔºåÈôÜÈôÜÁª≠Áª≠ÔºåÊ≠£ÁâàÁé©‰∫Ü‰∏âÂçÅ‰∏ÉÂ∞èÊó∂„ÄÇÊ∏∏ÊàèÁ≠ñÁï•ÊÄßÂæàÂº∫Ôºå‰∫∫Áâ©ÂÆöÂà∂ÁöÑÊÑüËßâÈùûÂ∏∏Ê£íÔºåÂèØÊÉúÊï∞ÂÄºÁ≥ªÁªüÁöÑÂπ≥Ë°°ÊÄßÂπ∂‰∏çÂ§üÂ•Ω„ÄÇÂÖ≥Âç°ÁöÑËÆæËÆ°ÂæàÂÆπÊòìÂõ†ÂüπÂÖªÊñπÂêëÈÄ†ÊàêÂç°ÂÖ≥„ÄÇË£ÖÂ§áÁ≥ªÁªüÂÅöÂæóÂæàÈ∏°ËÇã„ÄÇÊó†ËÆ∫Â¶Ç‰ΩïÔºåÊÑüË∞¢Ëøô‰πàÂ§öÂπ¥ÈôÜÈôÜÁª≠Áª≠ÁöÑÈô™‰º¥„ÄÇÁúüÁöÑÈùûÂ∏∏Áà±SLGÔºåCRPGÔºåÂèØÊÉúÂ¶Ç‰ªäÂ∑≤‰∏çÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂêàÈÄÇÁöÑÊó∂‰ª£„ÄÇ

author: {'steamid': '76561198025949530', 'num_games_owned': 451, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 930, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 930, 'last_played': 1526417422}
review:
Dieses Spiel ist etwa so gut gebalanced wie eine kaputte Waage. Man kann es schaffen, aber manches frustriert und entnervt nur. Etwa wenn man einen Kampf mit dem Ziel "bewege deine Helden auf die andere Seite" nur geschafft hat, weil der Hauptcharakter am Zielort war und der Rest der Gruppe tot, ist es besonders erfreulich, wenn man danach sofort in den Bosskampf mit einem drachenartigen Wesen geschickt wird, ohne M√∂glichkeit auf Heilung. Was bedeutet, alle Gruppenmitglieder sind auf 1 HP, au√üer eben der Hauptcharakter. Sch√∂n, wenn der Boss dann AoE spamt und seine normalen Attacken zwischen 12 und 16 Schaden machen (50 HP sind viel, als Vergleich).
Oh, und an einer bestimmten Stelle wird ein Caster-Char mit einer Schandmaske ausgestattet, die daf√ºr sorgt, dass diese Person nicht mehr zaubern kann und damit ein √ºberglorifizierter laufender Dolch ohne nennenswerte F√§higkeiten und Verteidigungsm√∂glichkeiten wird. Au√üer man skillt da vorher drauf, aber WOHER SOLL MAN DAS WISSEN WENN MAN KEINE L√ñSUNG LIEST?! Folglich k√§mpft man dann mit diesem Klotz am Bein sich durch die Gegend, auch durch besagte Drachenh√∂hle. Gut, als Meatshield vielleicht noch brauchbar, aber da w√§re etwas mehr Effizienz schon sch√∂n...
Auch zu bewundern sind Gegner, die in doppelter Mannst√§rke der Spielergruppe aufrennen, durch die Bank etwa so viel HP haben wie der Gruppentank und andauernd f√ºr 20+ Schaden critten (erneut, 50 HP sind hier relativ viel). Da man vermutlich nur einen Heiler hat, der logischerweise Magier ist, also in Runde 2 den L√∂ffel abgibt (ja, der wird gerne mal als Ziel priorisiert), ist man reichlich geliefert.
Bei letzterem Beispiel hatte ich dann genug und das Spiel durfte den Abflug machen.
Und nein, nicht alle K√§mpfe sind so schlimm. Aber wenn man jede Spielstunde auf einen Kampf trifft, bei dem es einen nur so juckt, eine Atombombe statt der Helden ins Gefecht zu werfen, l√§uft was falsch.

TL;DR: Streckenweise extrem schlecht gebalanced und daher frustrierend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981732943', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 696, 'last_played': 1526539815}
review: I have only put less than 8 hours into this game so far, and I like it. It reminds me of the ol "Gold Box" games from TSR (Dungeons & Dragons, back in the early 1990s. Most u you probably never heard of them, if some of you were even alive then! I like tactical games. I like turn based RPG that are not in first person view. Not to say I don't like Skyrim and uch, I do, but for different reasons. This game might be very linear, and some do find the constant battles challenging, so do I. I like that aspect and If you figure out how to get the console working (google it) you can give your adventurers what the game calls AP - action points but they are really spendable experience points. You don't "level up" (or at least I haven;t yet) but they let you improve many aspects of your game by expending these AP points. If it is too hard, give your starting characters a few thousand experience points. Spread them around carefully. The set it to normal. If you can't bring yourself to cheat this way, play on easy. It is still challenging. I like this so far. I'm having a great time. I frankly don't understand all the negative reviews unless it is inexperiences Action RPG'ers who want instant fast paced action (arcade like) and don't care about taking your time and using turn-based strategy. After playing several mindless ARPG's this is a definite welcome! If you like turn based combat in your RPG and are patient...but this game. For the price it is now, how can you go wrong?

author: {'steamid': '76561198033843646', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 817, 'last_played': 1526602267}
review:
Ok. Now I understand the negative reviews.

Blackguards is extremely challenging. It feels sometimes really unfair. I thought it is much easier on 'easy' than on 'medium'. ... Mistake.
I changed the difficulty to complete the 'dwarf game'. (you can change it anytimes)
On normal I died always. Even with all other completed sidequests and thought-out skilltree.
Easy mode, only a close win. This game is really hard, even for veterans.
Masochistic game, like Xcom. You need luck to win battles, because of dice calculation/ percentage chance to hit.

Sketchy, because of this rediculous difficulty. 5/10
I recommend it only for veterans and masochistic inclined players.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007599656', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 3848, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3675, 'last_played': 1526739980}
review:
Ok, Cet avis est tr√®s tardif pour un jeu sorti il y a maintenant 4 ans, mais si comme moi il vous faisait de l'oeil (noir) depuis longtemps et que vous vous d√©cidez √† le prendre en budget malgr√© le bataillon de mauvaises critiques qui l'accompagne voici un conseil des plus pr√©cieux :

JOUEZ EN MODE FACILE ET CONSULTEZ LES GUIDES D'ATTRIBUTION DES POINTS D'AVENTURE DES PERSONNAGES.

Parce que si vous √™tes un joueur normal (au sens strict du terme) qui s'int√©resse aux combats tactiques au tour par tour, vous tenez sans doute l√† votre seule chance de pouvoir vraiment appr√©cier ce jeu.

Voil√†, c'est tout et vous pourriez en restez l√†. Et oui vous pouvez me remercier.

Pour ceux que √ßa int√©resse je vais d√©velopper :

Si vous ne suivez pas mon conseil, vous ferez comme j'ai failli faire et vous ragerez de frustration contre cette purge au bout de quelques heures √† vous escrimez sur un combat d√©lirant de difficult√© (le premier d'une longue liste). Mais vous noterez la possibilit√© salvatrice de changer le niveau de difficult√© en cours de partie, point positif qui a litt√©ralement sauv√© mon exp√©rience de jeu.

En effet en mode facile et √† condition d'√©viter les pi√®ges idiots de cette abomination qu'est la progression des personnages, Blackguard devient un jeu sympa et jouable. Et quand je dis jouable je veux dire pas dire que vous allez rouler sur le jeu, non, m√™me en mode facile Blackguard propose un certain challenge et vous ne pourrez pas faire n'importe quoi, seulement vous aurez une bonne chance de vous y amuser au lieu de vous heurtez √† l'√©tron punitif que le gamedesigner sous camisole vous a concoct√© par d√©faut.



Blackguard ne pr√©tend √† rien d'autre qu'√™tre un tactical medi√©val fantastique qui encha√Æne les rencontres et le reste du jeu n'est que l'habillage de cette orientation principale. 

Il se trouve que cette habillage me pla√Æt beaucoup et que je trouve que les critiques sur celui-ci sont plut√¥t injustes voire carr√©ment de mauvaise foi car Blackguard annonce la couleur et ne trompe pas sur la marchandise contrairement √† Larian et ses DOS, DOS2 et BG3 qui se font passer pour des jeux de r√¥les alors que leur seul int√©r√™t est dans les combats (et encore).

S'il y a des failles √† lui reprocher, c'est dans l'ar√®ne qu'elles sont et pas besoin d'aller en chercher plus loin car elles sont b√©antes...

Les r√®gles du jeu de r√¥le ¬´ l'oeil noir ¬ª sont fid√®lement suivies mais pr√©sentent un l√©ger probl√®me‚Ä¶ Elles ne sont absolument pas adapt√©es pour donner un tactical‚Ä¶ tactique : Pas de syst√®me de couverture (ou alors tr√®s tr√®s discret), pas de syst√®me de prise en tenaille ou d'attaque de flanc (pour de la m√™l√©e c'est juste la base et cela revient √† se priver 
d'un int√©r√™t √©vident), il reste le minimum syndical √† savoir les cases bloqu√©es par les personnages, les ajustements d'attaques √† distance et les attaques d'opportunit√©s (qui n'existent m√™me pas par d√©faut). C'est trop maigre pour vraiment d√©velopper une strat√©gie personnelle qui fait la diff√©rence et on se retrouve en lanceur de tirage al√©atoire sur 
lesquelles (et c'est l√† le point noir) le joueur a bien trop peu d'influence. La bataille se joue donc le plus souvent en amont, sur l'√©quipement et surtout, SURTOUT sur la fa√ßon dont les points d'aventure ont √©t√© d√©pens√©es pour faire progresser les personnages. Par charit√© ( et parce que √ßa serait trop long), je ne m'attarderai pas sur cet aspect d√©sastreux du gameplay si ce n'est pour souligner que tout le mal que vous pouvez en lire i√ßi et l√† est encore trop gentil √† mon go√ªt.


J'en termine.


Appeler ¬´ difficult√© normale ¬ª, un cauchemar de frustration sans l√©gitimit√© ludique rel√®ve au mieux de la b√™tise crasse et au pire du sabotage industriel. C'est tout con mais juste augmenter d'un niveau la d√©nomination des niveaux de difficult√© aurait peut √™tre pu sauver le jeu de toutes ces √©valuations pleines de rage justifi√©e. On reste pantois devant autant d'amateurisme.

Mais si le game design a √©t√© chi√© par des cr√©tins incomp√©tents dont la seule ambition semble d'avoir voulu g√¢cher tout le bon travail de leurs coll√®gues graphistes et programmeurs vous n'y √™tes pour rien.

Ne vous sentez donc pas coupable.

Rendez-vous service et LAISSEZ VOTRE EGO DE COTE en jouant en mode facile.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273928279', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 3034, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2839, 'last_played': 1525652072}
review:
- TECHNIQUE ET FASTIDIEUX
Attir√©e par une promotion all√©chante sur un bundle de jeux Daedalic, je me suis retrouv√©e en possession de 'Blackguards', un RPG organis√© autour de combats au tour par tour. Le pitch paraissait sympathique (du RPG et des combats), mais je me suis rapidement retrouv√©e embourb√©e dans un gameplay lent et ennuyeux.
Du role playing, je n'en ai pas vraiment vu: les choix dans les dialogues n'influent que rarement sur le cours de l'histoire. Les relations entre les personnages sont st√©r√©otyp√©es. On ne s'attache pas vraiment √† eux. Les villes se ressemblent. Les PNJ sont interchangeables. 
Des combats, par contre, j'en ai vu, vu, vu et revu. Les critiques que j'avais lues attiraient l'attention sur leur difficult√©. En fait, √† part quatre ou cinq combats plut√¥t compliqu√©s, ils s'agit juste d'optimiser une ou deux aptitudes chez chacun des personnages et les utiliser encore et encore, avec, de temps en temps, quelques variations de tactique. Il m'a fallu recommencer plusieurs fois un certain nombre de combats, certes, mais j'ai vu pire dans d'autres rpg. 
Entre temps, il faudra s'armer de patience pour cumuler points d'aventures (n√©cessaires √† la progression de vos personnages) et Ducats (n√©cessaire √† l'achat de mat√©riel d√©cent).
Vous l'aurez compris, je n'ai pas vraiment aim√© ce jeu, trop r√©p√©titif et lin√©aire. Le mot qui me revenait √† chaque fois √©tait le mot FASTIDEUX.
N√©anmoins, j'ai appr√©ci√© le syst√®me tr√®s ouvert de customisation des personnages gr√¢ce aux points d'aventure, le moteur pour l'optimisatrice que je suis, dans ce jeu. 
Si vous √™tes fans de jeux de r√¥le ouverts (Baldur's Gate, Pillars of Eternity...), vous pouvez vous passer de Blackguards, tr√®s  technique et peu satisfaisant en terme de construction de personnages r√©alistes. 
Par contre si vous aimez le combat au tour par tour (et √™tes plein de patience!), ou si vous trouvez le jeu √† un prix r√©duit et que vous √™tes curieux de tester ce genre de gameplay, allez voir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198798159939', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 9107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3936, 'last_played': 1574333452}
review: Die Geschichte ist gut gemacht und stimmungsvoll. Grafik und Gameplay sind in Ordnung. Die K√§mpfe sind h√§ufig extrem unfair und von Gl√ºck und Zufall abh√§ngig (Und ich bin ein erfahrener Spieler und spiele nur auf "normal"). Manche K√§mpfe habe ich ein Dutzend Mal gespielt bevor ich sie so mehr schlecht als recht geschafft habe. Die Zwergenspiele habe ich nie hin bekommen, weil die Gegner viel zu heftig sind. Obwohl ich Zauber auf Stufe 8 habe und nur Zauber relevante Attribute gesteigert habe misslingen die Zauber sehr h√§ufig (teilweise 3-4 Mal hinter einander, so das der Zauberer in manchen K√§mpfen im Prinzip keinen Zauber hin bekommt. Ganz im Gegensatz zu den Gegnern). Wundheilung habe ich ebenfalls auf 8 und trotzdem misslingt die Heilung im Extremfall 5 Mal hinter einander. Sehr frustrierend. Deshalb empfehle ich das Spiel nicht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118428259', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 3615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2291, 'last_played': 1558886788}
review:
Blackguards is one of those odd RPGs for folks who love unique stat mechanics in their battles and a slight variation on what you would expect in a story. It is frustrating at times, but more often enjoyable. An interesting story and combat rules make up for a couple of glaring technical issues and writing foibles.

-

I'll start with the negative aspects, since they are notable enough to be "make or break" for most RPG players:

There are no respec options or training areas to get infinite "experience" to round out characters. If you commit a stat point, then you have to live with the long-term consequences. In general, you have to decide in advance what you want each party member to specialize in. The real kicker is that several achievements require you to spend a lot of stat points to make a character have a bunch of general skills with no specialization, guaranteeing that they will be useless in most situations rather than very strong in their main role. Finally, some builds just aren't viable past the mid-game; if you chose to specialize someone in Fencing and Throwing weapons or Traps, then you'll be very annoyed to find a lack of legendary Fencing weapons and that Traps and Throwables just do not deal enough damage or utility to scratch later enemies.

The game pulls an Aerith on [spoiler]one of the more interesting and well-written playable characters less than halfway through. You will lose someone permanently, and their replacement is a very dull and flat Generic Tribal Warrior dude with  little personality, backstory, or plot importance; the replacement is just kind of there to be another body on your team and will never do anything in cutscenes other than sit back and grunt.[/spoiler]

The game is very buggy, even after years of supposed bug fixes. Graphics sometimes bug out, the UI occasionally stops working, enemy AI turns off, side-quests randomly appear or disappear with no known reason, and achievements that require an entire playthrough to acquire simply will not be awarded no matter how many times you reload that Point Of No Return save. The sound also falters every single time a multi-target spell goes off, without fail.

Lastly, the game just... ends. On most story paths, there is a brief and inconclusive epilogue after the final boss that does not really address the repercussions (or lack thereof) and may even contradict the warnings that the final boss gives you about your actions.

-

Now, on to the strengths of the game!

Almost every battle is unique. I never felt like I was redoing the same fight over and over again like I do in other RPGs. Even fights that take place in the same gladiator arena as an earlier battle require a new set of tactics and positioning choices. A lot of fights also involve small puzzles or gimmicks that contribute to victory. This is probably the biggest step-up over other RPGs, in my opinion.

Most of your playable characters are entertaining to listen to and have their own perspectives on the situation. Witty banter and sardonic humor abound, and everyone will offer several solutions to multiple situations; choosing one option is quite likely to amuse someone else and annoy a third. Although, it's a pity that [spoiler]you lose one of the better, more dramatic characters and are stuck with a dull meatbot partway through[/spoiler].

While you are limited in the amount of points you get for stat and talent distribution, you do get many options on how to build your main character and allies. It is very feasible to make an archer that dodges all melee attacks while picking away at enemy rangers, or to have a tank mage casually ignoring everything the boss tries to do to them. Just remember that you kind of need to commit to a character only having one or two specialties if you want them to be effective.

The story takes some unexpected and delightful turns, especially on some of the longer sidequests. You also have a good amount of influence on it, even in comparison to most RPGs. The outcomes of several quests and the overall story in your game will likely deviate a lot from what someone else did.

-

In conclusion, I recommend picking up the Blackguards bundle off of the Blackguards 2 Steam page whenever it goes on sale. The games are worth playing, so long as you can tolerate a few black spots on the gems.

author: {'steamid': '76561198258192941', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 4964, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4964, 'last_played': 1524858473}
review:
[h1] 6,5/10 Affascinante sotto alcuni aspetti [/h1]

Grafica accettabile, reparto sonoro molto gradevole, la storia √® valida ma poteva venire molto meglio.

Storia interessante i combattimenti a turni ce ne sono troppi messi per allungare il brodo, in alcuni punti ci si annoia per la ripetivit√† mentre in altri i dialoghi, eventi inaspettati e trama sono molto piacevoli, dalle primare alle secondarie le missioni sono abbastanza varie, dei bug (parlo per la versione MAC) sono stato obbligato a riavviare degli scontri perch√® si bloccava, nulla di eccessivamente grave, solo un po frustrante.

Un sistema di LV up inizialmente complesso ma abbastanza varieggiato.

Bocciatura per la personalizzazione del personaggio in cui si dovr√† scegliere tra pochissimi visi di default (alcuni anche molto brutti) si avrebbe potuto arginare il problema con la variet√† di armi/armature e etc. che purtroppo le ho trovate troppo poche.

Tutto sommato √® stato divertente anche se non rimmarr√† negli annali come miglior rpg a turni resta un buon titolo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971663658', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1529068663}
review: Simple game, if a little clumsy with a pithy storyline and forgettable characters.  On balance a thumbs up, because it has such captivating graphics.  But graphics aren't everything, so if you're easaily bored by simplicity and repetition and uninspired gameplay, stay clear of this one.  A pity Steam don't give a third option, in additon to "like" and "dislike" -- a neutral choice for a so-so game.  I'd suggest popping it on your wishlist and waiting till it's at 90% off like I did, so you won't feel cheated if you find it tiresomely simple.  At just a few quid it passes the time nicely, at full price I'd be screaming for a refund.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088229804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 2373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2373, 'last_played': 1524608486}
review:
Blackguards ist meiner Meinung nach ein durchaus gutes rundenbasiertes Rollenspiel, sofern man einige Einstiegsh√ºrden √ºbersteht.

Das Spiel basiert auf dem Regelwerk von "Das schwarze Auge" und ist eine PC-Version von den mehr oder weniger bekannten "Pen&Paper"-Spielen. Hierunter darf man sich eine Mischung aus Gesellschaftspiel, Erz√§hlung und Improvisationstheater verstehen, welche eben einem recht strengen Regelwerk folgt.

Und hier liegt die Einstiegsh√ºrde. Zum einen sind die Regeln nicht direkt aus dem Spiel-/Kampfablauf erkennbar, wodurch man nicht wirklich gut versteht wie die Aktionen Angriff, Parieren und Ausweichen mit diversen Spezialaktionen und Charakterattributen zusammenh√§ngen. Zus√§tzlich spielt halt noch ein gewisser Zufallsfaktor mit, da es eben sich um die Adaption eines (w√ºrfelbasierten) Gesellschaftsspiel handelt.

Und dann kommt noch hinzu, dass es ein "level-loses" Spiel ist. Man bekommt als Belohnung f√ºr K√§mpfe und Auftr√§ge sogenannte "Abenteuerpunkte". Diese werden f√ºr alle Aktionen verwendet, die einen Charakter betreffen. Das Erh√∂hen der Grundwerte, der Fertigkeiten, der Waffenf√§higkeiten, sowie von Sonderf√§higkeiten und Zaubern (wenn der Charakter Magie begabt ist). Gerade zu Beginn ist man hier schnell √ºberfordert und man kann auch recht viel falsch machen.

Mein Tip ist: Bevor man das Spiel startet, sollte man sich erstmal mit dem Regelwerk auseinander setzen. Zum Beispiel gibt es bei Steam echt gute Guides/Anleitungen, die einem echt weiterhelfen und das n√∂tige Verst√§ndnis schaffen.

Wenn man sich mithilfe eines Guides in das Regelwerk eingearbeitet hat, entfaltet die Charakterentwicklung sehr viel Potential. Man kann die Charakter nach Lust und Laune als Nahk√§mpfer, Fernk√§mpfer oder Magier spezialisieren. Man kann aber auch beliebige Kombinationen erstellen. Ausnahme sind die Zauber, diese k√∂nnen nur von Charakteren erlernt und angewendet werden, die Magie als Grundausrichtung haben. Sch√∂n ist hier, dass sich die Charakter auch wirklich "anders" spielen, jenachdem welche Waffen sie beherrschen und √ºber welche F√§higkieten sie verf√ºgen.

Auch wird der Zusammenhang zwischen der einzelnen Werten und Fertigkeiten und dem Kampfsystem sp√ºrbar verst√§ndlich und man kann es gezielt ausnutzen um starke Charakterer zu entwicklen. Hier liegt dann wirklich eine gro√üe St√§rke des Spiels.

Die K√§mpfe sind taktisch mitunter sehr fordernd, lassen sich aber h√§ufig mit guten Management der F√§higkeiten der Charaktere, Waffen und Zauber gut schaffen. Die Umgebung l√§sst sich h√§ufig auch mit in den Kampf einbinden, so dass auch hier taktische K√§mpfe m√∂glich sind.

Das Spiel selber ist sehr story-lastig. Dies beruht wieder darauf, dass es sich um die Adaption eines Pen&Paper-Spiels handelt. Die Geschichte enth√§lt einige √úberraschungen, den ein oder anderen Spannungsbogen und erz√§hlt auch gut die Beziehungen zwischen den einzelnen Figuren. Diese wirken sehr passend f√ºr die Atmosph√§re.

Zusammenfassend kann ich sagen, dass das Spiel sich lohnt. Man muss sich definitiv in das Spiel einarbeiten, am Besten mit Hilfe eines Guides. F√ºr Spieler die mal eben eine schnelle Runde "Monster-Metzeln" wollen ist es dagegen wahrscheinlich eher ungeeignet.
