author: {'steamid': '76561198068141034', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 3046, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3046, 'last_played': 1524708570}
review:
I have a bit more time logged than shown cuz I played offline. I'm in Chapter 4, and I think Ch 5 is the last one. 

People have panned this game, unfairly I think, it deserves much more than a 'mixed' response. 

It's a haxagonal spaces, turn based, team combat, rpg. The atmosphere is dark, tho not depressing, there's a lot of black humor, and violence humor. 

The team really are BlackGuards - blaggards! Your mage is a womanizer, your witch is a liar, the dwarf is like addicted to violence (don't let him speak to anyone lol! Unless, ofc, you want some more exp, but sometimes you can overdo it and sort of violence your way out the wrong end of a quest, or finish it too early because there's no players left in the storyline :s). 

Some of the things you do are very questionable. While you might do heroic stuff - rescue maidens, priests, etc. you're also going to beat people into servitude, frame people, kill them on a whim, or because someone paid you to do it. Sometimes you find a quest item, and it's actually an awesome peice of weaponry, and you lie to the guy who sent you looking for it. No, we didn't find it yet :) 

Occasionally you can use an alternative to violence, e.g. charm, negotiate, or bribe your way forward. But rah, it's the beatings that this game is all about! 

Now... whyyy it gets panned in reviews.... cuz the first two chapters are the most difficult.... they are very very difficult.... gold is hard to get, Action Points (AP) which are the building blocks for your skills, are slow to accumulate, and the dizzying array of skills and spells and talents you can spend them on just seem to absorb what little AP you get, to very little effect. All of the stats grow very slowly, and among them is the percentile chance of your attack actually hitting home. 

At this point in the game, ranged opposition like archers will chop your team to quivering sushi. Your healer runs out of mana crazy fast, and you can't afford the pots to boost him. You need to sleep in an inn after every battle to recover. 

Under these conditions, you... are... streeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeetched to your team's limits. You can have an okay team, statted as well as you can stat them for that time in the story/game, you know that if you could set up your ideal defence or offence layout, that you could probably whup anything... but.... the field of battle is not letting you! lol! Stretched thin, is your line, at your absolute limit of what each individual and the team as a whole is capable of dealing with.... so... in that situation... what's the feeling when one of your melee fighters fumbles a crucial attack, swings, misses, lets some beast thru that savages your mage, the whole thing 's toppling like a tower of cards! 

It happens over, and over.. sometimes it happens becuase you didn't figure the map/baddies or the battlefield layout properly. In the early days, there are things in the battle areas that you neeeed to take advantage of, or you're not gonna get thru the battle. In other words, you team isn't always enough, the first couopla chapters has you on a knife edge of whether you can or can't beat the battle you're in, and like I say, your actual hit success stats are low, the lowest they're ever going to be, so its really tough. 

It gets you determined tho! 

It riles you up, that's for sure. But there is a way to ease the strain of all this. 

I got to a particular battle.... the 8th part of The Nine Hordes (which isn't really what it sounds like) (no spiolers! I just mention it to segue into this story....)

It got me, over and over, and I juuuust couldn't see howww, howwwww I couold ever prevent x, y, and z, from happening.... there seemed nothing I could do... so... I went looking for a walkthru.... 

I found on YouTube, this guy, freaki'n pretending... pretending! To be playing BlackGuards for the first time.... all like, what's that? idk what they do.... while at the same time flashing through the ability menus like a pro, he was doing it far faster than me! and as well... this battle... this particular one I looked up like this... he's like... okay... this this, that that... he was WORSE than me! But he beat it.... and I'm like, wth!? They move differently against me! They run away and re-energise! They go straight for the maguffin and bring the battle to a sudden halt in just a few moves! Why didn't they do that to him!? 

So... this is when I took the nuclear option.... the ultimate in winning strategy! 

I accessed the difficulty settings and put the game on 'easy' :) 

Oh nowww! Nooowwwww those things move like they did for that guy in the YT vid! Omg!!! What a cheese! What a Cheese head thing to do! Put it on 'easy' and then pretend that you've never played it before, and be all like, hawwww-he-hawwww, euuuhhh, ohheyyyy, yeuuhhh,  yupyup, I'm so good.... WHAT!? You freaki'n moron! 

omg... so... anyway.... I made it soooo far, before changing the settings to 'easy' ... and rah! The AP accumlates quicker, the hit rate is higher on my team, and the battles come down from 'impossible' to 'manageable.' 

Then give it another chapter... oh thennn we see some payback! 

Then... thennnn.... you start to build those skills.. you've earned literally tens of thousands of AP... you've maxed some abilities out already... you barely miss hit anymore.... you don't need to use pots to repelnish your mage and witch, becuasse they generate mana as they go along! You don't need to sleep after every battle, because you can just heal at the start of the next one, and replenish mages while you and the bad guys are rushing toward each other. And arrows?
 Arrows?? Don't make me laugh! My men brush them aside! The team is strong! Very strong! 

My dwarf now has a 'hammerblow' ability, which gives him three times his attack power, at the cost of lower hit rate... it's 60% usually, his hit rate on that.... which means that more than half the time he's gonna use 3 times his power. ALWAYS use it! lolol! It's a bad guy crusher! He's an OHKO machine! 

So... the game is long.. the battles are long.. and it's a slow burner to get started.... the 'easy' setting feels like it should be the default setting, with the normal one as 'veteran' perhaps... that's how it feels compared to other games. 

And... its... satisfying! Ohhhhh yes, nowww we're motorin', nowww we're talkin'! This is what I wanted to see! My hard, hard team pushing back the bad guys, weathering their spell storms, brushing their arrows aside, and then SMAK!!!!! Oh yeahhhh! You deserved that! You thougth you'd get by because you paralyzed my healer? Think again! Wham-bam-balammmm! awwwwww, are you on the floor? Here, have a 100% chance of landing Power shot while you lay there! 

BAMMMMMMMMMMMMMM!!!!

Ha! Haaaaa! Yeahhhh! 

That's what this game is all about :) 

The graphics are good, I'd say, scenery is nice. Gameplay is compulsive and satisfying. The voice acting is amazing, I love it, there's real layers in the toning. Your witch is a Kiera Knightly-a-like, with that English sort of delectation on the ends of some of her words. Really a hot voice, and liek I say rich with character, it's difficult to even envision people are reading this stuff from sheets into microphones, these voices are so authentic.

Your own team, and people in towns, react to how beautiful your witch is :) tha'ts sorta fun :) 

The team is fun as a whole. 

I've already bought BlackGuards 2, on the basis of the first three chapters of this. I absolutely love it, I don't want it to end, it has me that gripped. 

Okay, it's not going to be for everyone, but I think... well crikey.... the sheer number of people complaining that the game is too difficult... fraaaa... you mean... you paid for the game... it stopped you in your tracks... so rather than lowering the difficulty setting, you throw that cash away, turn your nose up at the game, and leave a bad review? 

Nyeuuuhhh, don't listen to them. This is fantastic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107896640', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 857, 'last_played': 1524599377}
review:
I obtained a copy because the regional price for 1 & 2 bundle was barely more than 1 usd. The main features that attracted my attention was turn-based, hex playboard and rpg. I was a big fan of xcom games, and I was so impressed by Daedalic's blade of the shogun, so my expectation was high. The game turned out to be a real pain instead.

Technically, the game crashed on the first startup, with a full size loading screen that cannot be removed or superposed, and I had to force restart my pc. Also, every time I tried to adjust sound or any other options, the game will be reset to an 800x600 resolution with full screen. The font of the UI also look blurry at 1440p while the rest of the UI looks fine.

In terms of game mechanics, I should not impose my subjective opinion on others, but like many have said, the rng was no joke. For example, a weapon with a 2D6+3 damage (two dice rolls plus 3) generates an output ranging from 4 to 15, so most of the time you will find it futile to plan your moves since its performace is unpredictable out of proportion. Most of the time I find myself quickloading an encounter over and over to have the fight starts favorably, because otherwise I would not be able to progress through the game, since the quest lines are mostly plainly linear. For reference, I played on normal difficulty.

There are of course interesting aspects of this game. I enjoyed the voice acting, for what it's worth, and the skill tree is mildly interesting. The visual is ok, albeit the lack of horizontal camera rotation was irritating. All in all, I'd recommand you to just try out other rpgs like divinity series and pillar of eternity, or even heroes of might & magic 3 for the hex mechanics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028993615', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 1983, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1761, 'last_played': 1522242303}
review:
The story is bland and the gameplay has annoying faults.
- camera can't be rotated - thus you end up fighting the camera more often than enemies
- there is no way to skip or speed up enemy turns - enjoy waiting for ages until a horde of zombies slowly walk to their destination one by one
- alt-tabbing pauses the game - so you can't skip enemy turns that way either
- inventory management is a pain - there are no option to sort equipment in any meaningful way, to compare an item across characters, the encumbrance system gets annoying fast
- the skill wheel is tiresome to navigate once all the hotkey skills are used up.

All these issues make the game feel more like a chore than something fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198297909459', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 978, 'last_played': 1523983113}
review:
√® un bel malloppo davvero questo gioco, sono ben venti giga da scaricare all'interno del vostro computer e ci potrebbero volere dei giorni per riuscirci
detto questo, diciamo che √® un titolo western rpg, con nani, elfi, goblin e via discorrendo
lo sviluppo dei characters √® la prima cosa che ho notato essere strana, √® un metodo bizzarro e difficile da descrivere a parole, riassumendo i programmatori non hanno impostato il salire di livello come avrebbero invece dovuto; ovvero con logica
la stessa cosa si pu√≤ dire per le abilit√† di battaglia da utilizzare in guerra, tutto ha una tonalit√† offuscata e non precisa come invece dovrebbe
le colonne sonore sono davvero pessime e molto mal suonate, l'unica loro vera utilit√† √® il "pagliaccizzare" le nostre gesta
parliamo delle animazioni perch√© graficamente √® invece un bestione con cui dovrete scendere a patti con i settaggi per settarlo a dovere, i personaggi hanno delle animazioni che io personalente ho trovato strane, sembra quasi che il muoversi, costi loro eccessiva fatica, inoltre sono ridicoli e si muovono in maniera ridicola
a proposito della difficolt√†, puntualmente il gioco, ti fa affrontare delle situazioni ben al di sopra delle nostre possibilit√†, con un numero di nemici su schermo, puntualmente di gran lunga superiore al nostro
poi c'√® da segnalare invece un fattore molto positivo; ovvero il poter disporre di numerose tipologie di azioni negli scontri che generalmente, andranno a sfociare nell'interazione con l'ambiente
in ultimo voglio solo segnalare un evento molto strano, se il gioco mi dice che ho il 95% di possibilit√† di centrare un colpo di spada su un nemico, mi aspetto che esattamente come viene scritto, una volta su venti io possa effettivamente sbagliare il colpo, e invece no, a conti fatti io non so esattamente che colcoli faccia blackguards e che calcolatrice usi perch√© io personalmente ho fatto i conti, il 95% corrisponde pi√π o meno al centrare 4 colpi su dieci
questo √® tutto
ne ho parlato male? non ho consigliato questo gioco? fregatevene e se potete acquistatelo, √® comunque un'ottima esperienza ed √® davvero molto divertente

author: {'steamid': '76561197993894575', 'num_games_owned': 349, 'num_reviews': 253, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1523907291}
review:
Awful, kinda what I figured before making my purchase but got it for like 3 dollars so pulled the trigger hoping to find a hidden gem. 

The UI is terrible, it is so hard to even look at gear and compare; and mostly screens are void of essential information while being full of pointless gibberish.  The UI in battles is even worse. Almost impossible to click on the hex you mean to and half the time it just deselects it faster than you can left or right click; but you will be doing mostly right clicking as you have to go through three menus just to do a basic attack with both weapons when dual wielding. This game is a disaster in sensible UI design and function.

The game falls into a rut most clueless gameplay designers choose when building strategy games. Just another missing simulator that is more frustrating than tactical. I could miss or I could hit for 2 or I could hit for 11; who knows but can‚Äôt create tactics around it.

I would just pass on this for any amount; it‚Äôs just a generic strategy RPG that does everything wrong.

review:
Moui... je lui donnerais un 7/10. 

Y a de tr√®s bonnes choses, et d'autres √©valuations vous les ont d√©j√† donn√©es je pense. Je donnerai les points n√©gatifs car ils ne sont pas r√©dhibitoires.

- Combats parfois r√©p√©titifs. Ce n'est pas g√™nants car ils ne sont pas long mais, des fois, √ßa ressemble √† du remplissage.
- Trop facile/difficile. Il suffit de quelques erreurs de r√©partition de points pour qu'un combat devienne horrible. A l'inverse √ßa peut devenir trop facile et vous aimeriez passer le combat.
- "Et hop!" C'√©tait tendu √©quilibr√© aux deux premiers chapitres et au troisi√®me j'ai rempli mes personnages de PA! J'ai max√© plein de choses. Je ne sais pas trop quoi en penser... 

Mais ces points ne g√¢che pas vraiment le plaisir du jeu. Si vous √™tes un joueur exigeant, il sera un peu fade. Sinon il est tr√®s bien.

ps: ne ragez pas lorsque vous raterez quatre fois d'affil√© un jet √† + de 90%. Sur l'ensemble du jeu √ßa se niv√®le, et des fois vous r√©ussirez des jets √† - de 45% plusieurs fois d'affil√©. :)

review: √â um jogo de turnos, estrat√©gia. at√© que a historia √© boa, muita gente que voc√™ acha que era do bem se vira contra voc√™ e outros que parecem o demonio te ajudam. Ruim √© que suas escolhas n√£o mudam tanto o final do jogo como o prologo promete, quem tem que morrer no jogo vai morrer de qualquer jeito. Seus companheiros s√£o limitados, poderia ter mais, tipo quero uma equipe s√≥ de magos ou outro tipo, mas n√£o, √© sempre o an√£o o mago o selvagem e  o personagem principal que por sinal √© o √∫nico que pode ser customizado totalmente, como exemplo de jogo assim FF Tactics. Seus companheiros podem morrer a vontade n√£o chore que no fim da partida se voc√™ ganhar eles est√£o l√° inteiros. Outra possibilidade que poderia ter seria fuga do combate, tipo os campos s√£o abertos, voc√™ entrou numa luta e acha desnecess√°rio ou que vai perder, tentar escapar n√£o √© op√ß√£o, mesmo com magias de acelerar o passo e muro magico, coisa chata.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071095171', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 8296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7734, 'last_played': 1707687011}
review: I really love this game, even if it has it's limitations. It is very atmospheric and deep rooted within in the realms of Aventuria. Maybe not 100% accurate - but we're talking about a fictional universe anyways, right? So if you want to dive deeper into the realms of "Das Schwarze Auge"/ "The Dark Eye", I really can't recommend you this game enough. I had well fun with it. It is also quite close to the ruleset of the of the 4.1 Edition of Das Schwarze Auge and even thaught me some mechanics when I was new to the system. Many of the places and cities you visit have their own describtions and maps in supplements etc. - so there is a really rich background  you can really see (if you know where and what to look for) and feel in this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028367646', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3063, 'last_played': 1591356819}

author: {'steamid': '76561197978969288', 'num_games_owned': 518, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 2104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2104, 'last_played': 1522181263}
review:
Blackguards is a RPG with a lot of emphasis on combat, every encounter in the game was handicrafted and therefore can be very challenging, while the combat system can be ok and the game allows you to pursue a lot of different careers, the game suffers from a whole lot of problems, starting from its longevity, its pretty long and you'll be doing a lot of combat in this game, so if you're somebody that prefers comfy experiences in RPG you're in for a rough time with this game, its very action oriented and there's not much of roleplaying here. 
It's certainly a good game but if you give this game a shot, you're in for a bumpy ride.

author: {'steamid': '76561198149866476', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2789, 'last_played': 1522010522}
review:
Daumen hoch!

Huhu, ich muss etwas weiter ausholen! 

Also ich habe einige schlechte Rezensionen gelesen, das Spiel aber in einem Bundle trotzdem erworben, da ich ein gro√üer Daedalic-Fan bin. Ich war anfangs auch sehr genervt und hab den ersten Durchlauf als Magierin abgebrochen. 

Aber dann hab ich als Kriegerin losgelegt und anders geskillt. Wenn jemandem das Spiel nicht gef√§llt, hatte er wohl einfach kein Interesse, sich mit dem System richtig auseinander zu setzen und mag keine rundenbasierten Spiele. Ich habe mir gerade den zweiten Teil gekauft und freue mich, gleich los zu legen.

Story/Hauptquest: Sehr fesselnd, ich wollte unbedingt wissen, wie es weiter geht. 

Nebenquests: Ich bin da ein kleiner Junkie, hoffe, ich habe alle erwischt. 
Am Anfang auf der Karte dachte ich, is ja etwas d√ºrftig, hoffentlich ist das Spiel nicht zu kurz und irgendwann kommt man dann auf die restliche Karte und denkt, das dauert bestimmt ewig, wie geil ist das denn!

Nachdem ich mich in das Gameplay und die Skills eingefunden habe, hat es mega viel Spa√ü gemacht! Ich gebe eine klare Empfehlung und werde es bestimmt noch ein paar mal spielen!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971355620', 'num_games_owned': 512, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1691, 'last_played': 1676229547}
review:
Descubri Deadalic por el juego llamado Deponia, el cual me gusto bastante y me parecio entretenido, ya que no so mucho de aventura grafica.

Vi este en ofertas de steam a un precio ridiculo, y me decidi a pillarlo, GRATA SORPRESA AMIGO!
Yo pense q ya no se hacian juegos de este estilo, por turnos de fantasia y jodidos como debe ser, me recuerda mucho a mis partidas de D&D 3,5 en mis tiempos mozos.. bueno un mozo sigo siendo pero ya me entiendes xD

A lo q voy q se me va la cabeza, si eres de esas personas q buscar un reto, pensar xq haces cada movimiento y para que, y escalonar tus jugadas pensado q va hacer la IA, un poco cheta aveces XD, y salga todo como tu kerias, lo cual da un gustico.....

RECOMENDADO SIN DUDA!

author: {'steamid': '76561197992456098', 'num_games_owned': 908, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1522852719}
review: I waited for the sale to buy this one, just because of the mixed reviews.  And all I have to say is that I simply love this one.  The storyline, the aesthetics, the premise, the mechanics, the difficulty... all of it... I've been waiting for this.  Longer than I should have.  I'm emmersed in it and very, very happy.  I don't recommend it, maybe it's not your cup of tea, or your brand of game.  Maybe you're not into something that's rogue and different... I just like it.  It's for me.

review: Un juego de combate por turnos y gesti√≥n de escuadr√≥n muy cuidado y desafiante. La historia, aunque escueta, es suficiente para mantenerte interesado. Los combates son todos interesantes, con escenarios est√©ticamente muy bonitos. Las decisiones que tomas como jugador en cuanto al inventario y progreso de tus personajes, realmente da la sensaci√≥n de ser importante y determinante en la resoluci√≥n de muchos combates. author: {'steamid': '76561198075880603', 'num_games_owned': 213, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1563, 'last_played': 1518993248}
review:
Si no quieres leer todo el analisis al final tienes una valoraci√≥n numerica.

Blackguards nos pone en la piel de un grupo de marginados sociales y nuestro personaje, los cuales estan todos encerrados en la carcel por motivos injustos, ¬øo no? este peculiar grupo va a intentar salver el mundo no sin percances por el camino, ¬øTe fiaras de esta panda de criminales?

La idea era buena, mecanicas del juego de rol Dungeons and Dragons aplicadas a un juego por turnos en el que "podemos" elegir el camino de evoluci√≥n de los pj... o eso pense al principio... la dificultad de los niceles varia absurdamente dejandote como unica opci√≥n, empezar de nuevo e combate y rezar para que no te envenene esta vez, no falles todo el tiempo un golpe del 95% o que los enemigos caigan en tus trampas... esto una y otra vez.

La traducci√≥n es "decente" no te vas a sorprender excepto en una de las ciudades ya el en ese momento el juego no esta traducido almenos 15-20 dialogos, no os preocupeis puesto que esta secci√≥n es un ingles muy sencillo que todos podremos entender, si embargo lo que no podremos hacer es la cantidad de bugs, la falta de farmeo para que nuestros pj cojan exp equipo, etc la imposibilidad de tomar muchas de las decisiones (no os encari√±eis con la arquera drogata) y las dificultades constantemente cambiantes.

En definitiva un juaego que me ha dado unas 30h de diversi√≥n/desesperaci√≥n y que las ultimas horas me costo horrores jugar haciendolo obligado practicamente, teniendo un final decente.

Musica 4/10
Niveles 0/10
Apartado grafico 7/10
Mecanica 7/10
Histotia 6/10

Valoraci√≥n final: 4,8 

Duraci√≥n 20-40h
Rejugable NO

author: {'steamid': '76561198812268190', 'num_games_owned': 17, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1520312594}
review:
I am newer to the specific genre of hex grid games like this, or Turn-Based RPG.
I didn't like it, but I believe it is a pretty decent representation of what to expect.
The one thing I struggle to accept, is that there is a lack of camera controls, and honestly, sometimes you can barely click on an opponents feet in order to attack. It's a silly complaint, but a "zoom" feature, or "rotate camera" would in my opinion turn this rather blas√© gaming experience into a memorable excursion from the everyday grind of life.

7/10 Graphics
5/10 Mechanics
6/10 Story
----------
6/10 Overall

author: {'steamid': '76561198009190567', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 3513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1118, 'last_played': 1589311791}
review:
If this were a phone app It would be great! unfortunately It is a "game", it is really a point and click interactive story that is interupted by anoying battles.

POOR and repetative. 
Over complicated armour and weapons system.
Graphic style makes it look ten years older than it is.
Charecters are weak story-wise, i do not care about what happens to them.
NPC encounters are linear and dull.
trade system is needlesly awkward.

Plus points,
Story is ok, but battles feel like they interupt it. Or maybe it is the other way around. 
You can smash objects in fights that add some tactical advantages.

Bottom Line. Buy if it is on sale and you don't have anything else to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008324440', 'num_games_owned': 422, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 5651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5651, 'last_played': 1519766143}
review:
Phex zum Gru√üe!

Fans von Games mit rundenbasierenden ("Schachbrett-") K√§mpfen √§hnlich wie in "M&M: Heroes", "Disciples" oder "Grotesque Tactics"werdem mit Sicherheit auf ihre Kosten kommen. Bei Blackguards f√ºrht ihr allerdings keine Armeen in die Schlacht, sondern "nur" euch selbst und eure Heldentruppe.

Das Spiel ist unter einer DSA-Lizenz (Das schwarze Auge/Pen & Paper RPG) erschienen. Ihr spielt also in Aventurien. Die Regeln sind etwas angepasst (soweit ich das sagen kann), alte DSA-Veteranen werden sich in den Talenten, Zaubern u.√§. aber schnell zurecht finden. Alle anderen aber auch nach kurzer Eingew√∂hnung. Entweder erkl√§rt der Infotext Funktionen und Items oder das kompakte Ingame-Tutorial bringt Licht ins Dunkel.

Die Story ist ok, keine gro√üen √úberraschungen oder Wendungen, welche man nicht erahnen kann. Ihr werdet eines Mordes angeklagt, den ihr vermutlich nicht begangen habt. Schnell zeigen sich auch Anzeichen, dass der Kult des Namenlosen wohl auch seine Finger mit im Spiel hat. Neben der Hauptquest gibt es zahlreiche Nebenquest, diese sollte man am besten auch alle erledigen. Die Erfahrungspunkte und Belohnungen sind relativ wichtig f√ºr ein sicheres vorankommen im Spiel.

Da alle Zauber, Angriffe, Talentanwendungen im DSA Stil ausgew√ºrfelt werden, kann der Chaosfaktor manchmal recht hoch sein. Deshalb immer:

SOS (SEHR OFT SPEICHERN)

und nicht gleich verzagen, wenn ein Kampf mal 4-5 Anl√§ufe braucht. Nutzt Gifte, Fallen und benutzbare Punkte (Hotkey: V) auf dem Schlachtfeld.

Mit den erhaltenen Erfahrungspunkten k√∂nnt ihr eure Charaktere direkt aufleveln. Einen "richtigen" Levelaufstieg gibt es nicht. Je nach H√∂he des angestrebten Wertes im Talent/Attribut/Kampfskill zahlt ihren einen mit jedem mal steigenden Betrag an XP. Das k√∂nnt ihr, au√üer im Kampf, jederzeit machen. 

Die Grafik ist kein √úberflieger, sondern eher zweckdienlich. Reicht aber vollkommend f√ºr vollen Spielgenu√ü, wenn einem die Sicherungen noch nicht durchgeschmorrt sind und man au√üer Grafik auch noch andere Dinge in Spielen wertsch√§tzen kann. Die Vertonung ist auch in Ordnung f√ºr so ein kleines Spielprojekt und spiegelt wie auch die Grafik das finanzielle Budget der Entwickler wider.

K√§fer habe ich im Spiel bis auf einen keine gefunden: In einem Dungeon konnte ich die Druckplatten nicht so aktivieren, dass eine T√ºr aufgeht. Ein Neustart der Kampfes hat Abhilfe geschafft. 


Fazit: DSA Fans & Anh√§nger des rundenbasierten Goblinkloppens werden bestimmt auf ihre Kosten kommen. Grafik-
 und HD Junkies sollten Abstand halten. Ebenso Menschen f√ºr die es nur Top Games (<80% Wertungen/aktuelle Engine/etc) gibt und alles darunter nicht so ist, wie sie es m√∂gen und kennen.

review:
Ah... S'il y avait la possibilit√© de donner une note neutre, je l'aurais mis. J'ai tent√© d'y jouer deux fois, s√©par√© de deux ou trois ans entre, voire plus. La premi√®re fois, j'ai arr√™t√© √† la moiti√©. La seconde (recommenc√© depuis le d√©but), quasiment √† la fin. 

Bon ambiance, gameplay plut√¥t bon, sc√©nario tranquille, mais... La premi√®re fois, OK, j'ai probablement mal g√©r√© et j'ai arr√™t√© parce que j'avais plus d'argent pour m'payer les soins ou l'√©quipement. Du coup, d'un coup, je ne pouvais plus avancer.

La seconde fois, j'ai mieux g√©r√©. Mais √† la fin, une grosse p√©riode wtf qui m'a saoul√©. 

Au final... je ne le recommande pas. Mais ce serait plus un bon, tentez, chacun est diff√©rent, et r√©agit diff√©remment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045783871', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1956, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1955, 'last_played': 1528135799}
review:
L'Oeil Noir... Que de bons moments dans cet univers de jeu de r√¥le...
Dommage que Blackguards n'arrivent pas √† la cheville de l√† d'o√π il est tir√©. Et je dis dommage, car que de possibilit√©s, de bonnes intentions et de potentiel ! Malheureusement, ce dernier n'est en rien r√©v√©l√© sous un bon jour. Alors certes, on est heureux de trouver un arbre de comp√©tence, la possibilit√© de m√©langer les genres et les couleurs dans la construction de son personnage, une ambiance sympathique et bel et bien digne de l'h√©ro√Øc fantasy mais... Ca s'arr√™te l√†.

Les lourdeurs s'encha√Ænent rapidement, pass√© les premi√®res heures de jeu, √† commencer par un sc√©nario bancal, pas vraiment int√©ressant car totalement obscur du d√©but √† la fin et dont la chute (non, je sais, je n'ai pas fini le jeu mais franchement, c'est tellement bateau que ca en devient navrant) n'apporte aucune surprise et ne semble m√™me pas bien men√©e. Dommage pour un jeu de r√¥le...
Alors forc√©ment, si le sc√©nario est en carton, les personnages sont en... papier m√¢ch√©, hein. Pas vraiment de relief, pas de pronfondeur dans leur personnalit√©, seulement superficielle, sans compter que le personnage principal est sans doute le pire de tous (appelez-le Narutard√© mental, ce sera parfait !).
Enfin l'interface et le gameplay. : sympathique au d√©but, ils encha√Ænent les lourdeurs, l'arbre des comp√©tences est fourni, certes, mais trop et dans n'importe quel sens et je vous souhaite de ne pas tomber sur des combats contre des zombis ou autres cr√©atures avec 2 de tension, car alors cela prend une lonnnngueur, mais une lonnnnnnnnnngueur !...

Blackguards, de tr√®s belles promesses et un r√©el potentiel pour un jet d'√©chec critique. ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198084584379', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 988, 'last_played': 1482958272}
review:
You could have told me this game came out in 1995 and I would have believed you - but no, 2014... Note, this is not just because of the odd artistic choices of the developers, but also because of the clunky mechanics and obtuse progression system. All of this echoes from an era where we "didn't know" what to do about these things - but sadly, we do know... and the reminiscnence of ignorant times isn't charming or fun, it's just annoying. There's also a massive difficulty spike about 5 hours into the game - if you have misbuilt your hero, you may need to restart the game to rectify your mistake... something that wouldn't be a big deal if it weren't for sub-par voice acting and a very disappointing plot line. The freedom to f*@& up is there, which is a good thing. 
2/5 for story
3/5 for gameplay
4/5 for difficulty
1/5 for visual appeal

author: {'steamid': '76561198005059057', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5362, 'last_played': 1519513243}
review:
There's a lot to like about Blackguards. The story is decent enough that you should have fun, and the voice acting is really high quality. Finding items to put on your characters feels like scrounging around, trying to cobble together something decent until you finally get that nice suit of armor -- an experience I personally enjoy.

The combat animations are quick enough that I never felt impatient waiting for them to resolve, and the available spells offer some really great tactical options.

So why am I giving this game a thumbs down?

There's no respec. The battles are tough enough that you have to optimize your character builds to progress the story or defeat the higher level side quests, and I've made some build choices that I had no way of knowing would not be viable. I'm no stranger to tough tactical battles, but without some kind of mechanic to either respec my points, or grind new points to correct my errors, my game is over.

I'm going to cheat and finish the story, but that shouldn't be necessary.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029288199', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1501707029}
review:
Ich muss sagen es ist ein sehr sch√∂nes Spiel, welches einiges zu bieten hat. Man hat sch√∂ne K√§mpfe, eine normale Story und man kann sich mit dem Spiel gut die Zeit vertreiben.
Zu 90 % kommt man auch mit 1, 2 oder 3 Anl√§ufen durch eine Quest durch. 
Man muss teilweise taktisch gut Denken und seine Schritte im Voraus plannen, was auch sehr viel Spass macht.

ABER, es gibt Quests wo ich selbst nach √ºber 50 Versuchen es nicht geschafft habe diese zu erledigen. Um aber die Story weiter erleben zu k√∂nnen, musste ich "gezwungenerma√üen" cheaten bzw einen Trainer benutzen der mir hilft die Mission zu schaffen. Sehr nervig!
Das Endspiel ist einfach nur tr√§ge und zieht sich ewig in die l√§nge. Alleine das die Gegner ewig f√ºr ihren Zug brauchen nervt ab einem gewissen Zeitpunkt, genauso wie die immer gleichen Spr√ºche der Helden. Wenn man in einer Kampfrunde gegen Gegner mit Gift 10-15 mal den Spruch h√∂ren muss "Ich hasse Gift" und das √ºber teilweise 20-30 Kampfrunden verzweifelt man irgendwann daran.
Der einzige Grund warum ich mich durch dieses Spiel bis zum Ende durchgeq√º√§lt habe, war, dass ich das Ende erleben wollte.
Und....
Einfach nur Entt√§uschend. Mehr als das... man sieht die Helden in einer Reihe stehen und der Zwerg fragt die Magierin nur eine einfach Frage die zwar zum Spiel geh√∂rt aber in diesem Augenblick absolut unn√∂tig ist. Nach 30 Sekunden ohne nennenswerte Handung ist das Spiel vorbei. Nichts .... einfach nichts.... Genauso wie der Abspann von Demonicon. Genauso sinnfrei.
Einfach nur Traurig. 

Kauft euch blo√ü nicht dieses Spiel. Selbst mit 90 % Rabatt ist es immer noch zu teuer f√ºr so einen MIST. 

PS: Ich bin jahrelanger DSA-Spieler. Dieses Spiel ist eine einzige Klopperei. Kaum mehr. LEIDER.

review: A mio parere si tratta di una piccola perla.  Certo, i ritmi sono compassati e la grafica magari accusa un po' il peso degli anni, ma la componente gdr e quella tattica alla X-Com sono ben implementati. Gli scontri sono molto interessanti. E finora anche la storia riesce a mantenere alta la curiosit√†, malgrado alcuni dialoghi non riuscitissimi. Considerando che ormai spesso si trova in offerta davvero a poco (io ho preso il bundle con il 2 che dicono sia anche pi√π riuscito a soli 4,90) ne consiglio caldamente l'acquisto ai saggi giocatori old school che amano le belle trame e un bel livello di sfida.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077629735', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1847, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1847, 'last_played': 1509411634}
review:
Ufff, no s√© por d√≥nde empezar. Llevo unas cuantas horas jugadas y no tengo claro qu√© puedo decir de este juego. Por un lado puede que sea un buen juego de combates por turnos (tampoco lo tengo claro), pero por otro lado lo considero un p√©simo juego de rol. La historia es lineal, los escenarios pobres y con apenas capacidad de interacci√≥n, m√°s propios de una aventura gr√°fica que de un juego de estas caracter√≠sticas. Hay momentos en los que da la sensaci√≥n de estar viendo una pel√≠cula entre combate y combate. Por muy t√°cticos que sean, los combates se hacen pesados y repetitivos, en parte porque los enemigos no ofrecen mucha variedad, en parte porque la evoluci√≥n de los personajes no permite incrementar las habilidades con la suficiente celeridad. 
En definitiva, creo que no vale demasiado la pena, pero entiendo que a los fan√°ticos de los combates por turnos les pueda gustar ya que al fin y al cabo es una sucesi√≥n de combates con un mapa y unas rid√≠culas pantallas entre ellos.

review: Ciekawy europejski tytu≈Ç z gatunku strategicznych RPG, osadzony w realiach dark fantasy. Nie≈∫le wykonany, choƒá jak na razie rozpƒôdza siƒô powoli :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198082493342', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2905, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2830, 'last_played': 1516315380}
review:
Be prepared for a long haul. 
The game is amazing, but the beginning is a bit of a chore. 
Getting your character to a state where a group of 4 characters can take on 4 enemies will take you atleast 10 hours. 
The payout is a game that has your character killing multiple enemies by the end .
Frustrating at the beginning, immensely satisfying by the end.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966760304', 'num_games_owned': 539, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1549024748}
review:
Bought this in the last Steam sale after a couple of years of it in my wishlist, should I or shouldn't I...

No real game. Just a story with hex grid-based field fighting, which is done fairly well. Very RNG based.

Overall, game is ok, but would be a better mobile game than a PC game. Can't recommend as a PC game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198306649890', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 218, 'playtime_forever': 1943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1943, 'last_played': 1515582179}
review:
Its a good game to play after you played multiple games with interesting story, options in beginning to choose from basic set up with starts you package of mage, archer and warrior, whilst if you choose expert mode choice is you get choose warrior/archer together, mage it cost you 500 ap. 

AP translate into Adventure points They are crucial to gaining maximum on any of panels. 
Weapon panel is 18 if you get that far one your characters becomes weapon master. 

Story is sad but interesting to complete there are many options of temptation, but how to make money, I don't know don't ask me. You could sell all our gear still don't make profit. If your warrior and you get tome your tempted to use tome on your available magic person but half its value and selling has bigger profit margin it keep your economy afloat. 


You can choose either sex and name which is pretty interesting then for first part of it your wanted fugitive the second part your a gladitator you could get test what that like if you go with dwarves get sample what that like. 

there are walkthroughs if I had known that I probably would used it help get pass a difficult part, baroness area if you survive it and still end up with her dying you might want to find the walkthrough states how you doing it wrong. 
It was interesting read if you get my meaning. 

I still have defeat the game once again I have to get to it when "goat" chores are done.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970456109', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1515107542}
review: Another game I thought I wanted that really sucked. Glad it was on sale. Buy this if your a glutton for punishment. I *knew* there was a reason why I hesitated so long to buy it. Pick this title up ONLY if you want the reason to buy a new keyboard,mouse or monitor. At some point you might break, throw or smash over your leg in frustration with that games "cheating" mechanics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052353402', 'num_games_owned': 637, 'num_reviews': 856, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1514982059}
review:
7 out of 10.
Blackguards is not that bad of a game as some reviews might suggest, but it is is clearly much worse than most of the modern RPGs with turn-based combat. I'd still recommend it but only for fans of the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005650677', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 2867, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2074, 'last_played': 1543159444}
review: If you like DSA this is the game for you. It can be pretty challenging at times and there are no save in battles, so if you have a low frustration tolerance, maybe this is not for you. Any RPG / Strategy lover should have a look.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070568882', 'num_games_owned': 178, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1983, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1983, 'last_played': 1514872132}
review:
Buscaba , solo un entretenimiento pasajero, que equivocado estaba , me ha enganchado , desde los primeros minutos, la historia , no es que se diga muy profunda , y las armas pocas , pero al ser menos profundo que otro juegos de rol , y de combates por turnos , las horas se te van voladas , ahora queda terminar el juego y empezar , por su segunda parte, que por lo que leo , es aun mejor , que este.

Contras: Hombre graficamente , ni en su epoca era un portento, miralo como el hermano "muy tonto" de titulos mas serios"

Pero como ya he dicho antes engancha , y que mas quieres , por un buen precio mas de 30 horas de entretenimiento , pocos te lo van a dar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014628174', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1514807365}
review: As much as I like the freedom of putting skills anywhere you want I equally hate the forced combat decisions,you have to do this or lose.pull a lever that's behind enemies.cover an endless spawning hole that's behind arches and enemies and so on(they don't grant extra exp. if you're wondering).....the Game gets really frustrating unfortunately. I play games for pleasure not to get pissted(like I am now after trying to save the baroness 5 times in a row-have to do it in 5 turns 3 of us vs. 7 of them with traps that end your turn and archers and crap-guess what you have to do cross 2 bridges behind enemies and then fight everyone you ignored and that surrounded you so you can save  her) unninstal

author: {'steamid': '76561198031359449', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1514447985}
review:
they give you many options to put points into your character but the actual game design actually forces the player to select a few. Otherwise you will encounter difficulty spikes which no chance of success.

other than a few interesting concepts of cover and enviromental interaction, which unfortunately are half baked and missing in most of the game, the graphics/sound/UI/world design/lore/economics is all 3rd rate, B-to-C grade fantasy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074636284', 'num_games_owned': 305, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 4046, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1414, 'last_played': 1527557778}

author: {'steamid': '76561198035524768', 'num_games_owned': 835, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1034, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 968, 'last_played': 1706740314}
review:
This game feels more like a puzzle solver than an RPG. Not my kind of game.

There is no Farming. If you make some bad choices with your "level ups" you might just not make it. Combat is mostly trial and error, but you don't even know if your character is even able to handle the situation. In the end, a lot of wasted time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062458381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1513439107}

author: {'steamid': '76561198001570682', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2530, 'last_played': 1513439958}
review:
Plot was dull.
Graphics and sound were OK.
Gameplay was OK.
Level design was awful.  I do not recommend this game due to how poorly the levels were designed.  They detract from the fun and make the game just not fun to play.
Character selection was non-existant.  There does not appear to be any real choices to make when establishing your team.  For a team-based RPG, the lack of selection does not allow for varied gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052213780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1476, 'last_played': 1512069736}
review:
Overall I don't dislike the concept of focusing on combat and just having light rpg-elements. The biggest problem in this game however is how akward the mechanics of the black eye system are. Leveling your characters feels tedious and not rewarding, the combat is full of ridiculous rng and so on...
I'm really glad they streamlined a lot of things for Blackguards 2.

review:
This game gets a bad rap.  I always enjoyed this game.  Enough for a second play-through.
I generally get frustrated with RPGs if they wast my time, ect.  I don't have that problem with this game.

It'd be sad if the poor reviews caused this to be overlooked for one of the many actually BAD RPGs out there.

review:
Rol de verdad, por turnos y dif√≠cil. Necesitas pensar, fallar, volver a intentarlo, tener suerte en las tiradas y sobre todo paciencia. Algunas veces pensar√°s que no puedes avanzar, porque no tienes suficiente potencial con tu equipo. Carga una partida anterior y haz misiones menores para mejorar. Equilibra el tipo de personajes y su tabla de evoluci√≥n. 
Pasar de un combate complicado te dar√° un momento de placer que no te dar√°n los juegos de rol de la nueva era.

Si jugaste a D&D o El se√±or de los anillos cuando eras joven (nada de ordenadores) segur√≥ que te dejar√° buen sabor de boca. Si lo tuyo es la partida r√°pida... no te lo recomiendo

author: {'steamid': '76561198031041139', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 4063, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4027, 'last_played': 1511707756}
review:
I'm really conflicted about this game, and it is hard to give it the thumb down, because there is a lot of good in it.
But for every great moment, there was another when I wanted to slit my own wrists...
I bought it out of pure nostalgia, it is an old school, turn based RPG, that you would have played in the '90s.
It is complex in a good way, not so easy like modern PRGs, quests are connected, they form a coherent world.
But the difficulty is uneven. Almost every battle has a gimmick or trick to it, like in one you need to kill a necromancer, and skeletons are spawning endlessly until you do, or in another you have to destroy a crystal, that is healing your enemies, or you need to avoid standing in water etc. It is interesting and fun when it works, but gets very frustrating when it doesn't, and you have no clue what you are supposed to do, and fight off endless waves of enemies until your party dies. Because of this and unclear objectives it sometimes feels unfair, I'm not proud to admit, that I rage-quit it a couple of times.
The story is one of the strong points of the game, it is competently written with genuinely good plot twists, interesting characters. Voice acting is generally decent for an indy game, but there are a couple of weak performances.
But the ending is underwhelming, the only thing I felt was relief, that it's over, and I can stop playing it...
Graphics is dated a bit, but the magic effects look pretty and powerful.
There are a couple of annoying little problems too:Quests are easy to miss. If you restart a battle (and you will), you have to watch the dialogue again and again, you can only skip one line at a time. There is no way to rotate the camera, only elevate it a bit, so sometimes walls, trees and such obstruct your vision of the battle. There is no way to store your gear, so you either drag everything around and encumber your party, or sell everything and hope you will not need it later on.

I really want to like this game, but I cannot honestly recommend it. Hope the devs improved it in the sequel...

author: {'steamid': '76561198073380932', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 4836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4836, 'last_played': 1418477263}
review:
One of the most underrated games for me. While not for everyone it has a pretty fun combat mechanic based on the TDE rules and close to XCOM. The story is quite dark and interesting there are some decisions to make but it is not as story driven as classic RPGs like Pillars of Eternity for example.

Before you buy this game you should ask yourself a question: Are you okay with the highly percentage reliant combat? If yes then this game is for you. It is really hardcore and not forgiving you may come to a point in the game when you realize that your party setup is messed up - restart is the only possibilty then. But then again if you use half a brain and don't try to get the jack of all trades but try to specialise the game is really rewarding. There is nothing more satisfying than proceed in the game after 20 tries by using the environment and everything perfectly - and maybe do your decisive kill by a lucky punch in the end.

One of the main reasons for the critics is part of the UI: while you can see the percentage to hit a target (close to XCOM as already mentioned) you can't see your parry chance i.e. once you hit with let's say 75% chance your opponent still has the chance (let's say 50%) to parry your attack. In the end you might only have a chance of 38% for example to actually do damage to your target.
But then again your opponents rely on the same rules.

At the end of the day this is one of my favorite games of all times it feels like a strategic Dark Souls. But it is not flawless

review: N√£o consigo descrever. Amo RPG, e esse aqui me surpreendeu em todos os aspectos. Comprei o jogo, achando que era simples, comum e s√≥ com gr√°ficos bonitos. Ele √© muito mais do que isso. Recomendo √† jogadores mais habituados com o sistema de distribui√ß√£o de pontos de um RPG t√°tico, porque cada ponto vai fazer a diferen√ßa, ent√£o gaste com sabedoria. O jogo √© lindo, a qualidade gr√°fica dele √© incr√≠vel. Tem uma resposta do comando sensacional, alguns bugzinhos BEEEM espor√°dicos mas se o jogador for calmo e n√£o se incomodar, √© poss√≠vel jogar tranquilamente sem ficar preocupado (comigo √© complexo ver os hexagonos coloridos bugados, pelo meu TOC de perfeccionismo). E por fim, o jogo tem uma trilha sonora linda. Eu simplesmente me pego v√°rias vezes fazendo o som da trilha simplesmente porque √© muito gostosa de se ouvir. Recomendo muit√≠ssimo pra outras pessoas que buscam por um bom RPG, com uma BOA hist√≥ria, com bons e diversificados comandos, al√©m de uma excelente capacidade criativa de batalhas com uma trilha ainda melhor do que a anterior! Personagens muito carism√°ticos, e que em v√°rios pontos, voc√™ vai sentir as mesmas dores que eles! Comprem o jogo se gostarem do estilo, vale muito a "pena" e a "galinha" inteira!

author: {'steamid': '76561198044487090', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3044, 'last_played': 1404175947}
review:
There are a lot of great reviews for this game already so I'll keep this simple. Back when I played Blackguards, I was really look for something to scratch that tactical rpg itch and it looked like a great fit and- I was not dissapointed. There are certainly low points as the story can lose itself from time to time and make it difficult to be invested, the loading every city and every conversation can get agonizing espicially when continually checking every person in every location is the only real way to make sure you aren't missing content as completing story battles moves the world forward and there are certain huge diffculty spikes in story battles (a certain one protecting a woman from bugs comes to mind). Taking all of this into account, though I still found myself staying up well into the next day playing, which I hadn't done for a single player game in years. 

Slogging into melee feels good, the plethora of spells and the differences from each spell's levels keep combat varied, every map has something to interact with in the environment and no matter how long the loading takes it feels so rewarding to find some guy on the other end of the world that suddenly wants you to clear out a non-story tower after completing a entirely unrelated story mission.

 I fully enjoyed this game even while this indie company struggling to translate an obscure table top rpg into a game is fairly apparent, it still managed to capture that feeling of adventure and optimization that table tops give you

author: {'steamid': '76561198068584099', 'num_games_owned': 458, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3128, 'last_played': 1447869162}
review:
Great game
Got it and the sequel on sale from a humble bundle dirt cheap (as in less than 5 bucks for it, sequel and other games)
Game is a bit dark and slow (not that that is a bad thing). Story is cryptic so while you want to know more, you cannot count on definite answers.
Half the fun is learning the combat on the fly. You get to realize how inter-actable the environment is (using forcefields to create choke points/preventing flanking or even causing a hallways through your other units who have attacks of opportunity or blowing up swamp gas bubbles etc)
It is rare to have 100% hit chance so some people are complaining about that but I didn't find that to be an issue. Game is difficult but generally, that is what people want from tactical rpgs. It has a unique feature where you can forgo your characters turn to attack in exchange for extra movement. I probably wouldn't pay full price for this but if you can get it on sale, it is great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126131226', 'num_games_owned': 422, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1005, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 820, 'last_played': 1549245165}
review:
[table]
    [tr]
        [th]Catagories[/th]
        [th]Ranking[/th]
        [th]Summery[/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Value[/td]
        [td] $2.99 (Normally $19.99)  [/td]
        [td] Wow, I've got to say I got one hell of a sale on this one folks. Very much worth the $2.99 I paid for it. BUT is it worth the $19.99 it normally costs? Yeah honestly it is, I'm not super huge on the whole Turn-based strategy genre but I've got to admit its got a great story that keeps it moving and its not a super long wait between rounds which is really nice. It‚Äôs a great game to play on the side of doing some other stuff. [/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Gameplay[/td]
        [td] 8 stars[/td]
        [td] Like I said I'm not  huge on this genre but damn me if all the turn-based games were like this I would definitely play more of them. The fluid and relatively quick game play in combination with the story line is pretty damn good if you ask me. Though I do wish there was more ability to wander around like you had in the Heroes of Might and Magic games or do a lot of side quests to level up.  [/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Story[/td]
        [td] 8 stars[/td]
        [td] It's no Lord of the Rings by any means but I've got to say I find it fairly gripping. I mean I've ignored a lot of the side quests pretty easily‚Ä¶ its almost like I got tunnel vision there from time to time. The story starts with one of those "wtf is going on here? I don‚Äôt get what's going on‚Ä¶" sort of situations and if you're anything like me, you've got to find out what is going on‚Ä¶. [/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Social System[/td]
        [td] N/A [/td]
        [td] Single Player Game [/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Community[/td]
        [td] 7 stars[/td]
        [td] They all seem to be a decent group of people though some can be a bit brutal in their honesty.  If I had read the community forums prior to purchase I MIGHT have second guessed my purchase. Lets get this straight. The games RNG can be fairly brutal and you may curse it up and down repeatedly. But if you sit back and take your time to really plan out your characters its pretty damn fun. Yes you do have to put some effort into planning ahead with this game! So be prepared to not go and try to make your character an almighty god among men who can do and be anything they want. [/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Graphics[/td]
        [td] 7 stars[/td]
        [td] They're not bad honestly my one complaint is the text box location within the UI but that‚Äôs not really graphics that‚Äôs the UI. So take that as it is Graphics :Thumbs Up: UI :Meh: [/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Ease of Learning[/td]
        [td] 8 stars[/td]
        [td] It's fairly easy to learn and the DO include a pretty good tutorial in the game so read that and you should be good. The trouble is your character planning‚Ä¶ I know I had a bit of an issue at the start and had to restart‚Ä¶ 6 times I think? Other than that I'd say yeah pretty easy to learn. [/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Playable Factions[/td]
        [td] Factions N/A[/td]
        [td] This is an RPG with Turn-based combat there really aren't factions to worry about. [/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Combat Style[/td]
        [td] 9 stars[/td]
        [td] High marks for this one, Like I said I'm not big on this RTS/ Turn-based stuff but the combat is pretty fluid‚Ä¶ The combats difficulty spikes on the other hand‚Ä¶ wow I thought I had the game all sorted out, then the Bailiff showed up the first time‚Ä¶. Wow was not expecting that sort of resistance. It took me a number of WTF moments before I sorted out my strategy and succeeded. Honestly if your playing to have fun and enjoy the story you may want to hunt down the god cheats or a trainer or something other wise its like reading a book and going back to re read that last battle scene 7-8 times because its garbled English‚Ä¶.. written by a 3 yr old‚Ä¶.. in crayon‚Ä¶. upside down.  [/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Soundtrack[/td]
        [td] 7 stars[/td]
        [td] Its nothing super stellar id say but its pretty smooth, and a great ambient feature. [/td]
    [/tr]
[/table]

Final Thoughts:
I really didn‚Äôt know what to expect when I bought this one, I half watched the videos and thought "cool a fantasy rpg where I can be a mage‚Ä¶" and tossed it into the wish list for about half a year, saw it on sale and said to myself "hell why not." In the end I'm really happy with the purchase, thrilled I got it so cheap but honestly I think id be happy with it even if I got it for the full price. Great little buy for anyone who likes to put some decent thought and planning into a character.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079854208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 4560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4283, 'last_played': 1509265178}
review:
I don't think that I would like to buy a sequel of part two of this game. It had a great plot, it's own lore but the crappiest ending I ever got from a game. I know there are multiple endings... I got the one where I got to rescue the girl, passed all the challenges and got the dwarf saying "No more secrets". Anyone can tell me if there was any better ending than that?

I'm not sure if I can recommend the game having such a lame ending. If you wish to play a good strategy game with it's unique rules and story plot. Be my guess, just to complain not being warned when you get the ending. Well, the ending might just be subjective for me being lame but look great for someone else (Some who might have no idea of a quality ending at all)

author: {'steamid': '76561198193886475', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1508077944}
review:
Ce jeu aurait pu √™tre bien mais trop de chose font que c'est injouable, limite le jeu te donne des bouts de bois pour tuer 10 gars en armures et arm√© jusqu'aux dents. Pour appuyer mon expliqation je vais utiliser deux exemples de batailles qui me sont arriv√© dans le jeu: - 1er cas: tu te retrouve sans armure et presque sans vie, apr√©s avoir affront√© des monstres, contre deux nains l'un attaque √† distance et l'autre au corps √† corps. Celui a distance t'inflige 10 points de d√©gats en moyenne alors que tes personnages ne poss√©dent qu'une trentaine de points de vie et celui au corps √† corps bloque toutes tes attaques, empoisonne quand il attaque, si tu passe √† c√¥t√© de lui il te met un coup et t'empoisonne et fait du 10 points de d√©gats aussi, sans oublier qu'il se reg√©n√©re tous les deux. Comment les battre ?!
- 2√©me cas: tu doit sauver une baronne de la pendaison, pour cela le jeu te dit que tu doit passer le deuxi√©me ponts en moins de 5 tours MAIS sur le chemin il y a une dizaine de gars qui d√®s le premiers tour mettent des obstacles sur ton chemin pour pas que tu passe et se mettent √† s'agglutiner derriere ces obstacles. Donc tu doit casser les obstacles et faire en sorte de tuer des gars pour te fray√© un chemin. SEULEMENT, tu atteint les obstacles √† la fin du premier tour, au deuxieme tour tu doit casser les obstacles, au troisieme tour en adm√©tant que tu a r√©ussi √† √©viter les gars, tu vient seulement de passer le premier pont. Apr√©s tu te prend sur le deuxi√©me pont des pi√©ges invisible qui te coupe net dans ton √©lan et au cinqui√©me tour en admetant toujours que tu arrive a √©viter les mecs qui se mettent devant toi pour te bloquer tu arrive √† la sauver. CEPENDANT, pour gagner il ne te reste plus qu'a tous les tuer sachant que tu a speeder pour la sauver et donc √©viter un max de frapper les gens pour pas gaspiller un tour mais que toi tu a pris tous les d√©gats du monde, il rest 10 pv √† tes personnages pour tuer 10 gars en full pv qui font du 10 points de d√©gats. Comment faire ?!
De plus, on nous donne des pourcentages de chances de r√©usite pour les coups donn√©s, mais quand ta un coup qui a 95% de chance de r√©ussir et que sur une dizaine de coup, il y en a 4-5 qui on rat√©, on ce pose des questions. Surtout avec le mage, de un il a pas de vie et deux deux il rate quasiment tous ces sorts.
Bref, je trouve que ce jeu √† du potentiel, les graphisme sont plut√¥t bon, l'histoire est simple mais entrainante, des quettes annexes plut√¥t sympa mais le jeu pour certains combats est injouable, les combats sont d√©loyales c'est pourquoi je d√©conseille. Ayant obtenu le jeu gratuitement, je ne sais pas combien il c√¥ute mais je d√©conseille d'acheter s'il est √† plus de 10‚Ç¨ (parce que je suis gentil). Ce n'est absolument pas mon genre de laisser tomber un jeu mais l√† je vais le faire.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013888613', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1507994867}

author: {'steamid': '76561198020049439', 'num_games_owned': 2603, 'num_reviews': 277, 'playtime_forever': 6778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4507, 'last_played': 1507935773}
review:
Coraje.

Coraje es lo que siento al analizar un juego que conceptualmente es bastante bueno e interesante pero que t√©cnicamente deja bastante que desear y se convierte en un autentico dolor de muelas.

En efecto, t√©cnicamente el juego es un peque√±o desastre. Esta mal optimizado y de ah√≠ parten la mayor√≠a de sus problemas. Depende el ordenador que tengamos tendremos mas o menos bugs, pudiendo incluso quedarnos sin poder avanzar en el juego si tenemos la peor de las suertes. Los tiempos de carga cada vez que cambiamos de pantalla son interminables y para colmo de males tiene muchos de sus logros bugueados.

¬øA que entran ganas de salir corriendo y que el ultimo apague la luz ?

Pues claro que si... y mas aun cuando los desarrolladores hace tiempo que dejaron de actualizar el juego y pasan ol√≠mpicamente de los bugs y las muchas quejas de los usuarios, lo cual te deja con ganas de quemar algo o lapidar a alguien antes de salir corriendo y olvidarte para siempre del juego.

Pero con lo que no contaba es que pese a todo lo dicho el juego me gustase, lo cual solo contribuye a que aumente mas el coraje y la frustraci√≥n que siento ante lo que pod√≠a haber sido un buen juego y se ha quedado en un juego del mont√≥n. Gracias a la falta de ganas y el pasotismo de unos desarrolladores mas interesados en irse de bares con los testeadores que de finalizar bien el juego.

Y es una pena porque el concepto del juego y la puesta en escena son bastantes buenos. B√°sicamente es un juego de rol ligero, muy centrado en un sistema de combate t√°ctico muy completo y cojonudo, una historia decente y un sistema de creaci√≥n y desarrollo de personajes, basado en el mundo de Dark Eye, elaborado y completo.

Adem√°s el juego se bastante dif√≠cil y se preocupa por plantear situaciones y combates muy diferentes para no cansar al jugador y someterle a todo tipo de retos. Algo muy de agradecer porque hay algunos combates realmente complicados, no siempre bien balanceados, que necesitar√°n de toda nuestra pericia y paciencia para salir bien librados.

¬ø Entend√©is ahora el motivo de mi enfado ?.

Como amante de los juegos de combate t√°ctico Blackguards lo tenia todo para triunfar conmigo y merecer un an√°lisis mucho mas benigno pero la falta de optimizaci√≥n y de testeo, junto a la nula respuesta para solucionarlo, terminan por lastrar un juego que de otra manera pod√≠a haber sido mucho mejor.

Y es que carajo, han sido demasiadas horas repitiendo combates por culpa de los bugs y la dejadez de los tipos de Daedalic a la hora de solucionarlos. 

Para invitatrlos a jam√≥n, vamos. 

Recomendable solamente para los amantes de los juegos de combate t√°ctico y aquellos que sepan armarse de paciencia ante tanto problema t√©cnico.

Abstenerse el jugador medio, le saldr√° una ulcera estomacal... o algo peor. 



6/10.

review: I bought this game in a bundle for a couple of dollars. Its a barain and I loved it. I haven't played many turn based fighting games but I really enjoyed this game. It requires a fair bit of thinking through, thinking ahead, getting killed and retrying. (Save your game lots!) The storyline keeps the game interesting - without it the fights would get quite stale I think. It does have a few bugs, but I seriously can't complain when I only paid a few dollars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089652452', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 11246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7476, 'last_played': 1506378833}
review:
I really enjoyed this game.I found it chalenging AND engaging throughout.So i dont really get the complaints about the games difficulty...ill admit it can be a bit rough to get going but i found the mid game to be a refreshing pleasure challenging the player to use and pic the right skill sets and abilitys,it felt rewarding and was never boring as some other easier games can be as you blow through the mid game,untill the end game where a challenge is considered enemies with way to many hitpoints not quite smart enough to use that finishing blow,unless your party is at max health: FACEPALM. Eventually leading to a boss that does a lot of nothing and has that 1 ability that leaves only one party member standing near death,goes back to doing a lot of nothing while your team recovers....
seriously there will be none of that in blackguardds,when your team fails it's usually abundantly clear where you are lacking or what mistake was made,so yes i suppose unfortunately for some this game does require the player to actually think about their strategy..in most battles.A severely lacking aspect in most games these days...if you enjoy challenging and rewarding gameplay then this is the game for you.

I feel this game was way underrated and under appreciated, it deserves so much more credit.thx for making this game guys i had a blast...now on to blackguards 2 ! i cant wait to see whats in store ;) !!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197989620359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 1201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1557257494}
review:
*UPDATE* I've read the corerules and found something about the fumble rule + some miscalculations in the review... This is a hastily written 'review' *UPDATE*

The real reason why I‚Äôm writing this review is because of the hit chance percentages. EVERYBODY COMPLAINS ABOUT THIS. For those who doesn‚Äôt know The Dark Eye ruleset this is very confusing. A 100% chance of successfully hitting someone  doesn‚Äôt give you a 100% chance of doing actual damage, and I think the percentages are thus misleading, also, the rules aren‚Äôt explained anywhere and the rolls aren‚Äôt shown in the battlelog. And to be honest, according to the rules, I don‚Äôt really know how you can have 100% for certain in the game - you always have minimum change of have a fumble.

I‚Äôm going to explain it a little bit with the actual rolls of the core rules. This is by memory actually and I'm just guessing some percentages, since I'm not a mathematician.

THE ROLLS BEHIND COMBAT:

You want to hit an enemy with your sword! You have two actions. One is moving toward the enemy, the other one is swinging with your sword trying to hit him. Your PC has an attack value of lets say 8. Your Rapier has an Attack Value of +1. The Rapier‚Äôs special attribute is agility, for every 3 points in agility above 8 you get a +1. You Agility is 14. 14-8= 6. You get a +2 to hit. This means you have to throw lower than 11 with you 20 sided die.

This means you have 55% chance to hit. (This would be a starting level character btw).

If you hit, the following happens.

Your enemy can parry or dodge with his parry or dodge skill. His parry skill is 13. Which is calculated by his DEX. Now he can use every 3 points above a base value 8 for agility. He has an agility of 12. 12-8= 4. So he gets a +1. Which is 14. Now he tries to parry with a short weapon against a medium weapon. He recieves -2 on his parry. He has to roll lower than 12. He has a chance of 60% to parry the weapon.

He can also dodge the attack. A Dodge is your agility divided by 2. 12/2= 6. But he has a skill body control which gives him +1. He has a dodge of 7. Which is too low to use.

You have 55% to hit and the defender 60% chance to defend himself. Which gives you less then 33% in total to hit. But the game will show 55%.

I think the percentages shown ingame are your own hit percentages. Because you can‚Äôt know your enemies stats.

THE FUMBLE RULE (IN TDE IT'S CALLED A BOTCH )

Now why still miss when a 100% hit percentage is shown? Two reasons. Probably the game rounds up. Lets say if you have to roll lower than a 19. But if your enemy lies on the ground, this gives you an advantage: making your *chance* 100% to hit: this can even go over 20. Lets say you have to roll lower than 23 to hit. This means that if you roll a 19 + a random disadvantage of + 2 making a 21 still is a hit. But the fumble rule still applies. If you roll a 20 it‚Äôs still an instant fumble (or botch as they call it in TDE, fumble is a DnD term) and norally in the P&P the gamemaster may get creative and invents a random failure. An archer misses on 19-20 rolls. So there is always a 5%-10% chance you fumble, and a 5% chance you crit (on rolling a 1) .

(If you played Drakensang, the first game wich uses the same DSA ruleset, there you can even fumble on picking up a flower.)

So in the original P&P, lets say you are in a house with a low ceiling. Your enemy lies unconscious before you on the ground. Let‚Äôs kill him in coldblood! You swing your sword full of rage. Outgame you have to roll a d20; let‚Äôs say that everything except a 20 hits. You‚Äôre unlucky: you roll a 20. The DM decides what happens: your swing your sword above your head in full rage and your sword gets stuck in the ceiling.

ABOUT THE GAME

It‚Äôs a difficult and unforgiving game. But it‚Äôs somehow still entertaining!

Daedalic is known for making point and click adventure games set in the Dark Eye world. This game is a story driven turn based strategy game with the occasional cutscenes which have some dialogue options for the fluff. The towns and outposts are like in an adventure game, where you can click on merchants or NPC‚Äôs. The cutscenes are ok, the way the story is told feels a bid like a normal P&P RPG session. Where a DM narrates what happens and you are given the ILLUSION of choice. But in this game there is NOT much choice, doesn‚Äôt matter if you have choice or not: it‚Äôs entertaining.

The turn based strategy is very difficult. Gamers without patience will have a hard time restarting the same combat over and over.

It‚Äôs fun, It‚Äôs hardcore. Its worth playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050016554', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 517, 'playtime_forever': 6779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5332, 'last_played': 1506234897}
review:
Je ne m'explique pas pourquoi j'ai autant jou√© √† ce jeu. Faux rpg, faux tactical, sans aucune variation √† la rejouabilit√© et une brouett√©e de succ√®s qui ne se valident pas. Ce n'est pas glorieux. Je suppose que j'√©tais dans un √©tat d'humeur propice au bon gros bourrinage sans r√©fl√©chir.

Faux rpg parce que totalement directif. On progresse dans une histoire lin√©aire qui nous contraint g√©ographiquement et humainement au sens o√π c'est elle qui d√©cide de qui nous accompagne. M√™me si on a par moment une impression de libert√©, elle se r√©sume √† savoir dans quel ordre on va faire les qu√™tes secondaires accessibles √† l'instant t. Les dialogues sont essentiellement destin√©s √† donner une ambiance, il n'auront que tr√®s rarement un impact sur la r√©solution d'une qu√™te secondaire et jamais sur le d√©roulement de l'histoire √† part ceux avec un personnage pr√©cis qui d√©termineront son comportement tout √† la fin et uniquement tout √† la fin (je l'ai lu sur le forum parce que personnellement j'ai toujours eu la m√™me fin sans jamais comprendre quels combinaisons de mes choix m'y avait conduit). La lin√©arit√© de l'histoire et l'absence d'impact de la majorit√© des dialogues ne serait pas forc√®ment une tare rh√©dibitoire si l'ensemble ne se traduisait pas en une forte contrainte dans le d√©veloppement des persos. Au-del√† de la n√©cessit√© de d√©velopper certaines comp√©tences critiques et de l'inutilit√© des sorts de bas-niveau qui en canibalisant les points conduisent √† l'habituel min-max, Blackguards nous encourage trop fortement √† d√©velopper un archer et privil√©gier les armes contondantes pour qu'on se sente maitre de notre √©quipe qui, cerise sur le gateau, nous est impos√©e et modifi√©e sans pr√©avis.
Apr√®s il y a un autre aspect que je trouve un peu dommageable pour un RPG et qui est l'absence d'exploration, l'histoire nous propose des points accessibles sur une carte, √† la mani√®re d'un Hard West et les interactions en ville se font sur des images fixes. Mais bon le go√ªt de l'explo c'est du go√ªt perso, pas un d√©faut absolu du jeu.

Faux tactical parce que de nombreuses cartes sont tr√®s typ√©es et ne se r√©soudront que d'une seule fa√ßon, genre fermer tous les tunnels, utiliser les flaques inflammables... Les cartes √† r√©soudre par nous-m√™mes en combat pur sont pour la plupart beaucoup trop petites pour d√©velopper une quelconque manoeuvre ou tenir une quelconque position. La tactique se r√©sume √† essayer de maintenir les archers √† distance de tir, et encore, une fois atteint un bon d√©veloppement leurs comp√©tences sp√©ciales et talent leur permettent de s'affranchir de toute contrainte de distance. 
Bon il y a un aspect RNG qui d√©coiffe. Perso √ßa ne me choque pas, des s√©ries de rat√©s ou de r√©ussites improbables c'est juste la vrai vie. Mais contrairement √† un XCOM o√π tout est rattrapable, l'affrontement des boss de Blackguards m'a renvoy√© √† mes pires souvenirs de combat d'Age Of Decadence, si vous ratez vos premiers coups et que l'ia r√©ussi les siens, il n'y a plus qu'√† recharger, point barre. 
A noter que ce typage tr√®s fort des combats est plut√¥t d√©courageant en d√©but de jeu parce que, le temps de piger la logique du truc √† exploiter dans l'environnement, on a l'impression d'aller de combat impossible en combat impossible, j'ai failli d√©sinstaller Blackguards au bout d'une heure face au premier troll. Donc si vous prenez ce jeu, pr√©parez vous √† devoir vous accrochez. L'effet pervers de cette r√©solution de combat fa√ßon puzzle est que, une fois plong√© dans cette logique, bizarrement en progressant vers des adversaires de plus en plus costaud, l'impression de difficult√© s'estompe et ne tient plus qu'√† la RNG.
  
Tout ceci l'un dans l'autre fait que la rejouabilit√© est th√©oriquement nulle. Sauf √† vouloir se vider la t√™te comme c'√©tait manifestement mon cas quand j'ai pris ce jeu. 

Je vais quand m√™me recommander ce jeu parce que primo l'histoire m'a plu, vraiment l'histoire l'univers lui est quelconque, deuxio/secundo cette fa√ßon de r√©soudre les combats √† le m√©rite de la vari√©t√©, Blackguards n'est pas un jeu o√π l'on r√©p√©te le m√™me combat au fil des rencontres, tertio/troizio mener une partie au bout repr√©sente suffisament de temps de jeu pour que la non rejouabilit√© ne soit pas critique.
