author: {'steamid': '76561198121140992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1505416979}
review:
J'ai mis "Oui" mais je suis mitig√©, a reserve au joueur experiment√© selon moi (Si vous cherchiez un XCOM comme moi passez votre chemin)

Le jeu est tr√®s narratif mais comme beaucoup (TROP) de jeu on nous lance 5 noms a la minute et en plus pas simple a retenir, sc√©nario trop classique de " Je m'en souviens plus ?! j'ai fait √ßa ?! nan je n'y crois pas ?! mais je ne me souviens plus de rien"
Les m√©canique sont classique, d√©placement Hexagonale mais bas√© sur l'initiative donc pas de vrai "Tour par tour"
Couverture haute et basse, non indiqu√© par contre mais le jeu prend en compte la taille donc le nain a de meilleur couverture et un ogre cherche moins a se couvrir avec sa taille, des fois on comprend pas pourquoi l'archer/mages a pas la ligne de vu
pas de details sur les probabilit√© non plus
+1 pour les different "Slot" d'arme qui permet de changer d'armes en cours de partie mais √ßa passe le tour.

par contre
Tuto trop vague j'ai pass√© au moins 5 minutes a comprendre qu'il faut Double clique pour deplacer un perso (parce que dans le ""TUTO"" il suffisait de un) et j'ai passer plusieurs tours a la place de bouger
le systeme de roue pour voir toutes les actions possible est confus (mais V pour voir les objet interactif est interresant)
Lorsque l'on tombe sur de nouvelles situation, le jeu ne l'explique pas

Exemple: 
La mission: Trouver la bonne tombe dans une crypte
Je tombe sur des genre de Cafard des crypte mais le jeu ne m'a pas expliquer que je devait dedier l'un de mes perso a faire le tour du terrain pour boucher les trou d'o√π sortent les cafard
Nan le jeu te le dit 3 tour plus tard, (quand il fait sortir le 1er) puis en sort 1 par tour
Ya 5 ou 6 trou, 2 perso contre les cafard (qui √©tait la depuis le debut hein) et le 3eme tourne pour boucher les trou

En bref: soyez averti que le jeu est narratif et a des d√©faut mais si vous passez au dessus de √ßa il a l'air interressant

author: {'steamid': '76561197989040570', 'num_games_owned': 281, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3843, 'last_played': 1505410778}
review:
Its entertaining for about 98% of the game but the end is fucked up. 


[spoiler]Your choices dont mater for the ending you dont even get stuff explained, you dont need to win the final battle you still get the same ending and the worst i think the ending scenes at the end explain nothing at all and are confusing as if the 
 were for another game with similar characters.[/spoiler]

The fighting is fun but missing 3 shots in sucsession with 100% hit chance is infuriating. 

The story is interesting, and the quests are fun.
The arrow system stupid you can only have a set amount of arrows with you and can only switch between 3 sets and this only if you dont take a melee wepon wich you might need because some object are immun to piercing dmg or not targetable at all. If you use the abilities very often that shoots 7 arrows at once you might get problems because the vendors have a fixed amount of stuff and you might waste all your arrows.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962007744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4464, 'last_played': 1502838003}
review:
A really nice cRPG linear adventure. Definitely not that black or anti hero thoug...
All the ingredient are there and the one huge downside is the not-appropriate pricing.

It feels a bit like an indie game, cheap cinematik and lack of polishing here and there (and there too).
I really did not mind, but I baught it around 5‚Ç¨. 

Story, leveling, general content and battles are worth it if you like the genre; just find a way to buy it a the right price (should have been around 20‚Ç¨ when launched, below 5-10‚Ç¨ nowadays).

author: {'steamid': '76561198071926221', 'num_games_owned': 446, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 5455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5242, 'last_played': 1505014066}
review:
I am a sucker for turn based games.  If you have other games in your back log, go play those instead.  

I finished the game on the hardest difficulty available.

Here are the undesirable things for me in this game:

- You cant compare weapons/armor that easily.
- 100% chance to hit with an enemy who is knocked down, will still miss.
Of course, a lot of 90% chance would miss.
- There are gameplay mechanics that are downright not fun, like a tentacle monster that will perma knockdown you eventhough you have max balance skill.
- Quests map is not intuitive.
- Unique named items you get in later chapters are weaker than normal weapons
- Mages are just buff and healbots.  You are always at a disadvantage as a mage, while enemy mages are a little OP.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020243128', 'num_games_owned': 276, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 4506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4036, 'last_played': 1631471297}
review: Its a good tactical rpg.  Its fun, challaging at times and funny at times too.  So far i have had no issues at all with the game and i am very pleased i bought the game.  For me the only thing it could do with is a rotational camera to get the angle you want to view things at.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273762327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1591586558}
review: It's super lame. Thankfully it was on sale, but this game is simply frustrating. You struggle to keep up the entire time, you don't get enough gold to buy the supplies you need. I you're going to make a game this difficult, at least provide some cheats. This game had so much potential. Disappointing!

author: {'steamid': '76561198102300423', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1132, 'last_played': 1506463515}
review: This game is broken. Dont buy it unless u have a serious masochism issues. The game constantly puts u against higher level enemies that dont give two f about "in game miss chance". Sure u have 89% and u try to cast a spell and 3times in a row it fails... 89%my ass, enemy on the other hand has a 60%miss chance and lands  a perfect spell every time AND I MEAN EVERY TIME 70times i did one battle and 60% chance was 100%. Also the spreed of dmg - ignite lvl2 deals 8-28dmg. when u use the spell its 10 or 12 if ur lucky but when enemy uses that spell it lands 16,20,24dmg. Also the taking of the gear. HOW CAN U TAKE ALL THE GEAR, ALL THE POTIONS,  and then make player fight with a scripted enemy that crits u for 2/3of your health with no problem has not one but 2 potions, enchanted gear and scripted responses. This game is fun for 10/30min until the developers decide its time for you to loose and then u have to repeat and repeat and repeat and watch how you can not land a hit on your enemy because for some reason a battle dwarf with 2 axes cant hit a gladiator RIGHT IN FRONT OF HIM and the enemy not only hits u but also crits u every 2/3hit. I hope people who made this game go bancrupt and will not make any onther game ever again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032137848', 'num_games_owned': 1957, 'num_reviews': 775, 'playtime_forever': 960, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1539596180}
review: lackguards is a straightforward, simple RPG with short battles that are easy to complete in a short time frame however it's very linear and the difficulty level is intentional and not needed and hence the bad reviews. I ado agree with those, but it's okay otherwise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202036207', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1008, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 881, 'last_played': 1505418269}
review: I really like this game so far. It has crashed on me once..but no big issues so far. I am totally new to this genre and the game is not that hard to learn...however..the tutorial could be made more interesting..you don't have to dumb the game down..just make learning the game fun. I think the story is as good as any story....To me..the game would be perfect if it had exploration and this type of strategy in one package...add local and online multiplayer and you would have a real gem. Its the best tactial game I have found so far...Divinity Original Sin is also a great exporation and tactical game..add that exploration to this game and you have a huge winner...ohhh and a little bit better graphics..the graphics are not bad...but could be better.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972040704', 'num_games_owned': 1835, 'num_reviews': 724, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1419096337}
review: I found the game to be a bit overwhelming and unwelcoming to new players. It seems like it expects you to already be a fan of this genre of game, and familiar with it. The world it was set in didn't hook me in during the intro area to make me want to stick around and try to catch on. If you're into this genre, it might be a game you would enjoy, but I cannot recommend it to anyone not already "in the know" about this brand of medieval strategy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024559087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1815, 'last_played': 1501644305}
review:
I am sick and tired of games with game breaking bugs.  This game was a very good game until...

the characters disappear, the game becomes unresponsive, reload same thing.  The devs have known about this issue for a long time with no fix.  I have tried the fixes suggested on this board to no avail.

Game breaking bugs are becoming the norm.  I had the same issue with underrail.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048101201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 200, 'playtime_forever': 1622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1622, 'last_played': 1500164557}
review:
I was a bit hesitant to start playing this, what with the very mixed reviews, but I ended up quite enjoying it in the end. Blackguards is a straightforward, simple RPG with short battles that are easy to complete in a short time frame, so that's already a plus. There's something about the setting that's nice too - the world is nicely presented and portrayed, considering the budget the game was clearly under. 

The combat and RPG elements are mostly pretty entertaining. There aren't any levels, just experience points you can throw into any part of your character development more or less whenever you want, though you probably won't have points to max out everything you want for each character. My only complaint would be that there are a lot of key skills locked to certain trainers in the world who can be hard to find, and it's never clear who trains what without individually mousing over skills while visiting them.

Combat is pretty typical tactical fare, though it has the usual RNG problem of attacks with very high percentage odds seeming to miss half the time. I think this is because the game displays your base chance to hit, but doesn't factor in your opponent's chance to dodge or parry - bad interface design for sure if that's the case, and in any case it's annoying how often your attacks miss. On the other hand your opponents' attacks will miss a lot too, so it's kind of a wash. Still, basic but fun combat here. Sometimes neat stuff happens, like the time my dwarf knocked back an opponent and he flew past two of my spearmen, each of whom attacked him spontaneously using their attack of opportunity as he flew past, killing him before he stopped moving.

A note about the marketing - the game is trying to sell itself as being a dark and violent game about criminals, but it's really not much darker than any other fantasy RPG. The main characters are mostly criminals, sure, but they're more the loveable rogue type than actually repulsive people - there's a mage in particular with a hilariously over-acted voice who's really fun to listen to, but even the dreamweed-addicted elf and the arsonist dwarf are more quirky than anything. And the game's story is still a typical save-the-world plot, despite a bit of grit thrown in. Go in expecting typical fantasy with a slightly darker edge, and your expectations will be met.

All in all, a fun if not particularly remarkable RPG. Worth a look!

author: {'steamid': '76561198087979217', 'num_games_owned': 207, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 1198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1198, 'last_played': 1420850423}
review:
Welcome great hero! Oh wait, you're no hero, you been wrongly accused and your world is threatened. It now lies in your hands with a bands of misfits and criminals to save the world! This game is dark. TOO DARK. Coupled that with a boring story and a lackluster battle system, it all goes downhill.

Battles are based on luck and your characters' attack are more than likely to miss even if chance is high that it will hit. Furthermore, story is linear based, boring, and lack any real depth. Add in those awful voices,...this game is not recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028494830', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1499140608}
review:
It's been a pretty bad experience.  Several of the fights have 'gotcha' gimmicks that aren't apparent until it screws you, then you replay the fight and stop the gimmick.  Its so tedious, especially when layered on top of the overwhelming rng. 

Good god, the rng.  These old school game mechanics have been mostly dropped by modern devs for a good reason, they're just anti fun.  Having your plan be ruined by missing several +80% chance attacks in a row is beyond frustrating.  It makes the fights success or failure be up to rng, and at that point, why am I even playing?  Could just throw a pile of dice onto a table and have the same experience...

Trochu flustrace asi nƒõkter√Ωm hr√°ƒç≈Øm nab√≠dne tƒõ≈æce koridorov√Ω a nalinkovan√Ω p≈ô√≠bƒõh, kde prostƒõ nem√°te ≈°anci uhnout mimo vedlej≈°√≠ √∫koly, s t√≠m je nane≈°tƒõst√≠ pot≈ôeba se sm√≠≈ôit, ale vzhledem k tomu, ≈æe je hra oproti jin√Ωm hr√°m vedena tahov√Ωm stylem to nen√≠ zdaleka tak ru≈°iv√© jako kdyby jste mƒõly pseudo voln√Ω svƒõt (Srovn√°m nap≈ô√≠klad s druh√Ωm d√≠lem Dragon Age) zde koridorov√Ω p≈ô√≠bƒõh v≈Øbec nen√≠ na ≈°kodu i kdy≈æ mo≈æn√° nƒõkomu ne √∫plnƒõ ne sedne - Zvl√°≈°tƒõ asi kdy≈æ hru bude hr√°t poprv√© a na zaƒç√°tu druh√© kapitoly potk√° hr√°ƒçe p≈ôekvapen√≠ onoho mnou nesn√°≈°en√©ho stylu "Nem≈Ø≈æe≈° nic dƒõlat, dƒõjovƒõ to prostƒõ bude takle a basta" Proto≈æe auto≈ôi rozhodli, ≈æe dƒõj p≈ô√≠bƒõhu se bude odv√≠jet tudy - S t√≠m je opƒõt t≈ôeba se sm√≠≈ôit. A nepoƒç√≠tat s voln√Ωm svƒõtem, tato hra jej prostƒõ nenab√≠z√≠.

P≈ô√≠bƒõh samotn√Ω je v prologu, prvn√≠ a druh√© kapitole docela svi≈æn√Ω (A to d√≠ky pr√°vƒõ sv√©mi √∫zk√©mu koridoru) V t≈ôet√≠ kapitole se svƒõt trochu otev≈ôe a mus√≠m ≈ô√≠ci, ≈æe to p≈ô√≠bƒõhu moc neprospƒõje! Nu. ≈òeknƒõme, ≈æe z√°vƒõr, ale hlavnƒõ jeho souboje v√°m daj√≠ tu pravou zkou≈æku toho jak jste pochopili tuto hru, ≈æe je o taktice a pr√°ci s mapou, ne jen s√≠le postav, ale i o taktizov√°n√≠, interakci, pl√°nov√°n√≠ a v≈Øbec kombinaci v≈°eho co jste zat√≠m v kapitol√°ch p≈ôede≈°l√≠ch mƒõli mo≈ænost odehr√°t a vidƒõt v akci, nyn√≠ uv√©st do praxe.

Pokud nap≈ô√≠klad m√°te ≈°anci na z√°sah nƒõp≈ô√≠tele 95% (Indik√°tor ukazuje tuto ≈°anci na √∫spƒõch skillu/Speci√°ln√≠ho √∫toku p≈ôed pou≈æit√≠m) Zcela bƒõ≈ænƒõ se v√°m stane, ≈æe 3 z 5 √∫tok≈Ø vyzn√≠ do ztracena!

Nebo pokud v√°m z tohoto je≈°tƒõ nezbƒõleli, ƒçi neze≈°edivƒõli vlasy na hlavƒõ, a nevythali jste si to co z nich snad zbylo a nerozv√°≈ænƒõ jste si vzali kouzeln√≠ka (Mimochodem, garantuji v√°m, ≈æe kouzeln√≠ka kter√©ho dostanete do party jako NPC budete ze v≈°ech NPC v dru≈æinƒõ proto nejv√≠ce nesn√°≈°et!) Pakli≈æe ses√≠l√°te kouz!lo se ≈°anc√≠ cca. 81-89% zcela bƒõ≈ænƒõ se v√°m stane, ≈æe dan√© kouzlo nese≈°lete i 4-5 kol za sebou, a jen zoufale kouk√°te na animaci jak√©si jisk≈ô√≠c√≠ energie a ohnƒõ, jak va≈°emu kouzeln√≠ku teƒçe z rukou z hl√°≈°kou "Next time!" A podobnƒõ!

Zcela up≈ô√≠mnƒõ, mnohem ƒçastƒõji jsem zas√°hnul se svoj√≠ kouzelnic√≠ meƒçem se ≈°anc√≠ 60% na "Mele hit" Ne≈æ abych sesla fireball s kouzeln√≠kem, jen≈æ mƒõl ≈°anci na sesl√°n√≠ 81-94% (P≈ô√≠padnƒõ zas√°hl speci√°ln√≠m skillem se z√°sehem 80-95%) Tak≈æe pokud v√°m z nƒõƒçeho zbƒõlej√≠ vlasy hr≈Øzou na hlavƒõ je to procentu√°ln√≠ syst√©m/Chaos generuj√≠c√≠ z√°sah, √∫spƒõ≈°nost skill≈Ø kter√Ω bohu≈æel funhuje stylem:

0-99% pravdƒõpodobn√Ω z√°sah, ov≈°em ƒç√≠m bl√≠≈æe 100% t√≠m ni≈æ≈°√≠ ≈°ance na √∫spƒõch, tak≈æe s 60% ƒçasto tref√≠te mnohem ƒçastƒõji ne≈æ s 80% nebo 90% - Zn√≠ to nelogicky? Bohu≈æel, po 10-15 souboj√≠ch z toho ze≈°ediv√≠te!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001151045', 'num_games_owned': 752, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 706, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 706, 'last_played': 1497085322}
review:
I've been enjoying the game, even though I've had to take a break because of work. It's a nice casual RPG - there's no epic amounts of exploration to do, or a world to freely explore. So it's even more linear in that sense. What you do have is a focus on tactical turn based combat, trying to figure out how that system interacts with your stats, and how to exploit the environment to your benefit. I won't mention graphics because this game is several years old now, they're quite adequate though, and the environments are nice.

Pros:
+ Nice mechanics
+ Voiced characters
+ So far interesting story
+ Relaxing, casual

Cons:
- Hitting in combat feels very RNG sometimes

author: {'steamid': '76561198262118401', 'num_games_owned': 2416, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 448, 'last_played': 1498655083}
review:
Ich muss jetzt hier mal eine Lanze f√ºr das Spiel brechen. Ich kann die ganzen negativen Reviews echt nicht nachvollziehen. Ich habe so viel Spa√ü an diesem Spiel. Die Story ist toll, die Charaktere glaubw√ºrdig (ich hab sie sofort ins Herz geschlossen), es gibt wirkliche toll gemachte Nebenquests. Ich finde die K√§mpfe spannend, vielleicht sind sie nicht das Non plus Ultra was Taktik angeht, aber das st√∂rt mich nicht. Im Gegenteil, ich mag es eh lieber etwas "oberfl√§chlicher".

Man darf nat√ºrlich keine High-End Grafik erwarten, aber ich finde die Optik passt hier sehr gut zu dem Spiel. Ich bereue es wirklich, dass ich aufgrund der vielen negativen Reviews so lange mit dem Kauf gez√∂gert habe.

Wenn ihr auch nur ein wenig auf RPGs und Rundenbasierte Spiele steht, bitte, bitte entscheidet euch f√ºr den Kauf, euch entgehen sonst viele Stunden Spielspa√ü in einem tollen Game.

Und noch eine Bitte an alle, denen das Spiel Spa√ü gemacht hat: Lasst doch eine positive Review da. Blackguards hat diese Durchschnittswertung wirklich nicht verdient!

author: {'steamid': '76561198068502559', 'num_games_owned': 647, 'num_reviews': 233, 'playtime_forever': 3358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3290, 'last_played': 1498527154}
review:
N√£o entendo uma avalia√ß√£o t√£o ruim desse jogo.. T√° certo, d√°va pra melhorar muito, mas ele diverte.

Blackguards √© uma mistura de RPG em turnos com point¬¥n¬¥click. As batalhas s√£o em turno, mas a hist√≥ria se desenrola sobre cen√°rios onde as possibilidades de di√°logos j√° ficam marcadas. Eu agradei e tb n√£o vi ningu√©m reclamando disso.

O sistema utilizado √© complexo, mas n√£o √© dif√≠cil de entender. √â bem verdade que terminei o jogo sem entender direito algumas coisas, mas isso √© outra hist√≥ria. kkk. Uma coisa interessante √© que o tamanho do personagem √© levado em conta. Vc pode atirar uma flecha no oponente mesmo se um an√£o estiver na frente. Mas se um humano estiver na frente j√° n√£o pode. Isso influencia tb no dano, um char muito alto d√° menos dano em inimigos muito pequenos. Interessante...

No mais o jogo tem uma dificuldade razo√°vel. Algumas lutas s√£o f√°ceis demais e outras (bem poucas) s√£o complicadas e exigem muita estrat√©gia e sorte. H√° possibilidade de interagir com o ambiente, o que torna algumas batalhas bem f√°ceis.

A hist√≥ria √© sofr√≠vel, linear e n√£o empolga. Assim s√£o tb as sidequests. Os personagens tem o carisma de um zumbi. kkk
Faltou um capricho com armas e armaduras, elas n√£o s√£o muitas. Os drops s√£o poucos e h√° tb poucas magias para se utilizar. O quinto capitulo √© bem ma√ßante e as duas ultimas lutas eu n√£o tenho vergonha de falar q coloquei no easy pq n√£o aguentava mais. kkk. Mas mesmo com todos esses defeitos, Blackguards me divertiiu por mais de 4 meses nessas 56 horas que eu joguei.

Nesse precinho que est√° √© quase uma pechincha!! Se vc gosta de um RPG em turnos, pode ir na f√©!

author: {'steamid': '76561198217090680', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1928, 'last_played': 1512227004}
review:
OK, I can't really understand why is this game receiving so many negative opinions ??? I mean, ok, a lot of them are about too hard level and that there is sometimes only one way to pass the battle and that it's hard to find it. I can see that it's bothering some people but for me it's actually one of the biggest pros. Game is not only the story, fact that I have to think and actually struggle a little with defeating my opponents makes my gameplay a lot more interesting. Furthermore, in the most of the battles there are actually a lot of ways to go through it, and that you can choose what is the best fit for you is super cool. OK, leaving level's topic behind, I really like characters (voice actors did SO GOOD WORK, like, reaaaallyyy, I can play this only for listening to Zurbaran accent) and storyline here. Also most of side-quests are cool  but it's true that they are more like side-MUST-TO-DO-TO-BE-ENOUGH-POWERFUL-FOR-MAIN-QUEST-quest... still it'd be a shame to not see what's in them so that's ok. Oh, and I just love jokes and all of these little peculiarities which are everywhere. Even in the tutorial's msgs~

And about cons, there's one that somekind bothers me. Your choices don't really affect the story. They are climatic, yeah you can choose if you wanna be "i-don't-care-i-just-want-a-lot-of-money" or "defender-of-justice" buuuuut that affects only your in game's wallet :p

Still, highly recommended (y)

author: {'steamid': '76561198076666056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 4512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3922, 'last_played': 1498386122}
review:
My biggest gripe is that you can miss 3 times in a row even with 90%+ hit chance thus making the battle very tedious especially toward the end game. Also, magic users are penalized too heavily by restricting them to only be able to wear about 20% armor of the non magic users' armor. While the story telling is quite good, it is very linear most of the time, even though the game sometimes ask you to choose, they dont seem to matter. The graphic is decent imo.
Overall i have a hard time to recommend this game, i enjoyed the first half part of the game, but like i said, the battle becomes very boring and frustrating because my 90%+ hit chance failed to hit. 
I will be going to blackguards 2 now, hope the sequel has more worth than this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976799778', 'num_games_owned': 1287, 'num_reviews': 564, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1497882481}
review:
Eigentlich mag ich rundenbasierte Taktikspiele. Leider ist Blackguards einfach nur kaputt. St√§ndig st√ºrzt das Spiel ab oder irgendwelche Trigger im Spiel werden nicht ausgel√∂st, so dass unendlich viele Gegner spawnen und man irgendwann einfach stirbt.

Obwohl das Spiel auf DSA basiert werden im Kampf die W√ºrfelergebnisse nur unzureichend angezeigt (viel zu kurz). Wie will man denn eine Taktik entwickeln, wenn man das W√ºrfelergebnis nur f√ºr ein Bruchteil einer Sekunde sieht?
Warum bekomme ich von dem Spiel das falsche Feedback angezeigt. Wenn ein Spiel anzeigt, dass man zu 80% trifft, sollte man auch in ungef√§hr 8/10 F√§llen treffen und nicht niemals!!!

Da das Spiel immer wieder abst√ºrzt, stellt sich f√ºr mich auch gar nicht die Frage, ob ich es weiterspiele. Bisher gingen mir die Charaktere und Story aber am A... vorbei. Schade

1/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198085093968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 329, 'playtime_forever': 2899, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1576646322}
review:
Was NOT the customizable campaign strategy game we were advertised, nor were the playable characters a dysfunctional bunch of jail-worthy psychopaths. If you don't want another basic RPG don't buy this.

Edit: I decided to actually play the game a year after my initial 2-hour review, and while there is some semblance of an actual CRPG in here, it's chock-full of bugs, confusing mechanics, and superlinear storyboarding.

The game, once again, is not a Darkest Dungeon clone where you manage boxed criminals into doing all your adventuring, but a standard The Dark Eye Tabletop Adventure with a mostly pre-generated party of True Neutral adventurers, half of whom happen to be criminals, while half are equally as guilty.

Except your party is imbalanced from start to finish. Two warriors, two mages, and a TEMPORARY archer who has to go back [spoiler]to her addiction, followed by getting killed by a giant monster for the Arena's amusement[/spoiler]. While the game has a complex cross-class system to compensate for this imbalance, it's too complex; trying to discover the system on your own will mainly result in poor long-term skill point choices that you won't discover until it's far too late, and there are no re-specs. (Also, don't use skill books unless they're absolutely useful. They eat up your AP and I guarantee you can find every single skill from a trainer somewhere in the world for free.)

Story wise, the game cripples itself. While the adventure and its modules are fairly entertaining, nearly all of your choices only influence a single consequence: [spoiler]whether or not your mage decides to screw you over. It all boils down to whether you blindly trust a former murder-cultist or the rest of your semi-unhinged team, and is strange and disturbing overall.[/spoiler]. Your main character has little to no impact on the story otherwise, as your other party members will do all the charismatic (or anti-charismatic, in the case of the melee units) talking for you.

But the worst mechanic is the special win-conditions; rather than spice up the fight, they typically turn it into a slog-fest as you fumble around looking for the exact tile to stand next to, so you can waste an entire turn activating some obscure background-looking object that MAY help you or just complicate the battlefield even further. Ever tried conquering a narrow maze filled with respawning Crypt Lice and a dozen pressure pads that will lock the exit door? The game fluctuates between easy and frustrating and is ultimately annoying to play through during these moments.

Die Story selbst war an sich zwar ganz gut aber ich fand dass das Charkterverhalten das eine oder andere Mal sehr unnat√ºrlich ist. 

Es ist halt ein DSA ableger. F√ºr mich spricht auf alle F√§lle mehr daf√ºr als dagegen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198281568815', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5226, 'last_played': 1496472815}
review:
= 2017/05/30 =

Here is what you get from Blackguards by Daedalic Entertainment.

Linear story based
Pre-made heroes (characters)
Skill based characters (not class based)
Spell caster or non-spell caster class (all skill available except spell type for non-spell caster, spell casters have a one time use of AP(Adventurer Points) in the beginning when creating your character)
Close range weapons : Dagger, Sword/Saber, Axe/Mace, Rapier/Foil, Staves, Spears, 2-Handed Sword, 2-Handed Mace
Long range weapons : Bows, Crossbows, Throwing weapons
Left/Right hand slot : One-hand weapon + shield, Dual wield, 2-Handed wepon, or bare-fist (not recommended)
Armor slots : Head, Chest, Legs, Hands, Feet, Waist (for belt to put items usable in combat)
Attributes : Courage, Cleverness, Intuition, Charisma, Dexterity, Agility, Constitution, Strength, Vitality, Astral-energy(mana), Magic resistance [Each attribute points contribute to Base Values]
Base Values : Vitality, Attack, Parry, Dodge, Ranged combat, Initiative, Magic resistance, Astral Energy, Speed
Talents : Body-control, Will power, Perception, Traps, Street-wise, Survival, Animal Lore, Warcraft, Treat Wounds
Special Abilities : from Power Blow, Tripple Shot, Dual Wield, to Astral regeneration. 16 main abilities, 39 including sub-abilities (for example Dodge 1->Dodge 2-<Dodge 3)

[b]= The below is a personal review/feeling of the game, you may feel differently! =[/b]

The goods
1. "The complex rule system". All these stats doing all sorts of different things! A must for the sophisticated(?) nerdy RPGer.
2. Equipment changes the character outlook (even made me use a lesser equipment just for the looks that I prefered)
3. Each hero (or should I say villain) has a unique touch of personality in the story
4. Graphics/Animation of skills shows the effort of the developers.

The bads
1. Not-so-good-working "The complex rule system".
If I see a 60% hit chance, I expect to hit 6 times out of 10 tries, or 3 out of 5.
But I miss most of the time.
The game is a liar in this sense and no one likes to be lied to.
2. Limited AP (Adventurer Points) to level up your characters.
No random mobs. All encounters are pre-decided.
3. Some encounters are almost impossible if you level-up incorrectly due to the limited AP.
Makes you restart the game because you cannot go any further.
So don't think of making a jack-of-all-trades bard-like character...
Your frustration level will rise to max gauge.
4. Receive same amount of set Experience points (or Adventure Points) for each encounter, no matter how many opponents you fell. There are some encounters where you will meet infinite (respawning) mobs. If you down 1 mob and finish the objective, it will give you the same reward as downing 100 mobs before finishing the objective.

[b]= conclusion =[/b]
It almost felt like a puzzle game more than an RPG because some (if not most) encounters had specific methods to win easily. Other methods, not so easy or impossible (to me).
Personally, I like to farm/grind, especially when I cannot beat a certain area but not with Blackguards.

Perhaps you will survive better than me but comparing the enjoyment to the frustration level, Blackguards is not recommened.

author: {'steamid': '76561198375256219', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2082, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 927, 'last_played': 1495619308}
review:
El juego esta bien, la verdad. Entretenido, buenos graficos, Muy, muy tactico. Lo compr√© a        
8¬¥90E y creo que los vale

A los que os gusten este tipo de juegos: Estrategia por turnos y Rol te vas a divertir. 

Pero tiene una gran pega. La dificultad.

Es     "E X T R E M A D A M E N T E"    dif√≠cil y llega un punto que se hace exasperante. Y eso que estoy casi en tan solo las 10 horas de juego. Al principio te da 2 opciones de dificultad, pero incluso la m√°s sencilla hace las batallas muy complicadas y complejas de resolver.

Te puedo asegurar que si eres de los que aceptan los retos hasta que o mueres tu o el juego, te lo vas a pasar muy bien. 

Pero si eres como yo de los que comienzas a golpear la mesa cuando ves que no hay manera. Ni te lo plantes, busca un reto m√°s sencillo y no rompas nada, que entonces el juego te sale muy caro.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055250612', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 6323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6311, 'last_played': 1395731765}
review:
A great RPG based on the Dark Eye system, but with a few flaws. It's been a while since I played, but here's my take:

The Good:
* Engaging storyline with memorable characters
* Good conversion of the Dark Eye system with a few tweaks for balance
* Each combat is different thanks to hand-crafted maps with interactive environments

The Bad:
* The Astral regeneration mechanic pretty much forces you to artificially prolong fights so that your casters can regain their astral power (as this only works during combat), making mid-to-late-game combats more painful than fun
* Not available under Linux

There also used to be a few issues with to-hit percentages not showing up correctly (showing 95% even if your chance was much less) and lack of in-game help on mechanics, but I believe these have largely been addressed now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039462623', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2550, 'last_played': 1494268226}
review:
DIe kurze Version: 
Das Spiel ist weit besser, als die meisten Reviews Euch glauben machen wollen. Es ist absolut nicht unfair in dem Sinne, wie viele, viele der Schreiber suggerieren. Aber: es hat eine Menge Design-fehler und man sieht dem Spiel leider an, dass es nicht von Taktikern, sonder von Storyschreibern kreirt wurde.
Normalerweise w√ºrde ich dem Spiel nie und nimmer eine Kaufempfehlung geben, ich nehme nur den Daumen hoch um ein Gegengewicht zu all den Verrissen zu bieten.

BITTE STEAM macht einen NEUTRAL-Button!

Die lange Version:
Zuerst einmal m√∂chte ich klarstellen, dass ich nicht ganz neutral sein kann. Ich spiele DSA-Spiele seit 1984, als die erste Box herauskam und ich bin ein Fan von Daedalic, die so gro√üartige Spiele wie "A new Beginning" oder "The whispered World" heraus gebracht haben, ganz zu schweigen von der weithin beliebten Deponia-Reihe (die nicht mein Geschmack ist) oder den Edna und Harvey-Spielen. Man k√∂nnte mich also als einen "Fanboy" bezeichnen. Wer jedoch meine Reviews liest, der wei√ü, dass ich dadurch eher noch kritischer werde, schlie√ülich hat sogar X-Com2 einen dicken Daumen runter von mir bekommen.

Mit Blackguards hat Deadalic sich an ein Genre gewgt, dass eigentlich au√üerhalb ihrer Expertiese liegt: dem taktischen RPG. Das Spielprinzip ist dabei denkbar einfach. √úber Vorgegebene Wege reist man zu verschiedenen Orten, wo man Quests annehmen kann (oder muss), die dann in einer Art "Kampfarena" gel√∂st werden. Innerhalb dieser Arena laufen die K√§mpfe absolut rundenbasiert ab, man zieht abh√§ngig von einem Initiative-Wert √ºber ein Hexgitter, gibt Befehle wie verschiedente Nahkampf- oder Fernkampf-Angriffe oder aber Zauber, dann kommt der n√§chste dran. Jede Figur verf√ºgt dabei √ºber 2 Aktionen, wobei die eine Aktion immer eine Bewegungsaktion darstellt und die andere f√ºr das Benutzen von Gegenst√§nden oder Attacken oder Bewegungen etc. ausgegeben werden kann. Macht man erst diese zweite Aktion, so verf√§llt die erste. Das alles erinnert stark an Spiele wie die X-com Reihe. So weit, so gut.

Doch hier kommt schon der erste schwere Design-Fehler um die Ecke. Denn das Kampfsystem basiert auf DSA-Regeln und diese sind nunmal nicht intuitiv. Zudem werden Zahlenwerte eingef√ºgt, die nur die halbe Wahrheit erz√§hlen und die f√ºr die gro√üe Wut in den anderen Reviews sorgen. In jedem Kampf bekommt man n√§mlich eine Anzeige, mit wieviel Prozent eine Aktion, bspw. eine Attacke, gelingt. Doch dieser Zahlenwert ber√ºcksichtigt NICHT die Verteidigung des Ziels! So kann man durchaus bei einem Gegner, der bspw. 30% Ausweichen hat, ein Drittel seiner Schl√§ge ins Leere hauen, auch wenn man 95% Angriffschance hat. 
Dies ist nicht in dem Sinne Unfair, nur nicht unbedingt ersichtlich. Macht man aber w√§hrend des Kampfes die Konsole an, so sieht man sehr sch√∂n, was im Hintergrund "gew√ºrfelt" wird. Es geht alles mit rechten Dingen zu, es wird nur, und das ist ein schwerer Designfehler(!), nicht erkl√§rt.

Der n√§chste Designfehler liegt in manchen Maps. Denn so manche Map ist extrem einfach, wenn die erste Runde "gelingt" und fast unschaffbar, wenn sie nicht gelingt. Das k√∂nnte bspw. sein: gelingt mein erster Schu√ü auf den Gegnerischen Caster? Gelingt oder Mi√ülingt der Debuffzauber? Werde ich am Anfang vergiftet oder weiche ich aus? Usw.. Endlosspawns und daraus enstehende Pattsituationen, wo es nicht vor und zur√ºck geht, tragen da nicht zur Verbesserung der Motivation bei.

F√ºr mich der schwerste Designfehler liegt jedoch in der Gruppenzusammenstellung. Ich bin eh kein Fan von Begleitern, die ich mir im Laufe des Spiels zusammen suchen muss. Die optimale Gruppenzusammenstellung zu finden und Charactere selbst zu erstellen und aufeinander ab zu stimmen ist ein wichtiges Taktik- und Spa√üelement, dass den meisten modernen Spielen schlicht fehlt. 
Doch mir nicht nur vorgekaute Chars zu geben, sondern diese auch immer mal wieder aus der Gruppe zu entfernen oder ihrer wichtigsten F√§higkeit zu berauben geht meiner Meinung nach gar nicht. Ich h√§tte gerne EINEN Fernk√§mpfer, den ich von Anfang an oder wenigstens vom Moment, wo ich ihn finde, dabei habe. So hatte ich ein Gro√üteil des Spiels 3 sehr √§hnliche Nahk√§mpfer und einen Caster. Da ist mit den DSA-Regeln aber mehr Variation m√∂glich!

Noch ein Fehler? Aber immer doch! In den DSA-Regeln werden Waffengattungen unterschieden und beherrsche ich die eine, kann ich noch lange nicht mit einer anderen umgehen. Dazu muss ich erst ein weiteres Talent steigern. 
Das finde ich gut so, doch - das Spiel hat mehrere Flashbacks, wo ich gezwungen bin mit einem Holzschwert oder einer Axt zu k√§mpfen, v√∂llig egal, ob ich das kann. Dabei w√§re es so einfach, eine Waffe entsprechend der F√§higkeit zu zu teilen... 
Ich kann ja nachvollziehen, wenn es Storybedingt ist (also man beim Gef√§ngnisausbruch keine Waffe aussuchen kann), aber warum sollte jemand, wenn er mit seiner Freundin auf den Asselverseuchten Friedhof geht, zu ihrem Schutz eine Waffe mitnehmen, die er nicht beherrscht?!?

Ein f√ºr Daedalic unverzeihlicher Fehler schlie√ülich ist das m√ºde und unmotivierte Ende, das keinesfalls f√ºr das Spiel belohnt, sondern mir ein "ist das WIRKLICH euer Ernst?!" entlockte. Schade.

Macht das Spiel √ºberhaupt was richtig?
Ja.Die Atmosph√§re. Die, f√ºr Daedalic typische, Liebe zum Detail in der Grafik. Und das - zwar nicht immer aber oft - aufkommende gute Gef√ºhl, einen fairen, aber schweren Kampf geschafft zu haben. Die Motivation, die Story weiter zu erleben. Das grundsolide Voiceacting. Die Darstellung des nun wirklich nicht sch√∂nen Aventurischen S√ºdens mit seinen Giftmischern und Sklavenh√§ndler, der Brutalit√§t und der Gnadenlosigkeit gegen√ºber dem Schwachen. All das bringt das Spiel hervorragend zur Geltung.

Reicht das f√ºr ein Daumen hoch?
Eigentlich nein. Aber f√ºr ein faires 6/10, was bei mir hei√üt: "grundsolide mit Schw√§chen". 
Und f√ºr einen waagerechten Daumen. Aber den gibts bei Steam ja nicht

author: {'steamid': '76561198041940354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 3215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3215, 'last_played': 1493952981}
review:
I just finished the game and found it very enjoyable. I will echo the limitations that others have stated as I do believe they greatly take away from the enjoyment of the game.  There are multiple fights in a row that really create an overly challenging situation.  There were times I lost several hours of progress and had to replay.  It was frustrating.  I was finally successful with the battles but they really killed enjoyment and turned the game into a grind. A little more balance would have been helpful.  

I also recommend having a strategy for building your characters before you start.  You can adapt during the game but it just makes it harder.  

All in all I did really enjoy the game.  After the issues in chapter 2 I think the rest was fun.  The story was interesting although not amazing.  

I give it a 7/10 and would recommend it despite the issues.


Addition to review.  

I've switch my thumb from up to down.  I've played several other games recently and just want to say I'm so happy to be playing other games.  Blackguards as I said has some nice features and playability but it's just not complete.   It's a 7 still but I think people can find better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032623014', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1489206814}
review:
The devs' heart is in the right place here. I tried really hard to like it, but nope.

A lot of the mechanics are fun, the story and characters are not bad, but the core gameplay - the combat - just isn't doing it for me. Equipment choices are bland and fighting is tedious.

That being said I'm willing to see what they've learned from this one and give BG2 a go.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975539981', 'num_games_owned': 226, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 2001, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1982, 'last_played': 1691317791}
review:
Don't get me wrong, I love this game, I have played an embaressing number of hours outside of steam with it.

BUT NO ONE, NO ONE IN THEIR RIGHT MIND should waste a single penny on this utter rubbish.

This game is cancer, the worst of the worst, about the only people that might like it are morons who thought Darkest Dungeon was good (I didn't, thats just how far out of field this game is).

If you are insane, retarded and have no life, there are 100 other games better than this one, if you run out of those, then try this. As a last resort, befor suicide. Although I'm beginning to debate that last one.

An example of this games mechanics : 74% - miss, 74% - miss, 74% - miss, 74% - miss, 87% - miss, 40% - critical hit.

Another example is one of the arena fights: 2 of your team go up NAKED with WOODEN weapons against an enemy pair, one in full metal armour with a permanently poisoned weapon and 2 health potions, both with more hit points and skills.

This game is not just hard (on hard) - it is UNFAIRLY HARD, hence my Darkest Dungeon comparison.

So you were warned: it can suck you in and you can spend an inordinent amount of time with it, yet in NO WAY will you ever be rewarded by the game for it.

review: Presents a problem when you hit a wall because you cant beat the bad guys.  Theyll talk about strategy and whatnot, but the reality of it is, when youre missing on high % shots (at least a high % based on what the computer tells you) strategy doesnt matter.  Theres nothing more disheartening than watching your team drop one by one and knowing there is nothing you can do to stop it..just load last game.  This imbalance causes more frustration than the game is worth.  Could have been better, just wasnt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041949592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 605, 'playtime_forever': 339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1492631621}
review:
Hey everyone and this is my review about the game!

This is a RPG(RNG) Turn based strategy game.


[h1]Interface/Menu/Settings[/h1]

There is a difficulty level settings available.
You are able to toggle the tutorial.
There is a master volume slidebar available and it is also % based.
There is a music volume slidebar available and it is also % based.
There is a effect volume slidebar available and it is also % based.
There is a voice volume slidebar available and it is also % based.
There are some different resolution sizes available.

[h1]About the game.[/h1]

Before you are able to play your game, they will ask you if you do wish to be a Mage, Hunter or a warrior. Each class has their own advantage and disadvantage. This game is borderline... Well let's say uncreative. You click on a map location and that level will start. You are either fighting against an enemy or you are in a town. Once in a town you are able to buy/sell items at a shop, Rest to recover the stats, Talk to some people or even doing quest activities. Whenever you are fighting against an enemy the combat rules are pretty simple (It's like Heroes of might and magic). The battlefield is on a Grid and each unit take turns for their action. The character speed is known as "initiative" and the higher number, the faster a character is able to perform again in a battle. Sadly enough the game suffers from "Random number generator" in fights (Such as X-Com) which means, Even if you have a 95% attack chance against an enemy. Well jokes on you, The 95% is not really 95% as you are still missing pretty often. Your character is able to level up and they are able to learn new spells, talents and other things. They can be equipped with items to make them stronger in battles.

Subtitles are voiced over. You are able to skip and fastforward it.
Great Graphics.
Turn based Combat.
Decent story.
Random number generated % based in battles.
Character has some customiziation.
There is a rules control overview.
Alot of ingame tips/explainations.
It has dialogues and cutscenes.


[h1]Other things.[/h1]

The random number generator in turn based games is simply NOT WORKING and will always ruin the game. Xcom is a good example (MY OPINION) as the enemy always have a higher hit chance than you will ever get.
So in short words. "Combat mechanic is unfair towards the player as it is happening too often"

-------------------

I Give this game a 5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198089326320', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1492275568}
review:
"Listen to me my boy. The possibility of you connecting this next attack is %95. But the possibility for that possiblity to be possible is only %2." 

I bought this game with a bundle discount and i still regret it. Altough this game has great potential, the whole rng system makes everything so frustrating. And trust me, I'm saying this as a person who's blessed by rngeesus himself. When you slay through all the enemies in one go after ragequitting months ago for missing five million turns on the goddamn 3rd fight into the game, I believe it's safe to say that there is something wrong with the whole system. There are times that this game feels almost unplayable. I hate downvoting Daedalic Entertainment games, but I must do it for a second time unfortunately.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980206817', 'num_games_owned': 383, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1491770634}
review:
I would very much not reccomend this game. After reading through comments and reviews I saw one of the biggest issues was unfair RNG in fights, I figured it must be a bit like Xcom and similar games with % hit chances where you'll miss the odd 99% chance to hit. Which I could understand, but not when it happens on the 2nd fight out of the tutorial, 4 times in a row mixed with 2 missed spell casts. Again I can handle bad RNG but not when the enemies have a 40% chance to hit and never miss. Even if that was not an issue, running into a bug that stops me from completeing the 2nd fight in the graveyard by not letting me interact with the thing the game is screaming at me to interact with to stop mobs spawning. 

I came into this game optimistic and figuring people were just too used to easy games that held your hand and gave it negative reviews because they didn't have to think. This game has proven that thinking wrong, its just a bad designed game with subpar voice acting, from what little I saw an unoriginal story (Accused of murder and coviently having no memory of it or anything.) No real customisation and just in general poor gameplay.

If you've read this far and have not bought the game I would say do not waste time and money on this and go get Divinity Original Sin for a similar but all round greater gaming experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047800149', 'num_games_owned': 1189, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2366, 'last_played': 1492588708}
review:
Update: Finished game, would hardly call unfair, most fights in the game took a max of 2-3 tries, plenty were 1shots. Did all sidequests I ran across before completion, not sure how close to 100% I was, but I'd guess I probably did a good 85-90% of the content on offer. It's just about learning the game to be honest, there's nothing super difficult here. I play a good variety of games and hardly am "an expert" at turn based tactics games for comparison to what you can expect. Fun game, a couple of times I found the combat very slow and wished I could skip through enemy turns when there were lots of enemies (last dungeon had a couple like this...)

Pretty funny seeing all the people here whine about this game being unforgiving or super difficult... I am completely new to Dark Eye game systems and have just taken my time in looking at the character trees etc and sort of feeling my way into where I'm spending my AP. I would say that if difficult = not 1shotting every single battle, then the game is "difficult". But beyond that, it's not very difficult. Every single encounter has taken me no more than 2 tries barring the end encounter for Chapter 2 (louse queen as a 3rd battle in a row with no recovery time. I decided to power thru it vs trying to load an old save and set myself up for easier success over all 3 as a whole with the knowledge I'd gained... too lazy to do that). And I can even say that the first attempt is often experimentation or trial/error with the different maps, traps and interactables etc and perhaps new enemy types. 

It's fairly easy so far, although I will say that the difficulty is spiky; it runs the gamut from faceroll to mildy challenging (and some of the reviews I see whining about difficulty are from people that spent far less time than I, so I doubt it's where I am in the game) -- honestly if you are having trouble, maybe reevaluate your movement and positioning. I've found that there is a lot of advantage to be gained and strategy in positioning and more or less "gaming the map" to keep control and manage some of the risk/rng. This is a hex based game, and sometimes moving 2 hexes right or left can change a whole lot. 

To give an example -- I saw a "WTF is" by TotalBiscuit, where he played a fairly early map and thought it was frustrating and difficult... immediately started making major positioning oversights in the very first turn he had. The corridor is bottlenecked to 3 hexes wide and there are like 6 active crypt lice. Why would you not move 3 characters onto each of those hexes and wait for the lice to come to you? Then you are only fighting 3 at once you only have 3 characters of your choosing taking damage (far more control over damage intake). Following this, you have infinite recovery turns on the map to heal before moving forward and "activating" the next group. This is just a very basic example... and I don't really even dabble in strategy games all that much. I just don't see how this game is hard. It's fairly simple with a bit of trial and error involved. The RNG complaints are also pretty bullshit... there is even a "wounds" system to manage the RNG... which I discovered at my leisure after continually investigating the ruleset as I played. Have some patience... you definitely don't need to read character guides to suceed. I've learned after playing and reading around that the optimal route is playing a mage as the hero (there's 0 disadvantage since there are basically characters that can cast and characters that can't -- everything else can be developed as you see fit as the game goes on...), and I'm doing just fine.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041769343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 3131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3101, 'last_played': 1427945983}
review:
I highly enjoyed this game. I've read over a few of the other reviews and i'm seeing a trend - the game is hard to the point of unfair. While there are some very challenging fights in the game I only ran into a couple actually took more than one attempt. 

If you want to see a bit of the game play you can click through my let's play of the game. https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLV4VR6BqqFu4dMvMwv_uo5V-WjivoYUYm

The combat was fun, challenging, and character development was fair. Your characters do need to specialize but that's part of a party building strategy game. Cover your weaknesses, develope battle plans, and execute. When a plan doesn't work you reassess and start again. Personally I felt the story was very weak but the gameplay is solid.

review:
Ach, ich w√ºrde dieses Spiel gerne empfehlen. ber ich kannes nicht. Ja es ist ein nettes Rollenspiel, die taktischen K√§mpfe sind auch oft ganz spa√üig. Aber: viel zu sehr vom Gl√ºck abh√§ngig. Und bei falscher Positionierung der Helden kann es auf manchen Karten passieren, das es unm√∂glich wird den Ausgang zu erreichen, weil unendlich spawnende Gegner den Weg versperren. Ich musste mehrmals K√§mpfe neuladen aufgrund solche Begebenheiten. Die Story ist eigentlich ganz gut. Das Ende jedoch langweilig und entt√§uschend. Der letzte Bosskampf auch eifach nur nervig und langatmig. Selbst auf leichten Schwierigkeitsgrad sind die K√§mpfe so zufallsabh√§ngig, dass man manchmal total Chancenlos ist und auch dann hilft nur ein Neuladen des Kampfes.

Alles in allem, habe ich mich eher zum Ende durchgequ√§lt, weil ich die Story und das Spiel beendet wissen wollte. Mit gen√ºgend Geduld, kann das Spiel aber durchaus Spa√ü machen. Ich w√ºrde sagen, dass ich zu 40 % des Spiels stark genervt war und zu 60 % Spa√ü hatte.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014539053', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2823, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2821, 'last_played': 1491121883}
review:
Eigentlich ein interessantes Spiel ,wennn es nicht zeitweise unfair w√§re.

Leider hat man teilweise mehrere K√§mpfe hintereinander ohne Speicherm√∂glichkeit.Da man vorher nicht wei√ü,wieviel K√§mpfe man durchstehen mu√ü,ist man oft schlecht vorbereitet und mu√ü gegebenfalls alle K√§mpfe(auch die gewonnenen) wiederholen.Das f√ºhrt zu Frust und √Ñrger...

Auch erscheint mir die angezeigte Trefferquote nicht plausibel (Trefferquote 100% ... und ich treffe nicht ???).Oft wird bei hoher Prozentzahl nicht getroffen,wenn ich von der gleichen Stelle den Gegner angreife(Trefferquote 90% und ich treffe 4 mal hintereinder nicht ...???....dann m√º√üte ich rein rechnerisch die n√§chsten 36 mal treffen).

Grafik und Geschichte finde ich ok bis gut ... immer wieder die gleiche K√§mpfe durchzuspielen wurde mir letztendlich zuviel.... ohne bestandene Hauptquest-K√§mpfe ist das Spiel vorbei.Es gibt nur eine linare M√∂glichkeit  die n√§chsten Kapitel frei zu schalten. F√ºr mich war das Spiel  im Kapitel 3 zu Ende.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995368942', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 600, 'last_played': 1671024631}
review:
It is easy to forget that RNGESUS is a wrathful and jealous god. I thank the developers for reminding me that although a game might look "sweet" on the surface, there is an unfair, unforgiving, and unbalanced mechanic lurking beneath ready to drain all the fun out of the experience.

"For lo I say unto ye our lord's rod is stiff, long and hard and he rolls a natural 20. Yea the unbeliever might do the math and sayeth he that 75% chance to hit means there is only a 1 in 4 chance to miss, but blaspheme not so! For the lord will punish ye all the way through to 95% chance to hit. Ye shall miss as certain as ye have bound the quick load/save to ye mouse buttons." -Numbers 1:20.

However it is quite interesting. And there are some variations to it depending on your choices.

It's a nice casual game for us who like the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074386839', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1505131196}
review:
[b] My view:[/b]

The game is worth one play-through, though on replay it is already disgustingly similar. Personally I think that a warrior, a ranger, a rogue, and a mage would live different lives, make different choices, define different loot. Here it does not even matter, as long, as you win fight after fight.

Tactical, combat-enforced hex-map fantasy chess with RPG stats of the once most beloved German pen & paper roleplaying game. The game starts nicely, even though the linearity of the story, and the lack of impact one makes unto the world around the chosen or hand-built protagonist seems to remind of decade old mistakes in RPG's.

The game is A LOT about tactical combat on a hex map, not much skills versus environment, not much story or choices which matter, but if you unlock the console and type WIN after pressing F12, then patch version 1.8 of the game is decent.

Given that several patches still failed to relieve us of all glitches and bugs, that isn't too impressive.

One mistake I found sucking:

Merchants offer a standard script of equipment. Entire armor sets and weapons can only be gained by using the 'give all items' cheat. Sadly that one crashes the game later, as it spawns a bug sabotaging the quest resolving.

Additionally you need your DirectX and VCredists (from 2008 to 2013) in peak-performance-state, or glitches and bugs are guaranteed!

Crystals and chests cannot be damaged by daggers or fencing weapons! Use two-weapon fighting plus a torch or slash or bash type of weapon, IF you need daggers or foils, rapiers to imagine your character (Horasian area of Aventuria)...

[b]The good aspects:[/b]

The character creation is decent.

The world is harsh and unforgiving, while still being the once famous Aventuria (Aventurien in German) of THE DARK EYE RPG system.

The allies of the protagonist and their voiceovers ain't bad.

Background music is decent, too. 

Skills like streetwise and survival make a difference, even though some can only be taken at character creation in expert mode. No trainers found later in the game.

The game does build atmosphere, but only for one more tactical combat on those ancient, antiquated, oldschool hexagone maps...

The oft-shunned Nameless God is much better implemented than in 'Demonicon'.

I purchased it years after first sale, for only 2‚Ç¨ plus 1,20‚Ç¨ steam key. For that pricing it was good enough to fill one evening, but not enough to make that old fever aka joy arise in my ex-roleplayer soul.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079211589', 'num_games_owned': 380, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 4718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4683, 'last_played': 1490529509}
review: Nach gut 50 Spielstunden habe ich es nun endlich durch. Ein tolles Spiel. Die Nebenquests h√§tte man aber auch weglassen k√∂nnen. Denn 50 Stunden zehrt schon extrem an meiner Motivation. Scheinbar gibt es auch unterschiedliche Enden. Denn ganz hat es meine Gruppe nicht geschafft alle Errungenschaften zu meistern. Die aber ohne erneutes durchspielen wohl nicht erreichbar sind. Aber noch mal 50 Stunden habe ich keine Lust ;) Werde daf√ºr aber direkt mit Blackguards 2 weitermachen. Ich hoffe nur das der zweite Teil nicht auch wieder so lange dauert. Ich mag so lange Spiele eigentlich nicht. Wie auch immer, w√ºrde das Spiel jedem Rundenstrategen und Rollenspieler empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972309532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1514, 'last_played': 1490816482}
review:
The first time I came to write a review for this game it was going to be a vitriolic missive of woe and anger. In true fashion, and not for the first time, the game had put me on my ass. It was during the games infamous second chapter, where fights come thick and fast, and leave you feeling brutalised and frustrated. I perservered however and came out of the other side happier for it.

This game is far from perfect, but for fans of tactical RPGs it is a truly a diamond in the rough. Battles are varied and interesting and party composition and tactical choices really make a difference. The combat system is deeper than it first appears and that hidden depth is one of the games finer qualities. It is also it's biggest drawback. The game is closely based on a pen and paper RPG and unfortunately in many ways just as indecipherable to the beginner. 

The character progression system is almost arcane in its complexity, to the point that it is almost certain that you will make mistakes in the way you build up your party. These mistakes will be deadly on even normal difficulty. It's reliance on a pen and paper system mean that unless you have a copy of the rulebook and many hours to ponder it and try out permutations, your characters will be woefully shy of optimal. This may lead to you having to restart the game several times as you begin to unravel its mysteries.

That being said , the game is sufficiently fun, interesting and challenging that you won't mind having to restart. I didn't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141897960', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1490048362}

author: {'steamid': '76561198325719395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2783, 'last_played': 1479041742}
review:
Kann ich nicht empfehlen, nicht f√ºr den vollen Preis.

Ein knapp √ºberdurchschnittliches Taktikspiel (rundenbasiert), das versucht, sich als Rollenspiel zu verkaufen.
Abgesehen von der Charakterentwicklung findet kein nennenswertes Rollenspiel statt, und Taktikspiele gibt es bessere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070616040', 'num_games_owned': 501, 'num_reviews': 268, 'playtime_forever': 1677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1413, 'last_played': 1457263424}
review:
Remember don't starve's difficulty curve? it's the same here, only less forgiving, it's a great game but it's better than the second game so explore and read everything, restart, retry and have fun.
It's an amazing game with a good system, it lacks balancing and needs more combat, more diverse combat

author: {'steamid': '76561198117760235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 695, 'last_played': 1489642382}
review:
3/5 Right on the fence between recommend or not, I chose not because of the game's very poor support of Mac graphics, which made it an epic challenge to get the game running initially and renders the Steam overlay unusable. Combine this with its comandeering of the OS ‚Äî no alt-tabs here ‚Äî and it is a largely unpleasant gaming experience.

On the plus side, if you are a fan of tactical turn-based strategy RPG (very light on the RP), and are running Windows (you fool!) then go for it.

All in all, I'd say take the advice of Rock, Paper, Shotgun: give Blackguards a pass and save up your money for Blackguards 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971156862', 'num_games_owned': 69, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 494, 'last_played': 1453660932}
review:
Avevo delle grandi aspettative su questo gioco e, da appassionato di strategia a turni, pensavo che la sfida contro l'AI potesse essere impegnativa e avvincente, per questo l'ho giocato alla massima difficolt√†. All'inizio √® stato divertente, poi il ripetersi delle battaglie √® diventato noioso, gi√† poco oltre la met√† del gioco non vedevo l'ora di concludere, anch√® perch√® i miei personaggi erano diventati fortissimi, quasi invincibili e a parte le sfide contro un paio di boss, ho faticato poco a completare le quest sia principali che secondarie, per cui da qui alla noia il passo √® stato decisamente breve.
La storia comunque non √® male, il gameplay per√≤ √® molto lontano dalla qualit√† vista in titoli come X-Com o il sottovalutato Expeditions Conquistadores per fare alcuni esempi, che, almeno per me, rappresentano delle pietre di paragone per il genere.
Credo comunque che una mezza dozzina di Euro si possano spendere su questo titolo, in fondo, ad altri potrebbe anche piacere. A me ha deluso.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056318208', 'num_games_owned': 173, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2185, 'last_played': 1490545413}
review:
Blackguards is a fairly entertaining tactical RPG. It can be hard at times,frustrating and random. You do need to put some thought into your character stats and abilities as they develop. It would be nice to be able to reset it by paying a cost or through some in-game service.

It is fairly complex but no more so than other JRPGs out there.

There story is pretty good with some decent voice acting. I am not sure why so many people don't just give this game a proper try.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999282226', 'num_games_owned': 971, 'num_reviews': 201, 'playtime_forever': 546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 546, 'last_played': 1434765597}
review:
Blackguards is a turn based RPG game. A very difficult, very unforgiving one. The backbone of the game is made up by the Dark Eye system, a system similar to DnD and (from what I understand) very popular in Germany. I've played  alot of DnD, and read a lot about the game's system and guides before playing Blackguards, but didn't really feel like it made much of a difference. The RNG is very unforgiving, in that if your characters' builds are not razor optimized, you will have an incredibly difficult time with the game, more than it already is. I STRONGLY suggest looking at character guides and just following one to the T in terms of what are good skills, what are must haves, where to put your points, and the like, as it is very easy to render a character effectively useless in a battle as you continue to invest points in skills.

Damage and  status efects stay with characters after fights, and consumables are in relatively short supply, meaning strings of fights become very dicey. Magic casting runs off of the same RNG as the melee attacks do, so it's possible to cast spells, have them fizzle entirely, but still lose mana - very frustrating since you then need to use one of your limited resources in money or mana potions to get them back to the point to where they can even begin to be useful again - or so you hope.

These difficulties in learning the games system will unfortunately turn people away from what is a very enjoyable and very think-y turn based combat game. Almost every single individual map is handcrafted and presents new challenges to the party, and the game often forces you to use various party members in different compositions: Aggravating if you chose to focus on one in particular, but from a game design standpoint, if executed well lets you offer all sorts of new challenges. The problem lies in the game's very punishing permanent levellnig system. With no way to undo bad choices and mistakes (and don't be fooled: there ARE mistakes and just bad choices you can make in character builds), you might be stuck at a fight you now have no way of winning, fifteen hours into the campaign.

The story is not particularly interesting, in my opinion, but I have played  alot of very intensely narrative focused games so I admit my bar may be set a little bit high. The characters are interesting, and it's fun to see a story told from the perspective of sly ne'er-do-wells rather than heroic caricatures. Unfortunately, I never really felt like anything groundbreaking or innovative was really done with the characters or situations they could have used, and instead it just sort of became background set up fora relatively generic story that could have been done with the more "Usual Suspects" of heroic characters.

Ironically, I garnered the most fun from the game when my frustration was at its peak and I simply used Cheat Engine to level my characters to the max immediately, giving myself essentially unlimited skill points and ability points to make the characters I actually wanted to make. Due to the punishing RNG and the thoughtful, puzzle-y situations the game likes to put you in, in every single combat, this takes less of the challenge out of the game than you might immediately think (it DOES make it much easier, of course.). Your mileage may vary, but for someone that wants to experience the combat system and the story, i would actually recommend just cheat engining your characters to max level and giving them all the skills you want them to have, and then enjoy using them in the varied combat situations the games put you in.

In the end, I give the game a thumbs down - but only because I think the game's opaqueness and difficulty in learning the system is such a a negative that many people will feel immediately turned off by a combinatioin of that and the game's innate difficulty that they'll be unable to enjoy the game for its positive sides.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024580466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3726, 'last_played': 1488371058}
review:
Insgesamt ein sehr herausforderndes Spiel mit einer gut erz√§hlten Geschichte im DSA-Universum. Ich habe es auf normal durchgespielt und auch dort waren viele K√§mpfe sehr schwer, und es gab durchaus frustrierende Momente. Die Spielzeit betr√§gt ca. 40 Stunden, wenn man sich alles anschaut. Das Spiel richtet sich an Spieler die auf der Suche nach herausfordernden taktische Rundek√§mpfen sind. Trotz einiger Defizite kann ich das Spiel empfehlen.


Pro:
- Gute Geschichte
- Toll designte Begleiter, die auch immer wieder Beitr√§ge liefern
- Durchdachtes Kampfsystem

Contra:
- Begleiteranzahl insgesamt gering (man hat auch keine Wahlm√∂glichkeiten, wer einen begleitet, wie in vielen anderen Rollenspielen)
- gerade in den ersten zwei Kapiteln sind die K√§mpfe stark vom Zufallsfaktor dominiert. Die Charaktere patzen h√§ufig beim Zaubern. Dies √§ndert sich im sp√§teren Verlauf, trotz allem habe ich noch kein Spiel gespielt, wo das Zaubern so schwer ist
- Man kann sich sehr leicht verskillen. Wenn man sich mit den DSA-Regeln nicht auskennt, kann man sehr schnell in einer Sackgasse landen. Ein  reskillen ist leider nicht m√∂glich, man muss sehr weit im voraus planen. Bei der gro√üen Skillm√∂glichkeit kann man leicht √ºberfordert sein.

author: {'steamid': '76561198288467486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2430, 'last_played': 1490327305}
review: dont waste your money. the AI is very rigged for failure. the percentages of success are fake. i purposely tried casting a spell with a 70% chance of success and because i would assume i was winning it would always fail. tried it several times. the story line is weak and unimaginative and the graphics are poor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045512003', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 10473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7652, 'last_played': 1488711050}
review:
Another example of a great (in places) game putting off players do to poor presentation of core game mechanics to player base / very poor ingame feedback. 

I don't know what the developers were aiming for with the way the final product turned out (it is NOT due to technical ineptitude or lack of creative ability - the game mechanics are consistent with its defined rule set, full of intelligent puzzles and reasonably bug free).

The lack of transparency (markedly unsound - it badly hurts their sales numbers by quickly alienating the "shallower" player base. ) seems to be caused largely due to intended design. Maybe TDE (dark eye) game rules are were so second nature to the developers they coudn't see how difficult it will be for "foreigners" to make sense of their otherwise "working within parameters" product. 

It almost like the game is made by aliens strangers to earth based game interface progression in the last 20 years. Maybe this what a game made by programmers/designers that don't play computer games should be expected to turn out (speculation). 

cons
-very limited ruleset/mecanics exposition and ingame feedback (steam guides mostly fixes this)
-alien game interface: bits of relevant information are scattered all over the place (need to navigate 5-6 "screens" to gather basic info about a character - a feat the good modern games can achieve in 1-2 "screens" with overwelmingly superior amount of detail - wastes player time, hurts immersion)
-stoneage like combat log functionality (mising a lot game critical events and the ones presented lack detail)  
-rough spell/ weapon class balance
-nearly impossible to read opponent's percentage based resists ( some even have vulnerabilities to certain damage types but it is extremely hard to tell due to the hidden resist stats , RNG damage component and poor combat log features)
-liniar story, set drops(limited itemisation issues) and poor spell/abilities balance (few powerbuilds builds) leads to poor replayability value. (maybe the obfuscation was intended to mask/hide the poor balance to the players - or the poor balance is the result of the obfuscation making it hard for the devs to see the problems ?)

pros
-the community with a bit of help from developers managed to unwind most of the critical game mechanics (check out the game's player guides section)
-the game is well oiled (very few bugs), the creative people did great - very high intelligent puzzle combat variation(enjoyable once you start grasping the game mechanics).  
 
I still recommend this game despite its numerous flaws because it has the capability to enthral players for hours, but wait for significant special offer discounts .

author: {'steamid': '76561198058844017', 'num_games_owned': 243, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1021, 'last_played': 1487206364}
review:
Bem se espera que voc√™ passe horas jogando e explorando o mapa do jogo, mas isso n√£o √© poss√≠vel. O jogo tem basicamente dois tipos de cen√°rios as cidades e os campos de batalha. Ou voc√™ est√° lutando ou est√° na cidade.

Como todo RPG os personagens possuem uma √°rvore de habilidades que v√£o sendo preenchidas com o desenvolvimento dos personagens, no BlackGuards o sistema n√£o √© baseado em level e sim em pontos de habilidade que voc√™ ganha ap√≥s cada batalha. At√© ai tudo bem e normal, s√≥ que o sistema √© justo somente no primeiro cap√≠tulo do jogo j√° no cap√≠tulo 2 em diante fica imposs√≠vel/injusto o progresso no jogo para os demais cap√≠tulos. Ou seja, mesmo se voc√™ for um jogador experiente em RPGs de um modo geral n√£o passar√° do cap√≠tulo 2. Provavelmente, vai recorrer a algum trainner na internet para poder progredir no jogo. Mesmo assim, os NPCs treinadores na cidade n√£o ir√£o treinar voc√™ em todas habilidades do jogo, voc√™ vai ficar limitado a uns 5 a 6 habilidades no m√°ximo(mesmo voc√™ cumprindo os requisitos para aprende-las) , ou seja, somente no final do jogo ter√° um NPC que treinar√° seus personagens com  todas as skills dispon√≠veis no jogo. Algumas skills voc√™ somente aprende comprando livros nos NPCs comerciantes e fazendo quests, mas s√£o muito poucas.


Pr√≥s:

-Cumpre a fun√ß√£o de ser um RPG com batalhas em turnos
-Ambienta√ß√£o e interatividade com os cen√°rios durante as batalhas.
-Customiza√ß√£o do personagem com armas e habilidades.
-At√© divertido e bom para passar o tempo
-Legendado em PT-BR

Contras :

-Aos poucos o jogo vai te proporcionando uma experi√™ncia extremamente frustante.
-Os NPCs treinadores s√£o totalmente limitados e os pontos de batalha para voc√™ treinar suas habilidades tamb√©m.
-O jogo √© justo s√≥ no primeiro cap√≠tulo, a progress√£o para os cap√≠tulos seguintes √© praticamente imposs√≠vel.
-Hist√≥ria fraca e bem confusa.


OBSERVA√á√ÉO:  Eu queria ter positivado esse jogo, por√©m ele aos poucos foi se tornando uma experi√™ncia  frustante a medida o progresso dos seus personagens √© extremamente desproporcional ao progresso dos inimigos que voc√™ encontra, mesmo se voc√™ for um jogador experiente vai ver os defeitos bem vis√≠veis nessa quest√£o de jogabilidade e outras. A sensa√ß√£o √© de que o jogo foi feito e depois foi abandonado pelos desenvolvedores em rela√ß√£o a um monte de defeitos , provavelmente isso faz com as pessoas que compraram abandonem o jogo com poucas horas jogadas.

review:
Someone else put this much better than I ever could.
I don't remember who said it, or the exact words, but it was something to the tune of "This game is like a wax apple."
It looks beautiful on the outside, and there's really no reason it should be bad, but the feel of the game is artificial, slow, and not very good. 
Supposedly Blackguards 2 is better, but I haven't played it myself. This one kinda left a bad taste.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101352874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1003, 'last_played': 1486650526}
review: This game is underrated.  If you like turn-based combat, where your characters learn new skills over time, and combat is the focal point of the game (minor story, which I think makes some reviewers not like the game), then this game is great.  Sense of accomplishment on every fight you beat, especially the hard ones.  It takes a while to figure out tactics for some of the harder fights, but there's nothing better than the feeling of beating it. This is a good game.  Try the demo, you'll get the idea from that, but it does get better after a few hours and you level a bit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080814955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 639, 'last_played': 1583700446}
review:
In general the game is good but the combat is terrible. You'll have 95% chance to hit something and you will miss 5 times.  From what ive seen so far the story is great, character progression and the option to make decisions are fun. i enjoy the battles even though the majority of the time you are greatly out numbered. I liked everything but the combat, that alone makes the game so rough. Its not that its hard strategy wise.

the combat really holds this game back a key destructible item will give you 100% chance to hit and you will still miss, or other times it will take you 2 - 3 hits to destroy it and sometimes it will take one. the consistency is terrible.
