author: {'steamid': '76561198051709367', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 1875, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1754, 'last_played': 1484225731}
review:
Detesto scrivere recensioni negative ma questo gioco mi ha lasciato piuttosto deluso. Nonostate abbia apprezzato molto [i] The Dark Eye [/i] all'epoca di Drakensang, trovo questa versione pi√π povera e negativa sotto vari aspetti. 
L'equipaggiamento √® abbastanza ridotto e costoso, soprattutto i libri di magia. Avere un budget decente da gestire sar√† uno dei grandi problemi per buona parte del gioco. 
Nessun crafting. La composizione del gruppo √® sbilanciata, i punti avventura distribuiti con approssimazione (vi consiglio di crearlo da voi il personaggio principale). Molti scontri sono abbastanza frustranti. L'interazione con l'ambiente, in generale, offre risultati migliori del combattimento diretto. La storia √® piuttosto buona ma ci sono anche scontri a catena e diversi momenti di delusione. Le ricompense migliori si ottengono spesso con quest risolte malvagiamente (che non alterano la storia), in generale si avranno poche soddisfazioni. Piuttosto che a Blackguards, consiglio vivamente la saga di Drakensang.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059308538', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 8072, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8072, 'last_played': 1483924750}
review:
Blackguards is a very interesting game with complex dynamics of the Dark Eye.

IMHO this game deserves a 8.5/10 and definitely worth hours of gameplay and to some extent re-playability. I found myself planing for hours what spells to get and how to develop some characters. 

Pros:
- Detailed characters that come to life
- Good roles mixture (I played as a mage but my real emphasis was a fighter with usage of the shadow spell)
- Detailed scenarios
- Fantastic spells and animations.
- Hard difficulty requires strategic previous character planning to be able to beat some encounters.

Cons:
- No 360 camera support
- Sometimes win or lose a battle feels more luck than strategy (Fail all the hits and all the magic, bad luck meaning lose).
- Mechanics such as Buy/Sell kind of feels incomplete and Weight system feels off
- End of the story is incomplete and leaves you wondering (Blackguards 2 continues this?)

Overall I must say I did really enjoy the game, and the story development might is interesting although not among the most interesting from the Daedalic games or Baldur's gates games storylines.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112810429', 'num_games_owned': 2591, 'num_reviews': 578, 'playtime_forever': 6362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4576, 'last_played': 1484022999}
review:
If only Steam would allowed that, I'd post it under the neutral banner. The game is neither all good or all bad, it's somewhat of any of those extremes.

I really liked the story part, especially the main villain figure, and all that dark cult agenda, it was really fitting. With that said, I'm quite not happy with the pace and rhythm the game plot proceed, the characters making their moves and all such things. It's all... static and boring. Yeah, again, the story is good, the way it was written and told is really subpar.
I liked the subquests, some of them are really creative and interesting... But buggy and not really rewarding.

I... liked the battles, at least, good bunch of them. The maps are challenging, the variety of abilities and ways to get going is really good. With that... Have you noticed the time counter Steam thinks I was playing? Something around 100 hours? Well, in truth it's maybe around 20. I've played the Blackguards on holidays, I never really needed to shut the game. So I was just playing over the moment I get bored and frustrated, and then just leaving the game without closing it. Mostly, it was around some combats, where you abide, and abide... And tarry the tide, if you know that verse.

You see, some of the combats are really long, with big maps, lots of enemies, unobvious goals or some freaky bugs not letting you to finish the fight. Like, for example, a crystal you have to break to proceed. You're standing next to it, with a hammer and 100% hit chance. And then you miss. 5 times in the row. The hit percentage is maybe the one of the worst abominations that Blackguards shows to the world of turn-based RP games. They are so unfair, as loaded dices.

Finally, with all that pro and contra stuff going hand in hand, there are broken achievements and over-the-top strange pattern to make a good ending. In the end, all the game is unrewarding. Unworthy. My mark is 5.8/10. Think twice over this buy, even on the lowest price possible.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960675266', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 931, 'last_played': 1483465268}
review:
I have mixed feelings on this game. I got it on sale and would recommend it as such, but this game is not worth 40$. 

Nothing in this game is bad except for the UI, but nothing is good either. Nothing impressed me at all. The spell system having 3 stats associated to every spell just doesn't make sense. I need strength for magic? Wait what? Okay it would make sense if its a force push or something maybe that fits right? Well one of them creates and arcane wall, the other is a debuff. How is that associated to strength at all? 

Most irritating part is some fights are just not properly balanced. There is one fight I spent over an hour on, had the moves mapped to a science, and just needed the RNG to connect. If you let the guy hit you on the second turn and poison you, you simply cannot win. So one companion has to move the perfect amount of tiles away from the enemy so it will chase him, while the other moves away and shoots at the non poisoning opponent. Kiting of this level doesn't have a place in a game like this. When I have to take my tank and run him in circles to not die, I feel like the developers missed something...  And to put it in perspective, I have the best armor and stats possible at the current place for a tank, and he cannot tank nor do I even consider him "tanky". Your shield will add a lot to your parry, but you can only parry once per turn turn so what is the point? My mage honestly has just as good of a chance to survive as he does wearing cloth without a shield. 

I love games like this, and this one just doesn't shine enough for me to recommend it over what is out there. As I said I don't feel it is bad, but I am not finishing the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014961613', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3459, 'last_played': 1584184607}
review:
Juego interesante dentro de su √°mbito. Su principal problema son los tiempos de carga entre los diferentes escenarios, que hace que la parte que no es propiamente de batalla sea un poco aburrida.
Por lo dem√°s, creo que es bastante entretenido y las pantallas de batalla suelen estar bien resueltas, al igual que la ambientaci√≥n y el apartado t√©cnico, aunque sin destacar frente a otros juegos similares.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991845568', 'num_games_owned': 2230, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 1249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1482936040}
review:
100% manure.
While first 2 chapters are fun, from 3 it goes down hill. Especially chapter 5, which is incredibly cheap and frustrating. The game explains itself poorly and people comparing it to xcom should play xcom first.
In this game hit chance % is actually not a real one, because the one that is displaying doesn't add dodge/parry/block to the equation, so the real hit chance is much lower in the end.

Graphics for a game from 2014 are meh, but fps droping to 35 on gtx980 show what an unoptimised mess it can be. If you want to actually check where it drops like that, go to arena and when there is a level with torches and what appeares to be rivers of oil, touch the torch, so half the map is on fire. If you will make them all fall, the fps will go down significantly. Music is unmemorable, characters are just there (with no real development) with really awful VO work. If you thought Bethesda was worst, check this game out on youtube. Completely stoned elf chick is horrendous.
Overall the game is incredibly buggy, from missing sound to other hilarious things.

The only pros for this game that I can think of are:
- cards, which you can sell
- if you really care about playtime, it can be from 20 to 50 hours.
- it is buggy. Why count it as a pros? Because there is a bug in the final fight when the game will beat itself, even if you lose, so you don't have to suffer this cheap and unfair fight anymore (with a trophy for completing and supposedly best ending!). At least I got it and I'm really happy.

2/10, stay away.

PS I will give you some awesome trivia and food for thought - only 7% of the owners actually beat the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996979104', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 3463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1318, 'last_played': 1483176508}
review:
First of all this game does not deserve the mixed reviews it has received.  I've been a fan of CRPGs since the days of Might and Magic.  Maybe it's the nostalgia of the Dark Eye ruleset that reminds me of games like Star Trail, which even with its flaws I love. I cannot understand some of the complaints I've heard here. I find the battle difficulty perfect. I know this may turn some people off, but I love it. I typically play all of my RPGs on the hardest settings. I play this on normal. There is an easy mode if you need. It's understandable. That said everytime I'm frustrated I put it down, come back to it later, and succeed.  I will say that I restarted once because given the difficulty I was unhappy with how I had planned out my characters. Let me also say that I am happy there was not a "respec" option.

Pros:
Feels like a classic CRPG
Superb characters and voice acting
Great truly tactical combat system
Suprisingly mature storyline and writing
Lengthy - some might see this as a flaw, I love it

Cons:
Limited character creation/customization options
Uninteresting and simple models/textures for armor/characters
A few bugs, some graphical, at least one gameplay

Note: For those complaining about the RNG, please remember that the mother of all RPGs D&D is a dice game. Get over it.

TLDR:
Great game worth the 4$ or whatever it is in the store right now. I would have bought it for much more. I can't wait to start the sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995688069', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 4232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3768, 'last_played': 1482480570}
review:
Fun game overall, pleasant enough to play - and quite longer than I originally expected - but didn't like it enough to throw myself onto the second installment. I might wait for it to be on sale. For the time invested, the ending felt rushed and not all that satisfactory, but overall game still gets the thumbs up. 

I remember when this initially came out awhile back that people were going on about the darkness of the anti-heroes, the crudeness of the dialogue, almost juvenile humor, etc. Maybe years of playing the Witcher games have heightened (or is that lowered) my tolerance bar, but nothing in Blackguards even raised my eyebrow. In fact, rather than being the EDGY ANTI-HEROES that seem be everywhere these days, it was kind of relaxing to find out that my party were just a bunch of losers, with a lazy, whiny main character, a dwarf who is possibly nuts and most certainly an arsonist, a philandering wizard, and that's just to start with. Rather than choices that are downright eeeeeevil, you mainly get the choice between being a cold-hearted pragmatist or a bit more charitable, which works great. Voice acting was quite good for the price and the type of games, and the graphics, well, they are what they are, I don't mind (honorable mention goes to the fire effects which may be the prettiest I've seen in ANY game at ANY price tag.)

I didn't find the combat to be as intense, strategic or engaging as Original Sin, but it was satisfying enough. The lauded interactive elements were for the most part useless when the surest, easiest strategy (on Normal, anyway) was to fall back, put my tanks in front of my glass cannons, hop the former up with all the buffs I could lay on, and let rip. But the game would fairly frequently throw a curve ball to shake things up; some fights have limited turns before you lose an optimal victory condition, others force you to move forward with ever-spawning enemies or poison gas. There was enough variety that it never got too repetitive or boring, though obviously some of the fights are going to feel annoying or unfair, or leave you way too open for the revenge of the RNG demon. 

Conclusion: I feel no rush to play this again, but I have no regrets buying it in the first place.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010811784', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 15776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10600, 'last_played': 1450398743}
review: Great tactical RPG.  The sequel is better in some ways, but they're both great, so I recommend you start here.  There are a few ugly little graphical issues here & there, but they're not common, so it's not a big deal.  I love the relatively low-magic fantasy setting & the fact that just casting a spell successfully, not to mention hitting the target, is genuinely difficult at first.  The ending is the weakest part, unfortunately.  One issue I have before that is the way the game handles damage types.  It seems a bit odd & nonsensical to me.  For instance, if you get an enchanted mace that does fire damage, (& don't expect to find any such wonders easily,) it does pure fire damage & no physical damage, & this is just one example.  Skeletons are completely immune to piercing damage, etc., etc.. Still a good game, though.  Battles are pretty difficult at times.  A lot of people seem to think this game is too hard, but I disagree.  I enjoy the challenge, & I hope you do too.

review: Ë¶ÅËØ¥Â§ßÁà±ÂæàÈöæ ËøûÂñúÊ¨¢ÈÉΩÁÆó‰∏ç‰∏ä Ëø∑‰∏ÄÊ†∑ÁöÑËßÜËßíÂíåÂª∫Ê®°ËøòÊúâÁéÑÂ≠¶ÂëΩ‰∏≠ÈöêË∫´Èº†Ê†á  ‰∏çËøáÊâìÊäò‰π∞ÁöÑÂæà‰æøÂÆúÂÜçÂä†‰∏äÊúâ‰∏≠ÊñáÂãâÂº∫ËÆ©ÊàëÁªô‰∏™‰∏≠ËØÑ  ÂèØÊÉúÊ≤°Êúâ‰ΩÜËøô‰∏™‰ª∑Ê†ºÁªôÂ∑ÆËØÑ‰∏çÂ•ΩÊÑèÊÄù Â∞±Áªô‰∏™Â•ΩËØÑÂêß  Âè™ËÉΩËØ¥ÂçÉ‰∏á‰∏çË¶Å‰π∞

author: {'steamid': '76561198278972391', 'num_games_owned': 471, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 4774, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4238, 'last_played': 1515453411}
review:
Es un juego que me ha gustado y que he disfrutado, aunque he de reconocer, que tendr√≠a problemas para alcanzar m√°s de un aprobado raspado en un an√°lisis serio. No obstante, creo que es un juego muy recomendable para los amantes de los SRPG.

Nada m√°s empezar, el juego nos da a elegir entre escoger un personaje entre tres ya definidos (mago, arquero o guerrero) o crearnos uno propio. Es mucho m√°s satisfactorio crearlo tu mismo. Para mi, la mejor opci√≥n y la m√°s divertida es crear un arquero/mago que use el arco para atacar y que pueda bostear y curar. De hecho en modo m√°s dif√≠cil, el arquero/mago simplifica mucho el juego y lo hace mucho m√°s llevadero. El ataque de arco "disparo triple" puede llegar a hacer unas cantidades de da√±o desproporcionadas y allana mucho el camino a la victoria.

La historia es entretenida y sirve para enlazar las batallas y sobre todo, de hilo conductor sobre el que mover a unos personajes que son uno de los puntos fuertes del juego. Todos ellos tienen fuertes personalidades y motivaciones y ambiciones que chocan con las de los otros compa√±eros de aventura, de forma que seg√∫n sean nuestras decisiones, se puede crear una atm√≥sfera tensa que s√≥lo espera una peque√±a chispa para estallar. Constantemente habr√° que tomar decisiones, las cuales afectar√°n de forma significativa en el juego. Por ejemplo, el enano intentar√° arreglarlo todo a la fuerza, pero si dejamos que el mago lleve la voz cantante, buscar√° conseguir el mismo fin mediante sobornos. El sistema de batalla es el t√≠pico de cualquier SRPG, pero con una peculiaridad: la interacci√≥n con el entorno. En todas las batallas hay elementos del mapa que nos pueden servir de ayuda en la consecuci√≥n de la victoria. Por ejemplo, las pozas en los pantanos pueden detener a los enemigos un n√∫mero determinado de turnos, o los barriles pueden bloquear el paso por determinadas zonas.

Gr√°ficamente cumple sin hacer ning√∫n alarde. Aunque lo que si se echa en falta, son cinem√°ticas. Hay pocas y muy breves y podr√≠an haber creado alguna m√°s que sirviera para apoyar la narraci√≥n.

Ahora bien, hay que reconocer que el juego tiene bastantes fallos, algunos importantes son:
-Por alg√∫n milagro de la estad√≠stica, es posible fallar ataques con un 100% de posibilidad de acierto.
-Unas pocas conversaciones est√°n en un perfecto "spanglish".
-Algunas frases no aparecen traducidas.
-En ocasiones es casi imposible seleccionar al personaje sobre el que va a recaer una acci√≥n y hay que hacer malabares con el rat√≥n para poder conseguirlo.
-Bugs con algunos logros.

Tambi√©n se puede hablar de otras cosas que se podr√≠an mejorar:
-Algunos logros no tienen ning√∫n sentido. Por ejemplo, un logro te pide hacer un personaje que tenga 10 puntos de talento en todos los tipos de armas y lo normal es que uses un √∫nico tipo de arma o a lo sumo dos, por lo que el logro te pide que tires los puntos en crear un personaje in√∫til.
-Las clases no est√°n bien balanceadas, siendo los arqueros mucho m√°s poderosos que el resto.
-El poder de los hechizos ofensivos y su porcentaje de acierto es muy bajo (lo han arreglado en Blackguard 2 y se agradece).
-No se pueden escoger las posiciones iniciales de los personajes y en ocasiones, jugando en dificultades altas, esto puede suponer que las probabilidades de perder un personaje en el turno uno sean alt√≠simas (tambi√©n lo han arreglado en Blackguards 2).
-Si bien lo m√°s importante es el camino, el final puede llegar a sentirse decepcionante e ins√≠pido.

review: Strateji oyunlarƒ±nƒ± √ßok seven biri olarak Xcom gibi bir oyun hayal ediyordum ama daha iyisini bulduƒüumu s√∂yleyebilirim ancak ≈üunu da belirtmem gerekir ki oyun herkese hitap etmiyor bu olaylar bakƒ±mƒ±ndan deƒüil de oyunun oynanƒ±≈ü mekaniƒüinden dolayƒ± √ß√ºnk√º oyun kolayda √ßok kolay normalde √ßok zor zor da ise oynamamanƒ±z i√ßin yapƒ±lmƒ±≈ü %95 ihtimalle bir atƒ±≈ü ka√ßƒ±rabilirsiniz yukarƒ±da (ya da a≈üaƒüƒ±da) bir yorum g√∂rm√º≈üt√ºm %100 ile isabetsiz bir vuru≈ü yapmƒ±≈ü o yorum oyunu alƒ±p almama arasƒ±nda beni bir bo≈üluƒüa d√º≈ü√ºrm√º≈üt√º olayƒ± ≈ü√∂yle a√ßƒ±klƒ±yayƒ±m her karakterin vuru≈ü g√ºc√º ve savu≈üturma g√ºc√º vardƒ±r eƒüer karakteriniz tabiri caizse eƒüer K√ñR ise arkasƒ± d√∂n√ºk bir adamƒ± %95 aim ile ƒ±skayalabilir eƒüer karakteriniz k√∂r deƒüilse bile karakterlerin "savu≈üturma" ve "diren√ß" yetenekleri y√ºz√ºnden vurduƒüunuz sayƒ±lmayabilir √∂rneƒüin yarattƒ±ƒüƒ±nƒ±z karakterinize a≈üina olmadƒ±ƒüƒ± bir silah √∂rneƒüin ok√ßu a√ßƒ±p elemana mƒ±zrak verirseniz silaha a≈üina olmadƒ±ƒüƒ± i√ßin sert vuramayacaktƒ±r ve zarar veri≈üi d√º≈üecektir hikayesi gayet g√ºzel √∂zellikle Nauarim sizi havanƒ±za sokucak tirden bir c√ºce eline baltayƒ± veriyorsunuz ve gerisini ona bƒ±rakƒ±yorsunuz tek ba≈üƒ±na 3 tane s√ºr√ºngen bacaklƒ± deniz ka√ßkƒ±nƒ± avladƒ±ƒüƒ±nƒ± bilirim sonu√ß olarak 59 liraya deƒüer mi bilmem ama indirimde 5.90'a kesinlikle deƒüer ha eƒüer √∂ƒürenirken hsinir krizi ge√ßirmeye razƒ±ysanƒ±z 59 liraya deƒüiceƒüini d√º≈ü√ºn√ºyorum

author: {'steamid': '76561197981945199', 'num_games_owned': 1379, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1482017932}
review:
I've been playing the game for around 4 hours at this point and I'll be honest...  I don't get the bad rep this game is getting...  The characters (so far) are well voiced, the story, although fairly generic, is decent enough and the combat system is decent.

I will admit, I bought the game as a part of this weekends sale, so got both Blackguards 1 & 2 along with a bunch of other games for about ¬£12.  I've been tempted by both of these for some time now, but was put off by the reviews and the price.  So far, I have found these to be unfounded.

I dove straight in on character creation rather than have the system do half the work for you and I am learning it as I go.  There's a lot to choose from so I just went with basics at least to start with.  It looks diverse enough to branch out later, which is always nice.

Sure, there is a large element of RNG, but look at XCOM...  That game has continually devastated its players by repeated 95%+ shots missing at the, single, most crucial shot of the game.  I can't count how many times in that I have missed that said shot and the mission suddenly went to hell.  This is no different, though I have yet to encounter anything so drastic, but it's still early days.

I can certainly see the game getting repetitive after a time, but there seems to be a lot more variation than XCOM in terms of attacks you can do, especially when you take in to account the spells.

I would say that this game is definitely recommended to fans of TBS games and also to those of strategic fantasy games.  I would also definitely say that this game 'should' be recommended.

To set 'not recommended' as others have because it's niche is just a tad overkill tbh.  If they aren't interested in a game just because it's a TBS or fantasy, then why are they looking at it in the first place?  It's a moot point.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011864330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 4228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3998, 'last_played': 1481329792}
review:
So having finally finished the game, time for a quick review. 

[b]Is it worth buying?[/b]

Eh, just about. It's regularly on sale for ¬£2 or ¬£3, and I got 70hrs out of it, so on that basis you'd be a whiny little bitch to complain. 

[b]Is it any good?[/b]

Eh, just about. It's a classic TBS affair. The storyline's OK, but gets kinda convoluted throughout the game so by the end, you've pretty much lost the plot and stopped caring. Something to do with a Whisper...? Anyway. 

One big plus is the characters and writing. They're generally a likeable bunch and have good banter between them, and often their conversations raise a chuckle.

Progress is extremely limited - you won't be working your way up through half a dozen better and better sets of gear as you progress: in fact, once you've got a complete set by around chapter 2, you can pretty much forget about upgrading any more. So if you're a loot junky and love waiting for the loot windows at the end of every fight to see what shiny new gear your heroes are getting, you'll be disappointed.

Having said that, if you simply enjoy the basics of TBS combat and love moving your guys around a hexboard and using your new skills/spells to smash zombies in the face, you'll enjoy yourself.

[b]Overall[/b]

It's not the best TBS out there, but it's not awful. The thrill fades throughout the game so towards the end finishing it off becomes as much a chore as a pleasure, but at 90% off there's no reason TBS fans shouldn't have it in their library.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031328124', 'num_games_owned': 279, 'num_reviews': 335, 'playtime_forever': 4605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4564, 'last_played': 1479770174}
review:
I really enjoyed it.. The difficulty can be ridiculous on certain enemies, and is extremely punishing if you screw up your builds.. Its very rng based, and people who hated the hit% crap from Xcom EU/EW will hate this as much.. I didnt have many technical issues, and I really enjoyed the game, and am looking forward to playing through part 2 when i get around to it.. 

I did have to turn the diff down to easy, as I was just unable to get through some fights (one in particular, which repeates later on, and is where i finally gave up) Irribar Illy or something.. Has tentacles, and wisps which can only be dmg via magic..  

Not only can melee attacks fail, but so do spell casts.. I dont mind misses when its a shitty chance to cast/hit, but when 90%+ chances miss consistently and consecutively, it just promotes save scumming to advance, and thats what i felt i had to do to progress..  Even on easy, as i said.. 

Later on, you feel much more powerful, but some other cheap feeling tactics are then thrown at you, often far out numbering the player.. 

Like I said, I enjoyed the game, but Ill be damned if i could figure out the difficulty, and Im no stranger to tactical games..

ZdarzajƒÖ siƒô te≈º b≈Çƒôdy w d≈∫wiƒôku, gdzie mƒôskie g≈Çosy sa podstawione pod kobietƒô i na odwr√≥t. W polskim t≈Çumaczeniu jest te≈º kilka liter√≥wek i pomy≈Çki w oznaczeniu p≈Çci. IrytujƒÖ r√≥wnie≈º czƒôste wczytywania map. Niby kr√≥tkie, ale ich intensywno≈õƒá jednak przera≈ºa≈Ça z poczƒÖtku. Potem jako≈õ siƒô przyzwyczai≈Çem. Grafika jest przeciƒôtna, choƒá w wypadku erpeg√≥w ma dla mnie znaczenie drugorzƒôdne o ile nie jest to jaka≈õ bijƒÖca po oczach pikseloza. Muzyka jest na bardzo przywoitym poziomie. 

Bardzo istotny jest wyb√≥r postaci jakƒÖ tworzymy na poczƒÖtku. Aby jak najmniej siƒô wkurzaƒá najlepszym wyborem jest czysty ≈Çucznik lub mag-≈Çucznik. Trzon towarzyszy to 2 wojownik√≥w i mag. Sam z poczƒÖtku stworzy≈Çem woja pod bronie dwurƒôczne, ale widzƒÖc, ≈ºe jednak brakuje mi kogo≈õ z broniƒÖ dystansowƒÖ zagra≈Çem od nowa, tym razem ze stworzonym ≈Çucznikiem, co potem okaza≈Ço siƒô strza≈Çem w dziesiƒÖtkƒô, bo odpowiednio rozwiniƒôty sia≈Ç niesamowite spustoszenie i jeden strza≈Ç r√≥wna≈Ç siƒô pewnym martwym przeciwnikiem.

Og√≥lnie bawi≈Çem siƒô bardzo dobrze przy Blackguards, choƒá drugi raz bym w niƒÖ nie zagra≈Ç, ale w drugƒÖ czƒô≈õƒá jak najbardziej. Polecam.

review: I can't begin to tell you how many times I've seen people say stuff like "Gee, I really wish I could recommend this game," and that's about how I feel about Blackguards. It's relatively interesting, there are some fun moments, etc., but overall it's just kinda lacking, especially in terms of giving the player a measure of freedom. I'd say just don't bother, it's certainly not worth $40, and I'd say it's only barely worth $5.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066188237', 'num_games_owned': 695, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 877, 'last_played': 1463001058}
review:
My main problem is the RNG. Restarting matches (and they are matches of your units VS -random units here-) because of critical RNG failure leading to either important people not dying or important people on my side getting suddenly fireballed. Having all your stuff yanked from you every-so-often makes me far less invested in "getting that cool thing" or even bothering to upgrade past basic equip or drops. 

I liked combat when it wasn't trying to screw me over. Mages are irritating and not fun to have on party unless they only do one magic spell for the most part.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006001346', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 804, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1588000440}
review: Ok I'm done. Got in to a decent start and I thought the game is alright. But then came the baroness rescue. Tried to bang my head against the impossible for several hours. Gave up. In terms of making a game challenging, it has to be executed in some different way than throwing you into an impossible situation which requires basically every dice roll to go on your favor in a maximum way. Otherwise, reload and against the same situation again, and again, and again, and again, and again, and again, and again, and again. Nuff said? Yeah. Killed all the fun for me. Luckily I got this game with a 90% discount and got a few hours of pretty decent fun. It's a terrible shame really, it would've been interesting to dwell deeper into the storyline. The characters seemed pretty interesting with their personalities. Oh well, now I'm off to uninstall this piece of garbage.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020543247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 532, 'last_played': 1479617101}
review:
The RNG factor in this game is major issue. I love turn-based/strategy/tactic- games but this game just takes all the fun out of the gameplay in fights. Even if you execute the fights as the game wants you to (clearly), you will get those 90%-95%  misses in row and that makes you using F9 or "try again" all time. It is frustrating/repetitive as hell and is sucking the all the excitement out of the game. I must say at this point im breaking apart and will most likely just delete this crap. 
If you want to test your "skills" (patience&nerves)  grab this game when -90%. If not, buy Xcom or some other real title instead of this **** .

author: {'steamid': '76561198046652573', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 10470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8293, 'last_played': 1532998710}
review: I am playing this for the second time. First time I played a mage and now I am playing a dual sword-wielding woman. There is definitely good replayability here. My old computer crashed a lot when playing this game, but it seems to be running fine on my new computer. I recommend a more modern machine when playing this game. Check the sys requirements. Wwhat can I say about it? Some of the battles can seem impossible. Save a lot. Not just a quick save, but named saves too. I like that many of the battles have to be repeated with new strategies. You will need heal spells, potions, poisons, nets, traps and some good strategy. Try to figure out how to get the overhead perspective to work because sometimes WASD camera control just won't do. I have a trackball mouse, so sometimes I can't see all the enemies or my PCs' positions. For regular mice, it should be the scroll-wheel to zoom all the way out. I like the spell effects. Complicated level up system with lots of points to spend from attributes (which cost the most so save for these) to special abilities (need to find a trainer) to weapon skills and spell strength. It's based on The Dark Eye, a German pen-and-pencil RPG that is more complicated, can you believe it, than D&D and very popular throughout Europe. Con: can be confusing how to finish some quests as they lack location markers and you will need to remember in which cities certain trainers are and the merchants that sell the equipment that you want. Overall, I find it more enjoyable than frustrating and it is a good turn-based tactical experience. Plus the voice acting is better than you'd expect. Pick it up on sale. Note: some poisons that are listed as lasting "whole battle" may not. Weapons with a magic bonus do not hurt magical creatures. When a wizard is wounded some spells will have very low chance of success, especially debuffing spells. Bandages often do not heal wounds even with high score in the healing talent, so visit a healer for wounds as needed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035011027', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1708185740}
review:
My impressions after first chapter, or 7 hours of gameplay.


I got this title, because I have quite liked "The Dark Eye" digital universe this far, Drakensang games having introduced me to it, and I think I like Demonicon better than the average game critic. I am generally a high-fantasy RPG fan, tending to like pauseable party based tactical combat evolved from Baldur's Gate the best.

In essence: I am not a natural fan of turn-based combat, and the biggest challenge to me on this first play-through is figuring out how to best invest my leveling points across attiributes, special abilities and skills etc.

However: I have liked the combat with Blackguards a lot this far, and have not found game-play frustrating, because the encounters are not that punishing after choosing the setting for players not familiar with Dark Eye rules at least. I've had both a few reloads, as well as feeling of particular successes when environmental effect or tactic has been just right!

What I like about these games is that the game-world feels like it has its own identity, and back-ground lore of belief systems, power structurs and faction relationships, owing to the original non-digital IP.

The gameplay design choices are in my view well prioritised, in view that the developer probably does not have a budget nowhere near the North American big gaming studios. Some choices are not so intutive to me, thou - I for example struggled a bit how to figure out how to get the world map after the intorductionary graveyeard quest!

I am personally pleased to have noticed this title, and have enjoyed my game a lot this far. I am curious to advance the story, and learning more about the game universe is also something that I personally enjoy with each Dark Eye title.

author: {'steamid': '76561198289072413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1466439081}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971190695', 'num_games_owned': 1377, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 1074, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1042, 'last_played': 1393956886}
review:
Known for old-school point & click adventure games such as Deponia and Edna & Harvey, German developer Daedalic took gamers by surprise when releasing Blackguards ‚Äì a tactical turn-based RPG based on The Dark Eye tabletop ruleset.

While the story sells itself as a dark narrative where you play as outlaws, it‚Äôs rather cliche and heroic. The Dark Eye ruleset is the true drawing point. While some rules where cut, such as most non-combat talents, it remains a solid and complex (if rather intimidating) classless system, offering ample freedom when creating your character. It‚Äôs a joy for hardcore players, but very poorly explained for newcomers. Sadly, the forced party members end up limiting some of your party building possibilities ‚Äì sometimes even forcing a restart.

Blackguards knows its limitations and uses some unconventional design choices to compensate them, betting everything on its battles ‚Äì cities are presented as simple animated backgrounds with stores and NPCs to talk with, exploration is limited to a 2D world map full of icons, dungeons are but a semi-linear sequence of battles without rest and the story is told via simple cutscenes, with an occasional decision to be made. This leads to an unique ‚ÄúWestern Final Fantasy Tactics‚Äù feel, and while the game first hours are very linear, it later opens up to a wide range of interesting side-quests.

Daedalic‚Äôs background as an adventure game developer is felt here in an unusual way. There are no random battles in Blackguards, meaning that every encounter happens in an unique arena specifically designed for it, often with unique challenges or tactical puzzles. There are traps, time limits, holes that spawn enemies, movable and destructible objects, healing orbs, falling chandeliers, mechanical blades, flying dragons, swamp gas, giant tentacles, mind-controlling plants, draw bridges, collapsing passageways, a giant cage on a crane, etc. 

There‚Äôs not a single RPG out there that offers so many interesting combat scenarios. This alone makes Blackguards a must-play for any tactical fan ‚Äì or RPG designer. 

Unfortunately, the game stretches out for far too long (40 to 60 hours), and the limited variety of enemies and equipment result in a rather stale second half of the game. Still, fans of Tactical RPGs will have a blast.

review: Als aktiver DSA Spieler kommt mir nat√ºrlich die Entscheidungsfreiheit zu nierig vor, aber dennoch ist die Story Klasse und es  wird auch einiges aus dem DSA Universum vermittelt. Als Taktik RPG Spieler bin ich aber von den K√§mpfen auf jeden Fall begeistert. Wieder mal ein Super Spiel aus dem Hause Daedelic, wovon ich bisher nur die wunderbaren Adventures gespielt habe :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198211394059', 'num_games_owned': 216, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 3999, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3959, 'last_played': 1477845066}
review:
Blackguards. 
Un nome una promessa.

E' un gioco che fa gridare al miracolo? No.
Per√≤ chi se ne frega !

E' un'ambientazione dove la cattiveria e la bastardaggine la fanno da padroni.
Nel role dei personaggi, con tutti i loro adorabili stereotipi.
Nelle scelte che ti permette di fare e le ricompense che ti da' se sei un gran fi**** di p****** la maggior parte delle volte.
Nel farti crescere dei compari e poi soffiarteli o metterteli addirittura contro: come suona tirar su l'arciere perfetto quando poi ti spara in faccia le sua frecce ?
Nel punirti se sbagli la tattica di gioco. E' difficile capirla? No. Tanto meglio cos√¨.

E' longevo, per quel che mi riguarda,. ci ho messo delle belle ore.
Si lascia giocare senza diventare noioso.
Secondo me merita se si √® ben convinti dell'acquisto.
Io lo ero: non mi ha deluso, per niente.

Da provare. Il due devo ancora provarlo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058768284', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1765, 'last_played': 1494981938}
review: I have just finished the second chapter and I find the game really fun, so the large number of negative reviews surprises me. Actually one of the few games I got hooked on lately. Well, on the other hand since the score was so low, my expectations were quite low as well, resulting in a nice surprise. It is less RPG than tactical combat game but it is very good at what it is doing. Frustration because of hits are not landing even when the indicated probability is high, comes probably from the fact the people do not develop skills properly. All in all, recommended, my score is 8/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040243171', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 3454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3393, 'last_played': 1477537370}
review:
Bad: 
The story ending feels very rushed and tagged on, compared to the plot development in the other chapters.
The  battles clearly have a "right" way. (I like this, it feels like puzzle solving, but that's a matter of taste).
Items, even basic items like arrows and health potions, are limited.
Very, very constrained in level-up points. The leveling up system is quite involved, and the constraint from the points is too tight. It feels like that there is one layer too many,,,
The animation is... special. Everyone has a dislocated jaw. 

The good:
Even though you can see the plot twist coming from a mile away, I still struggled to make the "right" decisions to try and get a "good"ending. (Once you play enough games, you begin to see the "right" choice.)
The game has a high F-U factor. Spent 20 hours and tons of money leveling up a character? Guess what, they're dead now, too bad. You think your arrows can break a crystal and you didn't think to equip your archer with a different weapon? Well, that's sucks for you.  

Overall: This game needed a little bit more time and polish. If it had that, it would have become a classic. In it's current format, I find it highly enjoyable but I can imagine if you don't play many old games this will test your patience.  

***IMPORTANT*** Given how limited level-up points are, for your first playthrough you should use one of the pre-created classes. I would advise not playing a mage, given that there is an entire fourth page of skills to level up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977070647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 3056, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3056, 'last_played': 1477525244}
review:
Not super great. Occasionally interesting gimmick combats, but the storytelling is really not memorable and the game is just not that well executed.
Once you figure out that speed buff level 3 + hammerblow is the way to go, most combats become trivial.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053624632', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4787, 'last_played': 1610894293}
review:
Das Spiel ist echt gut, aber auch knackig schwer. Ich kann es all denen sehr ans Herz legen, die gerne t√ºfteln und eher bed√§chtig vorgehen (Action-Fans sollten die Finger davon lassen). Die gewonnenen Erfahrungspunkte sollten wohl√ºberlegt ausgegeben werden, sonst ist bald der Punkt erreicht, an dem man viele K√§mpfe nicht mehr schafft und frustriert aufgibt. Ich habe selbst erst einmal f√ºr etliche Stunden drauf los gespielt, bis ich die Feinheiten alle verstanden habe. Dann habe ich erneut von vorne begonnen, einen Charakter ganz nach meinen Vorstellungen erstellt und siehe da, es hat geklappt. Und dabei Spa√ü gemacht, umso mehr, je weiter ich in der Geschichte vorangekommen bin. Ich bin froh, dass ich auch nach mehr als 80 Stunden immer noch nicht ganz durch bin, denn am Ende eines so tollen Spieles bin ich immer ein wenig traurig (weil es vorbei ist).

Die wichtigsten Vorteile:
- Das Spiel besitzt eine Story, die gut und spannend erz√§hlt wird. Viele Charaktere wachsen einem schnell ans Herz, bzw. auf einige Feinde bekommt man regelrecht einen Hass.
- Gute deutsche Sprecher, jede Stimme ist gut zu unterscheiden. Kurze, pr√§gnante Dialoge (kein blabla!).
- Einpr√§gsame, nicht nervige Musik.
- Jeder Kampf ist anders und findet auf verschieden gestalteten Territorien statt. Neben Nah- und Fernkampf kann man Fallen auslegen, Br√§nde entfachen, Barrikanen errichten, die Waffen vergiften, zaubern, Schatztruhen √∂ffnen, Hebel umlegen, Glocken l√§uten usw. usw. Des√∂fteren m√ºssen bestimmte Ziele innerhalb einer bestimmen Rundenanzahl erreicht werden. Nicht selten passieren w√§hrend des Kampfes unvorhersehbare Dinge: Der Feind erh√§lt Verst√§rkung, Br√ºcken brechen ein, Spinnen schl√ºpfen oder √§hnliches. Oft reiht sich auch ein zweiter oder gar dritter Kampf unmittelbar an, so dass man darauf achten muss, den ersten mit m√∂glichst wenig Schaden zu √ºberstehen.
- Man kann jederzeit und in freier Reihenfolge eine der vielen Nebenquests erf√ºllen, um Abenteuerpunkte zu sammeln und die Charaktere zu verbessern.
- Das Spiel l√§uft stabil, kurze Ladebildschirme, keine Bugs.

Ganz wenig Nachteile:
- Der Kampfbildschirm l√§sst sich nicht drehen und auch nicht nach oben/unten verschieben. Er l√§sst sich lediglich kippen. Manchmal muss man auf das Charakterportrait klicken, damit dieser wieder sichtbar wird, wenn er sich zu weit oben oder unten befindet.
- Wenn man Pech hat und der Gegner Gl√ºck, hilft oft nur, den Kampf erneut zu versuchen.
- Einige K√§mpfe sind ultraschwer (wenige habe ich auch nach 5-10 Versuchen noch nicht geschafft; ich bleibe aber dran!)

Fazit:
Ein forderndes Spiel, das wohltuend anders ist und in Sachen Qualit√§t den allgemein gut kritisierten Adventures von Daedalic in nichts nachsteht. Klare Kaufempfehlung f√ºr Spieler mit K√∂pfchen!

author: {'steamid': '76561197992229015', 'num_games_owned': 1175, 'num_reviews': 776, 'playtime_forever': 1541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1451, 'last_played': 1476912299}
review:
So, Blackguards, either loved or hated it seems.

I wouldn't go in either direction. To me this is a solid Combat RPG with a pretty decent story and excellent voice acting. The characters are a bit stereotypical, though. There's your hero, the crazed dwarf who sees dragons everywhere and the macho mage, as well as some other characters I won't spoil now, but their backstory and motivations aren't that much better. Still, they managed to make this into a more interesting story than Dragon Age: Inquisition...for a CRPG it's more than you need.

Be warned though, this is NOT a traditional RPG, you will NOT be exploring a huge world, you will NOT have hundreds of different dialogues and quests and choices. There is quite a bit of that but it's not the main focus. Quests are usually: go here and do that. And by go here I mean "click on the overworld map to move to one of the interactive points" or on the city screen. This is how you navigate the world of Blackguards, you click a POI on a map and your party moves there. This is either a city in which you can further navigate different parts of said city and speak to people, buy stuff, heal and rest. Anything else is mostly combat.

Combat and gear in general are pretty in depth. There are different types of weapons which all have advantages and disadvantages and must be learned to use. So your spear wielding barbarian is no good with a 2 handed sword for instance. To improve a certain aspect of a character you have to spend AP. You can spend AP for pretty much everything: ranged combat, specific weapons, magic resist, hit points, detecting traps, healing wounds, improving spells, movement points, etc. Like I said the system is pretty deep. Special weapons also have special attributes that you need to factor in. Maybe a weapon does less "attack damage", but has a +6 fire damage value, increasing it's effective damage again. You need to do the math in your head, though. There aren't too many unique weapons though so not that big of a deal. Of course there is also armor and set bonuses as well as magic you need to consider.

Once you're happy with your characters' equipment you can do battle. On the easiest difficulty most battles can be won at first try. On the harder difficulties, however, the game becomes rather difficult and potentially frustrating. And I think this is why the game has "so many" negative reviews. The combat can be unforgiving and you can't save during a battle. Battles also last forever. Do you like Heroes of Might and Magic? Yeah, like that in the late game. One battle can easily take up to 30 minutes, esp. on higher difficulties. There is of course also a random element in hit and crit chance. There is no 100% hit chance, only when an enemy is prone. And even then I needed to roll x, which I did, and still missed. I'd say that's a bug. Oh, apparently the chances are decided by dice and not actual percentages, so beware of false security. There's a handy battle log though.

Overall I feel that this is a pretty good product IF you are looking for this type of game. If you want Dragon Age or Baldur's Gate, don't bother. This is not that.

review: The game is bad. Level designer is (bad language) and should be prohibited from making any game or anything which include brain activity as he clearly doesn't have one. I'm not going to count all stupidity of the game here. In short: most times it's frustrating and unfriendly to control and as I said designs of some levels just terrible. Don't buy it even on sale as I did, you will waste your time playing it. Want to feel like you're playing this game? Grab bunch of dies and throw them few times, it's easy like this. So in the end it's not so much important how you develop your characters most of the times result of the battle will depend on dies. Once again: don't buy this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198041219230', 'num_games_owned': 230, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 903, 'last_played': 1477593440}
review:
The visuals of this game are in real stark contrast with the game mechanics. Everything looks very nice, but when it comes to the combat, skill system, rest periods and so forth, the game begins to feel like it was drafted twenty years ago.

It's just so inbalanced. The classes are not in balance. The attributes, skills, talents, weapon talents and special talents (I probably forgot something) are not in balance. The cost of items and services - compare for instance provisions, healing, bandages, potions and taverns - are not in balance.

The game is haphazard inside and outside of combat. You may begin a series of events only to notice that there is no way to return anymore. There are unforeseeable series of battles, and failing one may set you back an HOUR of progress. Failing even one spell might flip the situation completely. Putting all points in a single weapon talent can screw you up, because, well... find it out yourself.

But all this got me thinking. Are we too pampered with forgiving games? Perhaps. Here's a game that you can seriously break by playing it wrong (or right, in a good way!). Here's a game that requires putting those annoyingly flexible talent points into right places. So begrudgingly thumbs up for this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007486006', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 1899, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1899, 'last_played': 1474401861}
review:
A pleasant, unexpected surprise.

An old-style, turn-based, class-based RPG, that reminded me of my first RPGs (Pool of Radiance, anyone?). Sure, it is not perfect; the story is interesting, but lacks depth; the characters have personalities and stories, but you only scratch the surface; the classes are rudimentary and poor; the gameplay is slightly repetitive.
Nonetheless, it has a lot of potential, and I wholeheartedly recommend it, especially if we consider the price and the fact that it won't take you so long to finish it, so you shouldn't get bored before then!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993553287', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 781, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 763, 'last_played': 1467585372}
review:
I really want to like this game. It just feels off. Like the whole time I'm going up hill. None of the missions really ever seem fair. My spells never work. I miss all the time. Constantly feel like I don't have enough money. The character progression skill trees are overwhelming and confusing at best.

There are two missions that I tried over and over to beat, and absolutely can not beat them. I end up just taking the 'failure' option and feel bad about myself. Maybe I just suck at this game, but it feels like there is no way to really be good at it. I can't even 'grind' to level up my guys. It's just one disapointment after another.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103651772', 'num_games_owned': 314, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 5192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2240, 'last_played': 1474175238}
review:
I understand the negative reviews. The ruleset is complicated, and even more jarring perhaps to those used to D&D attributes and rules. That is why you should do as the game suggests and play on Normal difficulty and use the Basic (pre-made) character if it is your first time and unfamiliar to The Dark Eye. That's exactly what I did, and by the time I play a second time, I'll know enough of this convoluted system to choose a different class and choose my own stats.

It's a really fun strategy RPG, with an emphasis placed on usable objects on the battlefield, and unique battle maps. Every fight seems to have a "hook" to it. You will, however, spend hours looking at the manual, in-game tutorial and rules menu, and ultimately guides to explain what the hell is REALLY going on.

Talent modifiers to aid failed skill checks; Damage types as diverse and odd as Infantry, Piercing, Fire, Bashing and Magic (No, there is fire magic, it's just, well, the system is weird, OK); 3 separate attribute checks just to cast one spell; finally figuring out what the fuck Armor Rating and Encumbrance really mean. This is for all the true OGs of CRPGs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987316902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 686, 'last_played': 1473623556}
review:
The game locks up consistently.  Which means alot of restarts and lost time.

Regardless it's still boring.  Latest lock up came around the point I was feeling like it was all such a waste of time anyways.  Won't bother restarting again.  

RNG, I hate to complain about it...but...it's ridiculous in this case.  That's coming from someone who didn't mind it in Darkest Dungeon.

Linear.  With not much to do.  Imagine boring battle sequences with an even simpler point and click game in between.

Character progression.  Bleh.  The RNG has this covered to a point of non-consequential upgrades because a 10% chance to fail still means a 110% chance not to succeed.  Not always, just sometimes three times in a row... 

Clunky.  So clunky.  

Not alot of turn based combat games out there, which sucks.  But I'd give this one a solid pass if you're considering it.  It's just not worth the time.  I don't care how starved you think you are for that genre.

Bought this in a bundle for fairly cheap.  But even if it was free I'd still suggest a pass.  It's just so booooring.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971519880', 'num_games_owned': 565, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 2720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2626, 'last_played': 1472435671}
review:
First and foremost: this is NOT an RPG.  It's a party-based tactical combat game with RPG elements.  If you start with that understanding, you'll avoid the disappointment that many players have encountered.

The game is about figuring out how to beat a series of scenarios.  Sometimes it's about how you use abilities and items, sometimes it's about using the environment.

It's not a perfect game, but it's fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969512685', 'num_games_owned': 547, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1794, 'last_played': 1472400738}
review:
Ein SPiel welches Spa√ü machen kann, wenn man √ºber einige, teils extrem schere, technische Fehler hinweg sehen kann. Das Spiel startet mit dem aktuellen Betriebssystem nicht korrekt, bzw. wenn es mal doch startet so hat man nach dem Startvideo pl√∂tzlich ein schwarzes Bild.
Die L√∂sung, welche in diversen Foren kusiert, funktioniert nur zu 50%. Ich musste immer wieder, zwischen WinXP und Win7 wechseln, damit das Spiel dann doch lief.

Nun zum Spiel an sich. Grafik und Sound sind f√ºr die damalige Zeit ganz in Ordnung. Das Regelwerk basiert auf dem DSA mit einigen leichten Abschw√§chungen.
Die Story ist weder √ºberraschend noch wirklich spannend,die Charaktere blieben bei dem kompletten Spielerlebnis ehr blass und eint√∂nig.
Die Skillung ist, bis auf beim Hauptchar, teilweise bereits vorgegeben und eine Umskillung vom Magier hin zum K√§mpfer zwar m√∂glich aber nicht wirklich Sinnvoll.
Die einzigen wirklichen K√§mpfer k√∂nnen auch nicht zu Magiern gemacht werden, da sie die M√∂glichkeit schlicht nicht haben. Das Spiel erkl√§rt das mit der Herkunft der beiden Chars.

[u]Fazit[/u]
Das Spiel selbst hat, bis auf diese paar Sachen und einige Abst√ºrze (welche zum Gl√ºck erst dann auftraten nachdem das Spiel gespeichert hatte) viel Spa√ü gemacht und teilweise waren die Rundenk√§mpfe sehr fordernd.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028707432', 'num_games_owned': 155, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1470144058}
review:
Lost patience very early. The tactical aspect of the fights is extremely poor, just few possibilities to individualize characters and all in all little scope of action. Hearing some generic fantasy story, have a boring fight, buy items, repeat. It's like a really unexperienced dev team tried to create their first TBS. Can't recommend. Buy Divinity: Original Sin instead; this is worth your money.

Oh, and the mages suck. Failing their casting check all the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014313110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 2851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 837, 'last_played': 1497152389}
review:
6/10

PROS:
- Great soundtrack
-Combat has a puzlzish feeling
- Story is not great, but is cativating enough
- Graphics and style are neat.

CONS:
- The puzzlish combat I've mentioned made me repeat several beattles over and over
- General interface feels a little awkward.
- Character development takes some time to get used to. Should have the option to redistribute the points somehow.
- Quite straightfowrad and linear, sidequests don't feel like add much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016977238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1088, 'last_played': 1474202871}
review:
This game was part of a bundle I bought 1 year ago - together with Memoria and Dark eye: Chains of Satinav. I did not install it at the time because the looks of the game did not appeal to me at first. I even thought back then that this was a strategy game (its actually a turn based RPG :P) 

One month ago, I decided to install the game in order to get the steam cards. Based on the reviews I was expecting a pretty aweful game. Nevertheless, I decided to play for an hour instead of idling.

The first screen I encountered was the character creation. I was pleasantly suprised by the depth and variety of choices and I found myself tinkering at the various options and builds for an hour!

Well, after an hour, I thought that the options did not really matter because I wasnt going to play the game given how bad it must be according to the reviews I had read. However, I was still waiting for those cards so I decided to have a look at the actual game. 

Again, to my suprise, although it started slowly, the game captured my interest. Slowly, but steadily, I started enjoying the story and the battles gameplay. That was it, after some time I was hooked!

Here is what I think of the game:

+Give the game some time at the beginning. It starts slowly but it steadily builds a strong story! Same goes for the gameplay. It looks a bit strange at first but I grew to like it very much! 
+The Graphs are really good. 
+Full sound + Voice + Subtitles 
+Dialogue options
+Decisions matter
+Challenging game
+Character creation system. There is no level up system - Using adventure points to create unique ways of fighting. 
+Story twists. 
+I havent encountered any in game bugs. 

-Some may find the game TOO challenging. Its not a forgiving game. You have to think the consequences of your gameplay. 
-Linear. Most of the times there is only one battle available. 
-THE MOST IMPORTANT PROBLEM AT THE MOMENT IS THAT THE GAME SEEMS TO HAVE SOME PROBLEM RUNNING IN WINDOWS 10. However, this issue can be solved with a little bit of tinkering. There are numerous solutions out there. 

To sum up, I fully recommend this game at a discount and even at full price if you enjoy turn based RPGS. I dont understand whats going on with other reviews. Perhaps people were expecting a different kind of game? However, keep in mind that the game has some compatibility issues with Win 10. 

I've already bought Blackguards 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030679370', 'num_games_owned': 308, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1588111252}
review: Here is the deal with Blackguards.  If you liked the drakensang games, or the Blade of destiny remake, you will like this game.  I happen to like TDE games, and so i recommend to you if you are into that.  It doesnt have the free roaming of eather, but it has a less painful version of the Blade of destiny(remakes) combat. An interesting easter egg in the english naration are black library narrators (wh40k audiobooks) like toby longworth, and someone else that i dont recognize by name but by voice.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971569035', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 360, 'playtime_forever': 2492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2008, 'last_played': 1469488681}
review:
Se non conoscete il sistema di regole del gioco lasciate perdere o trovate i manuali del gioco cartaceo e leggeteveli. Il gioco non spiega nulla su come funzionino le dinamiche delle stats nelle azioni di gioco quindi o vi documentate o sbaglierete a creare\sviluppare gli eroi e prima o poi arriverete a un fight che non potete vincere e non potrete andare avanti. Stessa cosa per coperture, range ecc... Questa √® la premessa.

Il gioco √® assurdamente complicato, l'rng √® il 99.9% di ogni fight e a meno che non abbiate minmaxato i vostri personaggi sarete costretti a ripetere decine di volte il fight perch√® un tiro di dadi semplicemente √® andato male. Non c'√® nemmeno possibilit√† di annullare un azione o salvare durante i fight quindi anche un missclick vi pu√≤ rovinare tutto costringendovi a ricominciare. La magia (cure e danni) sono rng anch'esse e le stats del personaggio influenzano pochissimo la % in vostro favore. Se non credete alle mie parole c'√® un mio screenshot dove una magia al 100% di riuscita √® fallita.

Il gioco non √® un RPG, manca la componente RP dato che a parte una customizzazione del vostro personaggio il gioco √® statico, segue una linea e non ci sono decisioni che influenzano minimamente qualcosa. Inoltre gli altri personaggi del party possono essere sviluppati seguendo solo PRECISI sviluppi, andate da altre parti e vi ritroverete dei personaggi inutili.

Molte volte vi ritroverete a fare 4-5 incontri di fila dove non potrete riposare nel mentre. Il gioco ve lo fa capire in certi modi almeno.

Alcuni "boss" delle sidequest non possono essere fatti a meno che non abbiate il party configurato in un certo modo. A meno che non vogliate ripetere l'incontro all'infinito finch√® i dadi non vi grazino con eccezionale fortuna. es. (se ci arrivate) la lily al capitolo 3 non pu√≤ essere fatta a meno che non siate tutti arcieri (praticamente immune alla magia, i melee vengono esplosi prima di arrivargli addosso, un personaggio non √® utilizzabile).

Gli incantesimi che userete in gioco utili sono 3 circa. Gli altri sono inutili. I debuff sono inutili, qualsiasi caster che abbiate sottomano trattatelo come danni + danni + danni + danni. O healing. Per far entrare un debuff il gioco compie 3 tiri percentuale e i vantaggi sono praticamente minimi.

I talenti servono poco o nulla se non a conoscere quanti hp ha il nemico o quanta iniziativa ha. I talenti per le armi sarete costretti a prenderne alcuni inutili per sbloccare delle capacit√† speciali MANDATORIE per i vostri personaggi.

La trama √® interessante ma non approfondisce bene i personaggi rendendo l'idea che sia stato fatto molto di corsa.

Giudizio? Non ne vale la pena, il gioco √® frustrante e vi fa capire quasi a ogni fight che le vostre strategie o come avete sviluppato i pg conta poco o nulla contro a tiri fortunati o sfortunati. Il livello di frustrazione √® vicino a quello di dark souls + xcom a una difficolt√† elevata.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137464519', 'num_games_owned': 32, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 842, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1469192302}

Far too much story telling and poor game play. Would not recommend this if they were giving it away.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056445690', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1468398263}
review:
I can't have more than an hour into this game, and it's already crashed twice on loading screens. I force-quit it on the third non-tutorial level.

I'm a big fan of daedalic, and I champion myself as being well versed in every turn based RPG of this nature. But this feels like it was never play-tested. It genuinely feels like no one sat down and played it, as a game, and said "okay, these elements work mechanically, but from a game-perspective, they dont." Every single time you miss a hit, and your enemy never misses at all, and you sit there for a dozen turns soaking up damage for what feels like--no strategic reason, you realise, "Oh great, this is one of those games where I need to return to town every fucking time I finish a level, to heal up"

Why? Why not just heal back to full between missions? What purpose does returning to the inn after every mission serve as an improvement to the pacing of the game? If you take a bow for your caster (I mean, that makes sense right, you've read the reviews, you know you're gonna run out of mana and you're a ranged character) and you switch to it, and "Oh, I'm pointblank range with this monster. Hit chance 25% 4dmg" monster has 20 hp. Wtf. So statistically it should take me 20 fucking turns to kill this? I'm not talking about this being late game and you made a series of bad choices. This is the first mission that doesn't hand-hold you through a required tutorial.

Turns out, yes. It's going to take you twenty fucking turns to do anything, while trying to negotiate the ridiculous gimmick (plug those lice holes! Pull those levers!) no. I was done. The game is not balanced in any satisfying way. It's not "challenging". At best, it just challenges your patience to see how many times you can watch your ridiculously weak spell miss for the 20th time, before you realise there's absolutely no pay-off. I understand miss and dodge mechanics. But when your game is structured around you missing more than 50% of the time... there's no fun in that. No one is sitting at home playing this game thinking "Oh oh oh, I missed! What fun! That's 3 in the row!"

author: {'steamid': '76561198109670840', 'num_games_owned': 885, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 1499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1439, 'last_played': 1467586377}
review:
Shiny but overall bland.
Most missions feel like puzzles and not a turn based strategy game.
Very unbalanced - you can breeze through a bunch of missions but then simply get beaten and beaten and beaten in others just because you didn't level up the right "talent" - oh and I hope you have a old save game in that case otherwise good luck.

Overall: unless it is a really good bargin AND you don't have anything else TBS to play...don't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128728891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7325, 'last_played': 1547786416}

author: {'steamid': '76561198033699915', 'num_games_owned': 364, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 4658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3221, 'last_played': 1467070178}
review:
For an overview - this is a neat rpg game. I enjoyed it but i have to admit it has some flaws.

The Good:
- A good storyline
- Plenty of side quests
- Interesting npcs
- All nicely voiced
- Not bad graphics
- Towns look especially well
- A lot of options on character development

The Bad:
- the rng can get annoying, especially early in the game
- no way to reset your skills, which can be a problem
- loading screens every time you change locations
- several achievements are still broken

Overall i think if you enjoy rpg games, you might enjoy this one as well. Especially if you buy it on sale and you go into the game aware of its flaws.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001148097', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 652, 'last_played': 1469718729}
review:
Because of the review I was in doubt. I bought on sale the package, and I just tried Blackguards 1 for now. I played 5 hours in a row, it was hard but i never failed and I have been moving forward in the storyline. My first character was built to be a 2handed sword monster (blademaster style) but I have yet to find a two handed sword, which is a shame. I have tested a lot of turn-based game and this game suits what I like, it is similar to "Expedition Conquistador." 
I recommend this game for turn-based game fans!

author: {'steamid': '76561198121718704', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 2431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1471498477}
review: Blackguards is one of the best games i have played in this style. Its characters are superb, and in depth combat system that is also quite simple if you dont look into it that far, it has great scenery and graphics, and to top it all off it has a great lore and map. The whole amnesia thing doesn't annoy you as much as it does in many other games because you get to play through most of it learning as you go along just enough that it drip feeds your imagination of what will come next.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047955394', 'num_games_owned': 1281, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 3262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3262, 'last_played': 1466484001}
review: This game has kept me interested for hours and hours of play.  The different scenarios forcing you to use different stragies, defeating you over and over, then finding a different strategy to kick it in the dirt is so satisfying.  The game allows you to build characters in any which way, whether you wanna shoot at the baddies from afar with bows and crossbows, or be a complete juggernaut and get your hands dirty with beefy armor and an axe.  Some features might cause the game to be a little too easy after a while, such as massive gold accumulation making cheap healing outside of combat very convenient.  Even so, this game is a great one to check out and play around with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025834652', 'num_games_owned': 1121, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2175, 'last_played': 1466225513}
review:
Blackguards is not a very good game. It's a great example of turn-based strategy gone horribly wrong and just because something uses hexagons doesn't make it inherently worthwhile.
Blackguards is cheaply made. That much becomes apparent as soon as the voice acting starts torturing your speakers. The voice actor for the male main character is weirdly familiar from other budget titles. He's not trying very hard and neither is anyone else. The graphics are also fairly poor. I didn't expect much but it looks incredibly cheap and one has to suspect it was meant to be a tablet title originally. The art direction is also incredibly generic. This game makes Dragon Age look like Zeno Clash.

Most of the game is really just battles. Towns, numerous as they are, serve to buy gear and heal up and not much more. There are side quests but they almost always result in even more combat. You would think a game that contains this much fighting would have deep mechanics but no. There is not even flanking or backstabbing. Most of the weapon abilities make you hit harder or pierce armor in exchange for accuracy and that's basically it for physical attackers. Abilities that can hit multiple enemies are only available very late and they are not great. There is a knockdown but it virtually never works and most elite enemies are outright immune to it. The game is terrible with double standards like this.

Mages have a bit more to do but the spells are horribly imbalanced, ranging from absolutely useless to pretty much necessary to beat the game. You can't even make a proper offensive mage because spells do poor damage and are not very mana-efficient. There's virtually no way to restore mana outside of the very poor regeneration between turns. Potions do exist but they are insanely expensive. They're something you use in a boss fight and not something you can waste in a regular encounter. To make things worse, spells are also line of sight dependent. That means if you surround an enemy with your melee fighters, you can't hit them and if one of your characters gets surrounded you can't heal them. Want to throw a fireball into a cluster of enemies? You can't because you have no line of sight to the center so you can never really hit the whole group. It's as annoying as it sounds. Level 4 spells on the other are insane. They can hit every single enemy or ally on the entire map, no matter how far away they are. Sadly, later on enemies use the same spells against you and it's awful because you can't do anything about it.

The game's biggest downfall are the gimmick maps. This is hard to explain. Basically, half the encounters are built some sort of gimmick except... the game doesn't explain these gimmicks to you or warns you that there even might be a gimmick instead of a regular skirmish. The most blatant example is when you plunder a crypt and you get attacked by a gang of skeletons (you never hear about skeleton gang violence in the media, typical) and every time you destroy one, it gets resurrected by some crystal. Fair enough, you have the skeletons distracted by some of your fighters and have another one sneak around and attack the crystal. You attack it with your spear and...it does no damage. The crystal is immune to thrust damage. There is no feedback to it, you can't figure it out on your own through the environment. Well, that would have been nice to know, I thought to myself. Most of the time the best way to beat is a map is to figure out the gimmick and immediately reload the fight in order to actually use it to its full effect. Everything else is an uphill battle.

So yeah, it's not a very good game. It's full of baffling design decisions and even the things outside of combat are not good. I could write for hours about the awful, incoherent story but it's not worth the effort.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085574601', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4009, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4007, 'last_played': 1504057294}
review:
The game was quite interesting, a little fun. Though I found it quite short. For this reason, I suggest do not purchase it unless at a very good discount. These are the sort of games that you play once, and the story is done. Not much replay value, aside from nostalgia down the road. Honestly, who cares about acheivements anyway?

I went ahead and did the side missions, which still did not leave that much to do when all was said and done.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979827095', 'num_games_owned': 2042, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 3387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2153, 'last_played': 1616547807}
review: This is a good game.  It's refreshing that it doesn't coddle the players advancement and that there are consequences to choices and actions.  Definitely not for 'casual' players, and not a sandbox style open world, it still is a fantastic RPG that I find challenging and rewarding.  I plan to also play Blackguards 2 eventually, so I would  strongly recommend it to  RPG fans.  The graphics in the battles are pretty cool, the story is strong, and the acting/voice is nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052274912', 'num_games_owned': 697, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1488650404}
review:
Difficult to rate this game. I really really really wanted to like it. It seems like it has so much potential. But so far I have been unable to complete a play through without boredom or extreme crashes. I still plan to play the second game‚Ä¶ I just gave up trying to finish this one before I do.
 
Pros 
-	Thorough character creation
-	Fun/beautiful environment and settings
-	Interesting characters

Cons
-	Complex (and at times confusing) character skill selections
-	Continuous failing high percentages ( 98% ) attacks often makes strategies pointless
-	Many technical issues (crashes) makes it difficult to complete game

author: {'steamid': '76561198036494887', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 1998, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1812, 'last_played': 1705899780}
review:
Edit: So, the problem below was fixed, I didnt change anything, just my windows version, its 10 now, and i could finnaly get past the fight that was freezing in chapter 4, so i[m changing it to positive and will talk a little bit about the game.
First I want to say that the review was negative because i was really sad I couldnt finish the game, that is to say I was loving it, now I intend to finish. 
The game is great, really good Character Creation, thats the main feature for me, really complex at first, so read a guide, but it only means they didnt dumb it down to appeal to the general public, hence the mixed reviews. but once you understand it and get used to it it is clear what a work of art it is, the people who created it are master RPG designer and i would love to see a table top RPG system created by them.
I even feel bad for leaving a bad review for so long, sorry about that devs. And keep up the good work. I even bought their complete collection even though i already had this game, so it was not optimal, but some great games there too. i didnt have time to try the second BG yet but i hope its as good as this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113977353', 'num_games_owned': 447, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3505, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2861, 'last_played': 1464739523}
review:
I got this game in a bundle and was just curious to try it, so I first cheked the store page to see if there were good reviews. There weren\'t, and people was talking about it as too hard.
I agree, the character sheet is very complex and you end up wasting a lot of experience points, but it\'s not too bad.
I really enjoyed the story and I find that the voice acting is superb, there\'s a point in the game where you have more than 10 side quests and you really want to go on, but then there\'s a slow down and it gets quite heavy in the end. I don\'t think it\'s too hard, but I don\'t recommend playing this game at max difficulty, it\'s balanced enough at normal.
Overall it was a fun game, far from perfection but still enjoyable, I definitely won\'t play it a second time, but I will play Blackguards 2, which is said to be even better polished. Hope you found my review useful!

author: {'steamid': '76561197996426001', 'num_games_owned': 621, 'num_reviews': 327, 'playtime_forever': 2526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2526, 'last_played': 1464528385}
review:
When I started to play the game I was surprised that it have so many negative reviews, it looked like a very good game at the beginning, but then its flaws bacame evident.

pros: 
-good storyline
-interesting side quests
-huge freedom on character development
-decent graphic
-interesting combat system
-interesting magic/abilities

cons:
-freedom on character development can turn against you later in the game. there's no clue on which way you should get skills and abilities and you can come across certains fights where you absolutely need a certain skill to win or it will take a lot of luck. this is quite frustrating. expecially if you don't have a savegame old enought to learn the ability you need.
-inventory items are uninteresting: you only get good stuff from a few side quest in the entire game, merchants around the world only sell cheap/bad stuff. also I think the weight of the stuff (especially supplies) is unbalanced.
-major and minor bugs could prevent you from completing some side-quests
-unnecessary loading times


in the end I can recomend this game only if you are a turn based rpg enthusiast.
