author: {'steamid': '76561198080335466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3923, 'last_played': 1452450082}
review:
In brief: fairly linear hex-map RPG with good character system and decent storyline. You'll enjoy it if you like that sort of thing.

Blackguards is an old-school gaming experience dressed in modern threads, a pen-and-paper RPG brought to life on the PC. The graphics are appealing, animations smooth, sound effects satisfying and voice acting mostly good. You take the role of an assistant to a noble family who gets into trouble at the outset and goes on the run, and your attempts to unravel what's happened ultimately take on a global significance. The story, chiefly told in cutscenes whose animation is best described as economical, follows a fairly linear path, but a wealth of subplots and sidetracks provides a pleasant illusion of free movement which probably won't convince today's open-world gamers.

Your character is provided with several sidekicks and you marshall and move your party on the world map. Movement is essentially the selection of locations and passage of time is not tracked. In towns and similar locations you'll find traders, trainers, inns, healers, and the like, as well as NPCs who advance the plot and give you quests. Party management is done through the stat sheet and inventory of each character, and true to the RPG that gave birth to this game, the system is satisfyingly deep and complex. Your decisions about character development will win or lose you the game, and new players should take note: it is possible to build a character badly and it's very difficult to undo this once you've done it, so take the time to read the manual and the in-game character creation notes (which don't appear in the manual and are very useful).

Quests and plot advancement almost always involve a skirmish, and it's these hex-map clashes where you'll spend most of your game hours. It's clear that a lot of thought has gone into skirmish map design: in some cases it's a straight fight to the death, but often there are environmental factors to deal with and in some cases the map is a puzzle which you must solve to win. In fact you can think of every skirmish as a puzzle which must be solved, as enemies differ in their capacities and susceptibilities and you must apply the right tools in terms of weapons, spells and equipment to prevail. That said, the game depends ultimately on the roll of the dice, so luck is always a factor. Fortunately death isn't permanent and so long as you have the last man standing, you'll walk away with your party intact.

Some reviewers have complained of the game's excessive difficulty. At the time of writing this review I've completed the game on Normal difficulty and have clocked up over 80 hours of play. I think I saw every skirmish there was to see, well over a hundred in total, and more than half of those I completed first time. There were only a handful I had to attempt more than twice. The final battle is difficult, but so it should be ‚Äì my only gripe is that the plotting, or perhaps the scriptwriting, feels a bit wrong at the end, but YMMV. If you find yourself stymied by a skirmish, see whether you can go elsewhere to level your party up a bit; if not, it's very likely that you're either missing something important in the skirmish (always check the interactive objects) or you've taken a serious misstep in character building. Be careful not to spread XPs too thin on your characters: you can't take all spells and weapons to the maximum in the course of the game, and you do need some top-level skills and spells by the end if not by the middle.

Two things bothered me about this game: loading times, and the ending. My system isn't top-of-the-line but neither is this game, and I saw far too much of the loading screens for my liking (Mengbilla in particular tried my patience quite a bit). The ending... without spoiling things, I was surprised to see essentially the same cutscene after winning the final battle that I'd seen when I lost it. I'm unsure if your choice in dialogues makes any real difference to the way the game pans out, and online chatter suggests that a lot of players were left confused by the denouement. I can't honestly recommend that anyone other than a genre purist buy this game at full price, but if you see it on sale grab it and give it a try, and be sure to get to the top of the bow skill tree as early as possible!

author: {'steamid': '76561198044169026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2602, 'last_played': 1389841516}
review:
I wanted to like this game. I was really, really optimistic. And, if I'm fair, I probably have myself to blame for believing the game description and getting my hopes up. But no, I ended up loathing the game to such an extent that when the last chapter of the story was released I didn't even WANT to find out how the story ended.

My main problems are with the story and the combat, which considering how the game bills itself is unforgivable. Both are shallow, boring and slow, which is in no way helped by a quest system and map that seem to conspire to drag things out even more.

I will say that the game could be challenging in interesting ways at times. 

Honestly, if I could refund this game I would do it in a heartbeat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065898339', 'num_games_owned': 229, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 5890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5890, 'last_played': 1452257633}
review:
Too complex and not very entertaining.
Pros: a dense story with very cool characters and a very well built enviroment
Cons: game system is just too complex and takes research and dedication to realy understand it. Battles lack rythm causing them to become boring after some time, and some of them can take a really long time.
Conclusion: it's a beautiful game but it just doesn't serve it's purpose. tottaly do not reccoment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055725979', 'num_games_owned': 1326, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 8784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4273, 'last_played': 1521440012}
review:
Este juego se supone, al igual que muchos otros como Pillars of Eternity, que primero se tienen que estudiar unas reglas hasta comprender el juego y descubrir por donde meterle mano para que nos haga sentir seguros. Yo creo que la seguridad equivale a rol desde un modo ''afectivo''.

Esta recomendaci√≥n est√° dedicada a los roleros y no a los ''para vosotros jugadores xd'', sin embargo parece ser que se tiene que indicar alg√∫n tipo de aviso para los jugadores excursionistas. Las quejas no valen, los combates se pueden repetir todas las veces que queramos. Si no se tiene paciencia para repetir y estudiar los combates uno a uno o para aprender desde cero un sistema de reglas y llevarlo a la pr√°ctica poco a poco a favor de la estrategia y todo esto con muchos conceptos nuevos y de muchas formas no se recomienda.

Asumimos el control total o global de un grupo en todos los aspectos y factores de la jugabilidad que el juego propiamente ofrece y que a su vez no va a servir para tener una base y un gui√≥n s√≥lido, para dar forma a toda una historia con muchas tramas, misiones secundarias y libertad en muchos momentos en forma de visitas por los pueblos.

El juego mezcla momentos de libertad con otros en que nos quedamos sin provisiones, por ejemplo flechas de fuego, para acabar todos los combates, tenemos que, por lo menos, estar siempre al tanto de todas estas cosas realistas como buenas decisiones roleras.

Su ambientaci√≥n es de los tiempos de Roma: ropas y armaduras, armas... con toque fant√°stico: magos, druidas, criaturas gigantes...Y un toque Europeo y de Oriente en general: piratas, gladiadores, sables, cocodrilos...

El realismo y detalle imperan sobre la jugabilidad y la parte t√©cnica, sin embargo y entre unas cosas y otras el equilibrio y la jugabilidad parecen no estar afectadas aunque pueda dar la impresi√≥n de que si.

No es que merezca una oportunidad, es obligatiro jugar a esta maravilla, m√°s all√° de cualquier cosa que no nos guste o aprobemos. Esto es un tipo muy importante de rol y de aqu√≠ salen las grandes ideas.

El fuerte est√° en sus combates y es asombroso ver como estos llegan hasta el l√≠mite con los dos bandos rebentandos, momentos tremendos que, a veces, s√≥lo se ven en grandes juegos de estrategia como Starcraft. 

Para colmo goza de una dualidad equilibrada entre ataque y defensas en relacci√≥n a todo: nuestro grupo, enemigos, campo de batalla... Es un equilibrio salvaje entre decidir quienes o como se va a defender o atacar, que no sabr√≠a muy bien como explicarlo brevemente.

Cantidad de ideas y conceptos fundidos todos bajo la regla y el equilibrio y la personalidad: producto alem√°n.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960806746', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1446933489}
review:
It took me about three hours to be sure that I hate this game, and wouldn't want to play it even if I was getting paid for it.
Which was, of course, too late for a refund.

But at least I learned a valuable lesson - ask yourself "Is this actually any fun?" before hitting the two-hour mark.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026561656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1451665235}
review: Beginning intro quests are long and boring. There are many problems with Hex movements, as in, you believe you are close enough to interact or cast a spell, but something is still preventing it. At one point neither of my mages could cast any spells against the mobs, and there was nothing indicating why. That's when I hung it up, only made it about 90 minutes into the game. It has a lot of potential, but falls short in my opinion

author: {'steamid': '76561198019022165', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1451429599}
review:
Wow, i thought it was 1993 and i was playing an old 'Pool of radiance' forgotten realm game! It wasn't that great in 1993 imagine in 2015! 

The game promise strategy, but everything is badly designed. Interface ain't great either. It looks like you have a lot of choices, but ranged bow is just so far better than anything else it's not funny. Even spell that cost you mana regularly fail and are WEAKER than a bow that cost you nothing but cheap arrows and is ranged! Ha!

If you like hardcore dungeons and dragons and are a masochist, then this game i right up your alley! Graphics are bad, the maps are too small, all the ennemy feels the same. It's not a great game and i do not recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198235240888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1857, 'last_played': 1451619542}
review:
Pros:

The Blackguards storyline is quite enjoyable. I really like the different characters being voiced by different actors (though I'm sure some NPC's have doubled-up).

 I'm glad that players have the option of "creating" their character's base stats.


Cons:

 I'm playing on a 2-year-old  Mac and the game crashes frequently. I restart the game, restart the Steam client -- even restart my computer -- and it's still frequently crashing.

 When I'm in the game, occasionally the screen changes colours / views. For example, I'll see lines across the screen (not just the hexes) and sometimes the screen is entirely composed of solid colours. Another time I was playing the game and all the arrows / NPC conversation icons disappeared. 


Final Thoughts:

 Maybe these troubles are just due to playing the game on a Mac. If you can pick the game up on sale ($5 or less), then it's worth giving a try. I don't recommend paying full price for what can be a buggy experience.

review:
Liebe Spieler,

dem Kauf ging die faszination des Rundenbasierten Tabletop voraus.
Wer dies schon kennt, wei√ü auch in etwa, um das dahinterliegende Regelwerk. Leider wird dies in diesem Spiel nur mangelhaft mitgeteilt. Wer Vorkentnisse hat, kann dies umgehen.

Die Story sollte zwar geschmacksache sein, ist mir selber aber zu zusammengew√ºrfelt. Ein Diung zwischen Mittelalter, Elfen und Orgs und eine Mischung aus Psychokram.

Weit aus entscheidener sind die Grafikfehler. Das Spiel k√∂nnte eine gute Beta sein, niemals aber ein Verkaufsprodukt. Ich selber kann es nicht mals zuende spielen, da es an einer Stelle keinen Spielverlauf frei gibt und bugt.

Unterm Strich ein netter Versuch mal ein eigenes Spiel zu kreieren. Es sollte nicht gekauft werden.

Blackguards ist ein Genremix aus Rollenspiel und Rundenstrategie, das zusammen mit der verwendeten Das Schwarze Auge-Lizenz eine interessante Mischung ergibt, die ich in dieser Form bislang noch nicht gespielt habe und vielleicht gerade deshalb zu fesseln wei√ü.

Entwickelt wurde das Spiel von Daedalic, die mit der DSA-Lizenz ja bereits einschl√§gige (Adventure-)Erfahrungen sammeln konnten und auch sonst f√ºr (Spiele-)Qualit√§t aus deutschen Landen stehen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987130775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 1551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1253, 'last_played': 1450659273}
review:
Dungeons and Dragons meets Xcom. Instead of running from cover to cover, you use your environment to set traps, set oil puddles on fire, or gain health at a fountain. It's the best way to mix the two ideas.

Gameplay-wise, it's too slow in my taste, and it shouldn't cost my character's turn to change weapons or activate a switch; it's tedious. The leveling-up system is overwhelming, and it is too easy to make mistakes while managing your XP spendings. Be warned: XP is a limited ressource and there is no possible grinding. Also, There are some ridiculously difficult fights spiking about. If the game design wasn't all over the place, it wouldn't be an option to change the difficulty whenever I want.

It's not bad, but there's better out there. It's a really hardcore experience and I'm not a big fan of D&D. 

I had crashes and had to reload some games. The achievements are stupid : waste your XP everywhere, use an inn 50 times, run in a circle (not a joke)

author: {'steamid': '76561198043214785', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2324, 'last_played': 1451249878}
review:
Blackguards is a hexagonal turn based strategy game with some fun elements to it. 
The story line is fairly interesting, with many offshoots in the plot to keep you entertained.The graphics are nice and clean and the voice acting surprisingly good, with many humorous lines from the characters as they play off of one another during your adventures together. 
The learning curve isn't too harsh and the tutorial helps a lot during the start.
However it can at times be a little punishing and you will find yourself hitting the restart button on quite a few occasions, especially any levels involving poison, to which there seems to be many. In my opinion the mechanic is used maybe a little too much throughout the game and the effects can start to become a little irritating, so spec to counter this when you get a chance. There are a few bugs, but nothing I would consider to be game breaking, so all in all Blackguards is worth the buy, but I would recommend waiting for it to be on sale and avoid the full price. I picked this up discounted and am more than satisfied with what I got for the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031725194', 'num_games_owned': 1271, 'num_reviews': 309, 'playtime_forever': 2401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2401, 'last_played': 1450652779}
review:
Blackguards is a turn-based combat focused RPG, that will most likely frustrate you a lot with the amount of dice rolling in it!

My opinions won't really add much to the discussion, as they're mixed... like almost everyone else's. Also, I'm farily new to the genre, so the min-maxing aspect present in the attributes and skill-trees in the game don't really appeal to me, yet (mostly how of ignorance, but anyway...).

I really like RPGs in general, but I'm not one to read up on the game's numerous systems to learn what the optimal builds are -- I like to shape my characters as I please, leading to some interesting, fun, but not necessarily good decisions. I've done the same in Blackguards and will admit that, for the [i]most[/i] part, it went alright. I played through Normal mode, and never got truly stuck, which was my biggest worry.

Many people complained about reaching an unbeatable point in the game because they had a sub-optimal build. Maybe they were either playing on Hard, or I've simply been fairly lucky in my decision.

I will say that there were lots of details in the game that I simply did not delve into -- potions (offensive), traps, etc. Those didn't seem all important in any of the battles in Normal.

Anyway. It's tough. Some of the battles were infuriating, missing 3x in a row when I had a 90% chance to hit, having some periods of extended battles that far overstayed their welcome, etc.

But I did enjoy it quite a lot. Until I finished the 3rd Chapter, that is. Then the game offered nothing new.

The game is very linear, although it opens up a bit in the 3rd Chapter, giving you quite a lot of sidequests. The following 2 chapters barely have any of those, which felt strange.
It seems like the focus of the game was only the 3rd chapter, the other ones being mostly to build it up or simply carry the story.

The story was pretty bland, and the sidequests weren't too interesting either. Gameplay-wise, it's almost a pure combat game. You move from battle to battle. Other than battles, you just go to cities to buy equipment/heal/train, and get sidequests. Sidequests simply lead you into more battles. You never explore anything, never really find emergent gameplay or anything of the sort. It's very, very combat focused.

But hey... I really have very little to add that would be in any way meaningful. I want to talk about one thing exclusively -- and that is how opaque the game actually was! It was one of the biggest sources of frustration, for me.


Sometimes, the game pushes you into extended battles. Battle after battle after battle without an opportunity to heal, restock, change equipment, etc. These, of course, are a much bigger challenge -- especially because, if you do poorly on one battle, you'll carry that penalty onto the next one.
These battles felt extremely tense, to me. Sometimes they could go on for 2 hours, even if they were just 2 or 3 battles. The game is very slow paced, and a mistake can cost you quite a lot of time, which is frustrating. And the game often likes to pull tricks on you that it never pointed to. They're unwelcome surprises.

This is one side of it. The other, happened in the end of the game. After the [i]point of no return[/i], you're lead into a serious of battles, but you [b]can[/b] heal and re-equip between them. What you [b]can not[/b] do, is buy anything. Every healing potion, equipment, etc. that you can use is what you've taken with you. 
There were a few problems here -- first, you had no idea how many battles there would be, so you couldn't really judge. Second, what the game showed you was very misleading, by having it spread over 2 "pages", but only showing you the first.
Basically, you're expecting x battles, and suddenly, after wasting most of your potions, you're shown that there are actually twice as many. Well, shit.

Thankfully, the game wasn't tricking the player and ramping up the difficulty artifically -- on that second page, there was a healer and merchant that was essentially a safe point. And that was a very nice thing.
The problem is how the game never communicated that beforehand. Every battle I fought felt that much more frustrating because a small mistake seemed like a colossal one. 

Arguably, that the feeling that the game was trying to carry -- I doubt it, though. In this case, it was simply a case of bad communication with the player, it seemed. And similar issues happened throughout the game -- often leading you into "extended battles" without warning, and the like.

For me, at least, it's a huge source of frustration, to have to "judge" something without information. Especially when mistakes can cost hours.

So yeah. That's basically it. The game is a huge "tension" without the "release"...


Regardless, I enjoyed it. I'm not a hardcore player of the genre, so my appreciation is certainly different. It was a good challenge! There was some frustration with the dice-rolls, but overall, I'd recommend it to anyone who is looking for a tough turn based rpg.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037273117', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 234, 'playtime_forever': 675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1695359725}

author: {'steamid': '76561198022461255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1450589297}
review:
I can sum this entire game up in a sentence and a half. A three or four layered pile of stat sheets that serves to slightly improve your chances of besting the RNG gods on a turn by turn basis. With the odds against you.

If you think this is a dark, or pessimistic way to sum the game up, I can tell you that that is actually the nice way of putting it. To the list of gaming sins this game commits you may a redundant and unrewarding item system, the most difficult to navigate skill system I have seen since the sphere grid in final fantasy X (which is mainly out of your reach anyhow, seeing as it depends on trainers which appear at arbitrary points in the story), multiple attempts at large scale battles which quickly descend into long lines of infinitely spawning enemies dog piling on your phalanx of heroes, percent chance failures on pretty much everything that mean any well laid plan can come to a deadly end at any point in your game, and a difficulty curve that pretends all the random the dice wielding percent chance jockeys whom designed the game smashed into every nook and cranny of the game does not exist at all. 

The end result will leave you hitting the (restart battle) button on the second or third turn of each attempted play because your warrior's power attack whiffed, which you immediately realize means you won't be able to kill the enemies quickly enough to keep up with the level. Assuming none of the heals whiff (yes, your heals can whiff to, about 33% of the time in most cases), which is also a death sentence. I could go into the ham fisted attempts at interactive levels, mysterious and all around dumb line fo sight mechanics that let bows shoot a seemingly infinite distance but leash spells at just a few tiles, impossible side objectives, and lack of actual counter play and tactics, but my ranting would fill three pages.

All this is a shame considering the clear level of effort and passion that went into designing the graphics, story line, and characters, who despite being completely archetypical adventures manage to characterize themselves wonderfully though they're well developed connection to the adventure is set in. If half the effort that went into all that were part of the game, this would likely be a tbs to the caliber of dynasty tactics or r-type command. Instead, you have either a slightly better version of fire emblem, or a slightly worse version of final fantasy tactics, both of which are mind bendingly boring and tediously frustrating to begin with. If you enjoy either of those than you richly deserve this.

If you read nothing else I have written, read this: This game is a pretty face and nothing else. Looks great, plays very poorly. It would be worth about half the forty dollars it costs if it were a graphic novel. Like this, it's not worth the four bucks it was on sale for when I wrote this. WOULD. NOT. RECOMMEND. TO. ANYONE.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002526111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 7202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6107, 'last_played': 1575069035}
review: Really enjoyed this game. Where other CRPG's will focus on travel, this game eliminates that, the story comes to you and game play is table top turnbased scenarios. I really ejoy the unique take, this is for the tactician that favors combat over all else in their rpg's.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055016618', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 6958, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6958, 'last_played': 1458868537}
review:
Absolut stressfreies, rundenbasiertes Spiel mit archetypischen Charakteren.
Kern des Spiels ist definitiv das Hexfeld-basierte Kampfsystem, welches an die DSA 4 - Regeln angelehnt ist.
F√ºr einen Kampf ben√∂tigt man h√∂chstens eine Stunde Zeit. 

Um die K√§mpfe herum gibt es einen Haupthandlungsstrang mit mehreren Kapiteln. Daneben gibt es zahlreiche, optionale Nebenmissionen. Die K√§mpfe sind mal mehr, mal weniger Abwechslungsreich. Niedergekn√ºppelte Charaktere stehen nach einem gewonnenen Kampf wieder zur Verf√ºgung.

Die Bedienung ist leicht zu erlernen und l√§uft gut. St√∂rend ist ein wenig die strikte Trennung zwischen Inventar und Charakterbogen. Hier k√∂nnten dem Benutzer ein paar Klicks erspart werden.

Die deutsche Vertonung ist gut.

Insgesamt kommt schon ein "Komm! Eine Mission noch! Nur die Eine!" - Gef√ºhl auf.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973115845', 'num_games_owned': 635, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 16539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4022, 'last_played': 1575773445}
review:
Pro's:
Great voice acting
Very good AI
Incremental difficulty
Good graphics
Good story
Good skill tree's

Con's
Can't pan around battlefield
Frustrating battles (AI very good)
Need better award system for difficult battles

This was one of the funnest strategy games I've played in a long while, even with the frustratingly difficult advanced battles. I would definitley recommend this game.

I'll be purchasing Blackguards II when it goes on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998598944', 'num_games_owned': 2056, 'num_reviews': 1144, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1639147077}
review:
So hex based games are really hard for me to get into.  They are Baldur's Gate or Divinity without the exploration, questing, and dialogue.  On top of that you can't rotate the camera so playing this for the first time in 2021 feels very limiting. 

That being said if you like Hex based games there's a lot of depth here.  Equipment, talents, spells, stats, level ups, cover, destroyable objects, and more.  If you are in love with hex games and haven't played Blackguards, you'll probably like it.  If you just like games in general, I don't think you'll like this.  I didn't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006784126', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 400, 'playtime_forever': 548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1450092828}
review:
Blackguards (v1.5)

[b]POSITIVES[/b]

+ Das Schwarze Auge
+ gutes (auch im P&P) unverbrauchtes Setting im S√ºden von Aventurien
+ gut animierte Gegner (auch wenn Morfus und die Iribaarslilien etwas gro√ü geraten sind)
+ sch√∂ne Zaubereffekte
+ sehr gute Soundtracks (insgesamt √ºber 40 Minuten)
+ gute deutsche Sprachausgabe
+ keine strahlende Helden, sondern verbrecherische eher d√ºstere Charaktere mit dem "Schl√§chter von Neetha" in der Hauptrolle (das ist zwar DSA-untypisch, aber ich pers√∂nlich bevorzuge b√∂se Rollen)
+ Experten Charakter m√∂glich (aber leider ohne Vor- und Nachteile wie in Drakensang)
+ stimmige Begleiter (Naurim, Niam, Zurbaran, Takate)
+ rundenbasierende tabletopartige K√§mpfe die (leider) eindeutig den Fokus des Spiels darstellen
+ gelungene Battlemaps mit interaktiven Objekten und dadurch auch alternative L√∂sungen
+ keine recycelten Schaupl√§tze
+ spielbare R√ºckblenden
+ Lehrmeister die einem Sonderfertigkeiten beibringen, die man erst einmal finden muss, bzw. f√ºr die man etwas tun muss, bevor die ihre SF mit einem teilen
+ man sieht direkt welche Auswirkungen Eigenschaftssteigerungen haben, bzw. welche Eigenschaft gesteigert werden muss um etwas bestimmtes zu erh√∂hen
+ sch√∂ne Dialoge (siehe aber auch weiter unten)
+ guter Schwierigkeitsgrad (nur stellenweise etwas zu leicht)
+ maximale Traglast
+ viele Waffen und einige davon auch mit Reichweite oder Zusatzwirkungen
+ gutes KI Verhalten der Gegner die gezielt ihre St√§rken ausnutzen, Heil- und Zaubertr√§nke nutzen, sich auch mal anderen Charakteren zuwenden und auch ihre Zauber sehr gut einsetzen
+ Kampf gegen Fornunfur
+ Wendepunkt in der Handlung
+ interessante Storry (auch wenn es etwas l√§nger dauert bis diese in Fahrt kommt)
+ etwa 40 Stunden Spielzeit (habe es haupts√§chlich mit der DRM-freien Version gespielt au√üerhalb von Steam)
+ zumindest gef√ºhlt komplett Bugfrei und keinen einzigen Absturz(!) 

[b]NEGATIVES[/b]

- magere Auswahlm√∂glichkeiten beim Aussehen des Charakters
- nur drei Charakterklassen w√§hlbar (im Normalen Modus)
- blaues Leuchten des Hex-Bodens ist etwas unpassend
- UI wirkt zu modern und lieblos (ein Ringmen√º aus Stein oder Metall mit Ornamenten w√§re passender)
- zu wenige Talente und Zauber (ich weiss, dass die bisherigen einigen schon zu viel sein m√∂gen, mir jedenfalls nicht)
- Ladebildschirm bei jedem Ortswechsel nervt (auch wenn die Ladezeiten gering sind)
- keine 100%tige Umsetzung der DSA 4.1 Regeln
- St√§dte nicht begehbar
- keine richtigen Dungeons sondern nur Kampfpunkte zwischen denen man wechseln kann
- RPG Aspekte kommen zu kurz
- zu wenig Antwortm√∂glichkeiten und kein wirklicher Einfluss
- lineare vorgegebene Story
- wenig Nebenquests
- keine Zufallsbegegnungen auf Reisen (√∂de Reisen wie in Drakensang) 
- total unstimmiger bl√§ulicher Flammenblitz der anstatt einer Gruppe, Person oder schlichtem rotem Strich (wie in Schicksalsklinge HD) √ºber die Karte rast
- fehlende Ausdauerregel, wodurch viele Kampf SF zu stark sind, da diese beliebig oft einsetzbar sind (ich bin zwar im P&P kein Freund der Ausdauer, aber gerade in einem PC Spiel h√§tte das gut gepasst, da der Rechner ja die Verwaltungsarbeit √ºbernimmt)
- kein RS Zonensystem
- statt dessen seltsame %tuale Resistenzen gegen gewisse Schadensarten, was zur Folge hat, dass man seine R√ºstung nicht richtig einsch√§tzen kann (herk√∂mmlicher RS auf Zonen w√§re so viel einfacher und besser gewesen)
- bei den Zaubern in Bezug auf die Wirkung nicht richtig an die P&P Vorlagen gehalten wodurch nat√ºrlich gro√üe Ungleichgewichte entstehen
- fixe Schadenswerte der Zauber (dadurch am Anfang zu stark und sp√§ter zu schwach)
- Axxeleratus Blitzgeschwind mit seiner zus√§tzlichen Aktion ist zu stark; dass man nun die Kosten f√ºr diesen Zauber erh√∂ht hat, √§ndert daran eher wenig
- auch bei den SF wurde sich nicht richtig an die Vorlagen gehalten
- SF Dreifachschuss ist viel zu stark und sollte gestrichen werden, oder legt hier Legolas aus Herr der Ringe pers√∂nlich auf (?); diese SF gibt es auch im P&P nicht
- Flankieren oder Angriffe von Hinten (die nicht parierbar sein d√ºrften) haben keine speziellen Auswirkungen
- generell immer noch undurchsichtige und nicht nachvollziehbare Regelmechanik die sich heimlich im Hintergrund verbirgt; die Trefferchancen werden nun zwar angezeigt, aber nicht wie sich diese zusammensetzen (dieser schwerwiegende Punkt zieht sich durch alle F√§higkeiten, Talente und Zauber), ich vermute auch, dass die Regelmechanik nicht wirklich funktioniert, denn die Werte-Angaben und das wirkliche Geschehen unterscheiden sich ma√ügeblich (vermutlich wird es deshalb verborgen, denn sonst w√ºrden noch mehr Unstimmigkeiten auffallen)
- keine sichtbaren KK-Zuschl√§ge, die man sich selbst aus seinem Wege des Schwerts zusammen suchen muss, in der Hoffnung dass wenigstens diese korrekt umgesetzt wurden; man steigert also KK einfach so ohne zu wissen ob man dann einen TP mehr macht (immerhin wird mittlerweile angezeigt wieviele TP durch die hohe KK hinzugekommen sind, aber eben immer noch nicht ab wann f√ºr zuk√ºnftige KK-Steigerungen)
- MR scheint ohne sp√ºrbare Wirkung zu sein, da selbst Naurim mit MR 15 noch versteinert wird
- zu hohe AE Regeneration, da sogar pro KR (ist DSA untypisch), weshalb man seine Zauberkraft auch nicht mal aufspart, daman nach einigen KR eh wieder voll ist
- zu viele Tr√§nke (Heil- und Zaubertr√§nke) im Spiel, die es an jeder Stra√üenecke zu kaufen gibt, was nicht zu DSA passt, da diese in Aventurien etwas besonderes sind und nicht wie Wasser gesoffen werden (DSA ist kein Diablo)
- keine Alchemie zum selber brauen
- Heilkunde Wunden zu stark (eigentlich heilt man nur die H√§lfte seiner TaP*)
- keine Pflanzen und Kr√§uter (wie in Schicksalsklinge HD)
- seltsame Ingame-√úberlandkarte auf der au√üer den Orten kaum etwas anderes zu erkennen ist; warum hat man hier nicht einfach die sehr detaillieren originalen Karten genutzt?
- Gegner nutzen viel zu h√§ufig Gift, Charaktere sind dadurch andauernd Gr√ºn, was sehr st√∂rend aussieht
- Korspie√ü "Aderlasser" hat zu schlechte Werte, daf√ºr dass er angeblich aus Schwarzmetall sein soll und zuvor m√ºhevoll aus neun Teilen zusammengesucht werden muss...sehr entt√§uschend
- Fallen zum auslegen total unn√∂tig
- Wurfwaffen und zumindest ein Teil der Pfeile/Bolzen nach k√§mpfen nicht einsammelbar
- keine unterschiedlichen Roben f√ºr Magier (!)
- viel zu wenig R√ºstungen f√ºr K√§mpfer (Reiterharnisch ist h√§sslich und hat unterirdisch falsche BE Werte)
- zu viele Abenteuerpunkte (AP)
- im Nachhinein verschiebbare AT/PA Verteilung (wodurch man nicht planen muss)
- Echsenlehrer im 5. Kapitel, der einfach alles kann (sehr unpassend)
- wenig stimmungsvolles Ende
- kein Widerspielwert 

[b]FAZIT[/b]

Blackguards 1 ist weder gut noch richtig schlecht. Alles was DSAfremd ist, an diesem Spiel, st√∂rt mich aber. Warum benutzt man im Kampf Prozentangaben, von denen niemand wei√ü wie diese zustandekommen, anstatt sich einfach ausschlie√ülich an die guten alten W20 Angaben zu halten - die jeder DSA-Spieler versteht, und auch f√ºr DSA-Neulinge gut nachzuvollziehen w√§ren. Die Entwickler von Daedalic haben nicht nur keine Erfahrung mit Rollenspielen, sondern auch kaum Erfahrung mit der Welt und den Regeln von Aventurien, und das merkt man dem Spiel an. Die RPG-Aspekte kommen bei Blackguards viel zu kurz. Im Grunde geht es fast nur von Kampfbildschirm zu Kampfbildschirm, und im Nachfolger wird das noch schlimmer. Ich kann Blackguards 1 nicht wirklich empfehlen, leider.

Wenn ihr an weiteren Reviews von mir interessiert seid, dann folgt meiner [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/10868887-Dark-Chummer%27s-Reviews/?appid=63110]Gruppe[/url].

author: {'steamid': '76561198009089407', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1449612183}
review:
So, Blackguards, eh? Well it is a good idea for a game, but the realisation is missing something.
What could that be?
Well the first impressions were good- the characters have a lot to learn, but somehow for the new players it is unknown could they learn everything, something or just few things? There is no explanation.
The game gives you to chose between 2 options that will define your game- will the main stats of the hero will be automaticaly distrubuted, or you will do everything manualy.
So far for me, my adventure was with 3 heroes, however I was with 2 warriors and a mage. Somehow I did not made a ranger and I found that as a mistake when advansing in the game.
I found myself more frequently repeating and reloading a map to find the best solution to win or get out from combat.
Yes, the combat. 
Well, the combat is Turn Based so you have time to think your strategy, however heroes miss a lot, and sometimes a chance to hit or make a spell of 70%+ is not enough. Every fail punish could punish you really badly.
The maps are not so big, but for that kind of game I guess they are enough, however, for me, they looked someking small.
You could interact with some object in the map or use an object to take a cover from an enemy archer, however, not everytime this thing works. Some archers simply ignore that.
The audio is good. The voice acting is in good level.
The soundtrack is good. I liked it.
I made few side quests, but one of them was really pain in the ass in at the end I even did not finished it. It was horrible. Probably much higher level heroes could do it.
The grapics are nice for the eye.
I did not encounter any bugs, but I can not keep playing the game. It is enough.
So for final- this is avarage turn based strategy with RPG elements, however, there are better ones out there that you can play.
For me- I would not try this game anymore. I really wanted to like it, but I can't give it more time. 4 hours and a little bit more are enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121429906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1449454018}

author: {'steamid': '76561198089943640', 'num_games_owned': 1432, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1449516728}
review:
This is an okay game. Nothing huge but not terrible. It really tests your patience and you will restart battles a lot.

The good of the game is that the gameplay is enjoyable to an extent. It looks amazing and sounds wonderful. Many of the voice acters sound great except the times where they try to fabricate some accents.  Like there is a person you'll meet in the first place to shop at and he is either spanish or french. But all I know if that he meant to say "agility" but he said "agelity." Something small though.

It tests your patience with the battles. See, sometimes some enemies are immune to certain damage. For example, Skeletons are immune to stabbing. Seem obvious right? Well the game never really tells you, if you didn't know other wise then you'd restarting the battle. And the battles are small fights with 3-4 enemies. They take maybe 5-20 Minutes and then give a reward. They are a challenge too. Either I'm bad at this game or they always hit half your person's health while I chip small bits off.

In the end I recomment this game on sale. You can find it enjoyable with the gameplay and design along with problems you need to get used to. Get it for no more than 75% off.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058380579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1449176986}
review:
This game is the equivalent of Iron Man 3 - plenty of potential, a winning formula but just didnt pull it off where it mattered.

Let me explain..... 
It has a good story that makes you want to invest time to find out what happens to the characters. It has turn based mechanics with lots of flexibility - shall i use the environment to my advantage, shall i switch weapons or shall i just spam the most powerful attack i have (yes. do the latter). Just the WORST thing about the game is when you successfully miss 4 attacks in a row each with a hit chance of 80%. This sort of treachery happens often and really spoils the battle.

The battle map is great and you can easily find your way around the battlefield although in my opinion the user interface is lacking a bit - all the useful buttons are grouped together and are a little bit too small for my liking. You can semi-personalise each character and evolve their skills and attributes to your liking - although unless you want to turn a mage into a bad-boy-brawler (and why the hell would you do that) there isnt that much choice.

All in all it is a better than average game although is only worth buying when on steam sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043777940', 'num_games_owned': 326, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 1484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1281, 'last_played': 1448914885}
review:
This game should be a manual about how to fail a game.

It has been a long time I had not the chance to play a game so frustrating:
- wrong hit percentages (I once missed 99% 3 times in a row and I would say 95% means 70% for them)
- difficulty is scaled not on ennemy becoming stronger but you getting weaker (poison lowering stats, map full of traps) or them becoming more numerous (how great to play a turn based game with 20 ennemies)
- repetitive fights (always the same)
- useless quests (you can forge a 9 element spear which is as good as other one you can find easily)
- mage are useless. You have a low mana pool and will always run out of mana. Mana potions are so expansive you just cannot afford them (but the ennemy can).

This game is just a punition. If you are masochist, go for it. For normal people, it is a waste.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101361037', 'num_games_owned': 427, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1010, 'last_played': 1448345709}
review:
[b][h1]Blackguards[/h1][/b]
[h1]Spielbeschreibung:[/h1]
Blackguards ist ein Tabletop Strategie Spiel, welches zarte RPG Elemente enth√§lt.
Dabei kann man seine vorgegebenen Charaktere, flexibel, verbessern.
Das ganze Spiel hat eine vorgegebene Story, welche man nur bedingt beeinflussen kann. 
Meistens k√∂nnen durch gewisse Entscheidungen nur K√§mpfe vermieden oder getauscht werden.
Der Kernfokus in diesem Spiel sind die K√§mpfe.

[h1]F√ºr alle die mit dem Begriff "Tabletop" nichts anfangen k√∂nnen:[/h1]

Die K√§mpfe spielt man auf Sechsecken. Man hat begrenzte Lauf- und Aktionsreichweite und kann sich auf Zauber, Nah- oder Fernkampf spezialisieren. Die Zugreihenfolge wird nach dem eigenen Initiative Wert gew√§hlt und so wird der Kampf Zug f√ºr Zug abgehandelt.

[h1]Positiv:[/h1]
[list]
[*] Die K√§mpfe sind innovativ, es gibt viele verschiedene Monster und die Schaupl√§tze werden nicht recycelt.
[*] Man kann in den meisten Schaupl√§tzen, in den K√§mpfen, mit der Umgebung interagieren.
[*] Der Talentbaum f√ºr Waffentalente ist gut umgesetzt.
[*] Grafisch ist das Spiel sehr ansprechend.
[*] Ab dem dritten Kapitel kann man sich relativ frei bewegen.
[*] Gute Synchronisation.

[/list]

[h1]Neutral:[/h1]
[list]
[*] Es gibt Attribute/Talente die f√ºr die Gruppe gut sind, man ben√∂tigt nur einen Charakter der diese hat und die ganze Gruppe erh√§lt den Vorteil.
[*] Man ist bei den K√§mpfen meistens in der Unterzahl.
[*] Die Karte Ansicht ist Geschmackssache.
[*] Es gibt eine maximale Traglast, welche bei √úberschreitung Mali verursacht.

[/list]

[h1]Negativ:[/h1]
[list]
[*] Man muss bei manchen K√§mpfen mit der Umgebung interagieren.
[*] Jeder Charakter hat den gleichen Talentbaum, der einzige Unterschied ist der das bei manchen einfach Talente gesperrt sind. Dies ist nicht nur √§sthetisch unsch√∂n, sondern nimmt auch den Tiefgang bei der Gestaltung eines Charakters.
[*] An sich ist das System gerade f√ºr Magier und deren Zauber sehr begrenzt.
[*] Eine Stadt unterscheidet sich kaum von einer anderen. Personen und L√§den werden hier einfach wiederverwertet.
[*] Die eigenen Charakter sind Abschaum, mir f√§llt es schwer nur einen davon zu m√∂gen.
[*] Die Hauptstory ist weder innovativ noch ann√§hernd interessant.
[*] Zufallswerte entscheiden ma√ügeblich √ºber Sieg oder Niederlage in einem Kampf.
[*] Durch das Versagen in K√§mpfen, muss man diese (vom letzten Speicherpunkt aus) wiederholen. Dies sorgt daf√ºr das man immer wieder die gleichen Gegner, Spr√ºche, Taktiken und Umgebungen vor sich hat und das frustriert und nervt.
[*] Am Anfang hat man enormen Gold Mangel, man kann sich einfach nichts richtiges kaufen.
[*] Es gibt enorm wenig Ausr√ºstungen, dazu noch etwas sinnvolles zu finden ist noch viel seltener.
[*] Hat man mal das Gold um einen Charakter komplett auszur√ºsten, bringt dies einem keinen sp√ºrbaren Vorteil.
[*] Immunit√§ten gegen gewisse Zauber- und Waffentypen sind so gew√§hlt das man seine Charaktere so weit in den Fertigkeiten f√§chern muss, das sie zu schwach f√ºr die normalen K√§mpfe w√§ren.
[*] Das Spiel warnt einen nicht, wenn man was komplett falsch macht.
[*] Die eingeblendete Hilfe ist mMn nicht sinnvoll und st√∂rend, l√§sst sich allerdings ausschalten.
[*] Es gibt bei den Zaubern fixe Schadenswerte, somit sind sie am Anfang enorm stark und am Ende ziemlich schwach.
[*] Die KI ist ziemlich bescheuert..., man kann sie leicht in Fallen etc. locken und sie verh√§lt sich bei jedem Gegner gleich.
[*] Das Spiel hat ein paar Bugs, so sollte man auf der Weltkarte nicht zu weit scrollen da man sonst nicht mehr zur√ºck kommt und ohnm√§chtige Charakter werden als tot betrachtet, was zu einem Sieg oder zu einer Niederlage f√ºhren kann.
[*] Der RPG/P&P Aspekt kommt nicht zum tragen.
[*] Wenige Sidequests, und langweilig sich immer wiederholende Aufgaben.
[*] Laufwege, in K√§mpfen, lassen sich nicht richtig bestimmen.
[*] Um sich komplett zu heilen muss man zuerst irgendwo √ºbernachten und sich dann bei einem Heiler heilen. Dadurch werden die Manareserven und Lebenspunkte aufgef√ºllt und die Wunden geheilt. Macht man dies anders herum, also man geht zu erst zum Heiler und dann √ºbernachtet man irgendwo so zahlt man den vielfachen Preis f√ºr das gleiche, da der Heiler Lebenspunkte und Wunden heilt und seine Kosten darauf aufbauen, und die Kosten einer √úbernachtung in einer Gastst√§tte gleich bleiben und diese Lebenspunkte und Manareserven auff√ºllen.

[/list]

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]

Spielspa√ü: 2/5
[spoiler]Also am Anfang war es ganz nett, aber durch die dauernden Wiederholungen und das st√§ndige k√§mpfen, fehlt einem die Motivation weiter zu spielen. Dazu eine eher schlechte Story und langweilige Nebenquests, hat es einfach nicht raus gehauen. [/spoiler]

Grafik: 4/5
[spoiler]Ich finde die Grafik gr√∂√ütenteils ansprechend. Einziger Kritikpunkt sind die St√§dte und die Karte die mir nicht gef√§llt. Dennoch finde ich das hier gute Arbeit geleistet wurde.[/spoiler]

Musik: 3/5
[spoiler]Hat mich nicht besonders gest√∂rt, aber auch nicht besonders bereichert.[/spoiler]

Kostenfaktor: 1/5
[spoiler]Grundg√ºtiger, ich habe das Spiel zum Gl√ºck nicht f√ºr den Vollpreis von 40‚Ç¨ gekauft. Das ist vollkommen √ºberzogen. Ganz ehrlich, ich w√ºrde das Spiel nicht noch einmal kaufen.[/spoiler]

Gesamteindruck: 1/5
[spoiler]Schleppend, ich ging eigentlich ohne gro√üe Erwartungen an dieses Spiel heran, und wurde dennoch entt√§uscht. Das System ist zwar einigerma√üen komplex, aber ziemlich schlecht umgesetzt. Da ich RPG's liebe und auch P&P in verschiedenen Spielsystemen leite, muss ich auch sagen das ich K√§mpfe an sich nicht die Wichtigkeit zu spreche, wie sie hier zugesprochen wird. Daf√ºr ist der RPG-Aspekt, f√ºr mich, viel zu mager ausgefallen. Nur zu empfehlen, wenn einem Story und Charakterentwicklung egal sind und man gerne Tabletop spielt.[/spoiler]

Schwierigkeitsgrad: 2/5
[spoiler]Wenn man sich mit dem System besch√§ftigt hat ist es nicht schwer zu meistern, das einzige Problem ist einfach der heftige Einschlag von Zufallswerten.[/spoiler]
Hinweis:
Der Schwierigkeitsgrad soll nur eine Richtlinie darstellen und flie√üt nicht in die Wertung mit ein.

Gesamt: 2,2/5
[spoiler]Durchschnitt aus 'Spielspa√ü', 'Grafik', 'Musik', 'Gesamteindruck' und 'Kostenfaktor'[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198064599475', 'num_games_owned': 434, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 3217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2839, 'last_played': 1447629304}
review:
Pros
genre is underrepresented
No game breaking bugs
Significant protag customization
Interesting crapsack world
Portraits, mesh, and texturing is fairly decent
Voice acting is competent
Gave a moderate sense of player choices' mattering on first playthrough

Cons
Balance is poorly implimented in virtually every aspect of the game, from weapon and spell utility and encounter design, to difficulty curve, and pervasively undercuts every aspect of the gameplay
Mechanics are vastly overcomplicated, convoluted, and poorly explained.  VERY POORLY EXPLAINED.  
Animation is very basic

After I got over the needlessly high learning curve by experimenting with several builds, restarting the game a few times when they proved extremely frustrating to play, then reading several character build faqs, I discovered hamfisted, though not completely fruitless, neutral dark storytelling and moderately enjoyable, if one note, TBS gameplay.  Having finished the game I can conclusively say this is a game ONLY for extremely dedicated, veteran fans of the genre who are tolerant of some pretty serious lack of polish.  If you are such a person (and unfortunately since I completed it I was) you may consider this game a frustrating but sometimes enjoyable exercise of the TBS muscles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198257696182', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 5866, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3812, 'last_played': 1494050804}
review:
Blackguards is a textbook example of a TRPG.  Sadly, this genre seems to be dying out, though the Blackguards series gives me some hope for the future of gaming.  I love how the Blackguards system is based off of a German roleplaying engine.  Old AD&D games like Pool of Radiance, even Baldur's Gate and Neverwinter NIghts (though I hate the real-time aspect of these) are my favorites, and Blackguards is definitely along that same line.

Some of the positives.  
*The customization available is one of this game's many strengths.  They allow the player to keep each character unique throughout this game without having too many options as to overwhelm.  
*The story isn't that happy-go-lucky anime stuff.  It's dark and intriguing.  The complaints regarding the main character's amnesia seem gripey to me.  Amnesia happens, but it's not overdone.  What I mean is that your main character may forget a few things, but won't go through the game complaining about missing memories.  The amnesia just adds to the mystery and allows the player to catch up on what has transpired.  Make no mistake, though, the focus is on the combat.
*Most battles allow for different ways of completing your mission using objects in the field or terrain.  The complaint some make along the lines of "I use the same tactics every time and this game becomes boring" is the result of the choice the individual player has made, not the limitations of the game. 
*I love the variety of the enemies you'll face and their crazy portraits.
*The soundtrack is mostly dark but there were several battle tracks I enjoyed.
*Don't expect to get the "+5 Sword of Fiery Judgment" toward the end.  The weapons in this game do not provide the means to become amazing in combat, which is very unusual for RPGs.  I appreciated the change.

What I didn't like.
*Around 75% through the game, my melee fighters were essentially maxed out.  Without assistance from magic, fighters need a lot of luck to be helpful.
*Speaking of luck, that D20 (the to-hit random number generator) is the most evil creature in creation.  90% treated me more like 70%.  1s were very rare and usually happened when I was finishing off a foe with few HP.  20s were frequent, as was foul language coming from me.  On top of that, there appeared to be a glitch.  I tossed, say, a 14 when 19 or below struck, yet the result was miss.  This occurred about one in every 15 attacks  (Despite this, the game is very beatable, I've finished it).
*I wish there was more story.  Not better story, just more story.  I still don't understand the motive for one of the player-controlled characters to follow around the main character.  I wish one of the foes was more-developed.

Those that haven't succumbed to mainstream gaming and still appreciate TRPGs can not go wrong in buying this game on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059321709', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 2057, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1986, 'last_played': 1448507324}
review:
"Niam's targeted shot missed. (Chance 100%)"

That's about all you need to know; you will miss when you have a 100% chance to hit. It feels like an old game, but not in a good way. The concept of story and mechanics are all good, but it feels unpolished. Voice acting is not very convincing, character models are not very detailed, even in static conversation screens, and even the character personalities aren't very believable. [spoiler]At one point, some of your team tries to sell another into slavery. You kill the slaver and the offended team member doesn't even complain about the attempt to sell him.[/spoiler]

If you enjoy the brutalness of Xcom and want it mixed with a fantasy RPG, this is your game. But I, for one, have utilized the F-word in every variation during this play through. Get it on deep discount, like I did from Humble Bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009169294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 194, 'playtime_forever': 628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 628, 'last_played': 1447174980}
review:
Before playing this game I spend some time with [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/314830]Blackguards2[/url], and ultimately decided to wasn't worth my time.  I fired up Blackguards 1 to see if the original got it any better.  Surprisingly, the first game has a better pace to it, things move along a bit faster and the story gets way.  The protagonists seems more interesting, at least to me, and my crew is certainly an improvement.

Ultimately, the gameplay is still just so slow.  The combat and movement crawls like a snail.  Other titles like [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/237990/]Banner Saga[/url] have succeeded quite well with turn-based combat. 


[b]Pros[/b]
[*]144hz support
[*]Decent graphics, art tends to look reasonably good, it will immerse you.
[*]It‚Äôs better than [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/314830]Blackguards2[/url]
[/list]

[b]Cons[/b]
[*]Even though the game is turn based it needs to allow the user to speed things up a bit.  It takes far too long time to accomplish anything in the game
[*]No camera rotating?  Some objects are placed behind others with an obscured view.  It's not an isometric game so this is seemingly pointless limitation. 
[*]Combat doesn't seem to have a lot of strategy to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077349985', 'num_games_owned': 540, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1477844791}
review:
Ich hab noch nie ein taktisches Spiel gesehen was so extrem Zeitaufwendig ist wenn man im Modus : Normal spielt. Der Rundenbasierende Kampf dauert jedesmal mindestens 5 Minuten.. und es ist nicht wie bei Might of Magic, dass da dann mal was stirbt oder so. Das Spiel kann man nicht beschleunigen, man muss jedesmal wenn die Runde ung√ºnstig l√§uft das ganze von Neuem beginnen und es ist sicher, dass man maximal ne 20% Gewinnchance hat, wenn man ein bestimmtes Ziel in der Runde erreichen soll. Es ist zum Kopf w√§hrenddessen auf die Tischplatte hauen. Da manche Runden so etwa 20 bis 45 Minuten dauern, weil alles so unenedlich lange dauert.. dabei bewegt sich eine Figur eventuell maximal 12 Hex-Felder oder 4 bis 6 Hexfelder und wirft nen Speer oder ein magisches Geschoss oder haut einmal zu.. aber nein.. allein das dauert pro aktion mindestens 20 Sekunden. Npc's sterben grunds√§tzlich daran, dass die gegner zu stark sind. -.- 

Und wer auch immer gemeint hat es ist schlau sich vom Spiel die Werte ausw√§hlen zu lassen hat einen an der Waffel. Nach knapp meheren Stunden bin ich immer noch im Startgebiet. hmpf.  Ne. Kaum Lust noch. W√§r das nicht DSA w√ºrde ich mich da gar nicht erst durchqu√§len wollen. Die Spiele Entwickler haben doch einen an der Waffel, dass sie vergessen haben eine die M√∂glichkeit zu implementieren, das Kampfgeschehen zu beschleunigen. -.- War das Absicht? Damit die Story endlos lang dauert? Wobei es jedes mal nur Sprachfetzen sind.. an die man sich kaum noch erinnert, wenn man ung√ºnstiger Weise st√§ndig einen Kampf verliert und nach einer Stunde noch die Selbe Stelle bearbeitet?

author: {'steamid': '76561198052261087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1446611844}
review: Incredibly bad game. Battles are essentially impossible to win in the beginning even with good tactics and taking advantage of every chokepoint you can. Activating environmental effects barely give you an advantage. You have to fight battles way too many times until simple luck stops an enemy from dodging your tenth attack in a row so you can finally hit them. Lost a battle to an enemy who had less than 5hp and proceeded to dodge all my attacks and wipe me out. It's absurd. Not worth even as part of a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088877976', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1446957620}
review:
While I only played this for 30 minutes I was bored out of my mind the entire time. Story is all over the place. Starts with a common trope of put in prison for something didn't commit and has no memory. Another prisioner "rescues" you for no apparant reason, and you resuce another prisoner on your way out. So of course you become close friends and adventure together.
Combat was bland. I chose a ranger as my class and after the first battle which saw me kill a single creature in two attacks, I spend the next three combats using a torch as a melee weapon against armed and armoured guards. I won of course.
Maybe it gets better over time, but I'm not wasting mine after the introduction.

review: I love this game! I think Blackguards defines a template for what a perfect RPG should be. The only thing that annoyed me was lack of lighting in many areas. Everything else is just perfect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045549641', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6170, 'last_played': 1445420978}
review: I came here twice to give a scathing review, out of frustration.  I couldn't bring myself to post them, and I'm glad I didn't.  I ended up having more fun with this game than I've had in a long time, but keep in mind it has a learning curve.  This game is complicated, and incredibly fun once you understand how to play it and the fact that it is not designed for you to hit every shot you make (which seems to be the biggest complaint, but in my opinion only made it challenging and in turn fun in the end).  My advice is that on your first playthrough, when you get to the point to where you feel you cannot get past, start a new game.  You will then understand the game enough to really play it and will have learned how to develop your character.  This will be one of those few games that I will play through again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100477286', 'num_games_owned': 946, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 2119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2119, 'last_played': 1446406948}
review:
Game is funny , but short , not much customisation but have good story. Far too much fighting and it's easy when you know what to do. Yet have something which made me rush to finish ;) 
It is like a good movie , but longer. Was hoping for more but 35 hours and game finished :) 
Characters in game are awsome especially my beloved Dwarf ;) almost like  from pen and paper games ;)
Music sometimes is annoying , few to loud sound effects of few spells but higly recomend game.

Do not play anything else then expert mode it is easy to read all descriptions. 
Last fight is difficult so prepare for it do not let somones down in first faze as it will not be present in 2nd.
ALSO IMPORTANT : do not  use magical dmg weapons  only as in few quest you have to have only normal damage.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986997483', 'num_games_owned': 846, 'num_reviews': 314, 'playtime_forever': 1382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1177, 'last_played': 1526374336}
review: I can't understand the bad reviews.  This is everything I want in a tacticle RPG game.  Every combat is a unique experience, often with puzzles for you to figure out to make things easier.  The story is interesting, with fun twists, the dialogue is well-written.  I particularly love the static town screens so that you don't have to talk to every uninteresting twit there to make sure you haven't missed anything.  My only slight negative is that the upgrade system is rather complicated, and I had to restart the game once after I figured it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017062350', 'num_games_owned': 1505, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1467869490}
review: It's like playing D&D 4E with a rather railroad-y DM. Were I playing actual tabletop, that would be a bad thing but this game is the closest I've come to a full-production digital D&D adventure, without it actually being a D&D product.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976498153', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 4426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4061, 'last_played': 1446006259}
review:
*Consideratelo come pollice giallo*
*Giocato ad Hard*

Gioco di ruolo ambientato nel mondo di Dark Eye del tutto focalizzato sul combattimento a turni. Da subito si nota una curva di apprendimento ripida come l'Everest, la scheda del personaggio √® forse la pi√π complessa nella storia del genere. Come prenderete confidenza con le regole vi accorgerete che il bilanciamento √® fatto alla pene di segugio: combattimenti che dovrebbero essere facili spesso sono difficilissimi, altri che dovrebbero essere difficili sono facili, stesso discorso per le armi magiche trovabili, le quali sembrano buttate in giro senza una logica. Problemi di game design si presentano a pi√π riprese, esempio: avventurarsi nella sezione finale non livellati abbastanza o senza certi incantesimi fondamentali render√† quasi impossibile passarla.

Se tutto questo per voi non √® un problema, ed anzi, siete alla ricerca di una sfida, allora questo √® il gioco che fa per voi, anche perch√© tutti gli altri aspetti non analizzati qua sopra sono pi√π che dignitosi.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987388969', 'num_games_owned': 1728, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1446012888}
review: Blackguards is a Turn-based, Tactical RPG, where you have the freedom to customize your character to your own playstyle.  You can roll a Hunter, Warrior, or Mage, and cross train each if you choose. You will lead up to five characters whom you save or recruit on your travels to help you in your quest. Blackguards has a dark story, which may not be suitable for the very young gamer, but teenage gamers have seen a lot worse on television. Visually speaking, Blackguards looks beautiful, it is well designed, intricate and detailed. There are over 100 different scenes, each as detailed well designed as the last. While I am not a huge fan of turn-based play, this was a very fun game I could come back to again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963538243', 'num_games_owned': 2982, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1446055106}

author: {'steamid': '76561198048905432', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1385, 'last_played': 1442973246}
review:
I would call this an excelent turn-based fatasy combat game with weak RPG elements.  I stopped playing before I finished the game.  The combats were cool, but plot was far too linear for my taste.  It did not seem that anything you could do would affect on the overall plot and the game sometimes does bad things to your characters regardless of the choices you make.  I don't think the creators have a very deep understanding of the RPG player mindset.  The term "railroaded" feels appropriate.  

Overall I would rate it a 6 on a 1-10 scale.  Worth my money, but not one that I would played through.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021508010', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2332, 'last_played': 1445113788}
review: I love this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971118263', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3924, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3880, 'last_played': 1446342112}
review:
This game is hard, its fun and its not for everyone. plan on playing it and then restarting once you know whats going on. I find the difficulty refreshing. there only a few games like this that are this difficult. Its constantly challenging you wih unfair situations and at times the battles are more like puzzles to be solved. If your looking for a game where you can just put together the most effective , winningest party and then just consistantly  kick everythings ass, this isnt it. If your looking for a game that will constantly challenge you to find the way to win each battle or string of battles, this is the one.

That being said, there are definitly character builds that work fine up untill a certain battle and then they will not let you procede no matter how hard you try. Its highly reccomended that you check out one of the guides out there that will give you pointers on what to avoid and whats more effective.

author: {'steamid': '76561198248511294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1441618471}
review: I really liked the mechanics, the writing and the setting, but the combat becomes quite repetitive. Plus melee chars are quite boring. 7/10 points is fair for its genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006167184', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 3422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3369, 'last_played': 1445171378}
review:
Before saying anything else: this is a hard game. Getting to know how everything works may require time, and you will feel frustrated sometimes when your attacks or spells fail again and again. But that also can make it satisfying when you manage to do things well! So, knowing that, if you feel brave enough... go for it!

The game can be a bit expensive for its real content, but I would surely recommend getting it on sale. Combat system's really good, you'll depend on strategies and using the environment to get some advantage. Characters are not very developed but are unusual and funny in many scenes, and the story is... well, a bit different, though it has its cliches.

Be careful when designing your main character! You'll probably end up failing your first game hard and noticing he's useless when it's too late... Start with an archer if you feel lost - you can't go wrong with that.

Pros
+ Tactic and varied combat, with lots of maps and strategies
+ Fully voiced, good dialogues
+ Many different weapons, spells and items you can use during the fights
+ Shady characters, not your classic heroes
+ More content than I expected, with a lot of sidequests
+ A real challenge if you want to go into the hard mode... or even normal difficulty
+ One of the best dwarfs ever

Cons
- Some fights can be really hard compared to the rest of the game
- Learning curve? More like learning wall
- You won't understand how combat works until you've failed a lot
- Game controls feel a bit clumsy sometimes, you may end up casting heals on yourself instead of the intended target
- The ending doesn't live up to the rest of the story, it's too abrupt and you feel like you're missing a cutscene or something
- You may find yourself trapped... if you built your characters wrong, you won't be able to survive to certain parts of the plot and may even need to restart everything. I'm thinking about you, Nine Hordes...

author: {'steamid': '76561198054337027', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1447481689}
review: A decent core game completely undermined by the worst RNG I have ever seen. Even with a 80-90% chance to hit, you will miss consistantly and your spells will fizzle. Whatever strategy might have been is soon undone, as all encounters are eventually reduced to a group of units all clustered in one part of the map, swinging and missing each other.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990870838', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 3081, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2752, 'last_played': 1444073312}
review:
A really good game in the dark eye universe.
It is a mixture of kings bounty and the old dark eye games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056698823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 4668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4668, 'last_played': 1469878696}
review:
Blackguards is a RPG with a decent number of dialogue choices. The story has its ups and downs and early it is a bit confusing because they throw alot of unknown terms at you and and most of them you will only learn halfway through the game. And the end is kinda lackluster in my opinion.

The combat is turn based and the battles are mostly diversed since some can have puzzle elemnts others can have a few stages and so on. And your choices along the game influences some of the battles you have.

One of the biggest problem in the game is the amount of stats and character builds you can do makes the game way to difficult and players that dont understand how the game works in that regards can completely screw their games and be forced to start from scratch. The game does a really poor job of explaining how the overall stats work and the only way to learn about them is looking at help menu and read it or go to the manual. 

On the positive side when you learn to make a proper build your mid-late game characters can have quite impressive abilities and power, the high level spell effects are rather impressive.

Also it is worth mentioning some of the achievements don't work properly or don't work at all.

Overall I liked the game however the high learning curve that can really punish you is something that only some people can tolerate. And the game only really offers a couple of playthroughs in terms of story and in regards to builds I dont think that people will play purely on the interest of seeing builds with diferent weapons, the spells are nice but they will not make the players play the game again just to see their high level form.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025676649', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1695, 'last_played': 1444101274}
review: Gameplay is fun - tactics are good, character building is flexible and enjoyable. The amount of RNG in battles does get frustrating and the skills aren't well balanced. Story and characters leaves a lot to be desired.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007227242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1444560806}
review:
Another entry for the Thank-you-German-Game-Developers award. The game does not even start. I tried every little thing from 5 different forums. Nothing. Crashes on start. So after
Gothic
Gothic 2
Gothic 3
The Guild 
The Guild 2
etc
yet nother reason to never buy games from Germany ever again. Pains me, as I am from Germany. But I guess bug fixing and quality assurance do not exist for German game developers. Refund requested.

review:
Sch√∂nes spiel macht sehr viel laune und hatt auserdem auch ein gewisses d√ºsteres setting macht mir sehr viel spa√ü und ich finde es klasse stry hat sch√∂ne plot twist und ist ansich auch sch√∂n gemahct auserdem ist fast alles vertont wuhu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038538764', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 8981, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8662, 'last_played': 1444013609}
review:
Bockschwere lineare Rundenstrategie im Das Schwarze Auge (DSA) Universum mit kleinen Macken und nicht funktionierenden Steam-Erfolgen.

Die grosse St√§rke dieses Spieles sind die K√§mpfe. Sie haben eine grosse taktische Tiefe und spielen 
im Rundenstrategie-Genre ganz oben mit. Oft ist auch der Einsatz von interaktiven Objekten bei einem Kampf gefordert,
damit man siegreich vom Platz geht. Es kommt auf das richtige Zusammenspiel der Spezialisten (Nah,- und Fernk√§mpfer,
Magier) an. Echt super!

Wichtig ist auch zu wissen, dass der Schwierigkeitsgrad recht heftig ist. Ich habe viel Rollenspiel und DSA Erfahrung,
hatte aber auf "hart" teilweise sehr heftige Herausforderungen. Dem Normalspieler empfehle ich den "leichten" und
erfahreneren Spielern den "mittleren" Schwierigkeitsgrad. Damit man mit dem Schwierigkeitsgrad gut zurecht kommt, sollte man sich am Anfang Zeit einplanen und √ºberlegen, wie genau man seine Charaktere entwickeln will. Beim Magier kann man nur ein paar Zauber maxen und die wollen gut √ºberlegt sein. Ob die √úberlegungen stimmen, bekommt man im sp√§teren Spielverlauf immer mehr mit und machen auch nen grossen Reiz des Spiels aus. Aber dadurch ist halt auch ein verskillen m√∂glich!

Insgesamt war der Schwierigkeitsgrad in den ca. 200 K√§mpfen konstant und fordernd, mit einigen √§rgerlichen Ausnahmen. Einige dieser unbalancierten K√§mpfe waren optional, einige der K√§mpfe aber nicht. Sehr schade, dass man
so oft neuladen muss, bis die Gegner nicht t√∂dlich vorgehen, ohne das man was machen kann.

Auch gab es zuviel Erfahrungspunkte im Spiel. Ich konnte meine Party voll ausbauen und noch einige "Extras" leisten.
So geht der Schwierigkeitsgrrad ab nem bestimmten Punkt leider nach  unten...

Leider gibt es auch nen Zauberspruch (Hast Stufe 3) der fast wie ein Cheat ist und auch den Schwierigkeitsgrad
bedeutend absenkt.

Apropos Zauber: Richtig super sind √ºbrigens die Effekte der Zauber. Die Zauber selbst gibt es jeweils in 4 Stufen und die h√∂chste Stufe hat oftmals nen Effekt f√ºrs ganze Schlachtfeld. Da die Zauber jeweils optisch und akkustisch echt gelungen sind, hat man noch mehr Spass an den K√§mpfen.

Der gr√∂sste Negativpunkt: Trotz das viel Arbeit und Liebe in das Spiel gesteckt wurde, wird es nach Erscheinen
kaum "gepflegt". Es gibt ziemlich viele Steam-Erfolge, die einfach immer noch nicht funktionieren! Das ist den Entwicklern schon lange bekannt. Getan hat sich da aber seitdem nichts mehr. Auch wurde im Forum zugesagt,
Waffenschadenssteigerungen durch K√∂rperkraft klar zu machen (ab welchem Wert gibt es eine Steigerung). Trotz Zusage der Entwickler im Januar 2014 im offiziellen Forum ist dies immer noch nicht geschehen. Schwach!!!

Trotz allem freue ich mich auf Blackguards 2, da es wenige Rundenstategietitel mit dieser Tiefe und der starken Lizenz auf dem Markt gibt! Deshalb klare Kaufempfehlung an Fans des Genres!

Tip: Das Spiel mit nem Krieger zu spielen ist am einfachsten. Schwerer wird es mit Bogensch√ºtze und ganz schwer mit Magier (besonders am Anfang).

author: {'steamid': '76561198083366021', 'num_games_owned': 1142, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1443965595}
review:
Looks great, plays horribly...

-Percentages don't mean a thing apparently... 100% chance to hit shot, misses... how, why?
-Immense difficulty spikes majorly created by the shabby percentages...
-sufficient gear and cash are hard to come by, no grinding possible...
- have to quit playing, easy basic game, miss every shot every time even though  all the shots have percentages between 80 and 100%... on easy.... every shot... and the foes hit nearly every shot... on easy... nearly every shot...
This could have been a great turn-based rpg, but this way of being defeated, may be alluring to some, but to me this game is the dark souls of turn-based strategy, not because of skill requirements, but just just impossible hit-percentages...

author: {'steamid': '76561198026667042', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 2412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2216, 'last_played': 1444531350}
review:
I really like this game and the German pen and paper system it's based on. The plot is very good compared to today's standards. The voice acting is superb, except for a few characters- executioner.... It's a pleasure to look at, and for the most part the game runs smoothly. That said, it can be worth it if it's on a 75%+ sale.

I'm still giving it a negative rating because of how many times the damn game crashes or freezes on a loading screen. The latest save-game file constantly corrupts making you backtrack. The tooltip isn't kidding- save often!!! Waaay too much fubar and frustration, when most of my games work fine.

<Edit: I am struggling to just play without crashes, and it completely took out my new rig last night. Unexpected shutdown was attributed to the apps path of this game, as well as the temporary files in memory. I don't know why I'm even strugglebusing myself through the rest of the game when it freezes on every other loading screen...>
