author: {'steamid': '76561198004740941', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1398, 'last_played': 1451346733}
review: I really wanted to give this game a chance but it is not that good. I hate the limited battlefiled view and that you need specific trainers to get certain skills. I may try to finish it all the way just to see the end of the story but will think twice if I want to replay it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022385974', 'num_games_owned': 1420, 'num_reviews': 162, 'playtime_forever': 2675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2675, 'last_played': 1424802728}
review:
Bad graphic, poor tactic, strange story.
Why recommended then? Hardcore!
I mean it's really hard to complete. You will play, died, died, and died again. And play!
6 turns for saving girl among enemies and 5 turns you need for move? Easy!
Fight against almost immortal dwarf? Pff, not so hard as some missions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032268167', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5088, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4264, 'last_played': 1444068548}
review:
Das Spiel orientiert sich sehr stark an der Regelvorlage vom DSA Pen & Paper, mit allen St√§rken und allen Schw√§chen.

Wer die Vorlage kennt, findet sich schnell zurecht, denn die F√§higkeiten und Zauber werden wie √ºblich gesteiert. Neulinge werden jedoch etwas Einarbeitungszeit einkalkulieren m√ºssen. Man kann die Charaktere definitiv verskillen.

Das Spiel besteht eigentlich zu 80% aus einer Aneinanderreihung von Kampfszenen, die nach DSA-Manier in Kampfrunden ablaufen. Die K√§mpfe werden lose durch die recht klassische und liniare d√ºstere Story zusammen gehalten.
Nat√ºrlich gibt es auch viele Nebenquets, die aber selten sonderlich aufregend sind.
Die Story geht an sich in Ordnung, verliert aber durch die Kampflastigkeit etwas an Fahrt
Positiv finde ich, dass man nicht die klassischen Helden spielt, sondern Antihelden, die mehr oder weniger unfreiwillig in die Story hinein geraten. 
Im Spiel sind auch div. klassische Rollenspielerwitze und Klischees nett verarbeitet, was ich wirklich witzig fand.

Negativ finde ich, dass die Story recht locker insziniert ist. Die K√§mpfe als solches sind nicht sonderlich mitivierend, da auch das Zufallselement sehr hoch ist und man mit etwas W√ºrfelpech auch h√§ufiger verliert und neu laden muss. Erst zum Ende hin werden die Videosequenzen dichter und man wird mehr mit genommen.

Insgesamt kann ich das Spiel f√ºr Rollenspieler bedingt empfehlen, wenn man mit Schw√§chen in der Spielmechanik leben kann und nicht allzuviel Wert auf eine aufregende Inszenierung legt.
Wer mit Pen & Paper nichts anfangen kann, sollte auf jeden Fall die Finger von dem Spiel lassen. 

Ich pers√∂nlich w√ºrde f√ºr das Spiel nicht mehr als 10‚Ç¨ ausgeben. Ich habe es im Sale f√ºr 3,99 ‚Ç¨ bekommen und daf√ºr war es schon in Ordnung. Als Vollpreisspiel h√§tte ich es mir aber nicht gekauft. Im Vergleich mit anderen Vollpreisspielen wie z.B. Skyrim oder Mass Effect ist dann der Vollpreis eigentlich auch nicht zu rechtfertigen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995497021', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 2745, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2640, 'last_played': 1442762119}
review:
Blackguards parvient √† rester satisfaisant sur certains des fondamentaux du genre, √† savoir le leveling et les combats.

La mont√©e en exp√©rience des personnages se fait sans niveau d‚Äôexp√©rience √† proprement parler. En effet, tous les points d‚Äôexp√©rience accumul√©s au cours des combats et des qu√™tes termin√©es vont pouvoir √™tre d√©pens√©s dans l‚Äôint√©gralit√© des  caract√©ristiques (force, courage, etc), comp√©tences (pi√®ges, soin, etc), maitrise des armes et des sorts, comme bon nous semble. Sachant qu‚Äôil y a pl√©thore de param√®tres pour chaque personnage, la d√©couverte du syst√®me de leveling est un peu abrupte au d√©but, mais une fois qu‚Äôon s‚Äôy est fait, le syst√®me nous apparait comme tr√®s complet et nous permet de sp√©cialiser nos personnages finement, comme bon nous semble.

Les combats, malgr√© quelques soucis de finition question jouabilit√©, sont tr√®s tactiques, et ils se jouent √† la fa√ßon du X-Com moderne, √† savoir que notre personnage a le droit pendant son tour √† ¬´ un mouvement plus une action ¬ª ou bien ¬´ un mouvement √©tendu ¬ª. Si ce syst√®me a fait ses preuves, on regrettera cependant l‚Äôabsence du syst√®me de points d‚Äôaction √† la mani√®re d‚Äôun Fallout qui permet une gestion encore plus fine des op√©rations tactiques. Le plateau de chaque zone de combat est divis√© en hexagone et l‚Äôordre d‚Äôinitiative des participants (personnages ou ennemis) est clairement affich√© en bas de l‚Äô√©cran.

Malheureusement, l‚Äôensemble du reste du titre pr√©sente trop de d√©fauts qui, mis bout √† bout, finissent par g√¢cher l‚Äôexp√©rience de jeu. En voici les principaux :

La gestion de l‚Äôinventaire est simplement une calamit√©.
Le classement des objets dans l‚Äôinventaire g√©n√©ral (globalis√© entre tous les personnages) se fait en fonction de leur date d‚Äôacquisition, ce qui est stupide.
Le syst√®me de comparaison entre l‚Äôarme/armure √©quip√©e et celle disponible dans l‚Äôinventaire est bien trop impr√©cis pour √™tre d‚Äôune quelconque utilit√©. 
Chaque personnage dispose de 3 slots d‚Äôarmes (main gauche + main droite). Mais par exemple la n√©cessit√© d‚Äôallouer √† chaque arc (main gauche du slot X) son lot de fl√®ches (main droite du slot X) est √©galement une aberration sans nom, puisque ces m√™mes fl√®ches ne pourront √™tre utilis√©es par ce personnage avec l‚Äôarc du slot Y.
J‚Äôen passe et des meilleures‚Ä¶

Le jeu nous impose en permanence son rythme.
La gestion de l‚Äôaventure au cours des chapitres 1 et 2 est une catastrophe, avec un ultra-dirigisme qui donne la naus√©e, et on se doit d‚Äôenchainer parfois jusqu‚Äô√† 3 combats sans que le jeu ne nous demande quoi que ce soit. Sachant que la gestion de l‚Äô√©quipe ne peut se faire qu‚Äôen dehors des combats, leur enchainement peut vite tourner au d√©sastre.
Les choses s‚Äôarrangent n√©anmoins √† partir du chapitre 3, avec la quasi-int√©gralit√© des lieux qui se d√©bloque et la possibilit√© de faire les qu√™tes secondaires comme bon nous semble.

Enfin, le d√©faut IMPARDONNABLE pour un jeu de tactique faisant intervenir autant de "lancers de d√©s virtuels" : la gestion des statistiques ne suit simplement aucune logique math√©matique. 
Chaque action d‚Äôattaque entreprise par un personnage au cours d‚Äôun combat est notifi√©e √† l‚Äô√©cran par un pourcentage de r√©ussite. Mais le jeu est simplement incapable de g√©rer proprement ces statistiques et il m‚Äôest arriv√© de rater un coup affich√© initialement √† 100% de chance de r√©ussite. V√©ridique !!! Et il n‚Äôest pas rare d‚Äôenchainer avec vos personnages des √©checs successifs affich√©s √† 90% de chance de r√©ussite. Ce manque flagrant de coh√©rence math√©matique fait qu‚Äôil n‚Äôest pas rare de devoir recommencer de nombreux combats sous pr√©texte que nos personnages d√©butent tous leur premier tour avec une action rat√©e, le retour de b√¢ton de l‚Äôadversaire √©tant alors souvent saignant. A devenir maboule dingo !

En conclusion, Blackguards pr√©sente dans son ensemble vraiment trop de d√©fauts, dont certains sont fondamentaux, et qui mis bout √† bout finissent par rendre le joueur fou. Vous voulez du combat tactique en tour par tour, pr√©f√©rez lui le dernier X-Com, voire les premiers Fallout !

author: {'steamid': '76561198023344725', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 15850, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5246, 'last_played': 1593556708}
review:
I've just finished this game!!! That's awesone!!! I really can't find the words: the plot, the atmosphere, the gameplay, the music, the characters. All things are on the highest level!!! After I finished the game I wanted to try to make my own character.
The only dissapointent is very often bug, especially in Meghbilla city.
I really can recommend this game... even if the man doesn't like turn-based games! 
10/10.

Wenn man es in einem Sale f√ºr unter 10 Euro ersteht, ist es durchaus zu empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019672607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1740, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1540019503}
review:
Very nice! The story is interesting, the characters are fun and believable. And the combat! Its so fun to play something that isn't as easy as everyhting else these days. Also the combat mechanics are pretty strong.

If you think you like a challenge and turn based combat, this one is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018390149', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 646, 'last_played': 1438700236}
review: A game I highly anticipated but found extremely boring. The story was staid and stale and the constant fighting got dull real quick.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161696496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 656, 'last_played': 1442604263}
review:
Boring.
Game consist only of chain of fights with running over ridiculous hexes.  Yes exactly that - one boring fight over small map with hexes is chained to another equally boring fight by small borring dialogue.
That could be forgivable with group DnD novices with paper and pen, but not for game.
Besides invetory information is either buggy or terrible - all armors shows armor rating 0 (0) - that is no any protection by any armor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036655374', 'num_games_owned': 728, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1442412466}
review:
This is a game that was recommended by my games magazine. Still after reading the reviews here on steam I was not convinced so it ended up on my wish list,  I gave it at a try when it was for sale at 75%.

This is a game of tactical rpg combat but for me it gets old very fast, I want more from my rpg:s than only combat. Also since this is combat only they should at least have let you build all characters but no you can only build one, you are stuck with the rest of the team.

The layout is also in my opinion clunky and you can't rotate the map to get a better view, sometimes characters can be hard to see hidden behind objects on the map.

I cannot recommend this game but if you are really in to the tactical combat part of roleplaying games and want a challenge give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032729607', 'num_games_owned': 1080, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 4287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4287, 'last_played': 1442546070}
review:
Where to start? 
Most reviewers/trolls/noobs outright complain about the difficulty of the game, calling out bugs on things like dmg type resistance or getting knocked down because they cant figure out character builds.
if you want a game that its pretty much like click here to win, you are in the wrong genre.
if you want a game where you dont want to retry the same fight a few times to get it right, you are in the wrong genre.
This is a turn based rol-playing game, you won't get things right from the beginning withouth knowing the game beforehand. 
I can almost assure you that you might screw up the builds of your party and there wont be an easy way to fix that, but thats the idea of the game, you either push through, start over or go to forums or reviews to whine like a noob because you failed to see the game manual/help/build guides.

Now if you like challenges, and turn based RPGs this one is for you, you have magic, killer snipers and swords! 

bit of a spoiler if you may
you get a very functional party consisting of: A greedy sort-of-crazy dwarf, a gigollo magician, a stoner elf, a killer jungleman and a witch.
you can mold the characters as you damn well please, with some restrictions of course, but who dosnt want to have a mage in his party?

what else? main character is not gender or class locked so that gives you some freedom to choose what you want to do.

oh and yes don't forget: willpower -> def vs spells : body control -> falling/getting knocked!

author: {'steamid': '76561198062720658', 'num_games_owned': 350, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 933, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 933, 'last_played': 1442106748}
review: Okay - this is a slightly older game, but I can't put it down. The story is fantastic and the gameplay is a lovely combination of point & click, strategy and RPG.  I usually can't stand strategy games, but this has kept me hooked.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015421701', 'num_games_owned': 370, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1682, 'last_played': 1643835686}
review:
Dieses Spiel hat all das was man sich als DSAler erhoft!

Einen super Soundtrack, eine atmosph√§risch stimmige Spielwelt
und einen guten Einblick in das doch recht komplizierte Regelwerk.
Wenn man ein standart Abenteuer mit standart B√∂sewichten in 
einer visuell ansprechenden Welt erleben m√∂chte funktioniert
das hiermit sehr gut.
Das wichtigste am ganzen Spiel ist eigentlich das es sich auch tats√§chlich wie DSA anf√ºhlt!
Wenn man seit Monaten leider keine Pen&Paper Gruppe mehr zusammenbekommen hat 
ist das hier eine Lohnenswerte Alternative mit dem sch√∂nen Zusatz das man jeden Char selbst 
spielt und levelt.
Die K√§mpfe sind anspruchsvoll aber mit einer guten Portion Taktik immer zu schaffen. 
Zu bem√§ngeln ist lediglich das der Umfang nicht das volle DSA Universum darstellt und sich eigtl. nur ( bis zum jetzigen Spielstand ) auf kleine Teile des Horasreiches und Al'Anfa beschr√§nkt. Dadurch wird das Spiel aber auch f√ºr DSA Neulinge greifbarer und leichter verst√§ndlich. Au√üerdem bekommt man selbst als DSA Spieler einen sch√∂nen Einblick in Klassen die man selbst noch nie gespielt hat.

Wenn die Spielreihe so bleibt und sich der Umfang noch erweitert bin ich ein neuer Fan! 
Man muss sich von der bescheidenen Wertung keinesfalls abschrecken lassen. Klare Empfehlung!

author: {'steamid': '76561197978827620', 'num_games_owned': 955, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 2626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2626, 'last_played': 1441716737}
review:
Das Spiel ist nicht schlecht, ich empfehle es aber nur, wenn man verzweifelt auf der Suche nach einem Rollenspiel ist.

Ich habe es auf Schwer gespielt und muss sagen, die K√§mpfe basieren gr√∂√ütenteils nur auf Gl√ºck und sind teilweise absurd unfair. Zum Gl√ºck ist die KI d√§mlich sonst w√§re es noch frustrierender. Ich hatte zwar keine perfekt geskillte Gruppe aber das ist auch nicht das Problem. Das Problem sind die teilweise an d√ºmmliche Bedingungen gekn√ºpften K√§mpfe. Wie z.B. inerhalb von 5 Runden einen  bestimmten Punkt erreichen. Sehr frustrierend wenn man den selben Mist  √ºber 10x versuchen muss.

Die Charkterentwicklung ist daf√ºr aber gut gelungen, ganz im Gegensatz zur Gestaltung. Ich hatte nach der Erstellung schon keine Lust mehr da man nur 5 "K√∂pfe" zur Auswahl hat und die sich an H√§sslichkeit gegenseitig √ºberbieten.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971019221', 'num_games_owned': 155, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 4697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2357, 'last_played': 1445920752}
review: Some maps are just brutally hard and have to be repeated many times until random dice rolls work out in your favor. An otherwise OK game is really ruined by this lack of balancing and tuning. The engine is pretty cool, but the game content feels rushed and slapped together. Maybe Blackguards 2 is better. This is worth a couple bucks, not much more IMO.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121881744', 'num_games_owned': 1407, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 2617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2219, 'last_played': 1441413037}
review:
Blackguards ist ein wirklich hervorragendes RPG, in das man sich eigentlich nur verlieben kann. Der aktions√ºchtige Gamer ist hier allerdings v√∂llig falsch. Wer allerdings spannende und mitrei√üende Storys liebt und sich nicht schnell von Fehlschl√§gen und teilweise stundenlangen Versuchen einen Kampf zu meistern entmutigen l√§sst, wird dieses Spiel lieben. 

Ich kann nur eine absolute Empfehlung, mit einem unmissverst√§ndlichem Wink auf die vielen schlechten Bewertungen, aussprechen. Das Spiel basiert nun einmal auf DSA und in Aventurien funktioniert halt nicht immer alles direkt so wie man will, ganz genau wie im echten Leben.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018236570', 'num_games_owned': 235, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 768, 'last_played': 1442621311}
review:
I bought this on sale for like $3. I regret buying it.

Pros:
Hex-based tactical combat
Lots of character customization
Points system for leveling skills
Environmental effects such as setting bushes on fire, slipping in puddles, or knocking stalagtites off the ceiling of a cave

Cons:
You will likely hit your opponents maybe 10% of the time. You have a hit percentage ranging from 0 to 100. This is based on your skill with the weapon, your attack stat, and the level of the creature you're attacking. This does not take into account their ability to dodge or parry. A character (opponent or ally) can parry the first physical attack against them each turn. They can dodge any number of attacks per turn. So, if you have a 90% chance to hit, it is then further reduced behind the scenes by their dodge rating, and again by parry if they have not yet been hit. If you have anything less than say, 80% chance to hit, it may take you dozens of turns to end a battle that could have ended in like 6.

Enemies at the beginning of the game hit every hard, and rarely miss. You can increase your dodge and parry ratings through skills, but at character select you can't exactly make it huge. This would be fine, if it weren't for the fact that enemies can quite often hit for 10-15 damage, while your character only has about 30 health. Early game you only have 3 party members, and very often face off against 5+ enemies. It's easy to get swarmed, so using choke points is a must-- at least it would be if the majority of the levels they put you in weren't open rooms.

Cover doesn't seem to do anything. One of the earliest tips you get is that you are harder to hit in partial cover, and even harder to hit in full cover, like behind a tree. Archers have no trouble hitting you from the full length of the map behind full cover for 5-8 damage a turn, and it will take at least 2 or 3 turns to be able to reach them.

Some quests/scenarios are outright impossible if you try them too early, and the game has no qualms about sending you to your death. A good example of an early scenario in this game is facing a Wood Troll (like a treant). It has a ton of health and does a lot of damage (like 15-20 per hit), but it's slow and in a gaseous swamp. You can stand in front of a gas pocket and  use a fire spell or torch on the gas to explode it a few times to win the fight. You could do this at level 1 if you wanted, but an uninformed player would try to rush it and die quickly. 

A bad example is later on. You fight some dwarves in an arena. They have a lot of health, do a lot of damage, and can move as far as you. You're *supposed* to use the same method as the Wood Troll. Stand in front of the mace trap before it activates, lure the enemy into it, and do most of the damage through the trap. My issue is I was underleveled, and there was no way for me to know this until it was too late. The enemy dodged 100% of my attacks, knocked down a character per turn, and the melee dwarf hit for 15+ damage per turn plus 5 poison per turn while 2 of my characters had ~30 hp, and one with 46. The melee dward also parried the trap that was supposed to deal the damage to him each turn, so he was functionally invincible. I tried at least a dozen times, looked online, and saw the only real way to win the fight is to ignore the mission until you had another party member and were a little more leveled. Looking at my saves, I had one auto save right before the fight, a quick save right before the fight, and a manual save about an hour and a half prior (Which isn't the game's fault, but frustrating nonetheless).

You can't level skills without finding a trainer, even if you meet the pre-requisites to unlock it, or had the option to learn it during character creation. If I don't spend at least one point into the mend wounds ability at character creation, I cannot learn it until much later when I find the right trainer. I would understand for some skills, but for the basic levels of some passive abilities or skills it doesn't make much sense.

Overall, the game is difficult for the sake of being difficult, but not in a way that self improvement can make it any easier. Unlike an action game like Dark Souls, dying isn't always the result of you fucking up. A lot of the time, it's because a creature rolled the highest it possibly could 3 turns in a row, or all 3 of your characters missed every single roll 3 turns in a row. If you're okay with restarting a mission over and over just to beat it, or to avoid getting knocked down and started on fire before your first turn, go for it. If you're as easily frustrated as me at a game where RNG is the core mechanic of the game, avoid it, even for $3.00

author: {'steamid': '76561198035857861', 'num_games_owned': 230, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 701, 'last_played': 1441135005}
review:
Grandi potenzialit√†... sfruttate di merda.

Una serie di comparti, da quello grafico alla customizzazione e al combattimento, sono davvero ben fatti e molto curati e mi fa incazzare che tutto ci√≤ che di buono ha questo gioco sia rovinato da scelte di gameplay, stuttura mappe, gestione incontri/finanze e sopratutto il BILANCIAMENTO della difficolt√† dei nemici e scelte di design delle sfide.

chi √® il genio che ha pensato di mettere scontri in serie senza possibilit√† di cure (limitate gi√† di suo) con mappe fatte a dir poco col culo (ctrl+c e ctrl+v su questo quello e quello. poi ricopro il 75% della mappa di trappole e di NOIOSISSIMI buratti che non colpiscono mai e danno solo noia e fastidio nell'aspettare che finiscano la loro animazione), con scelte di bilanciamento delle medesime sfide al limite del ridicolo? ("ma si per salvare tizio devi essere qui entro 5 turni, 3 ti servono per arrivarci e in mezzo hai 6 nemici con altrettante trappole", oppure "ma si, mettiamo due nani fullati di pozioni di cura che asfaltano ogni pg, senza contare che il party √® NUDO e senza possibilit√† di usare gli oggetti precedentemente acquisiti". davvero si, ottima idea!)

in definitiva; il gioco, per un'amante degli rpg tattici a turni, sarebbe anche molto bello, se determinate scelte di level design e bilanciamenti vari non fossero stati fatti col culo! giocare al normale √® frustrante da morire, senza parlare che se sbagli un salvataggio al momento sbagliato, tipo entrare (senza sapere NULLA di cosa sta per accadere) in una sequela di eventi no stop senza tregua ne possibilit√† di rifocillamenti vari...  devi ricominciare da capo.
e non dimentichiamoci la bellisima parte "sei nudo, vai e combatti ma prima comprati questo equip costoso come un rene che poi non ti servir√† pi√π appena riavrai la tua roba". 200 monete d'oro butte via nel bottino, ole!

no programmatori, no... prendete chi ha fatto queste scelte di level design e mandatelo a coltivare rape in zimbawe, forse far√† meno danni.

consigliato per l'acquisto? NO.
mi brucia il culo ad averlo comprato anche se ci ho speso sopra solo 3 euro, non oso immaginare se qualcuno volesse spendercene di pi√π. pazzia pensare di spendere pi√π di 4 euro per un titolo del genere.

 se volete un buon gioco dello stesso tipo, prendete la saga X-COM, non questa merda.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030767212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 1643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1643, 'last_played': 1441209497}
review:
Soll man das Spiel nun lieben oder hassen? Eine bei Blackguards sehr schwierige Entscheidung. Die Story und die K√§mpfe sind an sich ganz gut umgesetzt. Aber die Details und das Drumherum sind irgendwie nicht stimmig. So sind die K√§mpfe z.B. durch den Zufallsfaktor manchmal recht schwierig und erst im zweiten Anlauf zu meistern. Aber womit wird der Sieg belohnt? Das Gold reicht kaum um sich auch nur einen Heiltrank zu kaufen und die eroberten Gegenst√§nde sind fast immer der gleiche Schrott. Und was tun mit der Erfahrung? Jetzt mit 50 bis 500 Punkten eine der mehr als 50 F√§higkeiten, Zauber oder Talente um einen Punkt steigern um ..., ja um was √ºberhaupt dadurch zu erreichen? Ah, eine neue R√ºstung, bei der sind 2 von 10 Eigenschaften besser und nur eine schlechter als vorher..., ist die jetzt eigentlich wirklich gut?
Zusammengefasst, das Spiel belohnt den geneigten Spieler kaum und konfrontiert ihn stattdessen mit einem un√ºbersichtlichen Zahlensystem, dessen tats√§chlicher Nutzen dem verw√∂hnten Spieler von heute weitgehend verschlossen bleibt. Insbesondere beim Ausbilden der Charaktere weis man eigentlich kaum, was man dort tut und was dies am Ende bewirkt.
Wer sich f√ºr Rollenspiele interessiert, kann gerne mal im Sale zuschlagen, aber f√ºr den Vollpreis kann ich das Spiel nicht empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026461830', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 2855, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 888, 'last_played': 1536777667}
review:
This is a game for the hardcore.  I got Blackguards 1 & 2 for $11 on sale; I wouldn't buy it before because of the mixed reviews.

It's basically like old school King's Bounty but better.  I'm only 10 hours in, but it feels like 20, which is a good sign.  I love the customization of the character and I am annihilating shit on normal, though I've read that the game is extremely hard.  Maybe I am just hardcore.

If you like a challenge and are willing to reload, get this game.  I can't reccomend it at full price; I would never risk $40 on a game with 60% positive reviews.  If it's $8 or less, go for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008455392', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 518, 'last_played': 1440961899}
review:
I've been playing rpgs since before Baulders Gate.  I saw this title on sale for 3.99 so I thought well how bad could it be? Well, bad, really bad.  If I had paid full price I'm not sure what i'd have done.  Save your 4$ and get a coffe or something.

Graphics are fine, no ability to rotate map to get a better view,  menus are just meh, loot drops are trivial, there are not enough quests available to prepare the characters for extended fight with multiple times the number of higher lvl npc's, animations severly interrupt the flow of the game, just all around annoyance.  

It looks like a deal but save yourself the trouble.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117901261', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 3126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2384, 'last_played': 1511017329}
review: An entertaining turn based strategy. The plot is not very deep, still it is meaningful. Dialogues are ok. What I liked most was the fact that you can interact with the environmet - it can have nagtive effects on you and your enemies which you can turn to your advantage. Another good thing is that there is sometimes more than one way to win a battle and that seems to affect the plot at times.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986504785', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3797, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3460, 'last_played': 1399353830}
review: The game was great, the QA for the game was not. Ran into a number of issues that got me stuck because of glitches.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981176523', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 950, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 950, 'last_played': 1440891221}
review: Blackguards was released over a year and a half ago and it STILL hasn't worked out all the bugs (First series of lizard fights, I could take out the first crystal with melee or ranged, but the second crystal doesn't allow a ranged OR magic attack, only melee. Either way you look at it, there's a bug in there), a sequel has been released before the first one was balanced correctly (apparently a foot of water has a 75% chance of knocking over someone walking through it - total bullsh!t), and the devs didn't fix NUMEROUS complaints that I've read about on forums (You have a fixed AP pool as you play the game, if you pick the wrong skills to level then you literally and I do mean literally F yourself right into a corner and are completely unable to recover unless you want to start over. Random battles on already-completed maps would be an easy fix for this but apparently the coding team is too lazy to put in the work to make it happen)......I'm glad I got this game for 4 bucks and waited for the sale. I won't make that same mistake on the sequel. Uninstalled. I had high hopes for this game but when the devs don't fix problems and the game clearly has balancing issues, there's no way I'm going to waste more time and effort trying to play it or bothering with a sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978337815', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 2261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2261, 'last_played': 1429661622}
review: Wow.  This game is 3.99 right now. If you like turn based combat it's definitely worth a shot.  The character progression and how to build your character properly is a bit different from the norm, but half way through the game I was at the point where I was seriously considering restarting just to focus my builds a bit more. Aside from that though, the game can be quite challenging and will take up a good chunk of time, so you will surely get your monies worth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056818248', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 3170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3170, 'last_played': 1441289046}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198063389004', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 4323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4323, 'last_played': 1440712291}
review:
Very oldschool-ish RPG with turn-based fights, rich dialogues and wide character advancement options.
Pros:
1. RNG (it makes the fights so challenging)
2. Dialogues with humor and consequences
3. Rather advanced character development system with lots of attributes, talents and special skills
4. Plot twists
Cons:
1. RNG (when it stops being fun it becomes so annoying you will sometimes hate it)
2. Not so many useful spells
3. Crappy loot system (traders don't refresh their inventories, lots of similar useless weapons, limited ammunition supply, mage armor almost non-existent)
4. Buggy achievements
Still highly recommended to any RPG fan.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031551599', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2485, 'last_played': 1423071775}

author: {'steamid': '76561197995253696', 'num_games_owned': 836, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1485, 'last_played': 1440360065}
review:
The game starts off well enough but I eventually had to quit.  I was getting so frustrated I nearly threw my mouse through my monitor.  Blackguards is presented as a game returning to the core roots of RPG strategy goodness.  Just check out the multiple videos from Daedalic above for all the stuff that sounds so great about this game.  What is presented sounded awesome to me but in reality my two attempts through the game turned into a frustrating slog from one scenario to the next.  

I got hooked on the story from the start which turned out to be a prison break.  Nothing ground-shakingly new here but it worked for bringing three main characters together and launching them off on what was to be a quest to save the world.  The cut-scene interactions just propel the story forward, but did contain some humorous dialogue.  City/settlement locations are really just screens you click on to visit the tavern/shop/quest giver, etc.  Again, nothing earth-shattering for the genre but where this game was supposed to shine was in the combat.

And the combat on many of the levels was excellent.  Some of the scenarios were very challenging and I truly felt good when I had achieved victory conditions.  You certainly cannot simply build up your characters and then rush through everything.  Planning was necessary.   All that was great.

Specific building of your characters is crucial to the point that if you build them wrong, you will find that the difficulty spikes.  Character building is handled through allocating skill points.  There are a lot of options (FIVE screens worth) and very little in-game guidance on what to build up first.  I am sure most players will do what I did and end up resorting to the forums and walkthroughs to know how best to maximize their points.  It should not be this difficult or nebulous on building up your characters - especially with this many options.  The game reminds you to save often so you can go back to an earlier time and rebuild if needed.  But that still stings a little knowing that you lost that progress and will need to make it up.

But then the game started throwing out some curve balls on the scenarios and I found myself needing to restart certain ones again and again.  These levels were often fronted by a cut-scene dialogue that had to be clicked through again and again.  I just do not understand why they couldn't simply start the level with your characters on the field.  Many of these levels had special rules or situations that were not made apparent until you played them.  So you learned the "special" rules through failing at the level and had to try again.  And again.  And again.  

It does not help when the game chains scenarios together without a way to rest in-between.  You may find that by the end of the 2nd or 3rd scenario you are completely out of potions/health/magic/whatever.  And you may need to not only restart that level, but perhaps go back to a prior level so that you end with enough health/magic to be successful in the next one.  I could see the game doing this on hardcore difficulty for those who really enjoy upping the difficulty, but I just wanted to veg out after a hard day at work.  

By the time I was into the gladiator fights in chapter 2 I realized something.  The. Game. Was. No. Fun. 

I am recommending a pass on this one.  If you do buy it, wait for a nice Steam or bundle sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140365370', 'num_games_owned': 300, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 5000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2180, 'last_played': 1569862313}
review:
Basato su "The Dark Eye", Blackguards rappresenta una sorta di esperimento per i ragazzi di Daedalic Entertainment ben noti per le loro avventure grafiche, esperimento che chiarisco fin da subito risulta riuscito anche se il gioco non √® adatto a tutti a causa di una meccanica di gioco un po' atipica.

Senza svelare nulla sulla trama chiarisco fin da subito che i cosidetti "cattivi protagonisti" non sono poi quel gruppo di degenerati che si pu√≤ pensare ma risultano pi√π che altro un branco di disperati che tra intrighi e misteri decidono di collaborare tra loro; non mancano situazioni tragiche ma anche umoristiche che per√≤ lasciano spesso il tempo che trovano.
La trama in s√® non √® all'ultimo grido ma subisce un'evoluzione e tutto sommato invoglia a proseguire, alternando persino qualche flashback e approfondendo alcuni aspetti dei compagni di gioco, a patto per√≤ di dedicarsi ad alcune quest secondarie.

Graficamente il gioco risulta curato nelle ambientazioni ma non nei personaggi che appaiono come se fossero di una generazione precedente.
Personalmente ho apprezzato la scelta di disersificare le icone di alcuni nemici (per esempio tra gli scheletri c'√® n√® uno con la benda, altri hanno espressioni diverse e via dicendo) durante le battaglie, per√≤ il tutto si poteva applicare direttamente anche ai modelli dei personaggi.
Il gioco nonostante la natura strategica si adatta molto bene anche alla modalit√† Big Picture, a patto per√≤ di usare la risoluzione 1920X1080.
Nonostante le apparenze il gioco non √® propriamente digeribile per l'hardware moderno e pu√≤ capitare qualche leggero calo di framerate sopratutto durante l'esecuzione degli attacchi magici di livello 4.

Riguardo al sonoro √® buono il doppiaggio (esclusivamente in inglese) dei personaggi mentre la colonna sonora risulta tutto sommato orecchiabile anche se difficilmente sar√† ricordata al termine del gioco.

La giocabilit√† √® affidata quasi esclusivamente al mouse con qualche scorciatoia a livello di tastiera, fortunatamente viene in aiuto il tutorial iniziale che aiuta a comprendere le meccaniche di base anche se la maggior parte delle battaglie richiede pi√π l'astuzia (in particolare interagendo con gli elementi di sfondo) e la magia rispetto alla forza bruta. 
In Blackguards non esiste il "farming" e le battaglie spesso danno un numero di punti esperienza esiguo rispetto alle stesse, diventa cos√¨ importante distribuire i punti esperienza pi√π verso le abilit√† che riguardano magia e attacchi a distanza piuttosto che al resto e sopratutto diventa fondamentale fare affidamento sugli istruttori (ce ne sono in tutte le citt√† principali).

La longevit√† di Blackguards √® sicuramente buona, ho impiegato pi√π di 36 ore per completare la modalit√† storia al livello di difficolt√† normale dedicandomi anche a diverse quest secondarie, tuttavia penso che la maggior parte delle battaglie (che poi sono il fulcro del gioco) siano state eccessivamente lunghe e che probabilmente si poteva strutturare meglio il gioco, ad esempio l'inserimento di qualche minigioco (magari come tributo agli altri titoli di Daedalic) avrebbe allentato la presa e spezzato il ritmo.

In conclusione questo Blackguards √® un titolo di buona fattura, un po' punitivo ma anche appagante e tutto sommato persino divertente, qui su Steam √® ancora troppo caro ma la versione retail si trova intorno ai 10 euro.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056095914', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 847, 'last_played': 1440160647}
review:
So I've recently started Blackguards, and despite initially feeling a bit iffy on whether or not I would like it, I can say I've been pleasantly surprised. The plot line is good, with enough mystery to leave you wondering at what's happened (alongside the protagonist, who can be either male or female, and is voiced appropriately) and what's going to happen next. 

I haven't quite finished the game yet, but would recommend it to anyone. The characters are vibrant, each with their own personalities and quirks, and the battles are satisyfingly challenging.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024293426', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1439639126}
review:
+ Nette Spielidee, reduziert auf taktische K√§mpfe, Ausr√ºstung und Charakterentwicklung.

- Sehr st√∂rend ist jedoch der recht hohe Zufallsfaktor (wenn ich 95% Trefferchance dastehen habe, dann m√∂chte ich auch gerne zu 95% treffen, und nicht zu 20%). 

- Die gesamte Ausr√ºstung wirkt recht lieblos und nur m√§√üig durchdacht (Es werden teils Gegenst√§nde zu horrenden Preisen angeboten, fern von dem, was ich, trotz aller Nebenquests, besitze. Zudem findet man kaum Beute, wenngleich massenweise Gegner fallen...)

author: {'steamid': '76561198089299679', 'num_games_owned': 7216, 'num_reviews': 392, 'playtime_forever': 3671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3671, 'last_played': 1439348918}
review:
Well.. you know  when you watch TV and see the that really Juicy Burger in the commercial? Well. They actually use plastic burger with special lighting and a lot photo editing to create such an effect. When you actually go to that fast food and order the same burger it's quite different and the taste is no where near as good as you imaginged when you see it on TV.

This game is like that burger in the TV commercial.. 
Graphic is great, Sound is great and packaging and concept is awesome.

But when you actually play it it's like a Plastic burger that you will have a lot problem to chew on and it taste bad.

First.. The Story is Linear with supposed plot twist but it's quite badly rewriten with a lot things unexplained.
Second.. The Game combat mecanism is following a old DND3 type dice/board game. Which they did a good job translate into a PC game but it just doesn't work out.. Repetitive and uninteresting.
Third.. each battle map suppose give you options on how to finish the each map solution seems very linear and easy to guess. Each battle may have different enemy but they don't feell unique when i see a different one.
Fourth.. The Game difficulty is super hard. I am a DND vetern and studied quite abit of that dice game before i started and I have a tons of difficulty finish the game.
Fifth.. the game interface is not well designed and hard to operate.
Six:.. there are about 7 Achievements broken at the moment and from what i heard in the forum the developer is not gonna fix them.

Unless you are a die hard Dice game fan i wouldn't recommend anyone trying this.
4.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013731775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1922, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1922, 'last_played': 1439558125}
review:
I can not recommend this game. Even if it is purchased on offer.
I really wanted to like this game, as both the type of game and the developer, usually is something I love.
Daedalic Entertainment is usually  quality in my eyes.

Pros ..
Okay history
Okay voise acting
Great XP system
Nice skill tree
Difficult game, even at the lowest level, it is a struggle.

Cons ...
Very linear history
Unimportant person gallery
Monotonous in length
Mediocre graphics, but had the rest of the game worked, it had not had any impact
Too few weapons and equipment
Difficult game, even at the lowest level, it is a struggle.
Very small world
Messy quest log

author: {'steamid': '76561197970329288', 'num_games_owned': 2781, 'num_reviews': 1449, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1434312513}
review:
A non-biased quick look @ the game:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TrU3b1p3oQ8

What happens when the only hope of a threatened world lies not with heroes in shining armor, but in the hands of a band of misfits and criminals? Blackguards, a new turn-based strategy RPG, explores this very question. You will discover over 180 unique hex-based battlegrounds within a dark and mature story of crime, drugs, and murder. 

Play as a warrior, mage or hunter and customize your character's skills as you see fit. The challenging campaign delivers a story of doubt, treason and loss. You decide the course of the story at key turning points and determine its outcome. - Recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198012782759', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1546, 'last_played': 1437914845}
review:
This game is all about luck. No matter what you do, prepare to reload plenty of time because because you missed at a critical time. Or just missed your 95% chance serval times in a row while your enemys crit you and stack up those wounds on you.

This game oes many things right, I like the story and presentations. The characters and their interaction are fun but it all comes to naught because it utterly fails at the most important point: the combat.

I guess everyone that has fun with slot machines would like this game, everyone else shouls stay away.

review:
My interest in Blackguards didn't last long, for 2 reasons.

1. Character development seems to offer very many options, but barely appeals me. Other games manage to motivate by  meaningful and game changing new upgrades, I don't see that in Blackguard. Or it is too well hidden among dozens of minor options.

2. The UI is terrible. No further describtion required.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063811135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 3810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3810, 'last_played': 1436338048}
review:
Dicen que de la vista nace el amor, bueno, en este juego no se aplica, a primera vista el juego cae gordo y a segunda, m√°s gordo. Pero si le dedicas una tercera, vas a encontrarte con un gran juego. 

Es muy entretenido, con una historia muy bien desarrollada. Combates desafiantes pero gratificantes de superar. Personajes carism√°ticos, enemigos despreciables y una ambientaci√≥n hermosa.

Un punto negativo es el apartado t√©cnico, aunque en general me trabajo a 60 fps estables la mayor parte del tiempo, en algunos escenarios parece haber fugas de memoria inexplicables, igualmente cuando se activaban algunos hechizos el juego tartamudeaba. Pero por ser un juego de turnos, no afecta  mucho, aunque es molesto.

8/10 sin duda alguna.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989243295', 'num_games_owned': 893, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1435549404}
review:
Blackguards is a simple indie stratagy game, if you like a decent story with an indie budget, you will like Blackguards.
Here is my take on this title

https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=aKQ_ktw9wLw

author: {'steamid': '76561198005908329', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 2765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 945, 'last_played': 1450122876}
review:
This game is brilliant from top to bottom. The characters are rich and fun, and they interact with eachothers and the world in entertaining ways. The story hooks you up from minute one and has you enthralled throughout the game. Combat is tactical-and-strategy-heavy, you have to put your head on every single one of them, and even so, they can still get merciless if you fuck up a single turn. I wholeheartedly recomend this game, If i would make a game, it would be exactly like this.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198078492616', 'num_games_owned': 177, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 9283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5000, 'last_played': 1439346537}
review:
If you are looking for a solid challenging turn-based tactical RPG, loving to prepare carefully before each battle, enjoying conquering seemly uncontrollable RNG madness, you probably will like Blackguards.

Otherwise, if you're not hardcore enough, you might will hate this game a lot due to its difficulty and unfriendliness against causal gamers. You have been warned.

Pros: 
storyline
soundtrack
spells
character development (mechanics)
depth of the combat system

Cons: 
lack of internal combat information or complete instruction (ingame)
intensive resources for smooth walkthrough
annoying inventory management
slow progressing
limited itemization
outdated visual comparing to modern games
enemy girls always have sexier protraits *lol*

author: {'steamid': '76561198065545417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 8937, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8508, 'last_played': 1410729108}
review:
**** (of 5)
As a big fan of the role playing game DSA, I would give it even five stars, but to be honest, at times the game can be a bit tiresome in its battles, because they take quite some time. Still the grafics and the story is good. I also like the turn-based battles and the variations in it. There are many ways how you can improve your character and you have to decide on what strength you want to focus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022514722', 'num_games_owned': 1078, 'num_reviews': 212, 'playtime_forever': 2767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2767, 'last_played': 1437423733}
review:
NACHTRAG #1:
Ich habe nun den "Endkampf" gesehen ... oder eher ein Massaker. Ich wei√ü wirklich nicht was bei den Entwicklern "Einfach" bedeutet. Haben die das jeweils gespielt? Es gibt bisher in meinem Leben nur ein einziges Spiel, das mich mehr aufgeregt hat als das hier ... und Blackguards ist gerade dabei die #1 zu werden.

Ich bin Magier, Buffe meine Leute. Aurelia ist tot, weil ich von den 12(?) Pr√ºfungen nur ein einziges Mal einen Fehler gemacht habe. Wow ... wozu dann sich bei den anderen 11 √ºberhaupt noch anstrengen?

Also K√§mpfen wir zu 4 gegen endlose Massen an Gegnern. Die Zauberer werden dauernd niedergeworfen, sodass man keine Zeit f√ºr Buffs irgendeiner Art hat. Sobald die es dann schaffen mal nicht niedergeworfen zu werden ... tja ... dann sind die schon so am Arsch, dass sie nur noch sich selbst heilen d√ºrfen.

Meine Leute werden durch gegnerische Buffs geschw√§cht, sodass ich permanent gerade mal 40% Treffsicherheit habe. Das macht wirklich 0 Spa√ü. Taktische Herausforderun? Ich wei√ü nicht ... wenn man nicht ein mal zum Zug kommt ... da kann man noch so viel taktieren versuchen.

Ach ja ... was mich auch tierisch aufgeregt hat war, als ich mit Befreiungsschlag die Massen niederkn√ºppeln wollte ... 5 Runden hintereinander ... 3 Gegner gleichzeitig ... 95% Treffsicherheit ... kein einziges Mal getroffen.

Ich wei√ü nicht, ob ich das Spiel mit diesen Settings √ºberhaupt noch schaffen kann. Ich habe es jetzt mehrmals probiert ... aber in der letzten Runde gegen Urias habe ich keinerlei Chance auch nur einen verdammten Zug zu machen. Nur Naurim h√§lt es einigerma√üen aus ... trifft aber nichts, ist geblitzt, vergiftet etc.. Ich habe Antidots, Heiltr√§nke (+500) etc. mit ... aber das ist innerhlab 3 Runden aufgebraucht ... Alternative: Tod.

Ich bleibe dabei ... das Spiel ist nicht gebalanced. Wenn man einen auf Heiler macht und nicht wei√ü, dass sp√§ter Aurelia ins Team st√∂√üt und ebenfalls zaubern kann ... dann hat man am Ende so viel Schei√üe geskillt. Dabei habe ich mich sogar noch beherrschen k√∂nnen und die Heldenpunkte(?) gesammelt ... ich hatte √ºber 8000, die ich dann entsprechend geskillt hatte. Killermagier, Buffmagier, Naurim der Tank und Takata, der Speerk√§mpfer. Alles hat Sinn gemacht, reicht aber wohl nicht. Ach ja ... Talente etc. habe ich nat√ºrlich auch "gut" geskillt ... 

Eventuell w√ºrde ich es neu starten und einen anderen Weg ausprobieren. Ich habe keinen einzigen Fernk√§mpfer ... dachte in der Mitte des Spiels, dass Niam zum Team geh√∂rt und da bleiben w√ºrde ... tja. Takata und Naurim als Fernk√§mpfer? Ne.

NACHTRAG #2:
Also ... ich habe einen uralten Spielstand geladen und habe mich bis zum Endboss durchgeschlagen ... √ºberraschenderweise, wenn man wei√ü wie gespielt wird, wird es wesentlich einfacher. Man kennt die Tricks und man benutzt eventuell Zauber, die man normalerweise nicht nutzen w√ºrde in iwelchen anderen Games.

Unterm Strich w√ºrde ich sagen, dass man das Spiel doch empfehlen kann ... aber nur f√ºr < 10‚Ç¨ und nur f√ºr Leute, die sich trotz Rage dazu entschlie√üen k√∂nnen ein Spiel bis zum Ende durchzuspielen. Manchmal bewirkt eine l√§ngere Pause Wunder.

review: Lange ist es her, dass ich mal Das Schwarze Auge als Pen & Paper Spiel gemacht habe und f√ºhle mich hier im Spiel schon sehr stark daran erinnert. So viele Einstellungs- und Entwicklungsm√∂glichkeiten f√ºr den eigenen Charakter und dessen Begleiter sind am Anfang schon sehr √ºberw√§ltigend. Die Tutorial Erkl√§rungen helfen aber auf jeden Fall schon mal sehr gut durch die ersten Begegnungen. Mal gespannt, was mir im Laufe der Zeit im Spiel noch so alles √ºbern Weg l√§uft bzw. was f√ºr Abenteuer bestanden werden wollen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044768454', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1147, 'last_played': 1437661038}
review:
They said it was hard. They said it was rough. My advice is: watch a couple basic-tutorial-videos on youtube to know what the hell you are doing with the AP system. If you understand that, you'll have real blast. Without giving anything away, the whole Mengbila bit is great! I mean, the sort of thing they throw at you is.... And the finale of that... 
Bottom line: take a bit of time to learn how the game works, choose the character creation expert mode, especialize your characters and have fun. Great purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045377291', 'num_games_owned': 1676, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 527, 'last_played': 1434872021}
review:
Typical CRPG with nothing really new but if anything that redeems it from that is one thing, one name, one dwarf...Naurim. He is by far the only character that keeps you playing because he is a master dwarf with a suspicious aggression for everything. The words that pour from his godly beard shatter everyone in a 100 meter radius.  

Hero - "Why did you burn down a tavern?"
Naurim - "Because the tavern had dragon in it's name, and I hate dragons"

420/10 Blaze that Tavern Naurim with your mystical beard, you are a god! Step aside Gimli you bitch, Nauim is the top dwarf now son.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000717877', 'num_games_owned': 1055, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1434937398}
review: A piece of shite.  DON'T BUY THIS GAME !!!!!!!!  This is the German idea of balanced gameplay!?!?  Continual misses by your characters (at 92%!!!!!) but the enemy will hit you, for two or three times your damage, at 45%!!!  WTF !?!?!?!?!?  Dead-alic.........we're done with you.  You couldn't program your way out of a wet paper bag.  It takes a helluva lot more than some pretty sprites to make a worthy adventure game.  And the notion that because this takes place in the Dark Eye somehow justifies this travesty of computer coding.  You're fifteen years to the party too late, and you STILL can't hold a candle to classics like Baldur's Gate.  That's SAD, SAD, SLOPPY CODING.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075640662', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2440, 'last_played': 1459358361}
review:
Wo habe ich mich da nur reingeritten...
Jeder der wenigstens einmal in seinem Leben ein Pen & Paper Rollenspiel wie "Das Schwarze Auge" (DSA) gespielt hat, kennt vermutlich diese Situation... 
DSA Blackguards greift das wohl popul√§rste Rollenspielsystem nach "Dungeons & Dragons" auf und verfrachtet es in eine Rundenbasierendes Real-Time Strategie Spiel...

Konkret bedeutet das, man verf√ºgt √ºber 3 - 5 Heldenfiguren, die man auf einem Schachbrett √§hnlichen Spielfeld zu unterschiedlichen Bedingungen herum schickt. 
In der Regel bedeutet hier die Hauptaufgabe: Besiege alle Gegner.
Hierzu stehen den einzelnen Helden wiederum Spezialf√§higkeiten zur Verf√ºgung.

Im Fall von DSA Blackguards wird zus√§tzlich der Rollenspielfaktor des Originals dazu gemischt. Man kann innerhalb einer Welt agieren, muss sich durch K√§mpfe und Aufgaben "Abenteuerpunkte" (APs) verdienen, mit denen man sich dann bei Lehrmeistern wieder neue Spezialf√§higkeiten kaufen kann.
Dar√ºber hinaus, muss man seinen Charackter verbessern/ skillen. Auch das geschieht √ºber APs, und nat√ºrlich kann eine bessere Waffe und eine bessere R√ºstung auch nicht schaden. Diese kosten allerdings Gold in Form von Dukaten ;), die man ebenfalls durch die Absolvierung von Quests erh√§lt.

Was braucht ein gutes Rollenspiel noch au√üer dem Spielprinzip? Genau, eine fesselnde Story!
Diese ist auch sehr gut gelungen, wie ich finde. (Ohne zu viel zu Spoilern)
Der tragische Held wacht eines Morgens auf und sitzt im Gef√§ngnis, aus Gr√ºnden, die er wegen einer Amnesie nicht erkl√§ren kann. Bei einem Ausbruchversuch, gabelt er zwei neue Freunde auf, einen knorzigen Zwerg und einen schweren√∂tigen Magier. Auf ihrer Suche nach den Antworten des Haupthelden gabeln sie weitere Mitstreiter auf, darunter auch Bekannte aus der Vergangenheit des Helden, verlieren einige Freunde, nehmen Rache und stellen schlie√ülich fest, das der eigentliche B√∂se gar nicht der B√∂se war, sondern das der wahre Feind eigentlich der ist, dem man am meisten vertraut hatte. 

An sich ein solides Konzept, mit den √ºblichen St√§rken und Schw√§chen.
Hat man sich verskillt, so hat man am Ende ganz sch√∂ne Probleme. Oder man reagiert nicht rechtzeitig auf eine bestimmte Situation und verliert einen Helden.
Wer an diesen Dingen aber Spa√ü findet, kann Blackguards beruhigt einkaufen. :)

Allerdings werden Achievement-J√§ger mit Blackguards keine Freude haben, da viele der begehrten Auszeichnungen aus irgendwelchen Gr√ºnden noch verbuggt sind und egal wie oft man die Bedingung erf√ºllt nicht freigeschaltet werden.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030660154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4464, 'last_played': 1430655573}
review: Taktische K√§mpfe mit DSA-Regelwerk - f√ºr T√ºftler. Es gibt Idealskillungen, die den Schwierigkeitsgrad merklich senken (bspw. die Nahk√§mpfer allesamt auf Zweihandwaffen ausbilden - keine Speere). Muss man aber nicht folgen. Die Story ist sehr nett, auch wenn sich schnell klarstellt, dass man nicht wirklich "ein b√∂ser Junge" ist.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031144522', 'num_games_owned': 820, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 3591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2388, 'last_played': 1436674350}
review:
Habituellement pas fan des jeux en tour par tour, celui-ci a r√©ussi √† me combler d√®s la prise en main (cr√©ation du personnage). 

Il est possible d'optimiser son personnage avec les classiques arbres de talents, mais, malgr√© le fait qu'ils soient tr√®s complets et vous offrant un nombre de sorts/capacit√©s tr√®s int√©ressants (bien sur, vous ne pourrez pas tout maxer sur le m√™me personnage !) cela ne s'arr√™te pas la du tout. 

Au fil des combats, votre personnage et les acolytes qui l'accompagne au fil de l'histoire voient leurs points d'exp√©rience transform√©s en points d'aptitudes, servant √† remplir les dit talents dans 5 arbres distincts. 
Les caract√©ristiques, diverses r√©sistances/forces, vie, mana, rapidit√©, puissance en m√©l√©e ou en magie ou √† distance, toucher...
Les comp√©tences d'armes.
Des aptitudes, g√©n√©ralement passives comme de la d√©tection de pi√®ges, de magie, des bonus de rapidit√© suivant le mileu, r√©sistances aux renversements/d√©cors...
Les sorts.
Les aptitudes sp√©ciales pour d√©bloquer de nouvelles armures, en r√©duire les effets n√©gatifs (perte de rapidit√© avec les armures lourdes), plus de port√©e sur vos sorts, en agrandir les zones d'effets ou d√©bloquer de nouvelles capacit√©s pour les m√©l√©es qui n'ont pas acc√®s √† la branche des sorts). 

Vous aurez donc √† g√©rer, hors combat, tous les points de vos personnages afin d'avoir une √©quipe solide.

Pour ce qui est du syst√®me de combat, j'ai appr√©ci√© le fait de la rapidit√© (ou non) appell√©e initiative.
Les personnages (alli√©s/ennemis) que vous controlez ou non n'obtiennent pas leur tour tous en m√™me temps mais en fonction de leur initiative. 
Il est possible de joueur en "deux temps", si vous effectuez un petit d√©placement, laisse le tour continuer, votre personnage pourra agir ensuite si vous ne vous √™tes pas d√©placez trop loin. 

Les maps sont tr√®s vari√©es, avec g√©n√©ralement des √©l√©ments de d√©cors interactifs (passif, quand on marche dessus par exemple ou pour se mettre √† couvert mais aussi actif pour inverser le cours du combat). 
Les effets de zones, qu'ils viennent d'un alli√© ou du d√©cor, se r√©percutent aussi sur les membres de votre groupe.

Le seul petit point n√©gatif que j'ai pu relever est les chances de rater qui sont assez importantes.
Malgr√© la possibilit√© d'am√©liorer votre toucher, vous pouvez tr√®s bien rater trois fois de suite une techniques/sorts/tir qui a 65% de chance de toucher, juste parceque vous avez la lose.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047121179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1773, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1773, 'last_played': 1407262916}
review: Blackgaurds is not a masterpiece, no. I have read many reviews over it and most seem to want a perfect game for one that is from $5 - $10 when on sale or not, and it is definetly worth that. TBS based battles are very challenging and saving often is your best friend. Game throws strong challenges at you as you progress through the story and believe me, the fights are just win-able. If your looking for a interesting take on a story done a thousand times, and a good challenge, this is your game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010429902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1328, 'last_played': 1434684168}
review: I remember playing this awesome game on the Xbox called Gladius... I've never played a tactical RPG as good as that was before or since. I wished Blackguards could be more but it's a pale shadow of everything. Taking a band of misfits and leading them to be the heroes of the land... squandered. Moral dilemmas? nope. Relentless brain numbing combat, buckets and buckets.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047384882', 'num_games_owned': 4838, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 4255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4091, 'last_played': 1434238325}
review:
Decent turn based tactical game. Tends to get somewhat repetitive over time, and suffers somewhat from the inherent weaknesses inherited from the Dark Eye game system and background. It also lacks somewhat a real feeling of character advancement - after playing a decent amount of matches you feel barely much "better" than in the bginning: the character have little more HP, the weapons do little more damage, etc. 

Full price I'd say it's not worth it, but on a sale it's a nice game to sink some hours into - if you like turn based fantasy tacticals, that is.

I still prefer the "old" stuff like Icewind Dale or Baldurs Gate for turn based combat, though, or the non-fantasy new ones like Shadowrun - which has both better system, and better plot. One thing I didn't really like was the chained battles - in the later part of the game you can have two or three battles chained after one another, without any opportunity to rest & recover, or even to reload bolts & arrows or potions & poisons. 

6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198041777027', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1491951207}
review: Muito bom o jogo, apresenta um modo de combate muito dinamico, relembrando anticos jogos de rpg de tactica

author: {'steamid': '76561198084763151', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 5265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5255, 'last_played': 1428271459}
review:
Tactically Reallistic 
its hard to say its good, its also hard to say its bad, so i'll give you both.

The Good
- Battle system is good.
- The Storyline is great.
- Limited sidequest available.
- Weapons & spells are extremely unique (only when you upgrade spells & weapon skills).
- You can use environmental traps.
- Battle skills & abilities are real great & useful.

The Bad
- This game is so reallistic that when you buy too many items & weapons pass your limit, it'll cause your characters to do negatively poor in combat (depends on the weight of items).
- If your not well prepared before events or battles, you'll have a tough time trying to complete that scenario.

my overall, if you are a person of poor judgement, don't buy this game
if you love Strategy/RPG type games, then this game is for you......

I give this game a 9 out of 10

review:
Pros: +Fun turn style combat
+Pretty good skill tree/stat system

Cons: -Linear Story/poorly written

author: {'steamid': '76561198012111055', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 249, 'playtime_forever': 379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1434234091}
review:
Otra vez echo de menos el bot√≥n 'Neutral' para clasificar un juego en Steam. 

¬øEs Blackguards un mal juego? No. ¬øLo recomiendo? Pues tampoco. 

Me explico un poco. Blackguards sigue el reglamento de un juego de rol alem√°n llamado 'Dark Eye'. Por lo tanto hereda para el combate sus virtudes y defectos. Y para m√≠ ese reglamento tiene m√°s defectos que virtudes por lo que he visto. Encima el juego no te da casi pistas de para que valen las puntuaciones de las hojas de personaje as√≠ que andar√°s m√°s perdido que un pulpo en un garaje al principio. Dicen por ah√≠ que cuando llevas bastantes horas empiezas a enterarte y entonces el juego mola. Yo le he dedicado bastantes y creo que s√© por donde van los tiros pero... sigue sin molarme. En el Baldur's Gate (por poner un ejemplo comparativo) tambi√©n usaban al dedillo el reglamento del juego de mesa (en ese caso AD&D) pero yo creo que explicaban bastante mejor el funcionamiento b√°sico del combate en el videojuego.

Una cosa que me ha fastidiado hasta abandonar el juego es que aparte de tu tasa de ataque los combatientes tienen una habilidad de defensa. Entonces t√∫ te enfrentas a un bicho y dices: vaya, tengo un 70% de posibilidades de darle, a por √©l. Y s√≠, le das... pero como √©l esquiva ya no le das. Hala. A fastidiarse. Por eso muchas veces estar√°s peg√°ndote pi√±os con gente sin que nadie llegue a acertar a nadie. S√≠ que es cierto que se aplica a ambos bandos y que s√≥lo se puede esquivar a un oponente por asalto, pero como normalmente el que est√° superado en n√∫mero es el grupo del jugador la cosa queda bastante descompensada. Adem√°s esto hace que el combate sea impredecible y, para m√≠, pierda muchos puntos de estrategia.

Adem√°s como digo los desarrolladores no se han esforzado demasiado en explicar para que vale cada cosa por lo que cuando empiezas a jugar vas subiendo de nivel sin saber demasiado bien que te conviene subir o que no. En mi caso lo dej√© cuando me met√≠ en un combate en el que parece que era vital el mago y le fallaban todos los hechizos porque no pasaba una tirada de Constituci√≥n. ¬øY yo como deber√≠a haber adivinado eso? Si es tan importante ¬°que lo avisen de alguna manera a los novatos! 

Encima al principio empiezas con un equipo m√≠nimo y, la verdad, cuesta bastante conseguir el oro suficiente como para no parecer un pordiosero y comprar algo con lo que zurrarle a los enemigos. Ahora ya s√© lo que sienten mis jugadores de rol en mesa cuando les racaneo objetos (s√≠, lo tengo merecido, soy un director de juego rata). 

Y sin embargo y pese a todo Blackguards tiene suficiente encanto como para que haya perdido un mont√≥n de horas intentando dominar el juego. La historia, sin ser de echar tracas, est√° bien. El personaje del mago es muy carism√°tico y el grupo lo forman un tr√≠o de inadaptados bastante simp√°tico. Las conversaciones entre ellos son entretenidas. El sistema de combate, si no llega a tener la peste de las esquivas, ser√≠a bueno. Porque adem√°s puedes usar el escenario a tu favor (se pueden accionar ciertos elementos en cada fase).

Hasta donde yo llegu√© en la campa√±a la cosa era bastante lineal. Hab√≠a algunas opciones secundarias pero vamos... que esto va de buscar una disculpa para cada combate.

Me queda un sabor agridulce al no poder recomendarlo pero, sinceramente, no me ha convencido.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068398360', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 4474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4341, 'last_played': 1429221749}
review:
How would you feel when you are unable to proceed because you do not have the required abilities to deal with the enemy?
You could say, tough luck, it is your own fault, because you made the wrong choices. 
And I grant you that. 

But how can I make the right choices when I do not know the strengths and weaknesses of these abilities? And how can I foresee that the story seriously impacts the functioning of my party?  At two moments in the game you will be inflicted with a setback that unhinges your party's fighting power. Once, one of the party members gets killed because the story is written that way. And at another time her replacement, a magic user, gets robbed of her ability to do magic and so thousands of points sunk in developing her magic powers becomes nullified with one stroke. 
So you might expect that the game takes this into account, but not at all: you cannot undo your choices nor does the game allow you to make up for the loss of a valuable party member.

This then, in a nutshell, is the problem with Blackguards.. 

This game is very much like searching for keys to doors, while you do not know which key opens which door, you do not know if a door leads to anything useful, you do not know when or if you will find the key or the door to which it belongs and you might find  that the keys and doors disappeared before you actually could make use of them. 
So what is left is to go back to an earlier point in the game and find the right keys to the right doors: make the right choices. And unfortunately you might have to go a long way back: perhaps all the way to the beginning.

And then another issue pops up.

Blackguards is  basically a tactical battle simulator in which the battles are linked together by a thin storyline that gives the battles context. You will find that many of the common characteristics of a roleplay game are underdeveloped. For one, your party members are a given and so are their classes. Do not expect that you can build your own party. 
Furthermore there are few choices in equipment so your party will be running around with the same armor and weapons for long stretches.  And while many places have shops, you will only visit them to restock your supplies. 
But the crucial issue is that the story is simply too linear. While at some point you can select what to do first, you will be unable to change the storyline in any significant way. And because the story isn't really special at all, redoing this game just so you can change your characters is not enough of an incentive to go through the game again..

Even as a tactical battle simulator the game leaves much to be desired. For instance you are unable to determine the setup of your party members. More often than not the game gleefully shoves your more vulnerable members, your magic users, in the front line.  Hilarious is the ability to set traps. You have almost no time to set traps, let alone set the traps that actually make  difference. The traps are expensive, the relevant skill requires a massive amount of points and you have only a very limited amount of traps.  
In addition some battles confront you with a special setup that is pivotal to the battle, often without explaining to you the specifics. In one battle, for instance, you will be able to make use of automated flamethrowers. But the game doesn't explain this to you, nor do you know what the impact is until you have seen their effect and you figured out how to operate them. It therefore requires you to redo the battle at least once.
Some battles are practically unwinnable until you achieve a certain level, or develop a certain ability to a certain level.

Is it all bad then?

Actually no.
When I went through the game the first time I actually was entertained. The game uses what I call the fall out principle. The fall out principle is that you start out as a nobody and then gradually start to make a difference when the story unfolds. This is the reverse of what you might call the dragon age effect in which  it is clear from the start that you are a special person destined to make a difference.
Personally I prefer the first angle to the last. 
Also the characters are amusing, even though, or perhaps because, they are so cliche. The remarks of the Naurim, the grumpy dwarf, are pretty funny and in line of what you might expect from a dwarf: a fighter who distrusts magic users and elves. 
The story, although linear, has a few twists and also there is some emotional connection as it involves a friend and later on a family member. It isn't also clearcut that the enemy is actually bad and it leaves things fuzzy  for a long time.
So it seems to me that if you go once through the game(using a game guide to form your party) then you might probably be entertained.



Verdict:
Blackguard is a nice filler when you are in between better games. Pick it up when it is in the bargain bin and around five dollars or euros or less.

(Note: steam doesn't allow for a meh score at the time of writing this review. This game most certainly belongs to this category. I gave it a thumbs up just because, when choosing between the negative and the positive, i prefer the latter).

author: {'steamid': '76561198019273313', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1420063063}
review:
Starts solid, fizzles BAD later.

Balckguards is challenging tactical RPG great focus on tacital, the characters strenghts are based of of the skill points you allocate into different areas such as weapon profficancy and constitution, and to note you can only carry four items per character in battle that includes arrows.  Combat is the typical turn based Hex grid goto but this is when the game can be a pain, traps are invisible of course you can take an action to scan the area around you for them, BUT to scan furthur areas you must move another character into the area avoiding the traps that are reveal. Movement is crap, the Hex grid makes thing wonky and you end up having the character accidentally move through a trap, inflicting damage, possible status effects, and ending their turn. If you don't end up walking through a trap on your way to the empty space you will likely hit a trap that is still hidden. Also the  AI opponents know where the traps are so unless it plays stupid and tries to make it's way to a weakend ally it will almost never hit them.

I am saddend by this spike in difficulty but if you enjoy masocistic gaming feel free but other wise avoid.
