author: {'steamid': '76561198015731346', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 3792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3476, 'last_played': 1433444410}
review:
Old school RPG with turn-based combat system, nice graphic and pretty fun dialogues. Quite an hard game with some harder difficulty-spike in some point but nothing exceeding. It's about 60 hours game .
Here i put some advice that i would have needed .

General advice:
- Let Naurim tank,he will tank everything on the earth. 
-Buffs,debuffs and almost all spell at level 4 hit the entire map. (for exemple u can buff your entire team or debuff their )
-check all spell teacher to get passives,mage are dumb cows without accuracy passive.
-at the beginning seems that all mage spell has low chance to hit,when you up em and get accuracy passive almost all abilities have 99% chance.
-heals are very important,get em at least al lvl 3 ,pretty nice to heal your wounds.
-CHECK THE ENVIRONMENT,it will always semplify battles.

Starter Class Advices:

first 50% of the game: 
-Normal attack damage class ,specifically 2 Handed weapon  or archer are insanely strong .
-Mages are nice but you've not lvl 4 spells and suffer cause of low mana. 
-hybrid is overpowered: get for example an archer + increased ranged damage buffs.( same for melee)

Other 50%
-Normal attack damage class are still strong,lot of hp,dodge,and damage. (melee weapons with poison are pretty nice)
-Mages now can annihilate an entire battle alone. Just with lvl4  flame spear ,evel 4 shield  and level 3 thunder globe.
-Archers with buffs are still overpowered.

Good luck and have fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198114632624', 'num_games_owned': 1541, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 1914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1125, 'last_played': 1434641834}
review:
Battles Galore! This game is really all about the battles. The story is just something to tie all the battles together. Read up a bit on what skills to buff up..  My tip is to train up on your own bow and arrow skills.

I ended up with some skills I bought earlier on, wasted. Cos someone else I pick up later will have it at a higher level.

Then some skills i thought will be useful, ending up crap. And there is no refunding of points. So good luck picking the right skills.

For all it's worth, this game is still worth a walk through, just for it's unique take on RPG you will not find elsewhere. (Probably during a sale)

author: {'steamid': '76561197960642462', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2893, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2893, 'last_played': 1433118914}
review:
I am a big fan of RPGS in general and here my view point after finishing in hard difficulty :

PROS : 
1)You can Customize your chars a lot and its real, REAL REAL delight it reminds the good old rpg with lot of customizing.
2)Epic dialogues, the voices are awesome.
3) Real strategy, some battles are pretty hard. 
4) Unlike a LOT of games you dont have a lot of gold during the game so you got to be cautious with what you are doing with it.
5)Game is "quite" long, for exemple it took me 30 hours to finish pillars of eternity max difficulty where i needed 48h for this one.

CONS : 
1)Poison everywhere on the 2nd half of the game. (its pretty boring to have your mage cleansing poison and wasting turns/energy on this).
2)Piercing weapons are bad (you cant hit undead with it, and most of the important "items" you need to destroy are immune to piercing damages but it's pretty fine if you havent more than one char in the team using it).
3)Game is too linear though for me i appreciated (as i said dialogues are awesome). 

I would give it 15-16/20 grade. A fair good game while waiting for Torment Tides of Numenera.
Have fun with this good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009269727', 'num_games_owned': 1036, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 2829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2694, 'last_played': 1416954047}
review: This game is the German version of Dungeons and Dragons and it's exactly as complicated as that makes it sound. Worth trying out of you're a fan of turn-based RPGs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030788488', 'num_games_owned': 744, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 4525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4505, 'last_played': 1440366475}
review:
[b][i]Blackguards[/i][/b] is a medieval fantasy turn-based tactical RPG based on the Dark Eye tabletop RPG. Framed and tortured by the one you called your friend, you make your escape with a few other prisoners, trying to find out the truth behind the accusations against you. This review takes into account the Untold Legends DLC.

[b]Pros[/b]: Nice game with enough mechanical depth to offer a variety of gameplay styles: rather than level-based progression, you spend adventure points on anything from attributes, weapon skills, spells and perks and determine exactly how specialized you become with your various talents. The story isn't of a great hero, but of someone who won't leave a mark on history, making your way in shady towns and accepting questionable quests, especially in the multiple side quests added by the [i]Untold Legend DLC[/i] where you must take stances on subjects such as slavery. Graphics are good enough for the genre, tactical maps are clean, most of which have interactive environment elements you might use against your foes if they don't use them against you. The game is sufficiently balanced, and even with the occasional difficulty spikes, you can jump right back in the last encounter to try things differently.

[b]Cons[/b]: Many will find the depth to be a bit too much, scrolling through 5 pages of skills and perks will make it hard to figure the best way to optimize your character. There is a limited variety of equipment, especially armor. The story is pretty linear and not all that complex. The odds of success aren't mushed, so 95% chance of success might still miss, multiple times, in a row, which will frustrate anyone who isn't used to rolling dices. The music is somber, and sucks life and excitement out of the game whenever you're not in a combat situation.

[b]Verdict[/b]: ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ - It's up to you

This is an ok RPG. It is definitively ported directly from its tabletop RPG roots, which might feel very "meh" to the average gamer. I still recommend it, just make sure you also get the [i]Untold Legend DLC[/i], or you'll feel the game is short on side-quests.

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
[i][b]This was just my opinion.[/b]

If you found this review helpful, please consider giving it a thumbs up, and feel free to check out more of my (purely opinionated) [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/CJsOpinions/]reviews[/url].[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198028351123', 'num_games_owned': 835, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 6151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5536, 'last_played': 1433054476}
review: First time I played this through, I got myself stuck in a position where it was impossible to proceed.  I'd just get wiped over and over again in the late game.  My first impression was that the game was broken.  It's not broken.  It's difficult, challenging, it assumes you know what you're doing from the very beginning of the game.  I read up on preferred magic spells and melee builds and then I went in for a second play through.  BOOM, my team kicks so much butt that even though I do a WTF! occasionally at the sometimes Xcom-like RNG, I'm still enjoying what Blackguards has to offer.  It's not like there's a lot of information on this game.  But one dude (vigomiller) on Gamefaq put together the most comprehensive guide to helping me understand how to succeed at this game and now I have to recommend both the game and the guide.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152804177', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2431, 'last_played': 1431558075}
review:
I would first like to pre-face this review by saying that I bought this Deluxe version and Blackguards 2 as part of the Daedalic bundle for ¬£9.99, making each game in effect worth ¬£4.99 to me. Based on this price I think Blackguards is definitely worth it. The full price of ¬£29.99 is however WAY off the mark for the amount of game you get (hint: not much) 

Despite me finishing the game in 40 hours, it is a very combat focused where pretty much every event you‚Äôll encounter will be a fight. Whilst this is fun to begin with, as a lot of battle maps are quite interesting, after 20 odd hours it just got tiresome. After every cut scene, conversation, exploration, etc I knew I would be fighting something. So you can imagine my utter delight when after defeating the final boss, the final cut-scene was just that a cut-scene!

Outside of combat there is unfortunately very little to the game, hence I only recommend it at a steep discount. There is no exploration to speak off, the town screens are static and the story kind of gets lots amongst 180 fight scenes you‚Äôll have to slog through. 

I also have a few gripes about the story, but these could just be personal preferences. For example, I don‚Äôt see how this is a ‚Äúdark‚Äù story as it seems very much like any other RPG where you-are-our-only-hope-to-save-the-world story (spoiler: you save it). Also this games is called Blackguards and makes the point of your character being an outlaw. I was picturing more of a vagabond, a mercenary on the run, or some petty thief down and on his luck. What I wasn‚Äôt expecting however was for my character to be buddies with a PRINCES whilst chilling at a home of a COUNT in the first ‚Äúmemory‚Äù cutscene. Less of a BlackGuard, more of a Brodude! Also in this game you have no meaningful choice ‚Äì it really just railroads you along the main story-line with some side-quests where you have a choice between killing guy A or guy B... with no impact on main story-line. 

A lot of negative reviews about this game are regarding the dodgy RNG, and whilst I have encountered some odd miss on a 95% chance, I have never experienced a 3 in a row miss. If you read the manual and understand how the rules work. The % you see isn‚Äôt the % to inflict damage, but rather to do an action, then the enemy gets a couple of saving rolls ‚Äì parry / dodge. So you might have successfully rolled an action, but then the enemy might have rolled a saving throw and so all you see is your guy missing or spell fizzing out.

review:
Ersteinmal vornehinweg, 
ich spiele schon sehr sehr sehr lange DSA, bin aber nicht b√∂se wenn ein Spiel sich nicht an jedes Detail h√§lt, aber ich muss zugeben dieses Spiel entt√§uscht mich ma√ülos, viele kleinere √§nderungen m√ºssen nat√ºrlich gemacht werden, um die Taktik und das Kampfsystem anst√§ndig zu gestallten. 
Aber damit habe ich gerechnet, und weil ich spa√ü an diesem taktikzeug habe, habe ich anfangs auch Spa√ü an blackguards gehabt.
Aber warum macht man aus einem Novadischen Derwisch (Zauberkundige Trommler) einen T√§nzer? Warum greifen Echsenmenschen mit Priorit√§t zivilisten an anstelle der Leute die auf sie heraufbolzen, und schlussendlich, wo bleibt die entscheidungs m√∂glichkeit.
Ich erwarte hier bei weitem kein Dragon Age, aber DSA das ist Rollenspiel, und ich will zumindestens einfluss auf unwichtige Details nehmen k√∂nnen.
Nein, die Story ist schlecht aufgebaut, die recherche l√§sst an so vielen Punkten zu w√ºnschen √ºbrig, und die Sinnlose zurschaustellung des Todes einen Characters (den man meist mehrmals ansehen muss, da der kampf schon ganz sch√∂n happig ist) hat mir ziemlich den rest gegeben.
Sorry,
aber deadelic sollte kein dsa mehr anpacken, das hat man ja schon an anderen spielen gemerkt...

author: {'steamid': '76561197994831518', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 8041, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5549, 'last_played': 1432732592}
review:
While Blackguards has interesting characters, visually appealing backdrop and a good amount of character customisation. It is linear in nature like most tactical RPGs, it is still engaging enough to keep you playing.


What could of been an exceptional tactical RPG, is heavilly mared by the skewerd RNG.  Enemies with ludecrously low hit chances will regularly hit, while your group with ludecriously high chances to hit will miss quite often.  This simply plays out this way the entire game.

Many of the enemy hits will impose effects but you wont resist them because of penalites of unknown oragin making the skills you developed to resist them, meaningless.  Likewise Enemies will constantly resist your statuses because aparently you dont apply the same penalities to them.

This would be fine for the most part if enemies did similare damage to your group, sadly they typically will almost always do about 50% more, leaving you to scratch your head wondering why.  

In general enemies will always be better than or equal to your group in combat, even if they happen to be some merchant or alchemist they will be exceptional warriors none the less.  They also wont give you the gear they are using (aparently that vanishes in a puff of smoke when they die)

Again this woud be fine through the use of tactics.  However the RNG issues will often destroy the best tactics you can bring to the table.

Plenty of places have traps everywhere and the non-enviromental ones will let the enemies happilly walk over with without triggering them.

At the end of the day unless you are happy to ignore the RNG issues and vague information on many of the combat aspects, I cant really recomened Blackguards (hopefully the second one has improved those issues).   Even then best to get it on a 75% off sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062367748', 'num_games_owned': 1302, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1577241057}
review:
Ein sehr atmosph√§risches RPG mit toller Hintergrundmusik und erstklassiger! deutscher Sprachausgabe!

Zu Beginn kann man unter 3 Klassen w√§hlen: Magier, Krieger oder Bogensch√ºtze. Jeder Charakter besitzt insgesamt 3 Waffenslots. F√ºr jede bestandene Aufgabe erhalten die Charaktere Abenteuer-Punkte, die man f√ºr die diversen F√§higkeiten, Waffenskills, Grundwerte, Zauber etc.... ausgeben kann. Die Skillm√∂glichkeiten sind wirklich √§u√üerst umfangreich, f√ºr Anf√§nger wie mich allerdings auch etwas verwirrend. Viel verwendete Skills lassen sich bequem in eine Schnelleiste ziehen.

Es gibt viele Nebenquests und die Geschichte ist nicht linear, sondern bietet auch hier und da Entscheidungsm√∂glichkeiten!

Kampfsystem:
- Rundenbasiert
- Hexfelder
- interaktive Gegenst√§nde

Als einzigstes Manko empfinde ich das Zufallsprinzip im Kampf. So kann es sein das Zauber oder Waffenf√§higkeiten mehrfach hintereinander nicht treffen und einem Gegner dadurch ganz sch√∂n zu schaffen machen oder man sogar verliert. Wiederholt man den Kampf, flutscht dieser dann auf einmal wie Butter. Da man aber viele Speicherm√∂glichkeiten hat, ist das zum Gl√ºck nicht all zu tragisch oder frustrierend! Meiner Meinung nach ist 68/100 Metacritic trotzdem eine viel zu schlechte Beurteilung!

Ich habe mir das Franchise Bundle (Teil 1&2, DLC: Untold Legends) http://store.steampowered.com/sub/64046/ 
f√ºr ca. 13 Euro im Steam-Sale gekauft und finde das Geld mehr als gut investiert! 

Wer sich trotzdem unsicher ist, hat ja noch die Demo zum reinschnuppern ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561197963382404', 'num_games_owned': 917, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 3809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2195, 'last_played': 1566944621}
review:
The ap and loot system feels more like living real life as a poor person oppressed by over priced rent, wishing he could buy steak at the grocery store only able to eventually afford the spam.. But only after he spends a few more days cleaning urinals. The limited amount of story line options in general make this a lack luster experience for a RPG, as its pretty much linear. For a tablet game, playing this while traveling on a plane, would be a decent experience, for a pc game it serves to make me want to go back outside and spend time in the real world despite trying to escape from it for a moment. 

I do continue to play it, and yell words I dont want my mother to hear when I miss 95% chance to hits over and over while the archers on the enemy side hit with 5% chances. Reminds me of my childhood when I played ninja gaiden and swore the game cheated hahah.

All that said, once you get across the border, things get a little more interesting and slightly more free. 

IF you can find this game on a deep sale, and love this sorta play style youll find it is an easy game to fill the void between what ever else you are doing with your life.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082061342', 'num_games_owned': 229, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1430418021}
review:
An indie game that tries to be the next big thing.It's a turn based RPG that uses hex tiles. The developer tried to implement enviromental effects and failed, horribly. The classes are bad, the character customisation is bad, and the gameplay is bad. The RNG based battles need to be changed drastically for any of the gameplay to be enjoyable. In my short time playing this game I've lost many (boring) battles due to NOT BEING ABLE TO HIT THE GOD DAMN ENEMY RIGHT IN MY FACE. And don't get me started on trying to cast spells with the mage guy. The voice acting is good although the dialogue is nothing to brag about, but there are a few good attempts at humour. The story is bad, and the choices you make don't seem to matter. Oh and there's no loot system.

2/10

review:
Merhaba T√ºrk dostlar,

Oyunumuz Blackguard , The Whispered World'un de yapƒ±mcƒ±sƒ± olan Alman firmasƒ± Daedalic Entartainment tarafƒ±ndan  Steam √ºzerinden satƒ±≈üa s√ºr√ºlm√º≈ü bir taktiƒüe dayalƒ± rol yapma oyunu.(Tactical RPG).

Hikayemize prensesi √∂ld√ºrmekle su√ßlanan (kim bilir belki ...) biri olarak hapiste ba≈ülƒ±yoruz.Orada kar≈üƒ±la≈ütƒ±ƒüƒ±mƒ±z Naurim adlƒ± m√ºthi≈ü balta kullanan dwarf karde≈üimiz ve usta bir o kadar da √ßapkƒ±n b√ºy√ºc√ºm√ºz Zurbaran Florios'la oyunumuza devam ediyoruz.Bunlara cadƒ± Aurelia , Gƒ±llƒ±alidyator Takate ve ke≈ü kadƒ±n Niam da ekleniyor.Oyunda zaman zaman flashbacklerle ge√ßmi≈üe d√∂n√ºyor ve hikayeyi √ß√∂zmeye devam ediyoruz.Yeri geliyor bir aƒüa√ß kurdu kar≈üƒ±lƒ±ƒüƒ± bir orc un canƒ±nƒ± baƒüƒ±≈ülƒ±yor, yeri geliyor size i≈ükence edenleri hunharca katlediyoruz.Tabi se√ßimler size kalmƒ±≈ü.

Oyunda karakterlerimizi turn based olarak y√∂netiyoruz.Her sava≈ü ve g√∂rev sonunda macera puanƒ± dediƒüimiz MP leri alarak karakterlerimizi upgrade ediyoruz.Oyunda kƒ±lƒ±√ß,eskrim,han√ßer,mƒ±zrak,balta,√ßift elli balta,iki elli kƒ±lƒ±√ß,asa, arbalet ve yay olmak √ºzere 10 silahƒ±mƒ±z var bunun yanƒ±na kemerimize takabildiƒüimiz fƒ±rlatma baltasƒ± cirit can potu gibi itemlarƒ±mƒ±z da var.
Karakterimizde silah yeteneƒüimizi,talentlarƒ±mƒ±zƒ±,b√ºy√ºlerimizi bir de default niteliklerimizi geli≈ütirebileceƒüimiz 4 MP harcama sayfamƒ±z var.Bunlarƒ± eƒüitmenlerde geli≈ütirerek sava≈ü sƒ±rasƒ±nda √ße≈üitli bonuslar elde edebiliyorsunuz.

Sava≈ülarda tuzaklara dikkat etmek gerekiyor.Aynƒ± zamanda v tu≈üuna basarak etkile≈üime ge√ßebileceƒüiniz yerleri de kƒ±rmƒ±zƒ± olarak g√∂rebilirsiniz.Bazen delirmi≈ücesine can basmak gerekiyor bazen hunharca adamlarƒ± ezip ge√ßiyorsunuz.Bazen de o sava≈üƒ± ge√ßebilmek i√ßin defalarca oynamanƒ±z gerekiyor.Her b√∂l√ºm√ºn kendine has taktikleri var. Ama o kadar korkmayƒ±n finale gelene kadar bekleyin (zuhahahaha -erol ta≈ü efekti ile) .

Oynanƒ±≈üta space ve enter tu≈ülarƒ±nƒ± d√ºnya mapine d√∂nmek i√ßin sava≈üta ise adamƒ±mƒ±za turn atlatmak i√ßin kullanƒ±yoruz.Yukardaki yanlƒ±≈ü hatƒ±rlamƒ±yorsam 9 bo≈ü kutuya fast skill atƒ±yabiliyoruz bu da g√ºzel bir fonksiyon olmu≈ü.Tabi bunu ilk oyunu bitiri≈üimde sadece sol tƒ±k yuvarlaktan eli se√ß ordan skilli se√ß y√∂ntemiyle oynadƒ±ƒüƒ±m i√ßin de s√∂yl√ºyor olabilirim.

Grafik olarak gayet iyi.Sava≈ü animasyonlarƒ± zayƒ±f kalmƒ±≈ü. Gƒ±lƒ±√ßla vurdum √∂ld√º . Sadece Buz √ñrt√ºs√º adƒ±nƒ± verdiƒüimiz t√ºm d√º≈ümanlara damage veren b√ºy√º yapƒ±lƒ±rken biraz render sorunu ya≈üanƒ±yor.Bunun yanƒ±na bir de bassƒ± fazla ka√ßmƒ±≈ü tipi eklenince olmamƒ±≈ü.Orasƒ± hari√ß oyun gayet iyi.

Ek olarak oyunda kendiliƒüinden T√ºrk√ße dil desteƒüi olmasƒ± benden 1 artƒ± daha alƒ±yor.Sonu√ß olarak oyun oynanabilir bir oyun Psp'de bulunan Lord Of The Rings Tactics oyununu sevdiyseniz bunu da seversiniz.

Herhangi bir bundle da denk gelirseniz ucuza da bulursanƒ±z alƒ±n.
Okuduƒüunuz i√ßin te≈üekk√ºrler, saƒülƒ±cakla kalƒ±n....

author: {'steamid': '76561197990234509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1430286961}
review: I regret purchasing this game as it's just poorly made. There is little customization that really matters, things aren't explained very well and the hit chance ridiculous nonsense is unforgivable.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970728484', 'num_games_owned': 3234, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 3823, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3823, 'last_played': 1399272903}
review:
Turn based, tactical, story (ish) game.

The faults of this title, the complex system and overly long combats take away from a otherwise enjoyable title.

While most games have a 'completed me' achievement, this title is one of the few where I felt it was truly earned (sadly for patience)

Still if your the type that likes to 'get into' a combat system, you might find some decent hours here.

5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198012621177', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 8627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7948, 'last_played': 1429870490}
review: I found that this game was very fun to play I liked the mechanics of it which was tactical. However I thought the game was based more on just sheer luck - Luck 60% tactics 40%. But still all in all a good game. There were some settings that were rather difficult because you couldn't zero in on the places the fighters were going to do all there fighting it was just rather awkward to control your hero's properly. Also the only thing you do in this game is fight from one end to the the other end that's all you do but I like a game where there is more to concentrate on than just brawling and that could be done in many ways for instance crafting.  Well there were one or two spots where at least you could do some shopping if you had the money for it however this is a game you start dirt poor and you don't get any wealthier the winning of a fight brings you but little and in coin the same. So you might well ask what was good then and well even if that's all you did was battle, the battles most were original giving you choices to play differently. And I heard that it was the best to start your player of as a mage and go the middle road while still being able to play warrior if you wanted. Yet I found I had two good mages or ranged fighters from the others that joined your group so I'm glad I started mine of as warrior and could sink my points into him just being a strong player. I found Naurim the best for this he came up big in more than a couple of instances. And the mages ran out of astral mana to fast anyway and a person didn't have money enough to so you could have astral potions with you extra and you rarely came across any by winning a battle.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983545926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 348, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1609512116}
review: I decided to replay this game after like 5 years and wanting to try a hex-based tactical RPG again. What I will say is that the combat is pretty good and the story is decent enough. What kills me every time is just how much micro-managing the characters all require; and the XP to level up characters is just not that abundant. I think I read somewhere that the game is like 40 hrs. to complete, which would explain the incredibly slow progression. I just feel like the game evolves at such a slow pace, it just can't keep my interest the way other CRPGs and TRPGs can. At the moment, though, you can buy the whole Blackguards franchise for like $2 on sale. If you are remotely interested, just buy the whole lot. That way, if you do like this game, you can have like another 60+ hrs. of game to play without overpaying too much.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970387688', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 407, 'last_played': 1429469646}
review: Like playing in a straight jacket, a boring, random straight jacket. Not much chance of actually roleplaying anything, Just a few poor mini games strung together with a poorer story. Avoid.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969302422', 'num_games_owned': 773, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 2408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2408, 'last_played': 1429475945}
review: Not good at reviews so I'll keep this breif.  The randomness of this game is just too high.  I had to restart fight after fight and the increadibly long load times are very annoying.  With my attack power maxed (hit rate) I still miss or get dodged/parried 50% to 60% of the time which just makes for a really long and teadous fight.  Outside of this the overall game is good I'd give it about a 6 on a scale of 1 to 10 so guess I would recommend it.  Though if you don't like watching your characters die over and over due to just really bad machanics, I wouldn't play this.  The late game has the other team with casters and 100% spell everytime and no amount of resist seems to work

author: {'steamid': '76561198072486950', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 5543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5370, 'last_played': 1521283170}
review:
TL/DR at the bottom.

Save Your Games Often. SYGO.

Lore: This games has a great story, or maybe just a good one, but with great soundtrack. Every time the action stops to give me some of the story, be it only with voice over or with a cinematic, it makes me feel like sitting back, dimming the light, lighting up a cigar (I don't smoke cigars, wtf) and just getting immersed in that world. It works. Oh and SYGO.

Graphics: Every graphics outside of the spells and backdrops are ok for a turn-based strategy game, cinematics or gameplay. The backdrops are nice. But the spells are one notch above that. They are cool. Let just say that after 80 hours, I'd gladly skip the crossbow animation in order to save 4 seconds every time, but I'd keep the spells any day of the week. 

Gameplay: I recommend you name your character SYGO. I didn't. I should have. Now I need to restart from scratch. Don't just SYGO. Keep them. You'll need them. This game is unforgiving as it leads you to think that you'll need this skill and that skill in order to make it, yet it surprises you (too) many times with different tactics and resistance to particular damage. If you can finish this game without a single hint from the internet, a walkthrough or without ever needing to backtrack yourself once to change some skill points (let alone back track yourself 40 hours to change almost everything...) you are a God amongst humans. 

TL/DR: One of the best turn-based game I've played, as enjoyable as your favorite HOMM or Civ. Poor DLC value, very good base value. If you don't want a good challenge (60 hours) that kinda forces you into restarting at least once the game from scratch (do I hear 120 hours?), then this might not be for you. Only negative thing is that I'm really dissapointed that the dev made a Blackguards 2 instead of adding more than one DLC to this game. Did I mentioned SYGO? Yeah, SYGO. Or cry. Like the people that wrote bad reviews for this game. They didn't SYGO. Clearly. But you will, right?

author: {'steamid': '76561198019754455', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 8790, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8710, 'last_played': 1429488568}
review:
This is a great game. XCOM: Enemy Unknown meets Baldur's Gate.

Pro:
- Flexible character build
- Great story

Con:
- Some Steam achievements are broken
- To hit % is only that: to hit. After this come some additional defence rolls, which can negate your hit or nullify damage. A lot of people get frustrated after missing a lot of 90% to hit rolls.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052278126', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 2860, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2354, 'last_played': 1533879325}
review: A great game for lovers of turn based strategic RPGs. This game is probably not for everyone, it has a very old school feel and out side of battle it is just point and click/ navigate through conversations. But if you are the type of person that is into these kind of games, you will find a great experience here.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974698125', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1428480896}
review:
I saw a bunch of reviews posted bashing how hard this game is, do not be fooled, I am on normal difficulty (which is on by default) and I breezed past the entire first part of the game and made it to the world map with no problems at all.
I am not sure what they mean by "only one way to play" it would be nice to know what gave them such trouble.. maybe they tried the game using the "basic" setting instead of "expert".. I opted for expert because I wanted to adjust my own stats and skills.. the game is pretty straightforward, you read all your stats.. it tells you what stuff does.. its basically D&D
The story is also pretty interesting, the game is sure to be a good adventure ahead.. don't listen to the silly people saying its too hard to click on things.. not to mention you can always restart a battle.. the ONLY thing I do not like is that you cannot take back your movement actions once you have made them and its still your turn.. but it will tell you if you click the spaces BEFORE you confirm what your attacks and stuff can hit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032819881', 'num_games_owned': 5432, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1996, 'last_played': 1428354613}
review:
There needs to be a review on this page telling steam users that at least 11 out of the 45 achievements are bugged and most players [u]cannot[/u] achieve them. There are plenty of community posts surrounding the faulty achievements.

The game itself took a while for me to get into, it wasn't until part way through the second chapter that I found myself actually wanting to continue playing the game.

I experienced 2 bugs during my gameplay, once the game crashed when trying to add a new save to my list of game saves and once when casting a spell in battle, nothing happened after the casting animation so I had to crash out and re-load the battle.

As for game play and story line, you can tell this game was not finished when it was released due to the map being more than twice the size of the actual parts of the map you explore during the game. I found the ending very anticlimactic. The whole game is fully voice acted, yet the ending has a few words show up at the bottom of the screen over some scenic views... There is no obvious resolution to anything in the storyline and you are not told how the choices you made throughout the game have affected the outcome of the ending, meaning if you were to replay the game you wouldn't know what to do differently.

The game is visually very nice and the voice acting is good, although some times in battle I had a mans voice sound when I hit a female enemy and vice versa.

As a result, I have to say that Blackguards is a non-recommendation as I don't feel like the story provided me with anything to take away and think about, and also because of the bugged achievements meaning I can never 100% this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971562414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 609, 'last_played': 1400804272}
review: This game looked very promising in the early screenshots and descriptions.  Unfortunately, it turned out to be quite boring.  The character development system is neither interesting nor diverse, especially in the early levels.  With such a small party size and limited abilites, success in the early to mid-game battles is more about dice rolls than about planning or clever tactics.  In a party with only one caster, healing is so much more important than damage that it is rarely wise to cast damage spells (except when environmental effects more or less demand it). For a party with two casters....well good luck.  Although there is a dearth of solidly enjoyable tactical, turn-based rpgs, I can't recommend this game to fill the void.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960269409', 'num_games_owned': 565, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 1708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1616, 'last_played': 1428180818}
review:
First: Blackguards isn't bad or good.  It's just extremely mediocre.  If you're into D&D alternatives and dig X-Com, it probably won't waste your time.  But I can't recommend it for most people.

The character customization is surprisingly lacking, despite the illusion of choice.  There are twice as many attributes as a D&D system, but they all just sum together to increase your attack, dodge chance, initiative, etc.  There are only a handful of combat abilities to use, so there's not a lot of choice as far stabbing/shooting.  The magic users are more nuanced; there are a ton of spells, each with 4 tiers, so you're constantly weighing the cost/benefit of those.

Combat itself is very similar to X-Com or D&D 4.0: you get either a move and an action, or a double move.  This all occurs on a hex-grid, and most maps have some sort of interactable element to spice it up.  They do an admirable attempt to differentiate the levels, but you will take place in about a billion combat scenarios, so a lot of them inevitably feel repetitive.  You'll probably be skipping side quests by the end out of boredom.

The plot is pretty linear.  There are batches of side quests that open up at various points, but none of them augment the main plot line at all.  It's your typical RPG "save my daughter" or "escort my caravan" kind of stuff.  You become enslaved and forced to fight in a gladiatorial arena at one point, so that's pretty neat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068835171', 'num_games_owned': 743, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 2206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2172, 'last_played': 1430247682}

author: {'steamid': '76561198131701710', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 394, 'last_played': 1427613898}
review:
I wanted to like this game. I really did. But the extremely clunky UI, the complete lack of explanation of gameplay, and the lackluster story made it very hard to do so. Not a complete waste, but there are much better games out there.
 
Played a few more hours, and it wasn't any better. The game is still wildly uneven in difficulty and very obtuse on how certain mechanics actually work. Everything out of combat is a complete joke; the "dialouge" which consists of clicking your way down the dialouge box until you're done, the fact that you'll most likely still be using starting equipment 5 hours in, the fact that all spells (no matter how trivial) have a failure chance, to the final point that Final Fantasy 1 had more freedom than this game does. Seriously, every single thing out of combat is a single screenshot where floating chat boxes tell you what's going on.  Save your money, buy a better game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007471259', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 239, 'playtime_forever': 3769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3647, 'last_played': 1427013107}
review: Great game 8.5/10! At the beginning, I was as irritated as some others about the hit/miss chances, but it already had started to enthrall me with its dark story, the DSA system where you can add your earned EXP points (called AP) after every battle to increase skills and get better. However, what in the end really made this a great game are the many battles, more than I expected, and make it a rewarding experience. So its tactical RPG with a dark setting with nice enigh graphics to make you happy. Will definitely buy Blackguards 2 now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019373741', 'num_games_owned': 4047, 'num_reviews': 285, 'playtime_forever': 2927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2917, 'last_played': 1426968589}
review:
Near the end of the game - chapter five caves of Mok Pan Tohal - the game became totally unplayable for me thanks to the poisonous mist that gets me every time because the  way gets blocked by an absurd number of enemies that position themselves before the 1 or 2 squares that are available to pass through.  I'm so frustrated and angry that its NO FUN anymore, uninstall and play Bulletstorm to wind down.  
Good story, up until this point batlles are ok if your party is well rested and if you are prepared to replay some batlles to think out a good tactic. A bit too linear and repetitive. Only buy if like me you're a huge fan of turnbased RPG's and want to complete your collection. My advise buy it cheap if you can.

review: Eu achei que ia ser um jogo bom, mas me decepcionei. Hist√≥ria bem mais ou menos, lutas repetitivas, tem jogos que desenpenham o papel que esse jogo tentou fazer de forma muito mais satisfat√≥ria.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011977615', 'num_games_owned': 282, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1426302400}
review:
I'm hugely disappointed with this game. It's nowhere near what I expected from a $40 game. And I'm no newbie to the genre, having played almost everything from Baldur's Gate to Dragon Age and back.
Blackguards is all about the battle, forget about exploring, meeting interesting NPCs, developing any kind of feeling for its dull characters. In order to move around cities, dungeons, etc, you won't be moving your character or group willingly, but selecting dots in some kind of map instead.
Regarding the battle itself... suffices to say there is a spell (that I learned in the very beginning of the game) that would supposedly with a 49% chance, and I haven't been able to land it once. NOT ONCE! And there's no info on what went wrong (unless maybe if you turn on the detailed battle information, which comes cluttered with lots and lots of data).
As I said in the beginning, I could have expected (and gladly accepted) something like this from a game sensibly cheaper, but not from a AAA priced one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997012035', 'num_games_owned': 415, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1258, 'last_played': 1426523902}
review:
Als Video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8wnkohmyY5M

Als reiner Text:
Bei Balckguards handelt es sich um ein Taktik-Rollenspiel von Daedalic im Das Schwarze Auge Universum.
Oder zumindest sollte es das sein. Um mein Fazit vorweg zu nehmen verkommt das Spiel meiner Meinung nach schlussendlich mehr zu einem Gl√ºckspuzzler, bei dem die einzelnen Puzzles durch eine Story zusammengetackert wurden.

Aber fangen wir erst einmal bei dem Setting an, das an sich noch sehr vielversprechend ist:
Wir spielen einen Charakter, den wir frei generieren k√∂nnen, und der zu Beginn des Spiels im Kerker landet, da er f√ºr Schuldig befunden wird eine Prinzessin get√∂tet zu haben. Zusammen mit einem verr√ºckten Zwerg, der hinter allem eine Verschw√∂rung sieht, und einem Magier, der wohl einen Schritt zu weit gegangen ist, um mit einer Adligen im Bett zu landen, brechen wir dann aus dem Gef√§ngnis aus und begeben uns auf der Suche nach dem wahren M√∂rder.

Der Spielfluss ist dabei so, dass wir von einem Schlachtfeld zum n√§chsten gehen und zwischendurch ein paar Dialoge f√ºhren. Und auch ein paar optionale Quests mit Entscheidungen gibt es. Im Kern des Spiels stehen aber ganz klar eben jene Schlachtfelder.

Und gerade diese Schlachtfelder machen einfach keinen Spa√ü. Warum das so ist, liegt an vielen Dingen gleichzeitig. Vor allem zu Beginn sind diese Schlachtfelder winzig, so dass man im Grunde auch nicht viel Spielraum hat, die Charaktere anders zu bewegen oder ganz grunds√§tzlich etwas anders zu machen als wie es das spezifische Schlachtfeld f√ºr einen vorsieht. Ein paar mal ist es sogar so, dass der Gegner zuerst zieht und noch im ersten Zug vor einem steht. Nun sind aber die Erfolgschancen von Schl√§gen, Sch√ºssen und Zaubern so extrem gl√ºcksabh√§ngig und der Spielraum der Schadensh√∂hen so gro√ü, dass der Kampf vor allem zum frustigen Gl√ºcksspiel wird. Das Spiel suggeriert auch, dass man in vielen Schlachtfeldern mit Objekten interagieren kann. So beispielsweise im Tutorial, in dem man einen Kronleuchter auf Gegner fallen lassen kann. In der Praxis gibt es so etwas aber eher selten und wenn es dann einmal so etwas gibt, dann muss man zuerst einmal einen Kampf daf√ºr verwenden um zu schauen, wo genau dieser Kronleuchter denn dann landet, um dann neu zu starten und das in seinem Puzzle zur L√∂sung des Schlachtfeldes einzubauen.
Ich hatte ausserdem das Gef√ºhl, dass sich die Entwickler nur sehr wenig Gedanken darum gemacht haben, was f√ºr Mechaniken in einem Computerspiel Sinn machen und welche nicht. Viel Frust und Ladeorgien h√§tte man sich sparen k√∂nnen indem man ein paar Spielmechaniken abgewandelt h√§tte.
Ganz vorn ist beispielsweise, dass man ausserhalb des Kampfes nur gegen Kosten heilen kann.
Innerhalb des Kampfes geht es allerdings auch ohne, indem man am Ende des Kampfes zig runden mit einem Gegner spazieren geht, dadurch jede Runde Mana regeneriert und diese Mana dann wiederum zum heilen verwendet. Es gibt auch einige K√§mpfe, die sich durch wildes hin und her Ziehen der Gegner ganz einfach gewinnen lassen. Das f√ºhrt nat√ºrlich dazu, dass gerade das Ende vieler K√§mpfe todlangweilig wird.
Bleiben wir noch einen Moment beim Heilen: Will man ausserhalb des Kampfes eine Bandage verwenden, die man f√ºr teures Gold erworben hat, gibt es dort ebenfalls eine Chance es zu verpatzen. Das f√ºhrt nat√ºrlich dann dazu, dass man einfach wieder in den Ladebildschirm abtaucht und es erneut versucht. Schlie√ütlich ist Gold keine endlose Ressource in dem Spiel und so m√∂chte man gut damit haushalten.
So ziehen sich die Mechaniken im Grunde durch das ganze Spiel. Der normale Spielfluss eines Abschnittes ist, dass man in das Schlachtfeld hinein geht, herumprobiert, lernt, was das Schlachtfeld von einem will, dann gegebenenfalls einen Spielstand vor dem Schlachtfeld l√§dt um Vorbereitungen anzupassen, und dann im Schlachtfeld den L√∂sungsweg abarbeitet und hofft, dass der Zufall einem keine St√∂cke, bzw ganze Bretter, zwischen die Beine wirft, durch die man dann neu laden muss. Zuguterletzt noch ein paar duzend Runden zum Heilen drangeh√§ngt und weiter geht es.


Nun kommt aber auch hinzu, dass die Technik des Spiels nicht auf der H√∂he ist. Die Grafik ist nicht besonders gut und es f√ºhlt sich trotzdem nicht ganz fl√ºssig an. Die ersten paar Minuten bestehen bereits aus einem Intro, das √§hnlich billig wirkt wie die ersten 3D Intros der 90er, aus abgehackten Dialogen und aus wild herumzuckenden Charaktermodellen.
Dann gibt es da noch ein grausiges Interface, das un√ºbersichtlich ist, bei dem viele Erkl√§rungen fehlen und das sich vor allem im Kampf hakelig anf√ºhlt.
Das Charaktersystem von "Das Schwarze Auge" ist bereits so schon recht komplex und kompliziert und dar√ºber hinaus m√∂chte ich auch an dieser Stelle garnicht darauf eingehen. Aber gerade dort w√§re ein vern√ºnftiges Interface extrem hilfreich gewesen. Sehr sch√∂n ist auch, dass viele Erkl√§rungen zu Interface-Elementen erst zu einem Zeitpunkt auftauchen, zu dem man diese schon X mal nutzen musste.

Zur L√§nge des Spiels sei kurz angemerkt, dass man mit etwa 40 Spielstunden f√ºr das Basisspiel auf dem mittleren Schwierigkeitsgrad rechnen kann. Ich habe es allerdings nach 20 Stunden auf dem Schwierigkeitsgrad Schwer abgebrochen.

Schlussendlich kann ich damit dem Spiel abgesehen von der Ausgangs-Story nicht viel positives abgewinnen. 

Das Debakel um die Collectors Edition hat es ebenfalls nicht besser gemacht. So haben K√§ufer der CE nicht nur auf einen Rabatt der Digitalen Version verzichtet, auf Early Access verzichtet, l√§nger auf Release warten m√ºssen als Spieler der Digitalen Version, sondern die CE beinhaltet auch keinen Steam Key, und der einzige Weg damit an die rein Digitale Erweiterung zu kommen, ist es diese auf der Platform Gamesrocket zu kaufen. Daf√ºr wiederum liegen der CE Ingame Gegenst√§nde bei, die das Balancing komplett zerst√∂ren.

Von mir gibt es daher einen klaren Daumen nach unten und ich w√ºrde das Spiel wirklich niemandem empfehlen. Wo Daedalic f√ºr Point & Click Adventures ein sehr gutes H√§ndchen hat, haben sie leider bei diesem Rollenspiel gezeigt, das Spiele mit komplexeren Systemen nicht ihr Ding sind.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994383050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1972, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1972, 'last_played': 1426511237}
review:
It is a good purchase if you can buy it for $20 or less.

Game style is squad turned base tactical strategy and has a lot of customization within normal high fantasy.  You have the ability to play Fighters, Mages and Archers of varrying types.

Fighters - two-handed, dual weild, sword and board, single handed
Damage types - slash, bash and penetration

Mages - Customization is really based on your ability to find and afford training the spells.  They start out weak, mid game are super powerful and in the end of the game are better at buffing your Master Archer and Two-Hand DPS meleer

Archers - You get 4 skills, 2 early on, extra damage shot, bypass armor shot and then later 3 arrows dps on single target (highest damage I can find in game) and then AoE rain of arrows.  Past that there is 1 good bow in game and Crossbow users can use those abilities it seems so 1 archer should do.  My main character was my archer.

If you like turned base squad tactical games this is decent but to me not worth $40, I would wait for a sale and get it at $20 or less if possible.  I did so at the last Winter Sale.

review:
Alors commencons par le n√©gatif, l'histoire est banal et les graphismes aussi... 

Mais peu importe ces deux critiques quand on veut un RPG au tour par tour et l√† ce jeu vaut le coup :

- on peut vraiment se cr√©er via les skills un groupe sympa et bien personnalis√© evidemment en toute logique il faut un groupe √©quilbr√© mais n√©ammoins comme je l'ai fait en faisant 2 runs en difficile on peut varier l'√©volution de chaque personnage hormis un mais c'est logique il a d√©j√† une bonne sp√© et il nous rejoint en cours de route mais son √©toffage reste √† notre guise ce qui permet d'autres sp√© mais d'un point de vue RP c'est pas logique de mon point de vue.
- je vous conseille de lire quelques guides qui expliquent les skills pour monter vos persos logiquement si vous ne connaissez pas les r√©gles de l'oeil noir (ma femme a jou√© sans rien y connaitre et en lisant √† peine les tutos ingame ca ne l'a pas emp√©ch√© de faire un run en normal puis ayant saisi l'essentiel d'en refaire un en difficile mais elle est perseverante elle a pein√© sur pas mal de combats)
- il a vari√©t√© de combats et de cartes avec des √©l√©ments interactifs pour tenir en haleine et contrairement √† ce que j'ai pu lire il n'y pas qu'une fa√ßon d'en venir √† bout. 
- la difficult√© des combats en difficile n'est pas un √©ceuil j'ai pein√© sur 3 combats mais 2 √©taient faisables quand je voulais car √©tant des qu√™tes secondaires donc j'aurai pu temporiser et sur la fin du deuxi√®me run avec une √©quipe sans combattant √† distance j'ai eu une map difficile qui en remaniant mes consommables (potions de vies, poisons etc;) a fini par passer donc j'ai du le refaire entre 5 √† 10 fois j'ai pas compt√© et en m√™me temps j'aurai aim√© plus de combat aussi retors...

Mon seul regret est la pauvret√© des √©quipements (armes et armures) peu de choix et au look discutable et le manque d'un  niveau de difficult√© sup√©rieur obligeant √† allier skills et consommables, ces derniers ne m'ayant √©t√© r√©ellement utile sur un seul combat c'est regrettable mais pour contrebalancer mon propos ma femme en a fait une tr√®s grosse consommation palliant √† travers eux sa m√©connaissance de l'√©volution d'un perso comme il se doit...

J'ai l'ai eu en promos pour 8‚Ç¨ donc 4‚Ç¨ chacun avec ma femme donc un r√©gal et on fera de m√™me avec Blackguards 2...

author: {'steamid': '76561198019334464', 'num_games_owned': 1241, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 1637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1537136493}
review:
[b]Neutral:[/b] There is certainly enough to love in the story and roleplaying of Blackguards, but the combats are pretty painful.  Drawn out mercilessly in some cases and filled with the occasional newbie trap, the tactical combat system is slow, clunky, and makes the game feel like much more of a grind than it needs to.  Nonetheless, a high-production game that is worth picking up on a sale if the slow pace and high micro on the combat isn't something that turns you off (or indeed, appeals to you). 

Read the full review [url=https://www.highlandarrow.com/reviews/191-blackguards.html]here[/url].

author: {'steamid': '76561197970683808', 'num_games_owned': 324, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 3049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3044, 'last_played': 1426784513}
review:
Never in my life did I play such a bad designed and awful game. 

While I¬¥m a fan of Das Schwaze Auge /the Dark Eye, I wanted to give it a try. The story was ok, but the gameplay was beyond bad. It doesn¬¥t matter what difficulty level you choose, the bad balancing will do his part. 

What, you maximized your weapon talent and hits on 95%, well the enemy will simply Masterly Dodge 5times in a row. What you got Magical Resitance 20, well the Achaz will still hit you with 100% spell.

Not only that the game speed is very low, some of the level are so bad designed that it will take way too much time to finish it, like a specific Cave level near the end

Then there are some levels like the Nine Hordes, oh how I wish I could punch the responsible person of this ridiculous endfight.

I simply cannot recommend this game, most of the fights were either really boring or setup with some really ridiculous requirements.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975387628', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 3236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3236, 'last_played': 1425845775}
review:
I bought this game with a bundle of a lot of games by the same company, and didn't think much of it. I had seen the positive review by TotalBiscuit, but I was not sure I would like the genre.

However, the game surprised me positively. The combat mechanics are well designed and implemented, and it makes the game fun and additive to play. Thanks to this good design, the game doesn't feel repetitive (even though most battles are very similar). It does also help that the battlegrounds are often different and sometimes with additional challenges.

The lack of possibility for level-grinding can make the game sometimes spike in difficult (at one point I was forced to lower the difficulty setting in order to get past one point, as there was no way to level-grind my characters), but for the vast majority of the game the problems arising from this have been largely avoided. (There are many similar tactical games that have no level-grinding where it results in the game being exceedingly difficult, but this game successfully avoids it for the most part.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198037468781', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 11891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10471, 'last_played': 1426185478}
review:
Difficult game which is reminiscent of tabletop rpgs. The stats and talents are merciless. Keep some saves close, don't expect to do the whole game without dying a few times. There's quite a few surprises. 

I enjoyed it. I can't really find any analogs to this game. It's too rpgesque to be akin to tactical combat, but it's not rpg enough in terms of deciding the fate of your characters to be considered a regular rpg.

Biggest cons:
-loading screens
-Attack/Miss
-Harsh to beginners

author: {'steamid': '76561197975582334', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1425773107}
review:
This is possibly the ugliest modern indie game I have had the displeasure of playing in a very long time. Everything from the sound mix to the graphics, down to the skid-mark brown art style. The only reconciliation is that I purchased when it was packaged with other junk and highly discounted. I highly recommend you do some research and watch some videos before buying this. If it wasn't so expensive I'd give this as a gift to people I don't like. It's so bad it makes me want to punch puppies and burn kittens. I mean it is just utterly atrocious. To put all that into context, it should be noted that I enjoy games like NEOScavenger. So yeah, don't buy this game unless your'e a masochist. The only darkness and gritiness here is the quality of development. I'm fairly certain they just dragged their taint accross the keyboard a few times and shipped it as a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967580967', 'num_games_owned': 1866, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 4833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4254, 'last_played': 1425510723}
review:
Gran juego, entretenido y largo. Me ha gustado much√≠simo, m√°s de lo que esperaba.

Al principio es un poco complicado pero al final se hace f√°cil. Como puntos positivos TODO, como negativos:
- Algunas misiones secundarias son extremadamente complicadas, pero tan complicadas que las dejaremos casi para el final del juego (no tiene mucho sentido que te aparezcan tan pronto)
- Hay una misi√≥n secundaria que est√° bugueada y no se puede terminar.
- Las tiendas son bastante in√∫tiles, termine el juego con miles de monedas de oro, ya que practicamente nunca compraba nada. Las armas y armaduras que venden siempre son iguales o peores que las que llevas.
- El tema del peso (carga) est√° mal hecho, termin√© el juego y a pesar de tener la fuerza de casi todos mis personajes al m√°ximo no pod√≠a llevar nada sin exceder el peso. Solo con las armas y armaduras equipadas ya iba en el l√≠mite, sin poder llevar armas o armaduras de reserva (se hecha de menos que no haya un baul donde guardar las cosas que no quieres llevar encima).

Es un juego completamente recomendable y me alegro que est√© traducido al espa√±ol.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111263701', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 2899, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1246, 'last_played': 1427151093}
review:
J'aime les T-RPG. J'aime l'Oeil Noir (m√™me si √ßa ne me rajeunit pas de repenser aux heures pass√©es dessus). J'aime bien ce jeu : son ambiance, son gameplay (m√™me s'ils auraient pu prendre en compte les statistiques d'esquive directement au lieu d'afficher des pourcentages de r√©ussite compl√®tement erron√©s, du coup). Mais non, je ne peux d√©cemment pas le conseiller.
Tout simplement parce qu'il est rempli de bugs. Et pas des petits. Des freezes bien gros et bien gras. Depuis le temps que ce jeu est sorti, c'est tout simplement une honte qu'ils n'aient pas √©t√© corrig√©s. Un exemple ? Vous devez aller dans une ville pour remplir une qu√™te. Normal. Classique. Et ben non : freeeeeeeze ! Bon, √ßa arrive. On recharge sa partie, et on recommence. Freeeeeeeze ! Bon... Apr√®s plusieurs essais - recharger une plus ancienne partie par exemple - on (re)recommence. Freeeeeeeeze ! La solution ? Aller ailleurs, et retenter sa chance par le biais d'un autre chemin. Et l√†, parfois, √ßa marche. Parfois, il suffit d'acheter quelque chose (n'importe quoi), et miracle, √ßa marche.
Mais au bout d'un moment, quand vous aurez progressez un peu dans l'aventure, ne vous inqui√©tez pas : he will be back ! Freeeeeeeze, c'est tout simplement le boss ultime de ce jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042993595', 'num_games_owned': 348, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 983, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 983, 'last_played': 1426351398}
review:
This is not a bad game, and i'd recommend it.

...BUT...
You will enjoy the game if you like the mechanics of Tabletop RPGs, if you are willing to pay attention to everything on the battleground, and if you like games where you have to think before every move.

You won't enjoy the game if you are looking for a simple rpg. 
Or if you don't like complicated skills and traits system.

The game is not perfect, but it's a good game if you like the genre.

The main flaw is the equipment is really weak and almost pointless to change

author: {'steamid': '76561198025115539', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 3037, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3037, 'last_played': 1424614250}
review:
Antes de comprarlo le√≠ un mont√≥n de cr√≠ticas negativas sobre el juego, tanto aqu√≠ como en otros sitios web, pero me segu√≠a llamando mucho la atenci√≥n as√≠ que me lo acabe comprando en unas rebajas.

El juego no tienen bugs, puede que al principio pero desde luego ahora no. Hay que ver el historial de combate detallado para ver que es lo que pasa con cada ataque realmente y no fijarse solo en el porcentaje de acierto. El juego es bastante complicado por momentos, sobre todo al principio hasta que consigues equipo y evolucionas a los personajes, con un sistema algo confuso hasta que te hasces con √©l y que no te explican en detalle en ning√∫n momento. Es uno de sus puntos buenos el ir descubriendolo tu mismo. La historia es lo suficientemente atrayente como para querer seguir y los combates-puzzles son originales y desafiantes.

No os dej√©is llevar por todas las malas cr√≠ticas que se leen y si os llama la atenci√≥n no dud√©is en darle una oportunidad.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989859778', 'num_games_owned': 1840, 'num_reviews': 228, 'playtime_forever': 3839, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3839, 'last_played': 1424612267}
review:
Wow, it has been a long time since I played the old "The Dark Eye" - Games. This game brought back some memories.

It has a nice atmosphere and is quite challenging. I really missed the roundbased RPGs, which is, for me atleast, revived in this. Sometimes you have to think ahead, sometimes you can just bully everybody down. Some fights are really stressful, while others are straightforward. The point is that almost no fight is like another one, each requires new tactics and strategies, atleast to a point. Of course you have your base tactics, which, in my case was a mostly ranged combat play style. But pure melee or multiple spellcasters sound interesting too. The good thing is that every character is can mostly do anything, aside the fact that only characters with magic potential can become wizards.

Another interesting thing for was the whole plot. Having played the other TDE games made it easy for me to fit into the world with its twelve gods, its mostly human based civilisation, with much prejudice against other races and of course its bright and wild country side, which makes this world a beautiful place. But the beauty in this is just a mask for all the darker happenings in this world.

All in all, if you love Roundbased Strategy, a good and detailed told story and funny, yet serious, characters, this game is for you. Just bring some time and patience, because the downside of this are the time consuming fights and the kinda missing background story of your secondary characters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125451441', 'num_games_owned': 591, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2814, 'last_played': 1527493179}
review: This is a very good game, fun to play through and great storyline. Some levels were difficult, but it makes you feel all that more accomplished when you complete it. The only problem was that some of the achievements are glitched and you won't get the achievement even if you do the required task.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004580691', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1417, 'last_played': 1409362981}
review:
It should be noted that I picked up this game in a sale at a discounted price, my opinion is based on me paying about ¬£18 for it rather than the full price. I think it is likely that my opinion on this game would change if I had forked out ¬£30 for it.

I knew about Daedlic's point and click games like Deponia so I was interested to see what their take on a RPG would be like. As it is something that I almost expect in a RPG nowdays it is important to state that this game is very linear. If you are expecting something like Dragon Age you are going to be very disapointed (to be fair expecting all RPGs to be like Dragon Age will invaribly lead to disappointment). Also I think the game description is a bit misleading, you and your companions do have a slight criminal air about yourselves but at the end of the day it is standard save the world type stuff, nothing too ground breaking.
The game has three main views, the first is the world overview you use for travelling around. This is basically a map type view with marker locations for villages, towns, places of interest etc... To move around you click on where you want to go and jump to that location - so no player controlled wilderness exploration or anything like that. The next view is the "town view". This is pretty much a static view where you can click on characters to buy goods or obtain/advance quests. The final view is the battle view, this is a map split up into small hexagons where the player controlled combat takes place. These battle maps range in size, though none are particularly huge. They consist of different environments and obstacles that sometimes require a change in tactics for some scenarios. Combat is turn based attack and move type stuff with close combat with swords, axes, maces etc..., ranged with bows and crossbows and ranged with magic. The combat can get a bit repetitious but there is enough in there that it does not feel too much a grind.
You get to pick one of three classes for your main character, a mage, a rogue/archer type or a fighter. On levelling up you pick attributes and combat skills and there is the freedom to create hybrid classes by giving your archer some mage abilities for example. I did find though that each class tends to have one particularly powerful skill or skill combo that you will just tend to repeat in combat.
The game itself has a lot of good and bad points, it is quite a mixed bag but there is probably going to be something in there that does end up annoying you, it certainly is not perfect. How much that thing annoys you is probably the defining factor in whether you will ultimately enjoy the game or not. For me it was with the combat, there are some monsters which are only vunerable to one type of damage. However, ahead of the battle you do not necessarily know what type of monster you will be fighting so in my case I frequently had everyone inflicting either piercing or magic damage. That was my best set up given my characters, weapons and prefered skills. However, in some fights monsters will be invulnerable to piercing so you have to quit the game reload and re-equip characters with maces so you can inflict bashing damage. Nothing game breaking but it did really get annoying, you learn pretty early on to have back up weapons handy and make sure your party is at least a bit flexible. You can look on that as somewhat of a positive as my party was really not set up for those particular battles so it did add an extra challenge, making what should have been an easy fight a bit more difficult. I think one other problem that needs highlighting is the party make up. You have a limited number of companions that you can recruit, essentially there is one party for the game. You do not get to deicde if you would rather have a mage or a fighter in your party you get what your are given. I do not want to spoil anything but at some point in the game something happens that means that really to fill a specific gap in your party your main character needs to be a specific class. Luckily I chose this class anyway so it was not a problem in my play through. If I had selected a different class it may have negatively effected my opinion of the game.
On the positive side I liked the story (the ending is a bit meh but nothing too objectionable) and found the characters interesting with some nice back story and different personalities. By the end I found myself invested in the story and felt fairly satisfied with the experience on completion. You do get some "choices with consequences moments" that give you a sense of control over how the story plays out. My play through took me 26 hours and I pretty much did everything quest wise in the game.

I would recommend this game but I did pay about ¬£18 for it. if I had paid the full retail price I would probably not recommend it as I think at that price some of the problems I have glossed over would have seemed a lot more annoying. My advice is to pick this up if you see it discounted as on the whole it is a relatively enjoyable experience. However, at full price there a lot better RPGs out there and I would be a lot less forgiving of the game's flaws.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061826908', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1424419319}
review:
A pretty dreadful experience.

Slow-paced and difficult, with too fine a stat/ ability granularity for how clunky and random the tactical combat actually is. The story was ok, just enough to give you a veneer of something to care about, but the beginning crisis was too cheesy and plot-holey, and everything that immediately followed felt really small, unimportant, and aimless. Game difficulty doesn't ramp well... as a starting player I felt always behind the curve, with crappy equipment and not enough gold to do much about it, and I spent more time redoing missions I lost than enjoying any sense of progression or accomplishment. The action wheel adds a lot of friction to the experience... it just took too long to do any action beyond the basic double-click weapon strike. Stores are weird... there's more stuff than I can afford to buy and more stuff available than I would even want, so it's an odd mix of too much/ not enough. As far as your character(s), there are too many skills/ abilities/ talents/ whatever and not enough information on what they are or do or what your starting levels indicate in terms of mastery... just too many knobs on one part of the game and not enough on all the others.

The VO was a nice touch and adds personality. The game looks good, if a bit stodgy.

But it's really just dreadful to play. The user experience just is not polished or satisfying. I like to have a good time, not a frustrating one.

Avoid, go play XCOM or Dragon Age or something else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147469502', 'num_games_owned': 453, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 9341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1583983598}
review: Instantly in love with this game.  It took a few battles to get the mechanics down but I didn't feel the learning curve was too stiff.  The story is engaging, the battles are fun and the difficulty scales to stay challenging.  I am glad I got this in a Humble Bundle and would have paid full price for it had I known how good it was.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005087995', 'num_games_owned': 504, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 3120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3099, 'last_played': 1404518843}
review:
Note: While I do recommend the game it's more of a niche, hard core-ish title meant for the more dedicated turn based tactics and rpg fans. 

I read many complaints about the immense difficulty and frustrating rng before playing Blackguards but when I got into it myself I found the complaints to be exaggerated though it's a subjective impression of course. The Dark Eye rpg system can seem strange to those who've never encountered it before and are mostly used to dnd-esque games but if one takes the time to study and understand the stats and skills and plan their characters the game will flow much more smoothly though there are a few missions that can feel overly long and frustrating. 

The most underrated part of Blackguards is the writing I think. While the overarching story is fairly forgettable the characters and their interractions with each other and the world around them are a treat on many occasions and the humor feels fresh and I found it genuinely funny as opposed to meme-ish or pop culture reliant as is often the case. The game setting is gritty and reminiscent of the eastern regions in A Song of Ice and Fire (popularly know as Game of Thrones). It's a place where slavery and blood sports are considered the norm and the Poisoners Guild is the "most respectable" It's a great place for your band of greedy liars, violet thugs, lazy misfits and romantic rogues to have their adventure. I found the English voice acting for the main characters very enjoyable as well. 

I won't go indepth into the gameplay rules since the game is a year old now and there's dozens of reviews and let's plays already. The system isn't perfectly balanced (is it ever?) and certain skills are not so useful to put it midly but it also offers a lot of flexibility in how you build your characters and it's satisfying to see your characters mature into serious ass kickers.

While Blackguards is a bit of a rough diamond I enjoyed my time with it quite a bit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002803441', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1512, 'last_played': 1423257864}
review:
Difficult one to call, I think. I was quite hooked over the first 10 hours of gameplay, and the story seemed like it was going places... However after a while I have found the battle-town-battle-town method of progression quite monotonous. 

I enjoy the battle system - but be warned, the amount of misses/parry can become extremely frustrating!

It is a good game. and I am recommending that RPG fans give it a try - but I think it's definitely an acquired taste!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011773013', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1424009236}
review:
I did not spend a lot of time playing the game but it was exceedingly hard to get into it due to the bland story.  The characters were very flat and the dialogue was just boring.  There are more than enough tactical rpgs out that I should not be wasting my time on a lifeless one.

The rest of the game (character creation, combat, inventory, etc) was okay but once again nothing that would make it stand out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980786340', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1481, 'last_played': 1424058050}
review:
I think this Blackguards has a strong base and may lead to a very good sequel.  The game is flawed though.  For a game that states:

"Your choice of spells, skills and abilities determine your battlefield tactics. Aggressive? Defensive? Tactical? It's your call how to tackle each challenging encounter! "

There is very little choice.  If you want an RPG where you can build your characters and team this is not it.  The game give you a very well defined group to play with.  It makes the game extremely difficult if you do not build your characters to a certain role.  The other characters are far enough down their progression that it makes little to no sense to try and change them.  What is so maddening about this game, is that there is a lot of really cool things you could do.  You are just not able to do them, because they game gates skills, and locks players into roles for you.  If the game just let you have 4-5 characters to build as you see fit it would be far better.  

The story was fine.  The voice acting was ok.  The game is good.  There is no real choice in the game though.  No characters progression choice and no choice in what you do.  That is why the game falls short for me.  It is not worth the full price.  

If you are looking for a decent game that has limited flexibility and is on rails this might be for you.   This game just falls way short of how it is advertized.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010946452', 'num_games_owned': 2426, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1072, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1072, 'last_played': 1423734854}
review: I liked the idea behind the story of Blackguards; there aren't enough games out there with 'evil' characters, however this game had a really slow story with frustrating blockages from not being as overpowered as the game expects and no way to 'grind' up the levels.  The middle section of the game was probably the most interesting with its non-linear gameplay, but a slow and boring 8hr lead-up and a slow and boring 4hr let-down of an ending accompanied by its repetitive and repetitive and repetitive fights in between.  The only thing keeping me going was the vague hope that it would get better, or stay as good as the 3rd out of 5th chapter.  Only worth playing if you are *really really* into repetivie turn-based combat

author: {'steamid': '76561198024921869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 3060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2866, 'last_played': 1423416606}
review:
Very enjoyable turn-based strategy game.  Easy to pickup, and a fun cast of characters that make your party. The core storyline is linear, but the battles are incredibly fun.  There is a lot of challenging battles, and plenty of easy battlse without a sweat.  It keeps the game tight toward the battle, because the overmap screen really gives you the chioce of what quests to pickup and what items to purchase, but there is not any unnecessary travel.  Essentially, you fast travel from location to location, and many times entering a battle at the various desitinations. 

There a few main enemies that show up multiple times, and adds to the drama.  However, the story is enjoyable, the battles at the last stage leading to the ultimate battle are quite good, however, the ending is a bit of let down.  However, that doesn't take away from everything they did to make this game awesome. 

If you like controlling your party for turn based D&D battles, you are going to love this game. :)
