author: {'steamid': '76561198007101660', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1394317926}
review: Played for less than an hour, story is TERRIBLE so far.  The voice acting is as bad as the story.  The game mechanics are severely restritive.  THE ENTIRE GAME is encounters in a series of predetermined instances and cinematics. I love RPG's, hex based games and strategy games as a genre - but there has to be more to the game than *fight* -> *poorly done cinematic with no meaning* -> *fight*.  Wish I had done more research into the game before purchasing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007145369', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1393954540}
review:
Although it has an interesting idea for a story, the gameplay itself is porrly executed. The fight sequences are repetitive and even on normal mode seemed arbitrarily hard, suggesting not a lot of creativity went into the difficulty just number values. The side quests were uninteresting, the characters were fairly stock and it just had the feeling of an unfinished game in general. Too be fair, I never made it out of Chapter 1, so I can't say it doesn't get better; however, I'm a firm believer in having the beginning of the game be the hook, to entice the gamer to play more. Another reason being: if the first chapter feels unfinished, how is the rest of the game going to feel better? And spells that have a chance of failing? I understand Magic Resists/Immunities creating another level of gameplay, but buff spells that have a 46% chance to fail? 
 Overall 5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985589039', 'num_games_owned': 539, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 1375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 827, 'last_played': 1421713609}
review:
This game is just terrible.
Shame because the looks and ui and the feel of it all is topnotch.

The problem lays in the balance, there is no way to go around and level up and get better gear, except to do the linear preset battles, terrible design. BUT the real problem lays in the fact that you are too weak, cant afford the items they have for sale etc, close to starting you will find yourself against lots of Lice , just one can take you out, but you deal best around 10damage, so do they, but there are lots of them, you can take a couple down but thats it, and that is on easy mode.

The game is really hard even on easy mode, a good game wasted, i feel like shooting the brainless devs.

Do not bother, if you do dont say you was not warned. Check the forum first for a true insight.

Avoid this one and the devs no nothing about balance etc.

Also if you play on a high resolution, forget it, i run on a 2560x1080 monitor and even that isnt supported.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013462301', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 7139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6301, 'last_played': 1667353394}
review:
I like the game so far. I give it a B. 
Nice combat system. Nice stat system for upgrading characters. Loot system is ok, I personally would like more armor options. Character customization needs more options. THe story and voice acting are decent.
However, the cutscene graphics are pretty bad - especially the backgrounds- not very pretty. The overall graphics are disappointing. 
Some light exploration would be nice as well. However, as a former AD&D player and RPG fanatic this game serves it's RPG fix in a satisfying way. Lastly, I'm playing the game on "Easy" and it's not difficult at all. I hear the difficulty curve is very steep.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039840227', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 2860, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2860, 'last_played': 1395779225}
review:
This is again a tricky one. Overal Blackguards is an extremely fun game but it has one big flaw. 

First the positive points: 
The strategic turn-based hex battles are great, I'm happy that finally game developers are taking this up again instead of all that RTS nonsense. The combat system with different moves goes smoothly, also the interface using a radial menu is OK. It does take a while getting used to.
Nice character development using a skill/talent system which is unconventional. This feels fresh and is an interesting change compared to other typical RPG's.
The voice acting is great and really adds to the immersion, also the characters themselves are well fleshed out and the interaction between them is hilareous at times (which is positive i.e. there is a lot of humor in the game).
There are many different (side-)quests, lots of items to find and experiment with etc.
The story itself is interesting and while the game is very linear it doesn't come as a hindrance. This also is a nice change of pace compared to other games recently where everything has to be 'open'.

Now to the one flaw which at times totally screws up the game: 'nonsense' battles ...
Each time I play, the battles are sometimes challenging, sometimes easy but overal quite fun. However, when you reach the pinnacle of that fun and are really enjoying the game ... the devs throw in what I call 'nonsense' battles which totally kill the mood and make you want to remove the game from the harddrive.

These 'nonsense' battles for example require you to rescue someone in 6 turns. The first say two attempts it won't work since you have to figure out what is needed, the next couple of attempts you run into traps (you can't detect them since there is no time in 6 turns). So in the end you have to constantly reload and reload and reload. Try a fireball on the first turn, if it fails, reload since no miss can be afforded. The game in such battles also feels as if the 'to hit' percentages are inversed. For example a 'to hit' percentage of 95% in these battles feels as if it's 5% since suddenly everything misses (so reload and reload and reload). It thus has nothing to do with strategy anymore but purely boils down to finding that one single path which 'could' lead to victory and then pray that your attacks actually succeed.

The above is really sad since it totally spoils the mood. After completing such a 'nonsense' battle (which is really a waste of time) the game is again great and fun until you again reach a point where they decided to dump such a miscreation.
It feels as if the game was designed by two different people. One person designed 85% of the game which is great and 15% was designed by someone who's only goal was 'How can I annoy the player the most?".

The game also has some minor issues like incorrect voices in cutscenes or a slight stutter when using certail skills (hammer blow) etc but nothing game breaking. I didn't have any crash or anything, overal it runs smooth.

In total it took me 47 hrs to complete it on medium.  Considering the fact that it has some interesting replay value (different starting class, different spells, ....) the game delivers quite some content.

So, in summary, it's a great game if you're into turn-based combat and will give you a lot of fun and funny moments, but beware the 'nonsense' battles since they can make you switch to a different game in a blink. When looking at the whole package the 85% definitely outweighs the 15% so I recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029480368', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 6180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5508, 'last_played': 1394482185}
review: Complex and challenging. The story is all right, gameplay is excellent. A lot of battles that are not too easy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972076777', 'num_games_owned': 1867, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1394205012}
review:
Pros: Very good and moderately complex skill system, nice graphics, turn-based combat. Rather rich equipment.

Cons: No free exploration, game divided into separate spots with battles or other encounters, battles with fixed loot,  exprerience and difficulty level (and there is no place to grind and level-up your characters). Single-screen cities, magic fails profoundly and its influence on combat is mediocre.

Conclusion: It's not a real RPG, it's tactical TBS with some RPG elements. Not worth the full price, but at 50% or more discount - why not.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012900927', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1122, 'last_played': 1395785119}
review:
Als ich damals von der Ank√ºndigung des Spiels geh√∂rt habe war ich erst mal etwas skeptisch. Da der Entwickler aus Hamburg f√ºr gute Abenteuer-Spiele steht wie z.B. die Deponia-Trilogie und Blackguards, Neuland f√ºr ihn war.

Nach dem ich mich nun ein zweites Mal, Blackguards - nun in Version 1.3 - hin gegeben habe, muss ich konstatieren dass ich so ein gutes Gef√ºhl schon lange nicht mehr hatte. Der spielerische Flu√ü und die taktische Tiefe sind sehr harmonisch abgestimmt, wie ich finde.

Die Story ist solide aber nicht der Kern warum man Blackguards antesten sollte. Wer alte SSI-Rollenspiele wie Pool of Radiance vermisst wird hier auf seine Kosten kommen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997183661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 3787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2763, 'last_played': 1397986914}
review: Engaging and complex turn based strategy, which surely has its flaws. This includes the graphics and story telling. What sets this game apart from others of its kind, are the varying battle fields. They often feature special rules forcing you to rethink your standard tactics. I also like the down-to-earth setting. While the "heroes" get stronger with time, you never feel "super".

author: {'steamid': '76561198059283170', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 5158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1404252226}

author: {'steamid': '76561198005687766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1394045363}

author: {'steamid': '76561197996662968', 'num_games_owned': 268, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1422236222}
review:
Not ready for primetime.  

First the good:  It looks fun and I enjoyed the first part of the first chapter.  Voice acting is decent and the combat flows OK if you like turn-based (and I do)

The Bad:  Constant crashes; gamebreaking to the point where I can't continue.  Not my first rodeo and I have tried all I can think of to resolve them.  I deliverately waited until the game was out of early access and patched before purchasing.  I regret doing so now.  I'm not your beta tester.  I'm a customer or WAS a customer.  

Look elsewhere to avoid frustration.

OK Update - After several trys, I was finally able to get the game to continue.  Felt like walking on eggshells.  Did I do anything profound? Nope.. Just kept loading from a save until it finally continued.

After further play, I still feel the game needs balancing.  Some of the fights are super-easy, others are nigh impossible.  I stand by my review.  Will this game be enjoyable at some point?  I bet, sure.. Does it need patching?  Yes it does...

author: {'steamid': '76561197973782676', 'num_games_owned': 2077, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1736, 'last_played': 1393713594}
review: Do you love endless battles on a hex grid? Because that's what this game boils down to. At the core, this game requires you to really have some strategy and luck. The battles are always stacked hard against you, often feature respawning monsters that all need to killed at once, or have you slogging through ranks of enemies that are immune to your particular weapon type. The story is totally forgettable, the "tricks" to certain fights are not always clear, the inventory system is bizarre. While the game is slightly better now than in pre-release beta, it's still not what I'd call a "fun" or "gripping" game. I think TOEE pulled this whole thing off a little better, plus that game is way cheaper. I wouldn't pay more than $7 for Blackguards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030675190', 'num_games_owned': 149, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1393500111}
review: So long after the release, still key features missing, game freezing randomly. I wont ever buy anything from Daedalic. So much potential in Schwarze Auge ruleset and so fracked up by incompetent testing and slow patching process.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010886229', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 1393977562}

author: {'steamid': '76561198020969919', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1585189741}
review: A terrific return to Turn-Based Combat, with a slightly darker, fantasy story. It at once feels like a renaissance of the turn-based genre, but with some newer, unique ideas. Character customization looks outrageous and daunting at first, but with a single type of Adventure Point and clear class-goals, linear guidance eases the pain, while still allowing anyone to experiment with wild combinations. It's a classic tale of old-school meets new-school, all in a really tightly-produced package. Graphics, story and gameplay are all great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012374057', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1384480464}
review:
Per il team tedesco Daedalic Entertainment la lunga maratona di rilasci riguardanti avventure punta e clicca si √® interrotta a fine gennaio quando, dopo mesi di attesa e di prove generali nella versione Early Access rilasciata su Steam, Blackguards √® giunto ufficialmente nei negozi tradizionali in Germania ed in quelli digitali di tutto il mondo.

Col videogioco in questione non si √® soltanto interrotta la routine suddetta, ma ci si √® aperti ad un nuovo genere, quindi ad un nuovo mercato; di fatto, Blackguards √® il primo gdr sviluppato da questo team che grazie ai tanti consigli della community Steam nei mesi scorsi ha potuto limare imperfezioni ed imprecisioni cogliendo al volo l‚Äôoccasione per un rilascio pi√π tranquillo e meno stressante, proprio per i riscontri pi√π che positivi ottenuti dagli acquirenti della versione Early Access, tra l‚Äôaltro notevolmente scontata rispetto a quello che attualmente √® il prezzo ufficiale.
Dopo aver passato un importante numero di ore sul videogioco, siamo pronti a dirvi la nostra. 

http://www.ilvideogioco.com/2014/02/22/blackguards-recensione-pc/

author: {'steamid': '76561198038820702', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1013, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1013, 'last_played': 1393136975}
review: Great concept for a game. And, basically, a great game! However, when "challenging" becomes "senselessly impossible" you will begin to question whether you should have post-poned rent after all. Maybe your landlady can be reasoned with... the AI in Blackguards can't be. After 28 hours of re-trying th same fight (gladiator), trust me, your interest in the game will be replaced with the kind of regret that can only be compared to being mugged in a back alley for the $40 you cheerfully gave for the privilege. I have bought and played 'hundreds' of games, but have never been SO frustrated with such an imbalanced game-play. If the difficulty is repaired to "achievable" it would be a great game, but currently you'll have more fun nailing your fingers to a wall.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017107138', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 10429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8867, 'last_played': 1395201185}
review: Very fun game if you would like a different type of RPG experience than other RPG games out there. Expert Mode makes it easier to understand how the game works and it also makes it so you have more control over your character build. Don't get too frustrated as you play and learn the system. Stick with it until you figure it out and you will have loads of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032528936', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2771, 'last_played': 1393089470}
review: Really enjoyed this game.  Difficulty seemed a bit high at first, but I got used to it quickly.  Devs also seem dedicated to making it the best game it can be.  Definitely recommend this title.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033473318', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2235, 'last_played': 1420794771}
review:
Many games call themselves "tactical rpgs" but that's just a slogan. This one really is. If you love turn based combat, with simple to learn rules but a lot of nuances, if losing a fight makes you want to play it better - this is a game for you. The story is simple but not bad, it progresses through dialogues as there is no actual exploration. But the whole point is developing your party and fighting cleverly designed fights. They require you to use terrain, positioning, traps and other tricks to survive. If by RPG you understand a game where you just click on an opponent - this game is not for you. Actually I would rather recommend this game to a strategy fan not an RPG one.

EDIT> I am sad but I feel I have to change my recommendation to a negative one. While the game itself is great, I ran into a bug in a fight at the end of chapter 3. Basically the turn of one of AI characters (Manolo) never ends. Thus I can't complete this fight and progress with the game. I reported the bug 3 months ago and still nothing, only a generic automated response.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055743317', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3210, 'last_played': 1502449146}
review: I have now put in over 50 hours on Blackguards.  I admit, getting started is a bit difficult, you really have to pay attention to what stats boost what spells or actions, but on my third character I finally had something good going.  The tactical combat is not as balanced as I had hoped for, but the challenge is mostly fun and only rarely frustrating - one flashback scene and the damn Iribar Lilies took me a good while to beat, but other than that, good times.  If you are in the mood for a challenge, give this game a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965818453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5971, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 832, 'last_played': 1688228336}
review:
Also ich bin ja ein riesen Fan von Rundenbasierenden Strategie- und Rollenspielen aber dieses Spiel ist echt ein Frechheit vor allem f√ºr den Preis.

Es beginnt mit der Charaktererschaffung, wo ich alle Vorrausetzungen f√ºr ein Kampftalent erf√ºlle aber nicht kaufen kann. Was mich besonders daran st√∂rt ist das ich ja woanders bewusst ein Nachteil in kauf nehme um das zu erf√ºllen aber das Spiel gibt es nicht her.

Als zweites gleich nach der Charaktererschaffung, wenn ich mir Items ausgesucht hatte sind die verschwunden und kann mit meinem Charakter eine ganze weile nicht spielen, au√üer ich schlage mit meinen F√§usten zu bis ich die Items kaufen kann die ich f√ºr meinem Charakter brauche, es sei denn ich gebe EPs f√ºr Waffenfertigkeiten aus die ich eigentlich nicht spielen wollte. Im Detail hei√üt das bei mir z.B. das ich einen Charakter mit Degen und Wurfwaffenfertigkeiten erstellt habe und ihn am Anfang nicht spielen konnte weil keine Items f√ºr Ihn kaufen konnte und Ihn im Grunde Umskillen muss damit ich mitk√§mpfen kann.

Wenn man die Hilfe f√ºr das Spiel anl√§sst erf√§hrt man das man die Umgebung nutzen kann f√ºr bestimmte Situationen was an sich ein sehr guter Gedanke ist, aber wenn man nicht erf√§hrt ob man etwas nutzen kann in dem man z. B. mit dem Mauszeiger √ºber einen Gestand oder auch Gel√§nde geht und keine Informationen bekommt, es sei denn man steht direkt daneben und klickt auf benutzen was nat√ºrlich nicht immer geht und man seine Bewegung in die Richtung umsonst ausgegben hat ist schon echt frustrierend besonders weil ich nicht jedes mal von vorne anfangen m√∂chte!

Au√üerdem kann man nur bei bestimmten leuten seine Fertigkeiten verbessern, wobei die Auswahl mal wieder begrenzt ist selbst wenn man wieder Anforderungen erf√ºllt das gleichzeitg f√ºr das Spiel bedeutet das man nie in einem bestimmten Skill, wenn man es m√∂chte dem Gegner √ºberlegen ist sondern das es sich die Balance h√§lt was im Grunde hei√üt egal was du spielst oder wie ist vollkommen egal, denn wenn man sich eine strategie zurecht legt kommt man √ºberall durch und der charakter ist nur nebensache.

Jetzt kommen noch die Begleiter die ich leider nicht los werde selbst wenn ich es m√∂chte und sogar im Spiel immer mehr dazu kommen.

Ich hoffe ich kann allen die das Spiel kaufen m√∂chte ein wenig weiter helfen wartet lieber bis das Spiel weniger kostet denn das Geld ist es auf keinen Fall wert.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969786287', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 4199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4199, 'last_played': 1392816986}
review: Surprisngly good fun.  A ton of quests, a hefty amount of character customization, fairly solid voice acting, and most importantly, good turn based strategy combat.  The game does very little to ease you into it, but once you pick up the mechanics and understand the stat system behind the scenes, it really comes into its own.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055144728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1392503393}

author: {'steamid': '76561197975369894', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 419, 'last_played': 1392753948}
review:
No No No.  Soooo frustrating to do the same fight OVER and OVER trying to figure out how to pass each level - not fun at all.

I've been itching for some RPG strategy that is unique and fun - I played the demo and thought - wow, this is well done.

Then...  I ran into the first "Strategy levels".  Really, try and save the Baroness with the Mage character I selected.  Not gonna happen without 30 attempts or better.

Then...  Try and beat the level where the ranged guy keeps hitting the same character over and over with a knockdown ability - oh sure, you can put up a magic barrier - but then it fades or the spell fizzles - oh, fun times - try again...

I paid HOW much for this?  Why didn't they stick to fun strategy like positioning and skill choices?  Not "I have to do exactly what they say or I fail" - This could have been such a fun game...  I am saddened...

author: {'steamid': '76561198057737119', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1056, 'last_played': 1394988877}
review: This game is smooth. The tactics envolved keeps the game fresh.  The characters fit perfectly into the story telling and the odd quests you find yourself in at time in no way shape or form feel out of place.  This game is awesome soo far and I can't get enough.  I recommend it if you love tactic RPGs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090605743', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 549, 'last_played': 1392857518}
review:
I hate to vote down this game because there are a lot of things I do like about it.  However I think the games biggest problem is that it just isn't open enough which doesn't feel right for an RPG.  If you run into a rough spot to where you just aren't a high enough level to win without a one in a milion chance of getting lucky every move then you just get stuck since there is no way to go and do a couple of battles to where you can get strong enough to complete the quest.  The only battles I've been able to do so far are all battles within a quest.  I've heard this game opens up a bit later on but I'm not willing to retry a ton of battles over and over again to get to that point when I can find similar games that start out being that open.  

I hated to vote this game down and I think a lot of people will like this game but it's just not for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987944431', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 2224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2224, 'last_played': 1392689138}
review: A great turn-based RPG without all of the random wandering fluff. Being based on The Dark Eye gives the rules a sense of deep development that you don't see in games that have invented their own ruleset. Pure classic tactical combat with enough character development and such to keep you playing well past when you should.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971320206', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1045, 'last_played': 1424889880}
review: I really like this game it has good indepth charackter creation and good strategic elements. Played like 10h now and I'm starting to get a feel for the gamemecanics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007982638', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1419834619}
review:
This is a pretty good game and I would recommend it for casual game play. It doesn't have the depth of some games, but it has pretty good graphics and voice overs, and is quite easy to start playing.

I often have little 5-10 minute gaps in my work day while waiting on a phone call or waiting on approval for a job, and the last few days have had this game running and play as a time-killer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051315194', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 5903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5701, 'last_played': 1392876970}
review: Great game. I'm an older player. If you like old school D&D themed type of games and turn based combat with quite a few skills spells and stats..... this game is for you. If you want a pew pew own other players in an MMO this game is not for you. The game seems slow to many people because well... it  IS!!! It's supposed to be a kick back and enjoy the world story with fun turn based battles. It may not be the best game ever or anything, I'm not saying that, but it is damn good imo. The dialouge can be pretty damn funny at times and it's a pretty game. The loading screens can be a bit annoying when you are trying to find a particular trainer or whatever so I suggest using a pen and paper if you find yourself forgetting where destinations are. One thing that annoys me a bit is I still have not found anywhere that tells me my AR flat out....and some of the hover overs on new equiptment can be annoying as they are not intuiative... takes a bit to figure out and doesn't need to be that way imo. I'd still give the game a 4.5 out of 5 stars...and it's a lot longer than I expected it to be which pleased me so far. (not finished with the game yet only at the end of chapter 3). I usually don't replay games but I think I will for sure on this one just to mess with stats.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994037570', 'num_games_owned': 408, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 3805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3716, 'last_played': 1392521257}
review:
Blackguards is a turn-based strategy game with deep RPG elements based on the popular German pen and paper RPG The Dark Eye. You assume the role of your own custom character who is accused of killing the princess in the opening cinematic. Your only choice is to run away, assemble a cast of shady characters such as the suave mage Zurbaran, the feisty dwarf Naurim and the tribal warrior Takate. The storytelling and the characters are solid, but they really don‚Äôt stand out in any significant way, for the most part it really feels like a poor man‚Äôs BioWare story.

What makes Blackguards truly shine are its great combat system and wonderful game world. The combat system is hex based and may at first remind you of fantasy turn-based strategy games such as Heroes of Might and Magic or King‚Äôs Bounty. In reality, it‚Äôs more like a combination of Disciples III and Neverwinter Nights, a heavy mixture of classic turn-based strategy and role-playing philosophy. The fantastic thing about the combat system is that every single battlefield is completely unique. Not only are they all different from a visual standpoint, but they are all set up differently as well. Sometimes you‚Äôre surrounded, sometimes you have multiple goals, sometimes you have to defend something. You can also use the environment to your advantage. Cut the rope to make the heavy wooden chandelier fall on your foes or burn down the walkway spiderwebs causing deadly poisonous spiders fall to their doom.

Another big thing different from usual turn-based strategy games is that you‚Äôre not building an army, you have a party of up to five characters. As you progress through the game, you acquire adventure points which you can use to upgrade your characters in a wide variety of attributes, abilities, spells, talents and weapon talents. It‚Äôs a really robust system that allows for truly deep customization and experimentation. The only negative thing is that the game assumes that you‚Äôre familiar with The Dark Eye ruleset when in reality you will need some time to really figure it out.

The other problem stemming from the use of The Dark Eye ruleset is that almost any attack can be a hit or miss. Because the game is really tough and the opening battles are rather grueling, it can be really frustrating missing a 95% attack. There are ways to upgrade your characters to offset this, but again, this will take some time to figure out as the game doesn‚Äôt really explain much of anything. This can cause some really ugly bouts of frustration and anger, but it‚Äôs not a deal breaker.

The vast majority of the gameplay is in the battles. Apart from that, you‚Äôll be using a lovely 2D map to travel from location to location. Towns are represented with a single screen depicting various points of interest such as shops, healers, blacksmiths and quests. The graphics are absolutely beautiful, the wonderful art style is sort of a mixture between fantasy, medieval Spain and 16th century Caribbean which is actually seldom seen in games. The accompanying soundtrack reflects that as well and fits the game very well. However, the animations aren‚Äôt that great and the voice work, while mostly solid, can be a bit cringe-worthy at times.

Blackguards is a hardcore game for hardcore gamers and it is completely unapologetic about it. So be prepared for some truly grueling stuff and a steep learning curve. The great thing is, it‚Äôs absolutely worth playing thanks to the great combat system, deep RPG elements and a wonderful game world.

8 OUT OF 10 (GREAT)

author: {'steamid': '76561197970358411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 10252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2490, 'last_played': 1409039835}
review:
Brauchbare (old school-) Rundenstrategie- RPGs muss man mittlerweile mit der Lupe suchen. Nicht zuletzt deswegen hat dieses Spiel es mir echt angetan. Nat√ºrlich ist es von der Aufmachung her eher ein einfaches Rollenspiel, aber das Wesentliche passt, n√§mlich der Spielspa√ü! Die K√§mpfe, mit denen man wohl den gr√∂√üten Teil der Spielzeit verbringt, spielen sich angenehm taktisch und anspruchsvoll, dazu sind die interaktiven Schlachtfelder sehr liebevoll, abwechslungsreich und durchdacht gestaltet. So kommt selbst beim 100sten Kampf keine Langeweile auf. 
Auch wenn man vielleicht schon besser pr√§sentierte Storys gesehen haben mag, erf√ºllt diese solide ihren Zweck und motiviert glaubhaft zum weiterspielen.
Sinnvoll finde ich auch Feinheiten wie etwa das Gruppeninventar, welches das Mikromanagement, wie man es aus anderen (DSA-) Rollenspielen kennt, erheblich und sinnvoll reduziert.
Auch die Spielzeit ist f√ºr heutige Verh√§ltnisse absolut vorbildlich, da bekommt man ordentlich was f√ºrs Geld!
Klar k√∂nnte man noch hier und da etwas verfeinern oder verbessern, aber insgesamt in meinen Augen ein sehr gelungenes und ausgereiftes Spiel und f√ºr mich mit die bisher beste DSA Umsetzung. 
Davon darf, nein muss unbedingt mehr kommen!
-> Absoluter Geheimtip! 
F√ºr DSA- erfahrene absoluter Pflichtkauf, aber auch DSA- Neulinge, welche rundenbasierende Spiele m√∂gen, sollten sich die recht umfangreiche Demo (kompl. 1. Akt) unbedingt anschauen. Es lassen sich anschlie√üend sogar die Spielst√§nde in die Vollversion √ºbernehmen - vorbildlich!
Also auf in den Kampf! ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561197991804024', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1855, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1193, 'last_played': 1393040793}

author: {'steamid': '76561198033342323', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2611, 'last_played': 1392190960}
review:
Leider unfair....(TEXT!)

So, nach 40 Stunden Spielzeit (mehrere Chars, Schwierigkeitsgrad: Normal, Expertenmodus, bis fast Ende 3. Kapitel) konnte ich mir mMn einen guten Einblick ins Spiel machen. Und ich muss leider sagen, dass ich es so wie es ist nicht empfehlen w√ºrde. Warum?
Ich geh√∂re zu den EA K√§ufern dieses Spiels, weil ich mich sehr darauf gefreut habe. Aus Zeitgr√ºnden konnte ich das Spiel aber erst nach Release spielen, Gl√ºck im Ungl√ºck.

Ich vermute mal alle, die hier die Reviews lesen haben sich etwas √ºber das Spiel informiert bzw. wissen √ºber das Genre etwas Bescheid, aber dennoch sei hier nochmals gesagt, dass man mit einer Gruppe "Helden" in sch√∂ner DSA-RPG Manier durch die Gegend zieht und sich (eigentlich) freut seine Helden weiter auszubilden...eigentlich.

Erst einmal kurz zu den positiven Punkten, leider wirklich nur kurz. Die Intromusik ist wunderbar, die Karten-Schlachtfelder sind sch√∂n gezeichnet bzw. sch√∂ne Locations, die Zauber auf dem Schlachtfeld sehen gut aus, einige Sprecher und Spr√ºche der Charaktere sind einfach klasse(!).
Das war es dann aber auch.

Die Musik ist auf Dauer unertr√§glich monoton und nervig, aber das ist ja sehr geschmacksabh√§ngig, ich habe recht schnell die Musik abgeschaltet, weil sie mich irre machte...

Die Grafik und Animation der Charaktere au√üerhalb der Schlachtfelder ist...zweckm√§√üig... Zeichnungen w√§ren sch√∂ner gewesen bzw. h√§tte keinen gest√∂rt.

Nun zum eigentlichen Problem des Spiels, aus meiner Sicht.
Das Spiel ist sehr, sehr oft unfair und nicht mal ansatzweise nachvollziehbar. Durch eine vielzahl von Talenten, Zaubern, Waffenfertigkeiten, Sonderfertigkeiten etc., welche man alle "skillen" kann suggeriert einem das Spiel, dass man viel lernen kann, sich bzw. seine Charaktere individualisieren kann um Abenteuer zu bestehen. Auch werden einem immer sch√∂n prozentuale Erfolgschancen angezeigt..welche sich schlussletztendlich als vollkommen egal und √ºberfl√ºssig erweisen. 

Eine Individualisierung oder breitere Auff√§cherung von vielen Talenten und Fertigkeiten ist absolut t√∂dlich und frustrierend. Bei den Waffen lohnt es sich eigentlich nur Hiebwaffen(1H/2H) zu lernen (bzw, je nach Held einen Schadenszauber oder "OP" Fernkampf), gegen Stichwaffen sind alle und jeder "immun", √ºbertrieben gesagt: einen dicken Ent bekomm ich mit der flachen Hand klein, aber nicht mit dem bis zum Ende geskillten Zweih√§nder...

Immunit√§ten/Widerst√§nde der Gegner sind eh sehr erstaunlich. Komischerweise wird einem gesagt, dass mein Feuerstrahl eine Wahrscheinlichkeit von 98% hat, aber wenn man bei 5-6 von 10 Mal Wirken von Feuerstrahl den Zauber verpatzt wird es frustrierend, weil nicht nachvollziehbar. Auf alle Zauber mit unter 70% Chance sollte man eh verzichten und sich die Astralenergie sparen...
Das ist die gro√üe Krux, √ºberall werden einem Trefferwahrscheinlichkeiten oder Prozentzahlen etc. angezeigt. leider ist nicht wirklich nachvollziehbar worauf diese sich dann beziehen. Erfolgswahrscheinlichkeiten bzw. Trefferchance verblassen im Programmcode und es gibt den nicht angezeigten  Widerstands-Algorithmus PRO Gegner..so scheint es zumindest.

Ich habe versucht einen Helden gleich zu Anfang und im fr√ºhen Spielverlauf mit 1H Hiebwaffen auf 18 (Max) zu bringen, das hat auch geklappt, aber ich treffe angeblich ziemlich oft und mache gut Schaden, theoretisch. Aber anscheinend passen sich die "LowLvL" Gegner darauf an, ich verhaue einen Schlag nach dem Anderen, es wird st√§ndig ausgewichen. Angezeigt wird aber das ich voll der 1H Hiebwafffen Superheld w√§re..

Auch hier ein Problem, wie ich finde, man muss sich extrem spezialisieren: eine Waffe (Hieb), zwei bis drei Zauber, der Rest klappt eh nicht weil die Erfolgschancen noch geringer sind als so schon. Wenn aber ein Spezialist tot/gel√§hmt/√ºbernommen worden ist...kann man den Kampf eigentlich von vorne beginnen, und auch das hat nichts mit Taktik und Strategie zu tun, wenn die Gegner erstaunlicherweise meine hochgelernte Magieresistenz umgehen, ich es aber nicht schaffe mit einer angeblichen 99% Erfolgchance mal zu treffen.
"Sichtfelder" und/f√ºr  Fl√§chenzaber oder Heilzauber sind teilweise sehr merkw√ºrdig, man kann √ºber den Kopf des kleinen zwergen hinweg schie√üen mit einer fernkampfwaffe, aber man kann nicht √ºber seinen Kopf hinweg einen Heilzauber wirken...? Oder Bewungsabl√§ufe bzw. Laufrichtung sollte man auch aufmerksam machen. Neben st√§ndigen Fallen *g√§hn* muss man am besten den Laufweg Feld f√ºr feld machen, wer etwas unaufmerksam ist und die halbautomatische vom Spiel vorgeschlagene Laufrichtung annimmt, l√§√üt seinen Helden gern mal durchs Lagerfeuer latschen, welches nat√ºrlich ausgerechnet dann den Inferno-Apokalypse Schaden macht...w√§hrend Gegner wieder mal W√ºrfelgl√ºck haben und erstaunlich resistent sind.......*abwinkt*

Und das zieht sich durch das ganze Spiel, vieles ist einfach nicht nachvollziehbar und ist dann frustrierend. 
Das man st√§ndig pleite ist, ok, rollenspieltypisch, aber selbst bei den K√§mpfen erbeutet man nichts Beseonderes, absolut kein "Sammeleffekt", der einen in der Motivation voran bringen w√ºrde.
Leider kann man nur an bestimmten Punkten speichern, was normalerweise mehr als ausreichend ist. Aber gerade in oder teils nach K√§mpfen geht das nicht, und man rutscht oft genug von einem Kampf in den n√§chsten. Tr√§nke sparsam gebraucht oder verballert ist egal, wenn man aber halbtot in den n√§chsten Kampf schlittert und man wieder einer Gruppe frischer Gegner gegen√ºber steht..hat das auf Dauer wenig mit Strategie oder Taktik zu tun, sondern reines W√ºrfelgl√ºck...

Es gibt genug, die das Spiel gut finden oder  denen es zu einfach ist. Das ist ja auch OK, aber mich st√∂ren die genannten Punkte einfach.


Wie ihr seht bin ich gar nicht begeistert und das finde ich Schade. Das Spiel hatte/h√§tte Potential. Aber das "W√ºrfelgl√ºck" ist mir doch zu oft nur bei den Gegnern sichtbar, da nutzen auch "X" Talente und Fertigkeiten nichts wenn sie alle keinen Wert haben. 
Und wenn diese alle keinen Wert haben brauch ich kein RPG spielen bzw. nicht dieses.

review:
This is a very good game. If you like turn based fantasy, then this is a game for you. The A.I. is a bit simple, but the maps and the way they can shape the battle makes more than up for that. Also the skills and spells are diverse and they can really shape a character. I give this game 5 stars out of 5, because its about the best turnbased fantasy game i played in a long time.
game on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034673181', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3674, 'last_played': 1392191927}
review:
For Blackguards, the whole is less than the sum of its parts.

I wanted to wait until I beat the game to review it. I felt obligated to do this. If you‚Äôre like me you bought in to all the good reviews this game had on Steam. A mature, turn-based rpg, starring anti-heroes? How could it be bad?

Well, for starters, the ‚ÄúKey Features‚Äù that Blackguards lauds itself on are deeply flawed. Character choice and combat tactics are undermined by balancing issues - certain abilities and spells are clearly better than others to the point where your characters will be at a severe disadvantage if specced the wrong way and beating some of the harder fights will be near impossible if you don‚Äôt have one or two specific spells. 

Additionally, the game suffers from sudden spikes in difficulty that leave the game almost unplayable. Battles go from challenging and needing strategy to just plain unfair and needing luck to win out.

Outside of combat, Blackguards doesn‚Äôt fair much better. The story is piecemeal and uneven - with the whole second chapter being nothing but a combat-only reenactment of ‚ÄúGladiator‚Äù that only seems to be put in place to fill time. The rest of the main quest is further hampered by a multitude of random side quests that hold no weight in the game world and only serve to distract you from your objective. Narrative elements and choices are frequently brought up only to never be talked about again. And finally, when the story actually manages to come together, it‚Äôs a rushed case of too little too late - leaving you with an ending that is worse than Mass Effect 3. Because despite what the game says, you don‚Äôt decide the course of the story at key points - nothing you do matters.

Characters are also largely underdeveloped and remain that way. Although, the voice acting, for the most part, is passable aside from one annoying companion. However, the male protagonist is the clear winner between the two gender choices (think the opposite of Mass Effect).

When the game asks, ‚ÄúWhat happens when the only hope of a threatened world lies not with heroes in shining armor, but in the hands of a band of misfits and criminals?‚Äù. It turns out the exact same thing that would happen if it were heroes in shining armor - because for a game starring ‚Äúcriminals‚Äù, you spend most of your time helping people and doing the right thing.

Blackguards has so much potential. It‚Äôs just like that really cool looking kid that has tattoos and fashionable clothes but when they open their mouth you realize that looking cool doesn‚Äôt mean you have substance. And as much as I wanted to like Blackguards, I can only recommend it to someone if it were deeply on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990629464', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1166, 'last_played': 1391340388}

author: {'steamid': '76561198011619955', 'num_games_owned': 154, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2352, 'last_played': 1402414090}
review:
I personally fell in love with this title, the writing is some of the best I've seen/heard in a while. The combat is nice once you get used to it. and the leveling systems is really well layed out.

I would personally recomend playing the demo first, to see if you like the game (playing the demo made me want to buy the game for the full price), as some of the asthetics are a bit od to get used to.

As for the price, personally i payed the full price for it, i don't regret it as the game has a lot of replay value as the skill set and leveling is extensive and i cant help myself wanting to see how the game would play if i played as a mage (even though i have not finished the game).

author: {'steamid': '76561197980107643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1391588151}
review:
Blackguards

Blackguards eschews the traditional ‚Äúyou are the hero!‚Äù trappings of most games and instead places you into the shoes of escaped convicts. Granted you are still on a quest to save your world, but you do go about it in a slightly different manner. Does the game differentiate itself enough from similar competitors, or should it have remained in solitary confinement? Suppose you‚Äôll have to read on to find out eh?

Let‚Äôs be honest, if you have enough interest in the game to have happened upon this review then you‚Äôve probably seen a couple of videos. From there we can assume you know what kind of art style is at play here. It‚Äôs dark, it‚Äôs got a lot of browns and grays, and it‚Äôs a high-fantasy setting. Dwarves, mages, swords and archers are all present. This is all to be expected, so we won‚Äôt cover the art beyond that. It‚Äôs pretty generic but it does the job. So we‚Äôll go ahead and move on to cover something you‚Äôre more interested in instead.

The gameplay! This is what you were looking for, right? It‚Äôs alright. You don‚Äôt have to be ashamed that you skipped directly to this section. I won‚Äôt hold it against you. I‚Äôll still tell you all about the game and help you decide if it‚Äôs worth the price or not. Let‚Äôs begin shall we? Blackguards is an isometric turn-based strategy game with all the expected trappings that come along with it. You begin by creating a character via a fairly detailed skill/attribute tree using a preset number of character points. You may begin as either a warrior or a mage, with the mage class costing you extra points to unlock. Points may be spent on spells, skills, attributes and upgrades for all of those. Further character points are earned by completing quests and missions throughout the game. 

As you play, you collect various companions who can be fully customized in the same fashion, giving a great deal of customization options and variations to be had. Each character, including your own, is fully voice acted and animated. Though it is hit or miss, none of it is particularly bad. It certainly doesn‚Äôt detract anything from the game even if it doesn‚Äôt always add to it either. The gameplay itself boils down to what you might expect; characters act in turns based on their initiative values, which are affected by what armor you have equipped. Heavier armor lowers initiative, light armor lowers it less. It‚Äôs fairly straightforward. Combat is equally typical of the genre. During a turn you may move and attack, or move a little further and not attack. It has a bit of depth, but not so much that it needs any more detail listed here.
 
Where Blackguards separates itself from the pack is with its tone. You aren‚Äôt a band of heroes out to save the world. You are a band of outlaws, cutthroats and brigands who just happen to be on the path that might end with the world being saved. As a result a lot of your quests have to do with helping a party member engage in some‚Ä¶bedroom fun times, we‚Äôll call it, with a local baroness. Also robbery, murder, chaos and overall mayhem. It‚Äôs a nice change of pace from the usual save this person or that thing and be all heroic that usually come in games like this.

Overall, Blackguards is a fun game. It has some downsides, being low-budget, but nothing that detracts in any meaningful way from the quality of the game. It‚Äôs worth the price of admission if you‚Äôre looking for a turn-based rpg to sink some time into. Give it a shot if it looks interesting and you like the genre. I don‚Äôt think you‚Äôll regret it too much.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970402020', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1175, 'last_played': 1393139365}
review:
Das Spiel bietet sehr abwechslungsreiche Rundenk√§mpfe mit individualiserbaren Charakteren. Die Storyline ist nett, der RPG-Part wird hingegen stark vernachl√§ssigt. Er ist nur insofern wichtig, dass man die richtigen Waffen/R√ºstungen kauft und dazu die f√ºr den Charakter passenden Talente aufbaut, um auch im n√§chsten Kampf zu bestehen. Gro√üartige Entdeckungstouren durch die Spiele-Welt sind nicht m√∂glich, da man nur zwischen verschiedenen Orten hin und her wechseln kann. Und auch in St√§dten lassen sich lediglich Hotspots besuchen. Dabei bewegt man sich nicht einmal mit seinen Charakteren fort, sondern die gesamte Kommunikation mit H√§ndlern, Handwerkern etc. laufen √ºber Dialogboxen ab.

Wer also nach einem gro√üen RPG-Abenteuer √† la Skyrim, Witcher, Dragon Age sucht, ist hier falsch. Fans von strategischen K√§mpfen (Might & Magic Heroes, Kings Bounty) haben hingegen viel Spa√ü mit Blackguards!

author: {'steamid': '76561197974250986', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 6451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6451, 'last_played': 1392043968}
review: Blackguards is a full game for a fair price, which is a rarity these days.  No silly DLC or micro-transactions.  Just a solid, fun, tactical game for one price.  The game, based on a German pen-and-paper RPG system has a deep stat system, and great tactical battles.  It lacks real exploration, and the plot is on-rails, but servicable.  If you enjoy games like Fallout Tactics, or enjoyed other Dark Eye games (e.g. Drakensang), then you will enjoy this one.

review: Enjoyed it, theres a decent amount of customization in the skill trees but sadly theres no real way to level your characters other than doing the quests and main story line.  No random generated battles.  Despite this being said its still a great game imo

author: {'steamid': '76561198019788935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2918, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1416, 'last_played': 1448611698}
review:
Like Might and Magic X Legacy, this title is going to polarise opinion madly. Both are old-school turn based rpgs with more of a focus on tactics than on roleplay, and the ambition of this title is to feel like a real-life in-person, yes-there-really-is-a-live-DM kind of excperience, at which this game is mostly successful.

The writing is adult, the tactics are tough, and the game has the sort of arbitrary cruelty and imperfection you get from a DMs interpretation of the rules. This is not a fps or action game, in any way, its a game for reflection. And yes its a pity there are a few genuine bugs.

This game will appeal to fans of HoMM, Disciples, XCom turnbased, Badurs Gate turn based, and as I say to players of IRL RPGs. I would say right now that I prefer MMX - Legacy to this, and its kinda stoopid that both games came on within a few weeks, given that its 5 years since the last half-decent rpg.

But if you're the kind of person above, then this is a truly excellent title, and you should buy both !!! Don't be put off by some of the reviews that score it for what it isnt....

review:
J'adore les jeux de strat√©gie au tour par tour, j'en ai fait pas mal (vandal heart, ff tactics, les fallout, shining force, etc etc...) mais jamais je n'ai vu un tel probl√®me d'√©quilibrage. 
J'explique: dans ce jeu, il est TRES courant que l'on attaque un enemi 4 fois de suite SANS JAMAIS LE TOUCHER m√™me avec un taux de r√©ussite de 90%!!! Le pire c'est que quand on le touche, parfois on fait ZERO d√©g√¢t.
Un truc qui est marrant, c'est que notre groupe est en petit nombre alors que les enemis peuvent √™tre un dizaine en m√™me temps.... pkoi? le h√©ro n'a pas d'ami ou quoi? Un jour, faudra que les d√©v m'expliquent √ßa (probl√®me r√©curant dans les jeux vid√©o. C'est comme si les guerres mondiales n'avaient √©t√© gagn√©es que par 10 personnes, vachement logique...)
L'IA est aux fraises et r√©agit al√©atoirement en ne comptant que sur son surnombre et sa force pour gagner (ah oui, parfois elle balance des boules de feu/glace √† travers les murs, on ne se refuse rien. Et changer la difficult√© ne sera d'aucune aide: j'ai bloqu√© sur une bataille en normal, je reteste en facile: aucune diff√©rence, tjrs les m√™mes abus de l'ia, mes persos ont toujours autant besoin de lunettes pour toucher et de muscles pour faire mal)
C'est simple: c'est presque impossible d'√©tablir une strat√©gie dans ce jeu de... strat√©gie!!!! un comble, tellement le hasard a un r√¥le important.
De plus il y a une tonne de stats, ok, pkoi pas? mais m√™me en augmentant nos stats, on fait tjrs des d√©g√¢ts ridicules (quand on touche!) Exemple: je boost mon sort de flemme et apr√®s 7h de jeu, je fais tjrs les m√™mes d√©g√¢ts!!!! pareil pour les coups. A quoi bon mettre dix mille options si elles ne servent  A RIEN? Autant les rendre plus ch√®res, mais lorsqu'on les choisit, on a un r√©el gain de puissance et surtout ON VOIT UNE DIFFERENCE. Encore une fois, apr√®s 7h de jeu, j'ai l'impression que je n'ai pas √©volu√© du tout (et pourtant j'investie les points d'xp)
bref GROSSE d√©ception, canard pc avait pr√©venu de ne pas le prendre avant leur test, j'ai √©t√© s√©duit, surtout par le manque de jeu de ce type, durant les soldes et j'ai crack√©... je n'aurai pas d√ª.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975844906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 10978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9260, 'last_played': 1392579214}
review:
Good idea with poor execution.

I downloaded the patch today and still cannot get through the final fight without the AI locking up.

Lizard caster stands there forever without taking an action.  I have reset the fight a few dozen times and its always the same thing.

Its moderately fun when you can play without having to crash the game but the attribute system gives inconsitent results as well.

If you configure two characters exactly the same way with the same exact stats, very often one toon will hit 3x harder than the other.  There is no infomation in the log to figure out why and I even pumped up warcraft to see extra stats and they are exactly the same.

To sum up, it COULD have been a very good game but the flaws make it too frustrating to play.

review: I've had a hankering to play table top RPGs for years now but upon getting older and moving to a new state it is difficult to find people to play with. So when games come out that give me the feel of playing a table top RPG like Blackguards has, it is a wonderful time indeed. Two giant thumbs up to the creators and anyone who is a fan of table top gaming or SRPGs should give this one a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970371967', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 3934, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3831, 'last_played': 1391855384}
review:
Gutes Spiel, welches sein volles Potential leider nicht ganz aussch√∂pft. Habe es sehr gerne gespielt, habe mich jedoch am Ende dar√ºber ge√§rgert, weil einfach noch mehr drin gewesen w√§re (verzweigtere Handlung, Wahl zwischen mehreren Gruppenmitgliedern, usw..). Die vielen Entscheidungen die man in allerhand Gespr√§chen treffen muss haben leider doch erschreckend wenig Auswirkung auf den Verlauf der Geschichte. Der einzige Faktor bleibt Aurelia, und deren Entscheidung wirkt sich auch nur auf die aller letzten K√§mpfe aus.

Unterm Stich ist Blackguards ein gelungener Mix aus Rundenstrategie und Rollenspiel mit angenehm langer Spieldauer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971971651', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 7674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2085, 'last_played': 1466258514}
review: W√ºrde ich das Spiel auch ohne jahrelange DSA Vorpr√§gung gut finden? Dazu ein klares ja, denn Blackguards bietet eine spannende Story, taktisch ansprechende Rundenstrategie mit Rollenspielunterbau, sowie eine stimmige und atmosph√§rische Umsetzung der Fantasywelt. Die Synchronsprecher sind durch die Bank hervorragend, und die erfrischende Unverfrorenheit der Antihelden bietet oft einen Grund zum schmunzeln. Rollen- und Strategiespielfans, sowie all jene die sich noch wohlwollend an die Strategiek√§mpfe der Nordlandtriologie erinnern k√∂nnen bedenkenlos zugreifen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032104799', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1392184180}
review:
I want to start off by saying that despite its many apparent flaws there is something that I find deeply compelling about this game.  The battle system is pretty good, you have quite a few options during combat and the interactive battlefields add a layer of fun and somewhat fresh gameplay.  

My primary gripe with Blackguards is the difficulty.  To say that Blackguards is a challenging game is an understatement, but I feel that the way that Blackguards challenges you is a bit contrived and ultimately kind of cheap.  I've played difficult games in which I've lost or barely won a battle and have walked away thinking "wow that was a good fight".  In Black Guards if I lose I usually feel like I've been robbed.  You constantly miss spells and attacks and the enemy constantly connects whether you're fighting a semi-retarded goblin, a backstabbing rogue or a giant tree.  And the dire situations that you are placed in again and again suggest to me that you're not so much a group of badasses so much as you are really gullible and kind of incompetent.    The main character feels really generic.  Pretty much everyone or everything that you encounter seems better suited for combat than the protaganist.  And so far I don't feel like the four playable characters that I have encountered live up to the name Blackguards.  They actually seem like relatively nice guys.  When I saw the name Blackguards I got excited because I had assumed that I would be taking on the roles of the Lannisters from GOT.  Instead it feels more like I've signed on with the Partridge family.  I've only  played a few hours so far and I'm not giving up on the game entirely just yet, but that's mostly because of the price tag.  This is not a 40 dollar game and I would not recommend that anyone pay that much to play this.  

I work as a merchant sailor and I am literally stuck on a boat for the next month so I will be playing on.  If I get to a point in the gameplay in which I feel that my assesment was premature or unfair I will return to humbly apologize and I sincerely hope that, that happens.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993661434', 'num_games_owned': 7096, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 975, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 905, 'last_played': 1391965852}
review:
I reserve words for certain games. Words which define the game itself and help encapsulate what I'm trying to get across. This game merits one such word, and that word is :

"Chewy"

Here's the deal. Blackguards is a strategy game which has been dipped, liberally, in the world of The Dark Eye, think Dungeons and Dragons germanic cousin and you'll be in the right area. It's got a wonderful, thick, rich backstory, with a lot of history, gods, cults, personalities, politics and intrigue. This is a world that over the course of several games (Check out Drakensang when you get the chance if you find yourself a fan of Blackguards, it's worth the time invested) has become every bit as nuanced and subtle as the more accessible DnD counterpart. The operative word though is accessible.

The Dark Eye is to Pen and Paper roleplay what Dark Souls is to videogames. A stern, rock faced, cold hearted, unyielding dominatrix who seems impenetrable and who demands your complete and total servitude, and at the slightest folly will beat you bloody and raw and tell you to start over again. You will, multiple times, due to a flaw in your build that down the line results in your character ending up stunted and a fight proving a little beyond your reach or poor choices when you level your character. 

But each time, you will learn, through the beatings and the whippings, much like Dark Souls, you will learn, and you will improve. Eventually once you get past the gatekeeper and once you've survived the rite of passage that is the near vertical learning curve of the games mechanics, you'll find a world that richly rewards, and deserves every minute you spend within it.

The graphics finally have shaken off a lot of the shoddiness and rough edges that have pervaded a lot of the TDE games, Blackguards is slick, smooth, and carries a glossy sheen with it, it's not QUITE melt your eyes gorgeous, but it's certainly pleasing to look at, and the spell effects certainly carry with them a definite sense of satisfaction as they connect and fly about the battlefield. So too has the voice acting and musical score improved, as presentation goes, Blackguards has matured TDE into a strong, and at last truly sellable product.

But it's not for novices. Noooooooo sir. This is not a new player friendly game. So far to date no actual "Roleplaying game" set in the TDE universe has managed to be even -remotely- new player friendly, this is not about to buck that trend, not when your character sheet runs to five seperate tabbed pages with more numbers to make sense of than the US Federal Budget. Not when the wheel that surrounds your character can offer dozens of possible options as to what action you might wish to take during a turn. Not when a conversation option can turn a story down a route that results in a fight you may not have been prepared for. This game does not go lenient on people who are not careful, not methodical, or not thoughtful.

The main story arc I'm going to leave spoiler free and focus on the mechanical side, the game follows a two-beat system, the world map, being a parchment map overworld that you zip around and visit static settlements to partake in various pleasantly rendered towns and villages, which offer side quests, conversation dialogs, healing and merchants. Then there's the meat of the game, a mix of single encounter and multi-encounter dungeons.

These take place on hex based maps which are closer to things like Kings Bounty : The Legend, however in this case, we're dealing with -single units-, and in this case the strategic rendering is done with TDE levels of detail. Characters are solid, so you can't shoot or cast spells through them, ditto for static objects and moveable objects. This means positioning becomes a factor, you can't just layer your melee in front of your casters, you need to play smart and ensure people are in the right place. Equipment too has significant impacts overall on the fight, with bows having minimum and maximum ranges before major penalties are applied. Spells have granular levels of "to hit" based on the casters skill... you get the idea. We're talking pen and paper levels of detail, rendered lovingly in the game.

Once you set up hotbars for your most frequently used abilities, fights run pretty smooth and fast, and the strategy element is as the word I used to begin with implies - "Chewy" - you'll be constantly thinking and rethinking your moves, and the AI puts up a respectable fight even at default difficulty. Environmental hazards too present a real and significant problem, and throw in an extra layer, thankfully there's no time constraint, so feel free to get a coffee as you ponder each move.

Do I recommend it? Yes. With the caveat. This is not a game that will appeal to everyone. It's a niche game. I celebrate it's existence. It's a strategy game for strategy gamers. If hexes, math, and stats excite you, get stuck in.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036019166', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 5582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1133, 'last_played': 1456720911}
review:
I really wanted to like this game.  I am a big fan of D&D and have played more RPGs than I can count.  I am also a huge fan on XCOM and that style of strategy so this looked like a match made in game heaven.

Alas it was not to be though.  Here is the good the bad and the ugly.

Good:
- Graphics are wonderful.
- Voice acting is top-notch.
- There "appears" to be a lot of character customizations.

Bad:
- Storyline beats you up in the second chapter and you lose your "investment" arbitrarily.  Sad really.
- There really is a lack of "strategy" as you are at the whim of roll of the dice.  Not XCOM calibre, not even close.
- $39.99?  I got is pre-release cheap.  Save your money it isn't worth that much.


Ugly:
- XCOM style strategy doesn't play as such.  Random roll really makes this a flawed game.  You can employ the exact same strategy move for move and breeze through a level, and other times get decimated.
- There is no place to "grind" it out to build up your characters if you are so willing to do so.  Early in the game you will find yourself redoing levels because you got a bad roll and you haven't enough Ducats (money) to do what you need.
- Some levels (first one) become closed the moment you go to another map.  There is no turning back until later.  A big map, but very linear and very unforgiving.

You have to REALLY love D&D style play to get into this game.  It will take a while to get used to, and even longer to become skilled at this game.  It feels more like work and less like fun.

I would not buy this game again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052450778', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3453, 'last_played': 1391620516}
review:
I have bought this game, as it was early access. I have played each chapter, which came out, until the end. I have spent 48 hours of my life for this ... game. During of the game play I was trying to find only one word for me to describe the whole game. Finally, after the final chapter ended, I have found this word of "banishment": annoying!
I would say this game is a typical example where a good idea meets bad story and bad implementation. I would not recommend to buy it, even if it would be on sale for only 9,95.. 
The fights are nice but only because they are turn based... the so-called story is meaningless... there is no good gear to buy... I would even say it is not even needed, because all limited money will be spend on heal/mana potions, which costs 1-4 times more than any good/best gear or weapon.. The game is badly balanced or completely unbalanced at all.. The AI is sometimes very stupid, sometimes cheats badly... All spells/talents are worthless‚Ä¶
I would say, a good game must be interesting and enjoyable... On my opinion, it does not suit for this one.
Buy it, if you do not trust my words. Buy it, if you would like to make your own opinion. 
But do not say after that, that you have not been warned!

author: {'steamid': '76561198005184581', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1391652191}
review: Good turn based strategy game. Nice use of the enviorment to add variety. The slight challenge is that some battle fields feel small however its is primarily a melee game so it really has no negative effect overall. AI is average and the UI takes getting used to. Its very hard to see how some of the skills effect you character progression - others, like unlocking spells, are more obvious. Pretty good set of tutorial screens thought to explain the basics. Resource management between fights is challenging.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965180048', 'num_games_owned': 2753, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1390841583}
review: Definitely not worth 39.99, luckily i got mine pre release for cheap. It looks and feels like a browser game. The skill upgrade/weapon use/magic upgrade trees are huge and confusing and no explanation on what would be useful for what type of classes. The FOV is beyond frustrating as is trying to click on the proper hex to move or attack. It becomes boring and repetitive very quickly. Not to mention the casters spells fizzle out like 80% of the time. I had better luck beating them with a torch instead of casting. The amount of gold you recieve after killing 5-6 mobs is way too small to be effective. Like you get 7 gold after a 5 mob fight and just one health potion costs 5 gold. I wanted to like this game but just doesnt seem ready or have enough depth for my liking.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993500303', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 227, 'playtime_forever': 2705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2350, 'last_played': 1391664174}
review:
Great turn based RPG. Combat system is good, and gearing and skilling up your characters is rewarding.

At first I was disappointed about the absence of random encounters, worried that the game would be on rails, but once you get into the game there are enough side quests to keep you occupied.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973957153', 'num_games_owned': 722, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 693, 'last_played': 1415540211}
review:
Really having alot of fun with this one!
After being overwhelmed at the start with all the different stats and talents, the gmae just keeps on getting better.
The story is great, the humor is actually funny, and the game is very challenging.
Once you get further in the game, there are a lot of fights you wont beat on the first try.
But the beautifull part is that it does not get frustrating and I press the try again button with a smile on my face untill I get it right :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198049703219', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1427128489}

author: {'steamid': '76561198024080920', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 5041, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3757, 'last_played': 1602476381}
review:
Great game, lots of fun.  Well worth the money if you are into tactical, turn-based combat.
The characters and voice acting are top notch.  The dialogue witty.

Character advancement is done by earning adventure points that you apply to the skills and stats you wish to improve. There's no set levels. The more skilled or powerful you are at something, the more adventure points it costs to improve that skill or stat further.  It makes it impossible to make a character that is unbeatable at everything, so you really need to put some thought into party roles and utilizing each character's strengths and weaknesses.

Most of the battlefields have static and dynamic features that can add an advantage to your party or spell their doom. This keeps combat interesting.

One thing I found fun, but some might find frustrating is that you don't get to choose where your characters start on the battlefield.  For the most part, your characters are started in such a logical position that you don't even question it, but every now and then a battle is added with your characters scattered all over the place. Sometimes it makes sense within the story line, sometimes not.  

The enemy AI does fairly well as an opponent. While it doesn't always use the battlefield features to full advantage, it does it often enough to keep you on your toes. 


Overall, two thumbs up !

One thing to note - if you are the kind of player that has to have tons of sparkly, magical loot, this game is not for you.
If you are the kind of player that needs to have five sets of armor, fifteen weapons, and a house with fifty chests to store all those weapons and armor in, this game is not for you.  Gear upgrades are mundane and modest, and you'll have the same armor and weapons with you for large portions of the game.  Encumbrance penalties dissuade you from carrying much more than the armor on your back and the weapons on your person. 

The game is more about tactics and skills than it is about loot.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970074892', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2259, 'last_played': 1403719071}

author: {'steamid': '76561198035289749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3429, 'last_played': 1391556410}
review:
Juego de rol, con combate por turnos. Un juego que t√©cnicamente es mediocre: gr√°ficos de hace 10 a√±os. Las animaciones, las cutscenes, y la mayor√≠a de lo que se ve es anticuado para un juego de 2014. 
Pasando a lo importante, la historia y el desarrollo son bastante simples, reci√©n cuando termina el primer episodio uno puede contemplar la parte divertida del juego, que es viajar por el mapa libremente, visitando ciudades y realizando misiones.
Sobre la trama, puedo asegurar que es de lo m√°s normal y previsible que hay en un RPG, sin casi sorpresas ni momentos memorables. El protagonista es un mero espectador, y carece de toda personalidad (si bien es descripto como holgaz√°n). Los compa√±eros son poco interesantes, y a menudo son ellos los que tienen las l√≠neas de di√°logo ingeniosas, graciosas, o simplemente, los que toman las deciciones, por encima del protagonista.
La dificultad merece un cap√≠tulo aparte. Es incre√≠blemente desbalanceada, y tiene de a momentos picos de dificultad desesperantes. Consejo: Si una misi√≥n no sale, y no es obligatoria, d√©jala para m√°s adelante.
Como destacable, es la detallada forma en la que se desarrollan los personajes, a medida que adquieren puntos de aventura, necesarios para subir las habilidades, conjuros, puntos de vida, de magia, etc. ya que no hay niveles de personajes y puedes elegir minusciosamente como gastarlos. Cu√°nto mejoran los personajes a medida que incrementan sus atributos, es algo que lleva tiempo darse cuenta.
Resumen:
Lo bueno:
El sistema de juego, y el combate.
La dificultad, exige pensar cada movimiento que haces.

Lo malo:
La historia y los personajes son muy poco interesantes. 
El desarrollo de la trama es muy sencillo.
La falta de contenido entre combate y combate (llamese historia, di√°logos, etc.) puede ser agotador de a momentos.

Puntaje: 6,5

author: {'steamid': '76561198045987567', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 5268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4304, 'last_played': 1388769267}
review:
Tout y est, ce jeu est l'apologie de l'antih√©ros, des personnages qui m√™lent parfaitement charisme et attitude loufoque, qui malgr√© tout arrivent √† s'entourer de myst√®re et de profondeur; tout simplement un bijou narratif pour qui aime les longues soir√©es avec un pack de 26, un d√© 20 faces, six d√©s √† six faces et de bons potes fan de naheulbeuk. "JDRDTDM"! Bref, le jeu est bon et bien con√ßu, mais il y a un mais, malheureusement c√¥t√© tactique il serra pour les d√©butants, l''interactivit√© du d√©core n'est pas forcement tactique et plut√¥t anecdotique, ce qui me fait dire qu'ils sont plus pr√©sents pour amuser l'oeil que d'une utilit√© concr√®te. D'autre part, le jeu est tr√®s r√©p√©titif et lin√©aire.

Le jeu se place donc dans le m√©dium game donc 20‚Ç¨ pas plus.

Les plus : profondeur des personnage et de la narration, la touche artistique √©vidente, la dur√©e de vie, l'humoure et le sarcasme.

Les moins : musique r√©p√©titive √† la longue, combats r√©p√©titifs, pour les bleus, parfois un mauvais √©quilibre sur les chances de coups/succ√®s ce qui fait pencher un peu de trop la balance du cot√© de la chance et non de la technique.

Je vous souhaite bon jeu et de vous faire votre propre avis, c'est celui qui compte!

author: {'steamid': '76561198050865043', 'num_games_owned': 478, 'num_reviews': 193, 'playtime_forever': 3063, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1959, 'last_played': 1544535470}
review:
Decent game in its own way, but definitely not worth 40‚Ç¨. The game is fairly short (solved it in 3 days, including all sidequests , except for those that were bugged and couldn't be finished) and has little to offer in terms of complexity (no open world map. All you get is a bunch of screens you can click on, like an adventure game. You can't even move around in cities).
The fights are very puzzle-like, with different maps who all have (annoying) extra features like traps.
Character balance is so-so. Mages for example have ridiculously little mana which limits them to cast 3-4 strong spells per fight.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081858314', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2069, 'last_played': 1391930449}
review:
I'm only about 4-5 hours into it but this is great! The combat system reminds me of king's bounty, or maybe Heroes of Might and Magic where your characters are on a hex grid and you move then attack/ability. It has the feel of a proper RPG though, with various attributes/skills/powers that have points put into them that are subsequently used in the fights. The out of combat system isn't as interactive as, say, fallout 3 or skyrim or something. It's almost exclusively chatboxes accompanying a thumbnail picture of the speaker while there is a static background image, like many JRPGs (especially back in the day), and there is a map with nodes on it to which you may travel but you don't run around freely looking for stuff. Personally I don't consider that a drawback per se but others might. I can't say for sure how much your choices effect the story because I'm too early in the game, but the element of your choices mattering seems to be there, for example *spoiler* there are twin brothers that want to kill each other and you can choose if or which one you help them kill and you fight different battles and get different rewards depending on which one you choose. It's a sidequest though so I'm not certain it's a big deal.

Anyway great game! Definitely worth the buy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198074693549', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 10099, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10099, 'last_played': 1391444538}
