author: {'steamid': '76561198004693150', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2201, 'last_played': 1392052305}
review:
Took roughly 40 hours to beat the game and enjoyed the majority of it.

Though there are some serious bugs and exploits possible in the game to beat encounters (such as the final boss), I vastly enjoyed this game. I would recommend it to anyone that enjoys tactical RPG's or just decent RPG's in general. However don't expect a super duper in-depth story experience. This game is based heavily on the turn based combat and in a lesser extent on the storyline.

Things that are good:

- Stupidity gets punished
- Upgrading characters is really mandatory
- Reasonable dynamic encounters, that ask for different approaches.
- Letting you wander around the world to do sidequests and unlock trainers
- The exp-gain system (named AP)

Less impressed by:

- Cutscenes were useless and lacked in quality compared to the rest of the game.
- Balance in the different roles is off, my Archer is 1-shotting 80hp enemies.
- Encounters vs caster NPC's are completely random; no synergy or logic in their spells.
- Best in Slot gear is fairly early obtainable, roughly 50% of the game. Didn't feel like a superduper reward.
- Few bugged encounters
- Storyline bit meh, jumps a few things if you chose the wrong conversation choices. Which can complicate the logic of the chain.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007073876', 'num_games_owned': 343, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3074, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1370, 'last_played': 1400560064}

author: {'steamid': '76561197976267857', 'num_games_owned': 520, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 3053, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2707, 'last_played': 1391343812}
review:
F√§ngt spassig an l√§sst aber immer mehr nach je weiter man spielt, jetzt hat mich in Kapitel 5 komplett die Lust verlassen. Der Grund ist schnell gefunden: Man rennt von Schlacht zu Schlacht, dass war es. Ein freies Erkunden der Welt √§hnlicher Spiele wie der Heroes oder King's Bounty Reihe ist hier leider nicht, Blackguards beschr√§nkt sich nur auf Schlachtfelder, die St√§dte wo man zwischendrin mal das ein oder andere Gespr√§ch f√ºhrt oder was einkauft sind nur statisch und nicht frei begehbar. 90% der St√§dte bestehen sogar nur aus einem Bildschirm.

Grafik: Zweckm√§√üig, nicht mehr und nicht weniger. Animationen im Kampf ganz ordentlich.

Sound: Gute Waffenger√§usche, stimmige Musik die sich schnell wiederholt aber nie wirklich st√∂rt. Sprachausgabe in Deutsch teils teils. Die weibliche Hauptfigur sowie der Zwerg machen ihre Sache richtig gut, der Rest der Truppe auch noch ok aber alles was sonst noch so durch die Lande streift ist meist durchwachsen bis schlecht besetzt.

Umfang: Nach knapp 40 Stunden war ich in Kapitel 5 angekommen, was ein recht ordentlicher Umfang ist. Man muss aber bedenken das diese 40 Stunden nicht gerade sehr abwechslungsreich daher kommen.

Negatives: Schlachtfelder lassen sich weder drehen noch zoomen, es kann nur der Kamerawinkel in der H√∂he angepasst werden. Es gibt kaum unterschiedliche R√ºstungen, f√ºr K√§mpfer gibt es ganze 4, f√ºr Zauberer nur 2 und f√ºr Fernk√§mpfer (Leder) sogar nur deren eine soweit ich das entdecken konnte. Das ist ziemlich mager. Bei den Waffen sieht es schon etwas besser aus aber das Gelbe vom Ei wird einem hier auch nicht geboten. Dialoge im Spiel sehr statisch, Mundbewegungen nicht synchron zur Sprache, keinerlei Mimik/Gestik bei den Figuren erkennbar.

Fazit: F√ºr 12,49 die es mal im Early Access Sale gekostet hat war es definitiv den Kauf wert, aber f√ºr mehr kann ich das Spiel leider nur bedingt empfehlen da es zu schnell √∂de wird da einem nicht wirklich abwechslung im Spielverlauf geboten wird. 


Bugs: 
- Auf 2560x1440 ist die Schrift total unscharf und kaum Augenfreundlich lesbar, der Bug ist seit Monaten bekannt wird aber nicht gefixt da man davon ausgeht das die meisten Spieler in Full HD spielen wo dieser Bug eben nicht auf tritt.
- Bilder der R√ºstungsteile sind seit Release vertauscht (Schuhe sind R√ºstung, R√ºstung sind Helm usw)
- Kapitel 4 wurde nicht im Spiel angezeigt, nach Kapitel  3 folgte bei mir direkt Kapitel 5.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003987457', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1017, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 852, 'last_played': 1387093696}
review:
Blackguards is an  average game at its best . Follows genetic fantasy tropes . Character creation is bare bones , you cannot modify starting stats .  Game offers large world map , but due to its linear nature you will be just staring at places you can't go . Story progresses by clicking on hubs where you will either enter a city screen or combat . Side quests are very limited . 

Appearance customization is limited to picking  out of five pre-made characters per gender.  There is significant shortage of light and leather armor variety . 85-90% of all armors in a game are metal which means you spell caster wont be able to use it . Game has nice sandbox system where you are allowed pick whichever skills/perks you like . Perks require xp and trainer .  It can be difficult to find trainer to teach you perk . For example you might unknowingly leave act 1 and lose access to mage trainer for rest of act 2 . 

Combat is dull . Most of it involves using same spell/melee attack and hoping you will get lucky.  

Graphics and are style are uninspiring .  There is no camera angle rotation and overall camera controls are poor . This can lead to some frustration such as inability to target or see enemy hiding in a corner . 

You can interact with some environment and there are some environmental hazards like methane gas in swamps. You characters and enemies can slip on wet floor . Some maps with lots of water spills turn into some kind of comedy involving every character falling to the ground at start of their turn . 

Voice acting is decent . And dwarf you get in beginning of the game is awesome . 

In terms of bugs and glitches game was polished in its early stages . I've only encountered one minor bug that was quickly fixed .

author: {'steamid': '76561198037872521', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1223, 'last_played': 1391417455}
review: The system is all about combat, which I could enjoy as I love tactical RPG... if that wasn't only about percentages. The skill tree is dull, fireball-aimed blow-dodge-... and tell it all from level one. All the nice videos I see while writing this seem very far from my 20 hours game experience. Not gonna do that until I powerlevel my fireball to lvl 12, my axe/mace skill to 10/12, my strengh to ... bah.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020264195', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1534, 'last_played': 1391622724}
review:
Good:
Good combat.
Hard game, even on normal.
Sets a good mood.
Nice particle effects.
Many choises for character progression.

Weak:
Hard to plan out character progression.
Story is a bit weak
Gear progression could be better.
Gear comparisons are difficult to understand.
Visuals are only acceptable.
Resting/sleeping/eating to regain health and mana is a bit awkward.

Overall i really like the game, and will most likely play it through to the end.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057305729', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 3281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3015, 'last_played': 1393876236}
review:
From the trailers one is given the impression that you're playing the roles of the "bad guys" for once but have to "save the world";  a more apt analogy would be to say that the characters would probably fit well into the world of the former T.V shows Breaking Bad & Sci fis Battlestrar Galactica.  Does each character have skeletons, of course but I've yet to see one that actually warrents a "Blackguard" title; in fairness here the Blackguard definition, a-la from Dungeons & Dragons, is in a different context then from this title.  

As has been stated in other reviews & from [i]Daedelic Entertainment[/i], the game is based off a tabletop role-playing game from Germany. This is my first foray into this system in any case.  The story is OK, but not much more then that.  You don't gain levels per se, but you gain adventure points (AP) when either defeating foes or completing a quest.  You use these points to raise just about everything pertaining to your character, be it statistics, your skills, your resitances, & for magic users how effective spells are & the astral points needed to cast them.  The higher the "level" of the STATS, skills etc, the more AP they cost.  Unfortunately, I've not come into any battle where my group has had a "windfall" of AP, so far  I've either gotten 30, 60 or around 120 AP depending on the battle ([i]whether mundane foes or major ones[/i]).   I've gotten a bit more AP when completing quests though. In fairness here I'm playing it on the easiest difficulty, maybe battles give you more AP on the harder ones, though I doubt it.  

The hightlights of the game are the battle system, I've yet to encounter any "cut & paste" battle area.  The upgrade system for your characters is fairly subtle, but noticable for the most part.  In short, you don't feel like you're spending AP to upgrade your character & they don't feel like they're more powerful.   The spells are diverse & effective. Mapwise there is a fairly large area to cover in both the in battle maps & world map.   

The weaknesses of the game, thus far are:  

No areas to really grind for AP,  [spoiler]with possible exception of arena, but even there I believe you can only have a certain amount of battles in the arena[/spoiler].  You can't actually make things, not armor or weapons, at least not at the point in the game that I'm at.  There's no height or lowlands difference in battles; in short I've not had so much as 1 battle where either I or the enemy started at the top of a hill.  I've also yet to have been involved in a battle where I've gotten a huge amount of AP. I'm roughly at the halfway mark, going by what the creators wrote on the main page, but I've yet to see so much as one magical item, whether defensive or offensive item.  I don't know the tabletop RPG this is based off of so perhaps the world lacks magical items or if they're simply more subtle in nature when compared to games like Final Fantasy Tactics.   The spellcasters also need work, I find them more useful as party "buffers", and from what I've read on the forums I'm in the nearly overwhelming majority.  

This game needs some minor tweaks to really grab you & keep you in it's grip; but so far any issues I have with it, in the scheme of things, are relatively minor & not game breaking.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023671793', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1864, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1864, 'last_played': 1391365607}
review: Guter Name eines der wohl beliebtesten Pen&paper Games, der sch√§ndlichst mi√übraucht wird. Langweilig desingte lvl die nur dadurch hervorstechen, das vieles Unfair gescriptet wurde. Grafisch ist es auch kein Highlight. Hier mu√ü man die Hauptquest vorantreiben, um einige Nebenmissionen zu bestehen, nicht wie altbekannt andersrum. Die Belohnungen f√ºr die meistens unfairen lvls sind weniger als Erb√§rmlich. Ist wohl eher Gl√ºcksspiels als das es irgendwas mit Taktik zu tun hat. Obwohl das ist nicht richtig, nach dem 1000000000 Versuch und erneutes Laden hat der Spieler irgendwann mal mehr W√ºrfelgl√ºck als der Gegner, naja wers braucht. Achja und nach JEDEM verlassen eines Arials kommt erstmal ein Ladebildschirm. Rein in eine Stadt: Ladebildschirm, raus aus der Stadt: Ladebildschirm. In einer Stadt das Arial wechseln: Ladebildschirm und nat√ºrlich zwischen den K√§mpfen: Ladebildschirm. Auch st√ºrzt es gelegentlich ab und hat noch diverse Blinkgrafikbugs, aber das ist nicht so wild, da es grafisch eh nicht sonderlich H√ºbsch ist. Kampfsysthem reines Gl√ºck. Auch wei√ü man nicht welche Figur( au√üer der eigenen) es sich lohnt hochzuspielen, bzw sie zum Unterst√ºtzen auszubilden, weil einem bereits im Akt2 schon die erste Figur weggenommen wird per Sequenztot.   3 von 10 Punikten rechne ich dennoch an, weil sie immerhin darauf achteten, ein wenig Regelwerk mit einzubauen, was die Auswahl der Atribute betrifft, die sich verschieden auf die Talente auswirken. Wer allerdings glaubt das er immer trift mit einem Fernkampfwert von 20 liegt enorm daneben. So ist auch sichergestellt, wenn man zu gut optimieren will, das man immernoch auf pures Gl√ºck angewiesen ist. Wer Gl√ºcksspiele aber mag und tausendfaches neu laden der lvls sollte bedingungslos zugreifen. Auch sind die unterschiedlichen schwierigkeits Grade eher Sinnfrei. Egal ob auf leicht oder schwer, die Gegner rennen trotzdem in die Fallen und bleiben dort drinn stehen, der Unterschied ist lediglich das die Gegner mehr LP haben, und dann scheinbar Immun gegen Fallen sind. Und es gibt logischerweise weniger Erfahrungspunkte auf schwer, auch mal sehr sinnvoll um mehr "Taktik" einzubringen lol. Eine sinnlosere Zeitverschwendung f√§llt mir gerade nicht ein....Deadalic ist leider auch wohl eine deutsche Firma, aber naja au√üer Bier und sch√∂n wegschauen hat dieses Land leider nichts zu bieten. Diese Art von Spiel wurde schon um ein vielfaches besser Desingt und zwar Battle World Kronos, Grafisch sehr eigenwillig, sehr schwer, aber fair und Strategisch/Taktisch, nix mit Gl√ºck.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018812704', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1391315733}
review:
Its not a bad game and I do appreciate a developer bringing turn based fantasy RPG's back to the market. However, it just feels like it fell short of its potential. Not to knit pick but starting with the lack of facial customizations. I know its not a big deal but in my opinion, it starts the game off on the wrong foot and goes on from there.

there is really no exploration, its extremely linear and predictable as far as the encounters go. The rules of turn based combat are also not the greatest and are very vanilla. No attack from behind bonuses that I could see so you can retreat and not worry about taking a blade to the back if you were standing in a hex next to an enemy.

My biggest frustration was in upgrading my gear. Theres RNG involved for what you can loot from battles, so dont count on picking up that axe that this guy just done done whacking at you with for the past 10 minutes.  It just vaporizes apparently leaving you with your trusty ol' starter torch. 
Weapons and armor cost a lot of money and while you may be able to gear your guy up with a basic sword after the first half dozen encounters, that will be it for quite a while until you can afford more. Meanwhile, wave after wave of baddies wielding swords, shields, axes, armor, bows and arrows will make sure you pull your hair out before you can afford to gear your party adequately enough to fight them.

Das Wechseln zwischen mehr oder weniger statischen Bildern, keine M√∂glichkeiten Gebiete zu erforschen/ erkunden all das spricht nicht f√ºr ein gutes Rollenspiel...Es erinnert mich viel mehr an Warhammer 40k als an ein Rollenspiel. von 1-10 gibts darum von mir eine 5-6.

review:
Pour les d√©butants, le jeu devient un peu r√©p√©titif quand vous √™tes pouss√©e d'un combat √† l'autre. Ce n'est pas un RPG classique, mais quelque chose de plus proche des FF tactiques .

Cela √©tant dit, le combat est amusant, l'histoire fascinante, des personnages int√©ressants avec skilltree d√©taill√©e . Certain  combats peuvent √™tre assez dur et le syst√®me de combat  peuvent devenir un peu ennuyeux parfois mais rien qu'un rechargement ne peuvent pas r√©soudre. J'aime le fait que vous avez r√©ellement besoin de vous pr√©parez avant de passer √† la prochaine bataille que vous ne pouvez pas appuyer sur la touche d'inventaire et commencer √† √©changer des armes ou en utilisant les √©l√©ments.

Dans l'ensemble un jeu solide et un jeu a la peine (graphisme,redondance). Juste essayer de limiter vos sessions de jeu √† 1-2 heures. Personnellement,  toute session de jeu plus de 2 heures tend √† devenir p√©nible.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993351932', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7090, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4449, 'last_played': 1609174170}
review:
Great game!

This is my 3-part review of the game. 1. The RPG system, 2. The actual roleplay, 3. The feel of the game. It is worth mentioning that I am a RPG guy with long experience in both Pen and Paper RPG (mostly PF, but also Vampire), and a lot of CRPG. So, naturally, this has an impact on how I liked or disliked the game.

1. The roleplaying system The Black Eye is really nice and has a lot of depth and will be candy if you, like me, havent tried it before. I cannot accout for the differences between the pen and paper 4th edition (witch the game mechanic is derived from) and the system Blackguards has implemented. But as far as I am concerned its really nice. Different attributes combinate to give different base statistics - and control how well you fight / use talents / casts spells. There are no levels for characters, insted you gain Adventure Points from combats and finished quests that you either continually spend or save up to spend on more expensive upgrades. It really is a fun system and has similarity with the way Vampire the masquerade works. The turn based tactics is nothing but pure enjoyment!

2. The actual roleplaying is somewhat linear. If you like that then no problem. If you want more choice, then it has shortcomings. Things are pretty much set up and you cannot deviate too much from the path. The choices you are given doesnt even have that much impact. For instance one side quest presents you with two identical twins, the one is evil and the other is good - but who is who. In the end, if you chose to root out the good guy OR the bad guy there is no impact on the game other than your own conciousness. (...and honestly, who cares abouth truth when it comes to a book worth 50 ducats?!)

3. The acutal feel of the game is, at least to me, awsome. The characters you pick up are rather strange, a paranoid dwarf, a sleezy magician and later on a drug addict elf to name some. But this is what strangley keeps it interesting - actually highly enjoyable. Bugger off with the lawful good paladin that does good at every turn. Here its like "plant unlawful poison at a highly esteemed noble to get him arrested" or "Get a new slavegirl / trophy for the master of the city".

To sum up, I really enjoy the game - (not finished yet as this is written) and I see a replay possibility with choosing differet abilities. If you enjoy RPGs and in particular the combat part - this is a game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062337287', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3186, 'last_played': 1525686964}
review:
I've clocked about 34 hours with this game at the time of my writing this and have gotten through a fair portion of Chapter 3, so I think it's fairly safe to say that I've formed a solid enough opinion. Simply put, Blackguards turned out to be a rare gem and has already, surprisingly, found its way to my personal list of all time favorites. A few minor glitches aside, it's a lovely blend of dark fantasy storytelling, challenging tactical combat, and flexible charachter development that so far hasn't failed to delight. And it looks quite attractive to boot, with a fantastic UI and lovingly crafted imagery. 

The cast of lovable rogues that comprise your party is well acted and well written. The story as a whole, at least so far, is engaging without being overbearing, maintaining a light touch while never failing to be consistently interesting. It ain't Shakespeare, but it never aspires to be. Instead, it accomplishes exactly what the early hours of the game promise: it is  a damned enjoyable caper of a kind that perhaps we need more of in the world, a slice of true, unabashed, adventure escapism that somehow evokes the simpler, formative days of a young nerd's nerddom. The subject matter is often dark, but it always feels like an exciting journey above all else. And sometimes that's more than enough to make something worth one's time. 

While I am sure it's not for everyone, players who enjoy tactical combat, roleplaying games, and being entertained can find plenty to love here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013424387', 'num_games_owned': 887, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 5377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4131, 'last_played': 1394398865}
review:
Definitely a must-have for old cRPG turn-based fans.
This is the first turn-based I'm enjoying so much after years (on PC Plattform).
Simple but very nice story, characters with his own personality, battles are never boring because different goals or external elements interaction, enough spells/skills to customize (shame that you know already all spells in game from the beginning, was more interesting if talents/spells would be revealed only when meeting NPCs who can train it)
A game that reminded me FFT and Vandal Hearts on PSX, and definitely a good one! No resource management, no extreme high graphic, just turn-based battles, equipping/healing in cities and pure enjoyment...as it used to be!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970683990', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1391188391}
review: Calling this a tactical RPG is insult to all the real Tactics games that came before it.  The combat is from Heroes of Might and Magic.  Flat hex map walk towards each other and swing, over and over.  90% of the skills are useless (spend points on being able to see the hit chance of the guy I'm swinging at anyway, or spend points on +1 to hit), and the 3d20 skill system may be novel for the RPG this is based on but here it is just opaque and weird.   Going straight from battle to battle is actually a good thing, so don't fault it for not being the JRPG it is not.  But boring battles and boring equipment and boring skills in a Tactics game is a bad thing.  I'm going to go play Disgaea to wash out my brain.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030118745', 'num_games_owned': 2013, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 792, 'last_played': 1391376333}
review:
I played the Demo first (includes the complete 1 act, took me about 6h :D)
The Game is really good, its challenging, u really need to think about what to do and how u do it. Runnin in axes blazin wont get u far ;)

So, the Combat System is turn-based with NO timer! You can take ur time to think about youre move.
You cant use health/mana potions, bandages etc. Infight! unless u eqipped it inside ur belt.
Belt's have different number of slots. take the right items for each hero ;)
You or the Enemy are able to block,dodge & parry every melee attack or arrow/bolt. Also it can be missed :D
The Magic cant really miss, but there is a high chance u cant get the fireball done :D
You can use (in most of the fights) the environment to ur advantage or to ur disadvantage :D
Espacially the swamps (damn i hate the Swamps), u can get Stuck inside and be unable to use this hero for about 5 turns :(
You can learn the ability to "see" those traps. i higly recommend to use it :D
I never died as much as in this game on "normal" ^^
There is NO crafting, you need 2 buy everything from a merchant/smith.
Every NPC have a unique set of items 2 sell. Most of em r really expensive so choose wisely ;)


The game is really fun even sometimes u just wanna smash something :D (1 fight took me about 1,5h, maybe im just unskilled :D)
Usually im not into those kind of games but after a few fights i really fell in love with it

author: {'steamid': '76561198028352716', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2439, 'last_played': 1391137342}
review:
Fantasy Adventure with a dark and mature story eh? Ummm... more like a very PG Fantasy Adventure.

Leading a band of misfits, scoundrels, criminals, outcasts, etc. sounded pretty cool, but that was far far from the case when I actually started to get moving along in the game. Blackguards in title and story is very ho-hum and has you playing the hero at almost every turn doing errands for NPCs... not really what I was expecting given how the store page spins the hype around it. Sure there are a few choice options that cater to your supposed anti-heroism but they are few and far between.

True to its billing I did clock in completing the game in about 40 hours. I liked the game for what it was (i've played better/worse turn based RPGs) and will most likely play it again with a different hero build but I'm not really in any rush to do so.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031202599', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1387500370}
review:
Turn-based-strategy at it's "almost best". This is almost the perfect T.B.S. game for real. So close. It has everything you'd expect, but misses a few. These drawbacks are only "my opinion". The progression is strangely slow, in that it takes so long to get enough points in one stat to notice the difference, and then once you've spent literally days worth of playing, you can't undo those decisions. Which I don't wish to "undo" my stat point decisions any time I wish, but it's very aggrevating to get so far into the game and wish you hadn't wasted those points. 
The choice of weapons and their cost (in gold). The amount of weapon choices is very boring, just your run of the mill (standard) choices. And the fact that you literally never, NEVER, feel as if "that weapon was the best choice". Because all of your enemies have the same or better chance of killing you. You never feel even slightly more powerful or skillful than your enemies. I understand this game is dice rolling, but when you get a "good roll", you should feel EMPOWERED damn it! I spent all those points in that axe for the dwarf and it didn't seem to make him a badass with an axe. Lastly the cost of anything is just silly. You make one wrong purchase, and bingo, you're out of money and your whatever is pratically useless.
That's really it! The game is so so so so very close to being amazing, but it's those small couple of things that ruin it for me.
Also they should have added blacksmithing or crafting.
The magic is actually really awesome, but it is the same feeling of "I wish I fealt more powerful" after spending all of my points.

review:

The battle is simple to quite implex battle that could give a love or hate it with a scorn. It is quite the first time for me to decide and upgrade upon the talents, skills, magic and stuff.

Another thing that I like was that you can equip any kind of weapon. Very nice to see that and so much possibilities to put for your character.

Although I am bit perplex about the ending, I am quite enthralled with the game and was addicted to finish it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985763710', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 6694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6003, 'last_played': 1391573260}
review:
Very enjoyable gameplay with a compelling story.  Couple of shortcomings:

1. I did not connect with any of the characters, not enough depth

2. Nothing evil about this game.  When I read that I was going to be the villian, I was exciting to be playing a different role.  However, I seem to spend all my time rescuing people and playing the hero... Maybe I don't understand what beinga  villian means

3. Action Point system is flawed.  I can't tell a difference between the character I started with and the one I ended the game with.  To test it out I downloaded a trainer from www.cheathappens.com and added nearly a million action points, maxed out everything.  Was still not even able to one shot basic mobs 

If you are a fan of turn based RPGs, I say put this on your wish list and wait for the price to drop.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031757498', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4841, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4502, 'last_played': 1391482469}

review: Great game.  The Dark Eye is a good rpg system.  The story is pretty much on rails but still not bad at all; the combat and chardev make this game.  The choices I have been presented with do not seem very significant or have had much of an impact on the story (it seems).  Combat is 10/10.  Chardev is 10/10 but would be nice if I could have created my own party. Some really interesting battles.  The dwarf is pretty entertaining.  I would say this game is a must for fans of JA, X-Com, or RoA series.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994937841', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 6687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1186, 'last_played': 1532224774}
review: This is an interesting mix of set piece turned based battles and point and click adventure. The difficulty level is reminiscent of the good old days when games didnt't hold you by the hand.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066799702', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 3181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2793, 'last_played': 1397913764}
review:
The Combat in Blackguards obviously carries this game through all its shortcomings. Each battle-map is different fom the last and has a unique feel to it. Customizing your characters in weapon skills and magic feels rewarding. The most fun comes from figuring how this game actually works, like when the points you just spent make a noticeable difference in the overall challenging battles. Don't expect too much offensive magic, you're better off keeping your mages in a support-role (where they ROCK hard). You probably heard about the interaction with stuff in battles, but that's totally overrated: Wasting a turn to push a box or set something ablaze is rarely worth it. Occasionally this is implemented quite nicely, like trapping something in a cage, but most of the time there's only boxes to push.

I hear people drooling over how interesting the characters are, but honestly your party members are *completely* one-sided and sometimes downright dislikeable  (*minor spoiler* Zurburan selling Takate to some slaver...seriously? *spoiler end*). Their is no intruiging background story to them and definetly no progression in personality whatsoever. The story on the other hand is compelling, but since story-specific dialogue is only few and far in between the dominating combat, it's ultimately thin...very thin (if you know DBZ, you lnow what I'm talking about *lol*). The world itself feels a bit on the bland side and the streamlined gameplay leaves little room for Lore or in-depth consideration of your potentially stunning surroundings.

The biggest issue here is how barebone the gameplay is. After a fight you basically point&-)click your mouse button a few times to advance the dialogue or move to the interchangeable towns to check on the completely interchangeable merchants and start the next fight. Combat-Dialogue-Click-Combat-Repeat. Kudos for the quest-writing though which I found top notch!


So: Combat: AWESOME. The rest: *MEH*. I enjoyed it a lot, also because it is more fast-paced than some of its TBS-brethren.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973977106', 'num_games_owned': 110, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4089, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1515, 'last_played': 1403663359}
review:
Closest thing to classic pen and paper games I've seen in a long time. Requiring a trainer for special skills is an ok concept, but  not the best, and a bit unfair, as some enemies will have skills you can't get til you are past their area. Environmental Hazards are fun, keep you alert on the battlefield.

I'd rate this game an 8.5/10, due to flawed trainer system and the odd freeze- but last part might be my system, who knows.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030116322', 'num_games_owned': 375, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3804, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2424, 'last_played': 1553383384}
review: This game is absolutely gorgeous. It has deep tactical combat, beautiful visuals and sweet gory plot. I'd recommend it to every TBS/RPG fan out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058972490', 'num_games_owned': 163, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1982, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1044, 'last_played': 1421085322}
review: Inge h√∂jdar graffe p√• detta spel men kul!! Gillar du RPG med turbaserade strider s√• gillar du detta spel.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973142363', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 1871, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1871, 'last_played': 1391445500}
review:
Surprisingly good game.  Blackguards does a wonderful job of blending RPG mechanics within a turn-based combat game.  I'm enjoying the story so far and the characters are memorable.  I like the fact that every single battle is unique with some maps having objectives other than simply kill the enemies.  

I give this game a solid 8/10.  If you're a fan of RPGs or turn-based combat then give this game a try!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009544618', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 2181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1465, 'last_played': 1421883581}
review: There are some interesting concepts in the game, the gameplay mechanics are limited.  The combat is frustrating and somewhat riddiculous, such as terrible die-roll mechanics...missing attacks 3 to 4 times in a row, with a 93% change-to-hit...HUH?!?!?  Yeah...pass on this, or wait until it drops to about $10-15 before trying it out...heck...I wish I could trade my license for it to someone who REALLY wants to play and get frustrated by the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003524982', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2786, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2648, 'last_played': 1391448167}
review:
First of all, I love squad based RPGs like baldur's gate and xcom, so i might be a little baised.
Also if you don't like challenging games, Blackguards might not be something you'll be interested in.

The leveling system takes a while to get used to, and adds minimal advances, but also means it's very forgiving if you plan to change builds throughout the game.

I love the story and the voice acting without a doubt.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979482980', 'num_games_owned': 700, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2305, 'last_played': 1390945956}
review:
It's a good game in general,

Positives:
1) Long Playtime; I got around 40 hours out of my first playthrough, got half the achievments
2) Story and Characters are good, interesting and likeable
3) Voice Actors and Music are both great
4) Complexity of Character Building and Fighting is something I hope for in most RPG's and I got it in this one, lots of stats to invest points in and to costumize your characters
5) Sometimes the dice won't roll your way, sometimes they do, it's as close to a D&D experience in a modern Video Game you will ever get

Negatives:
1) Loading times when you enter a city, or go through areas in a city are attrocious and can get really on your nerves when your try to check NPC's for side quests
2) Unbalanced Encounters, Not that big of a deal but sometimes you can get your ass kicked out of the blue which can be frustrating
3) Encounters that don't tell you what the goal is
4) Slow Battle System, the more enemies there are the longer it takes for everyone to finish their turn which can piss me off
5) Lame Ending

Tips for Beginners:

1) Choose Hunter as your MC; You won't get one for 80% of the game
2) Sword and Shield sucks, Spears are great and so are 2 one-handed Weapons
3) Always carry a blunt weapon with your chars to switch to when you encounter UNDEAD enemies, they are immune to piercing dmg
4) Train Perception high with your quickest Character(With highest initiative, mine is Takate) and use it at the begin of every fight to check for traps
5) Spells to lvl for your Mage: Haste to lvl 13 and cast it on your best fighters, it rly helps and is srsly good; Also I like Fireball @lvl 3 and the AOE Spell the 2nd Mage gets can be rly great coz it knocks down enemies.
6) Try to push "Astral Energy Regeneration" as soon as you can, helps out alot too.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970781615', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 2905, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2788, 'last_played': 1391372926}
review: Really fun turn-based tactics game. I don't like the P&P system that it uses as its base (The Dark Eye), but the game has truly amazing level design. All of the encounters are hand-designed, and they play like a tabletop campaign, with environmental effects being hugely important on many maps. The game is also huge - about 40 hours of content is a good estimate.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992764570', 'num_games_owned': 1766, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 1821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1564, 'last_played': 1401764672}
review:
Turn based combat system? Yes please!

One thing I appreciate about the game is that so far I haven't encountered any battles that felt repetitive. The maps, the environments, interactive elements on the maps (starting fires ftw!), and the variety of opponents have kept it fresh so far. Of course I need to state that I'm only on Chapter 2 at this point, so maybe that changes. Some battles have been easy enough, others have been challenging. There's been a few battles that I've had to retry but it's been a fun challenge, not a drain on my enjoyment of the game.

So far, I'm loving this game and have been looking forward to playing it as time permits. I started over 6 hours into the game to switch from a basic character to an expert (custom) character. Having become more familiar with the game, I wanted to be able to customize my character more. I'm 20+ hours into this game and I'm still enjoying it which is a positive sign!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993326494', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1391220115}
review:
BlackGaurds is Great.   ...and, as it should be, infuriating at times. The enviromental effects give the tacticals something even FF and Ogre didn't have. Its a must play for anyone who likes turn based.


*edit:  After playing some hours I feel the need to edit my review. The game remains great, except that it crashes no less than once ever 45 min. ...save often, its frusterating enough when played when the program IS responding.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056231281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1419221392}

author: {'steamid': '76561198008018024', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1657, 'last_played': 1392533117}
review:
Having worked on turn-based RPGs in the past professionally and as a fan of them, I am open to enjoying an imperfect game. Blackgaurds has decent graphics and gameplay and I enjoy the battles that require real thinking to resolve. I can also appreciate the aspect of the game where you need to be very careful how you expend your experience because there is a fairly linear event horizon and if you have mispent too many points you may not be able to win the next fight.

What I very much do not appreciate about the game are the various idiotic things you need to do to stay alive where you aren't really roleplaying, you are trying to beat the ganme:

1. You dont seem to be able to buy a potion of healing and just drink it. You need to enter a fight then waste your time drinking it.

2. I have mana regenration and healing (basically over time unlimited healing) I can sit in a fairly safe town but need to entera fight to regenerate mana. I would be fine with this in an arena with 10 seconds between fights but in the narrative I have hours to lounge around the town. However, I cant heal myself even though I have the ability.

3. When you have a character with a healing spell and mana regeneration, you have to sit around with one monster left hitting one character (or behind a force wall) as your mana regenerates and you heal. You spend 40 turns getting your mana and health up to full.

All in all an okay game. I cant really get into it thought because I spend too long having to game the system.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027059793', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 828, 'last_played': 1390951530}
review: This game is... garbage.  In fact, this game is an insult to garbage.  The engine is clunky, and good luck getting past the boss fights if you don't know the engine like the back of your hand.  Oh, and lets just throw in some gratuitous anti-arab racism just to make things even better.  I do not recomend this game, I recomend avoiding this game like it has plauge.  Plague and bird flu.  I picked it up after spending a long time feeling deprived of a Tactical RPG, but after this, I would rather not a single tactical  RPG ever be made again rather than deal with another moment of this awful game.  I would rate Blackgaurd as a 0/10, for having no redeaming features at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973871326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1391283817}
review: This game is absolute garbage. all it is, is turn base battles. with some story, thats about it. could have been such an awesome game

author: {'steamid': '76561198116582101', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3485, 'last_played': 1403353063}
review:
man seems to me alot of these reviews are harsh on this game. i have played many tactical strategy games over the years and this is a pretty good one in all parts.  I think the thing most people have a hard time with in this one is the dificulty of the game and them not really explaining on how attacks work. like in the percent chance to hit someone.  but if you do a little research you can figure out how to make it easy. 

like all spells have three attributes allocated to them. so if you want to cast a spell that has agi, cha, const then you would want all 3 of those stats to be high. the higher they are and the higher the spell lvl is the better chance you have to hitting someone with them.

for rng and mele you want have the stat to be high to hit. for range its dex for mele its str. think there are also others that help. then you need the weapon you are using good also. plus therre is also a slider on the weapon. that lets you decide if you want to defend or attack better. so if you are on defend on the item you wont hit as often or as hard. so set it to attack.

all in all i think this is a decent game worth a shot. at least on the demo for anyone who has an interest in tactical strategy rpgs.  i got it on sale and im not disapointed at all. also the difficulty can be a little harsh you will not win a battle the first time everytime. but im not one for easy games i loved temple of elemental evil and others that are harsh.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005057621', 'num_games_owned': 821, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 2491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1995, 'last_played': 1391314309}
review: Ive had a great time with this game so far. Its one of the better turned-based RPGs that I have played in a long while. If you like this sort of game, I definitely suggest getting it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998394233', 'num_games_owned': 584, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1385946169}
review:
the first few fights are all i played, as the game lacks controller and hdtv support... it works, if you dont mind its clunky seeming interface. can't recommend it as i have uninstalled it and won't be playing again, at least not for awhile.
    the impression i got from my time with the game is that it's a b-lister, mostly directed at heroes of might and magic fans of the easy-to-please variety. boring maps with just stupid combat, hexagonal set pieces with stupid cover and a stupid skill/attack wheel which is too small to see in 1080p on an hdtv without straining. just the most basic of games whos aim was too low and hit the mark squarely (the 'too low' mark).  if i had played the entire game, my opinion might matter more, but i gave this what i feel was a fair shake, and even submitted recomendations about controller support and the ui, which were apparently ignored (probably because i wasnt ass-kissy enough, according to one random poster- paraphrased by me of course). 
     if you are a fan of xcom enemy unknown, you are going to know what you are missing when you play this electronified board game. xcom does all the things right that this game ignores in favor of flashback hour (think ff tactics, but with crappy gameplay). the way you are thrust from one fight to the next is lame, when, given this is 2014, i expected to be able to a) walk around freely or somewhat freely between fights, perhaps with interesting things to do or b) same as 'a'. instead, the story is fed to you between battles and that's it. fight! crappy fight! 

if the price was 10 dollars, it would excuse the quality in my opinion, but they want to charge like the big boys, they get judged like them.

to make a long story one sentence longer, i dont dig it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966880355', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1996, 'last_played': 1390936089}

author: {'steamid': '76561198098005984', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1400371287}

author: {'steamid': '76561197995224732', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 865, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 865, 'last_played': 1390909615}
review:
A horrible turn based RPG. 

The A.I. makes no sense at all and seems to just roll of RNG. For instance, you could be in combat with an insect, a large dumb version of 'lice' that would waltz right by your entire team to go secure an objective that you should be holding that the insect doesn't even KNOW about, story wise. 

There is no way to view your armor as a whole, to compare it to other armor sets. This also doesn't let you save in combat, and the combats are slow and tedious. Matter of fact, I had the FINAL gladiator fight I was in crash on the next to final turn as a waited out the final baddy to blow up (was on a timer in an arena and covered in oil and lit.)

This game will make you rage, not because of the difficulty, but because the horrible interface, no real enemy A.I. (I swear they go full retard half the time. "Oh hey, spikes. I should jump up and down on this space over and over again until I keel over!)

Overall, go with something more polished that you can get your hands on. Only 5 characters to play as in this one too, so I suggest you roll an archer, considering you don't get to keep one, forcing you to roll an archer (or gimp someone else into an archer) if you want a balanced team. 

Also, no explanation of half the games mechanics makes this a very annoying venture. 

Really don't recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969380334', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 947, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 748, 'last_played': 1390847137}
review:
I was really looking forward to this game, but what a let-down it was - a total lack of loot, a feeling of being pushed down a single storyline without any option to deviate to do many side quests, every fight feels like a chore and you are always, always outnumbered.

The game is not at all forgiving with character abilities - make a mistake and the game is impossible.

Even the icons for the gear slots are mixed up on the character page!

It had a lot of potential, but failed to deliver - I uninstalled it without even getting past chapter 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062235558', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1804, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 770, 'last_played': 1684000805}
review: Blackgaurds is one of the most addicting games I have played and has been a great game to start out 2014 for me. This game has some of the best voice acting and music I've heard and its gameplay feels like it actually melds with the story. Quite a few times you'll be presented with interesting alternatives in combat most wouldn‚Äôt think of in a turn based RPG. You could go the classic route and just beat the baddies in a one on one fight, or if you‚Äôre feeling creative lure them into hazards that you normally wouldn't think of. For instance lure them into a bush then set it on fire or release a group of prisoners to fight for you. Even some battles have great story elements. Need to collect some mushrooms while a giant troll is guarding them. Distract the troll and gather the mushrooms, then run. It‚Äôs these types of options that make you feel like you‚Äôre having an impact and cause you to think outside the box. The few problems I do have with the game mostly revolve around a few graphical glitches and sometimes the enemy AI can be a little too slow. Graphical glitches like people suddenly having mouths that stretch way too far when they speak or the amount of a silver currency you earned being blocked has happened to me. While the biggest flaw is probably the AI, I like how you can set traps for them but when an enemy chooses to continually get burned in a bush and not leave it that‚Äôs when I call stupid on the AI. These bugs can be annoying but they don't break the game and I recommend this game to any RPG or Turn-Based Strategy fan.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012992721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2096, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 904, 'last_played': 1423019519}
review: Great game for anyone who likes story driven, turned based RPG's. Old school but updated. Great fun so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055462590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 704, 'last_played': 1609408404}
review: I am thoroughly enjoying this game. Cool story, strategic gameplay, and nice depth of experience. I think it is possibly a niche game, so try the very generous Demo (~1/5th of the game or Chapter 1 of 5) and see for yourself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010711508', 'num_games_owned': 625, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1889, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1419655010}
review:
Beta: 7/10
Launch: ?/10

Played several hours of beta and had a great time. The combat is pretty standard turn based strategy with a hex grid. The early parts of the game were pretty combat focused. Some optional quests were pretty challenging. The main part of the game is character custimization, every character can learn anything you want. Now that it is fully released I plan to go back for a fresh playthrough. A nice feature I already noticed is the advanced character creation. You can choose between the standard warrior/archer/mage types or just make a unique character with anything you want.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960684241', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 477, 'last_played': 1390371364}
review:
I am not sure why this is getting so many negative reviews. I have played a pretty good amount of this game so far. Is it the best? No. However it is not bad by any means.

If you like turn based RPGs then this game is great. People REALLY should research games before they buy them. The game has a little bit of a steep learning curve but if you are even a semi-decent gamer and are familiar with TBS games then that should not be a problem at all.

Personally I am REALLY REALLY sick of all the games nowdays hand holding you and making things so simple. What some say about the leveling and skills/stat points is true however. There is really not alot of explaination about how to do this. Trial and error is all you have. I ended up starting the game over a few times before I really started to figure out how to do it properly.

The story is not the greatest and neither is the gameplay or graphics. However I have had alot of fun with this game. I like the darker story. I like that your crew is not a bunch of goody goody types. The movement and cities are pretty bland but that is ok beacuse the fights are alot of fun IMO. The enviornmental parts of the battles are very cool. I like that you have to open cells to create a distraction and get away from the guards. It was way cool that I had to lead the troll into some flammable gas and then shoot him with a fireball to do a ton of damage. Cutting the rope and dropping a chandelier on some  guards was pretty damn cool. There is alot to like in this game if you can get around the mediocre graphics and horrid voice acting!

If you are looking for a AAA super polished graphical game this is not for you. If you like a decent story, dont really care about graphics, and you like TBS RPGs then this is for you!

Overall this is a pretty good game. There are not alot of TBS RPGs out there to pick from and if your a big fan of that genre then you will like this game.

Divinity: Original Sin is a better choice IMO but that is still in Alpha and has ALOT of bugs. I bought both of them and I really enjoy them both.

Again this is not the prettiest game. The voice acting and cut scenes are ATROCIOUS!!!!! But who cares as long as the combat and RPG elements are good.

Graphics: 5/10
Sound: 5/10
Story: 5/10
Gameplay: 7/10
Overall: 6/10

Like I said its not the greatest game out there. But in this genre there is really not much to choose from. TBS RPGs are probably my favorite type of game and this game does an above average job.

Buy it if you are like me and really jonesing for a TBS RPG!

author: {'steamid': '76561197995427314', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2560, 'last_played': 1426455075}
review:
At a glance, Blackguards is a fun foray into the turn-based tactical genre. The system is both simple and overly complex at the same time, but it balances out nicely. The graphics and the storyline certainly aren't anything to write home about, but for a turn-based game they are more than acceptable - after all, the real focus of any turn-based strategy game is going to be the combat, not the sparkling wit or crisp graphics.

Unfortunately, the combat is where things really fall apart.

That's not to say that the combat system itself is at fault. It's passable, and roughly analogous to Dungeons & Dragons. The real problem is that many of the set-piece battles are designed to be inherently unfair. Even on the easiest difficulty, you'll often struggle with scenarios that are designed to be one step short of impossible. You'll often find your character(s) stripped of their equipment and forced to use random items that you don't have the skill to use. You'll often find yourself thrown into insane battlefields filled with literally dozens of hidden traps, endless hordes of respawning opponents, or obtuse victory conditions that require you to interact with five or more scattered pieces of scenery. Somewhere along the line, the designers seem to have gotten just a bit too clever about their level designs, inadvertantly making many encounters more frustrating than fun.

Fortunately, the developers made several adjustments as the game went through early release - so if you can power through the first two chapters (Chapter Two is particularly frustrating), then you'll find that the game opens up a good deal. At that point it becomes a much more enjoyable experience, although still occasionally plagued with annoyingly obtuse map design (one optional "arena" map can easily take an hour or more to finish due to it's maze-like design and infinitely spawning enemies).

If you're a hardcore strategy gamer, then Blackguards is certainly worth buying. For anyone even slightly more casual, though, you should probably give Blackguards a pass.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011351873', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1339, 'last_played': 1392188005}
review:
TL;DR: If you like a game of chance, play roulette. If you like RPGs, buy a real RPG, if you like tactical combat, buy XCOM. But dont buy Blackguards.

After 10 hours of playing the game, the game is simply over for me. I am stuck at an impossible fight, the autosave is at a point were I cannot make any meaningful alterations to who fights anymore. And the fight is unwinable with the character I build.

Now, dont get me wrong. Its not a badly build character. Its a very straightforward mage. Its not underleveled either for I did every single quest so far. But if your character is a mage, and you dont build it in one very specific way, you will be stuck at the beginning of chapter 2. It is impossible to progress, since there are no potions or pieces of mage armor available so you usually just get one-shot.

Unfortunately, this happens quite often in Blackguards. The game is not balanced - at all. You can in theory build a character, but if you build anything other than a fighter or a very specific mage, you just get stuck in impossible fights - like the one that ended my game.

I had fights like this before, and I got through them by just reloading for two hours until the RNG finally turned into my favor.  Here is an example:

In one fight, turn one, my main character would get shot and fall on his ass about 90% of the time. That means the fight is over - I lacked the DPS to win and he would just continually be shot down. There is nothing you can do against this either. You cannot prepare for fights - all spells etc. can only cast once you are IN the fight. So right away 9/10 cases, I had to reload. If my character managed to dodge, I now had to get a very specific spell of to make sure he wont get shot down every single time. However, the spell barely ever got used so it failed in 3/10 cases. If it failed, reload.

So right away I could only progress in 3% of the cases. Of course the rest of the fight also included a lot of luck.

Sure with a different character build that wouldnt have happened - but if the game is only beatable with some very specific builds than either dont give the players the option to build their characters, or rebalance the fights.

This is the main problem of Blackguards - the game is not skillbased, its largely RNG. That means that dicerolls decide outcomes of fights, not your skill or ingenuity. This makes the whole experience hugely frustrating. 

And its not frustrating in a good way. In Dark Souls, it is extremely frustrating but you know its your fault, and if you get good enough, if you finally figure all the patterns out, you beat it, and its awesome. In Blackguards, you beat a frustrating fight and the only thing you feel is 'finally its over'. Because its not skill that won the fight, its just that for pure random chance the dice have fallen in your favor. 

Almost every fight in the game is like this. The few fights that arent usually have a very simple to figure out environmental danger that you have to activate in order to basically get a free win.

Until this game actually gets balanced, dont buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030617169', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1390851732}
review:
This is the worst game i have played in  long time.  Story is linear and boring.  it's cut scene after cut scene forcing you thr4ough the story interupted but completely unbalanced fights.  i have a dwarf in the game who wields a two handed hammer, and i cant hit an unarmoured wizard, on top of that when i do land a blow, the wizard deals more damage to me with his melee attack.  so the mechanics are sort of broken and frustrating.  It is ultimately a bad story mixed with crappy game mechanics (BTW i am playing on normal).  There is no exploration into the game.  i have played 10+ hours worth so far.  just go hear kill this go hear kill that, save this maiden, do this task.  etc...  If you decide you want to gain some xp before you move forward so the game doesnt kill you very easily you do not have an option.  you have to crank the diff down to easy and then it becomes boring and dull with no real challenge.

So the two options i found where ridiculously hard and non sensical (wizard does more melee damage than a two handed melee weilding dwarf)

or easy and equivelant to pressing play on a bad fantasy movie every now and again to get the story going.  i would not recomend this game to anyone, especially not for $40.  I love turn based fantasy games.  grew up on the dark sun TSR games, baldurs gate, and way back to hero quest in the late 80's.  so it's definetely up my alley.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008815247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2322, 'last_played': 1391134465}
review:
The game itself is fun and worth a full playthrough, but that's about it. The loot is pretty uninteresting, and I wish there was more things that mattered.

EDIT:
Finished one playthrough. The game story itself isn't that interesting honestly, it feels rather cut in pieces. Also, the whole 'choices' thing seems to be a trend lately mostly along with the popularity of visual novels that actually are totally based off only those choices...but if you're going to have a game that really wants a diverging story up to that level, blackguards isn't your thing.

The selling point, however, is that the battle system is awesome and pretty fun. True, it can get a bit repetitive and annoying, and perhaps easy if you're not playing hardmode. Still, the combat is solid and pretty fun. 

Overall, I'd give this game a 3.5 / 5. Good enough for a single playthrough unless they come up with more updates. Is it worth the money? I honestly dunno, but I'd pay around 20 i guess. If you want this, perhaps wait for sale period or something

author: {'steamid': '76561198056374526', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1215, 'last_played': 1417819562}
review: Blackguards combines engaging tactical combat with a pretty nifty story. It's pretty much what D&D Tactics wished it could have been, even though I personally liked that as well. The amount of freedom you have when it comes to upgrading your characters is quite welcome as wel, as is the interactive objects on the battlfield. If you're the kind of person who even just thinks this game looks interesting, chances are you'll love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997074475', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 5567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2874, 'last_played': 1391914985}
review:
I don't write reviews for games often, but i felt the need to review this game being it's getting "mixed" reviews.  Blackguards is one of those games that is not going to give you instant gratification.  After playing it for a couple of hours I initially logged out and went back to another RPG thinking to myself that it was not very fun.  Well after going back to it a few times and progressing through the game I've determined i love the game.  It takes some time to figure out the combat system and how to get a feel for the ebonflow.  It is highly strategic and combat can be approached many different ways using the battlefield, spells, usable inventory and special abilities, this is where the game really shines, it has a difficult and somewhat different system than most RPGs I've played.  

If you dislike a true roll based game where you expect to push x spell and it hit your enemy, do not buy.  This game will drive you crazy sometimes in that regard, the battles can be long and having your caster miss twice in a row with your entire party down really brings me back to the Nintendo days of smashing my controller into the screen.  However this is part of the appeal to me.  And yes somewhat less but the enemies do bork their spells ocassionally too so it is a little fair in that regard.

If you dislike having to study a game with a totally different feel than what you are used to, in regards to stats, abilities, and tactics, do not buy.

If you love a good challenge and are willing to spend some trial and error learning the system, it is extremely fun and the play is flawless, i've seen no bugs or problems other than the Head and Foot Icon on the character pane reversed.  I've only put a few days into the game but can say that it has grown on me with each battle and i can see where the replay on it will be high since each battle really is totally different and your tactics are very modifiable.  I'd give this game a 8/10 thus far and believe it's one of the better RPGs on the market right now.  Thanks for reading.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032132893', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3563, 'last_played': 1393185673}
review:
There is little to recommend, thinking I shouldn't have bought this.   D&D style RPG that invokes quests that don't use your current stats.  One that takes away all the party's armor and gives everyone clubs.  Another that takes one of your party out of the fight (and kills them off).  While one might say it's a strategic RPG,  that only applies if there aren't so may variables as to make strategy next to pointless (it's mandatory, but still comes down to plain luck far too often).  Bad enough the normal D&D variables to hit, the variable damage, but then lets toss in higher numbers of opponents, invisible terrain traps, and opponents that always have poisoned weapons.  Flanking an opponent doesn't seem to have been included, so pointless, and while crit hits are included, when the opponents out number you, they have a greater chance of getting crits, by benefit of more of them means more chances for a crit role. High level of frustration.
Update - 2nd attempt, a little better.  Got to the point I quit first time.  Believe first time it was bugged as chance to hit was only 55% and bugs hit for 8-10 dmg.  This time I see my hit chance at 75% and bugs hit for 4-5 damage.   Meant I could actually get through the quest.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986716191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1390608438}
review:
I have only played 6 hours of this game, and I have stopped.
This game will appeal to some of you, but it doesnt work for me.

Blackguardsis a style of game I just dont like. 

To be clear I prefer game that at least give you the appearance of free will and self determination. 

Blackguards has set out to control your play, not allowing for any random encounters and engineering the enounters that you have so that they are all "challenging". Which would be fine, except that your toon build really, really matters.
With limited points to spend and "challenging encounters" it seems as if there is a certain build type that will work for each toon.
If I am right, and it feels so, then giving me freedom to build 'incorrectly' as is my style of play, means I fail.
With no random encounters to build toons otherwise, it means either re-start and build differently, or follow the guild for builds as in the forum.(There is a forum guide on 'best' builds for your toons.
Seriously, I would prefer auto build if i have that little choice, where certain builds work and others just dont - where you follow the games perfered build or fail.

If you prefer Dark Souls over Elder Scolls or Fallout, then this may well be the game for you, else if you like to play YOUR way, wether it is turtling, over leveling your toons, or just building them the way you want, to play the way you want.. then perhaps stick with games that let you do that.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981098561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1759, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1759, 'last_played': 1390952891}
review:
Fun game so far, I'm enjoying it... Scratch that....

Combat which you will be doing alot of is bland and repetative. Be prepared to be posioned in alot of battles, also prepare for your spells to fail regardless if you are maxed out in them, For example I had 1 spell called  Cold Shock (Level 18) Maxed in the description I have a 99% chance to cast, in one battle this % drops to 8% with no explaination. This game is not not very forth coming in telling you the negatives that effect you well unless is poison :). 

Magic, What the game does not tell you is with spells that effect all enemies your chances of casting these spells drops to stupid odds... For example in the last few fights in Chapter 5 I was trying to cast a few spells the chance was 1%, please understand I had all my skills maxed regarding spell casting, even reliable spells like the Fireball one was reduced to 48% from 99%. As a whole being a magic user you are punished. Does the enemy get punished in the same way? No they are able to case level 4 spells at 99%.

Storyline, seems non exsistant at the moment and I am on chapter 5 the last chapter, you arent made to care for your choices or characters sorry I like to feel my choices in RPGs actually make a difference.

Skill Trees, again like combat it is bland, if you go melee you want to go for Hammer Blow which forces you to take Two Handed Bashing or Axes and Maces. I did start the game of as dual wielding swords how wrong I was :(. There is very little choices in skills say unlike games like Path of Exile.

The equipment you get is standard and boring. You would expect from a Fantasy RPG to get some magic items well dont hold your breath, there are a few items that will give you the odd boost but they are few and far between.

Overall as a fan of Turn-Based games and RPGs Blackguards comes up short in so many ways.

I am glad I paid less than what its on sale for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106518220', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 535, 'last_played': 1466870537}
review:
Ich mochte das Spiel Drakensang (erschien im Jahre 2008) sehr, es war sch√∂n m√§rchenhaft und so gar nicht d√ºster. Ich habe lange auf einen w√ºrdigen Nachfolger gewartet und bis vor Erscheinung dieses Spiels keinen gefunden.Blackguards hat zwar wenig mit Drakensang zu tun, spielt aber in demselben Universum namens Aventurien. Die Grundstimmung ist aber so ganz anders! Doch der eigentliche Star dieses Spiels sin die K√§mpfe! Es macht sehr Spa√ü Strategien zu entwickeln, um die Monster, die mir dieses Spiel entgegenwirft, zu besiegen. Die K√§mpfe sind sch√∂n (teilweise sehr) anspruchsvoll, die Arenen sind sehr abwechslungsreich, und die Anzahl von Items angenehm befriedigend (alle typisch DSA, wie  u.a. der Morionhelm). Nur die Story,die eigentlich sehr spannend ist, k√∂nnte etwas besser insziniert sein, denn dann w√ºrde sie besser zur Geltung kommen. Allerdings hatte Daedalic vermutlich nicht das Budget eines "The Witcher", deshab kann man ihnen auch keinen Vorwurf machen.

Kurzum-Blackguards ist fantastisch!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006773050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1394064272}
review:
This is not an easy game. Loot does not come by easy. The battles come at you at every turn. Littile mistakes can cost you and force you to reload later to a previous save. The game was recently released, but I have not encountered any serious bugs. One bug/mistake is that the Icons in the character/inventory sheet do not match the correct placement of the gear.

I love the story and I love the difficulty. It feels great when you complete a map. Some games lately just make it to easy or just force you to grind out to make you feel better about the game. 
If you like turn based strategy I would buy it. I am enjoying the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020064870', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1584, 'last_played': 1391101993}
review:
Am Anfang dachte ich mir, dieses Spiel muss ich haben, da es anscheinend eine gut erz√§hlte Geschichte und auch noch taktische K√§mpfe unter einen Hut bringt. Als erstes ist mir die teilweise hohe Schwierigkeit aufgefallen, die ich als Liebhaber von Dark Souls etc. begr√º√üte. Doch wo Dark Souls immer fair erschien, ist "Blackguards" an vielen Stellen einfach nur unfair, was einen vom Spiel- zum absoluten Frusterlebnis bringt. 

ACHTUNG SPOILER: 

Wie z.b. ist es zu verstehen, wenn bei einer Mission Tentakeln aus dem Boden kommen, einen umwerfen, sofort wieder verschwinden und man nur noch mit dem automatisierten Aufstehen besch√§ftigt ist und dabei seinen Helden beim alm√§hlichen Ableben zuschauen kann? Frust pur! Oder bei anderen Missionen wo die Gegner auf einmal so schnell spawnen, dass man keine Chance hat, sich aus seiner Position zu befreien und muss auf einmal wieder von vorne anfangen.

Fazit: 

Zugegeben das Spiel hat mich, obwohl ich einige Male zur Wei√üglut getrieben wurde, doch in seinen Bann gezogen und wenn man von der Tatsache absehen kann, dass man oftmals einen vorherigen Spielstand laden muss, weil man in eine unl√∂sbare Situation man√∂vriert wurde, wird man viel Freude mit dem Spiel haben.
