author: {'steamid': '76561198061175568', 'num_games_owned': 173, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1758, 'last_played': 1390695116}
review: I was intrigued when I saw the game. So much so that I plunked down my cash for early access. But I realized very quickly that youre basically expected to run the game once completely blindfolded before you will ever know how to build the party or what theyre capable of. Mistakes will dog your every step during your first run. Its very tedious and frustrating. But the killer for me, the straw that breaks the camels back, is the ridiculous spike in difficulty from one fight to another. It would be one thing if there was some sort of difficulty precursor before a fight. But there isnt . You step from one fairly mild fight to, suddenly, be faced with a large force led by a high level mage and youre expected to kill everything on the map. IN SEVEN TURNS. Did I mention all the mobs have healing potions? And the leader is on the other side of the hex map? And there are spike traps and tripwires everywhere. So you need to kill 6 mobs, in 7 turns, while they use heal pots, while missing on roughly 30-40% of your attacks. This game is dead to me. I would say it isnt worth the 22 bucks i plunked down for early access. Its a ridiculous waste of cash at the durrent $35 price tag.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960445792', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1188, 'last_played': 1421896486}
review:
PLEASE READ THE ENTIRE REVIEW

Initial Review: Ridiculously, pointlessly difficult. Enjoy 85% attacks missing 50% of the time. Marvel as you're pitted against overwhelming enemies while armed with Shakespearean costumes and sticks. Savor wasting money on healing bandages that DO NOT WORK. I understand a challenge, but this game is unplayably hard. Maybe I'm missing something, but the game is unbelievably frustrating.

Upon further Review: Had to sleep on it and think of other approaches. OK so the game doesn't hold your hand. But if you give it some effort, time, and thought, you will find different ways to approach things. I was too harsh. The game just may be fucking brilliant. Maybe I'm the dummy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040012049', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 193, 'playtime_forever': 462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1390852940}
review:
A very challenging but interesting tatical RPG with puzzle like battle maps.  And by that I mean the battle map may be unbeatable if you don't figure out which enviornmental trap to use at what time and figuring out how to get the enemy to stand where that trap will be most effective.

While the games tatical battles are quit enjoyable due to this puzzle aspect, at the same time can be frustrating because you can end up spending hours having to try and retry a map to only figure out that in addition to the puzzle you already solved but keep losing at you need to rebalance your attack/parry skill points on your weapon type for the fight in addition to solving the puzzle. Which brings me to the only thing I have come across so far in my play that I have disliked about the game, the combination between having no way to gather more xp since each map seems to be doable only once with the fact that there does not seem to be a way to respec where you allocated your xp. I don't mind that the game does not allow you to grind to over level stuff, infact I like that it prevents you from doing that, but it also means that if you spent all your xp in the wrong areas you can reach a point to where a battle becomes unbeatable because you have all the wrong skills win.  Maybe later in the story it allows you to realocate xp at the cost of gold or something, but currently where I am in the story I can see mismanagment of xp making the game unbeatable.

With that said, despite this one major consern with the games mechanics dealing with xp I would say it is a very enjoyable though sometimes frustrating game. I would say play this game on normal difficulty and if you get stuck on a puzzle don't feel bad having to turn it down to "easy", because some battle maps are hard to complete even on easy unless you have the perfect build where no xp was spent in the wrong place. And as I say this game is definitly worth picking up might I just suggest that for a few of the puzzles do not sell your torches even if your close on weight limits because you will come across some puzzles that become 100x easier to solve with having more then just a mage to use fire damage.

Edit: Also the soundtrack is pretty good, is it $20 of value good, eh, to most people no, but just putting it out there for those debating on picking up the regular edition or the one that comes with the soundtrack.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002977088', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 8109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5971, 'last_played': 1391712522}
review:
I like most of what the game offers - but there is some evil RNG in the game, and there is also a lot under the hood that is hard to grasp just from playing that unless you understand it makes some of the fights hard and frustrating. 

But if you want a good tactical RPG in a dark-fantasy setting its pretty good.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967450014', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 4457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3777, 'last_played': 1398362906}
review: Pour ceux qui aome les combats strat√©giques en tour par tour baign√© dans un environnement RPG...foncez...sc√©nario sympathique lin√©aire, mais √† rebondissement, ce jeux me scotche depuis 50h et je n'ai pas encore vu le bout, alors que tous les combats sont uniques, script√©s, et proposent un r√©el challenge, toujours surmontable apr√®s quelques essais. Essai transform√© pour Daedelic sur ce jeux !

author: {'steamid': '76561197980366980', 'num_games_owned': 506, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1248, 'last_played': 1390842385}
review:
All the frustration of DnD: without the dice, friends, and customizable campaign.
With the added bonus of loading screens every two seconds.
It's an SRPG though, so there's that.
Seriously, I have never been bothered by the amount of loading screens by any other game before.
When they said "40+ hours of gameplay" I assumed that meant I would be playing for 40+ hours and not waiting for something that should already be loaded to load for 20.

Edit: It isn't the loading times, it's just the sheer number of loading screens. I don't need to see a loading screen every two seconds. For example: in cities if you want to go anywhere or do anything aside from using a merchant you need to go through a loading screen. That stuff should already be loaded.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006431116', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 4326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3880, 'last_played': 1391626649}
review:
WOW! I cant belive how well made this game ist!
If you are a console guy who like action games and consider Diablo an RPG then hands OFF this game.

For all who love strategy and RPG with a deep and complex rule system pick this one up!
Be warned however... its a game where you are supposed to THINK! Its has no easy-mode and without some clever thinking you will get nowhere.

THANKS FOR THIS GREAT GAME! Awesome! Cant wait for a sequel!

author: {'steamid': '76561198049374810', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2005, 'last_played': 1417189458}
review: First 80 minutes or so? Wasn't impressed. Didn't feel all that great, controls felt kinda clunky, targeting was a bit of a hassle. But I got used to it, and fell down the rabit hole, as it were. There's no karma meter, and the game doesn't seem to push you to be "good" or "evil". I would recommend this game for that alone, but like I said, the controls you get used to, the characters are believable, and the fact that you can interact with the terrain is just wow. Though I do wish I had known the bushes at one stage could be lit on fire BEFORE throwing that fireball next to my fighter...

author: {'steamid': '76561197971852593', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 630, 'last_played': 1390588152}
review:
I can't really recommend it.. It's somehow frustating at some point and I never got beyond the first couple of 'towns' and the relevant quests. It started quite good and interesting but when I have to try a fight over and over again vs. incredible strong opponents at the very beginning it turned out, that you rather need some good luck to win a fight, rather than tactics. I'm talking especially about the fight to rescue the baroness and the fight vs. the two dwarfs. I mean why fight such powerful opponents in the very beginning with such shity gear and values for your party? And that stupid turn limit to rescue the baroness is just frustating. 

Sorry, after a good start it just gets disappointing. If I could sell or gift it on steam, I gladly would.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086830584', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5665, 'last_played': 1402096472}
review:
Vraiment un jeu agr√©able! Le meilleur depuis un bon bout de temps! Si vous aimez le tour par tour, c'est un jeu √† acheter!
Seul b√©mole, c'est que le sc√©nario semble un peu lin√©aire et les dialogues n'ont que tr√®s peu de cons√©quences sur celui-ci. Sinon les combats en valent la chandelle! Wow!

author: {'steamid': '76561198032212621', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1392228791}
review:
Hin und wieder trifft man ganz unerwartet auf eine klassische RPG Perle. Wer frustfreies Spielen erwartet, sich selbst wieder aufladende Gesundheitsbalken oder grafisch anspruchsvolle Open-World Action, der ist hier fehl am Platze... 
Wer sich allerdings endlich mal wieder in das komplexe DSA Regelwerk einfuchsen will, taktische rundenbasierte K√§mpfe bestreiten, eine tolle (wenn auch etwas abgedroschene) Geschichte erleben, und Abenteuerpunkte (Exp.) auf unz√§hlige F√§higkeiten und Talente aufteilen will; wer also das alte Tabletop-Flair der DSA-Reihe wieder mal erleben m√∂chte, der muss einfach zugreifen.
Aber keine Angst... Blackguards ist keine dr√∂ge Zahlenschubserei, sondern belohnt jede erledigte Quest, jeden besiegten Gegner mit APs, Loot und Storyfortschritt...
Der Preis ist zugegebenerma√üen ein bisschen happig, aber im Gegensatz zu manchem Shooter ein wahres Schn√§ppchen ;-)
Einzig den Metascore von (derzeit) 71% verstehe ich nicht... Das liegt aber wahrscheinlich an mir...

author: {'steamid': '76561198018159973', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 11800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1126, 'last_played': 1393309152}
review: This game is awesome! The leveling system is a number junkies dream come true, and the battles really reward thoughtful play without making it unbalanced. The sound design feels like a big budget studio with amazing voice acting and an engaging soundtrack. This is the game I hoped xcom would be and any fan of tactical RPGs would be remiss not to pick it up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053168064', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1405204686}

It has even in the beginning nice details, th sotry is so far better then most "gamemasters" think of their own ones, the feeling is fine, and the choices in which skills you point is making a real difference.

GREAT WORK, Daedalic. And be sure, i do not like all of your games :)

Giiiiiive Addons ,... give storys...give all !

author: {'steamid': '76561197964042778', 'num_games_owned': 992, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1850, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1643539920}
review:
For the most part I really like this game. Character development is very deep and interesting for an indie RPG and the combat, while not incredibly nuanced, is fun and challenging. On the other hand however, the game's marketing material tout that you play as a band a criminals and miscreants - even the name of the game hints at this. However the game appears to reward you for being the 'good' guy and punish you by omission for being the 'bad' guy, which is surely counter productive if you want your players to be nasty 'Blackguards'. However that's just my opinion.

I can't recommend this game in its current state. There are far too many bugs and design issues that should have been weeded out during testing. Another testament to how pointless and anti-consumer the early access system is. The game is simply not worth the asking price as it is. However once these problems are fixed and perhaps the game comes down in price a little, I'd happily recommend it. At its core it's a very enjoyable game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003518140', 'num_games_owned': 2820, 'num_reviews': 360, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1511335767}
review: While I don't have a lot of time invested yet in Blackguards I must say that I am enjoying the turned based combat and overall feel of the game.  The game is very pretty and seems bug free for the most part at least for the 3 or so hours I put into the game.   I really haven't gotten to invested into the story yet but it is interesting enough.  Visually the game is very pretty and gameplay wise it seems rewarding.   I haven't seen anything that reinvents the wheel but that said what it does it does well.  I so far highly recommend the game.  Honestly in the short time I have been playing I have had more fun combat wise than with games like Dragon Age.  Of course it isn't completely fair to compare a Real Time with Pause game with a turned based game.   I will say that between this and Divnity: Original Sins it makes a turned based strategy RPG gamer happy with glee to see such great games coming out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007375423', 'num_games_owned': 430, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1404495161}
review:
Also 4 Stunden auf der Uhr, es wurde Vorgestern released und es macht einen heiden Spa√ü! Nachdem Chaos Cronicles auf Eis gelegt wurde, hatte ich keine Hoffnung mehr, auf ein S-RPG. Doch dann erschien Blackguards. In Aventurien angesiedelt, das Regelwerk von DSA, was will man mehr? Die K√§mpfe k√∂nnen und sind meist sehr vordernd, da man entweder einer gro√üen √úbermacht gegen√ºbersteht (man sollte dan Eng√º√§sse auf der Karte nutzen) oder sehr harte Zeitlimits (dort kommt dann der RNG zur Geltung) zu bew√§ltigen hat. Dass man einen Kampf 3,4,5 ach mehrmals neu starten muss (kein Speichern w√§hrend des Kampfes und jeder Kampf verl√§uft anders, NPC's machen nicht immer die gleicehn Aktionen) ist keine Seltenheit und ich spiele es auf Normal aber standard Characktergenerierung (keine Werte selbst bestimmt am Anfang). Man kann selbst entweder K√§mpfer, Mager oder Sch√ºtze w√§hlen, was mit unter grad die Anfangsk√§mpfe komplett anders gestaltet.
Fazit: Auf jeden Fall eine Kaufempfehlung f√ºr alle RPG-Fans, und f√ºr die unentschlossenen gibt es eine Demo. :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561197971830093', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 764, 'last_played': 1390780289}
review:
To get it out of the way, like all Dark Eye computer games this game is built from the ground up to appeal to the "rules lawyers" of the tabletop gaming community. The Dark Eye is like Dungeons and Dragons for people who think that what Dungeons and Dragons really needed was more math and latin.
In keeping with the analogy for Dungeons and Dragons, which I use because as a franchise it is one that most people are more familiar with, the Drakensang games were kind of like Neverwinter Nights. This game, by contrast, is more like Temple of Elemental Evil. The game is almost entirely action, incorporating as much of the nuance of the tabletop game as possible, and takes place within a turn based framework, although with the incorporation of an actual hex grid battlemap rather than the approximation thereof. The combat options are numerous and exceptional in variety, with a number of opportunities to interact with the environment lending additional depth to each of the maps. If it has any weakness, it is perhaps that it is too pure; encumberance limits and limits on the skills offered by trainers and the goods offered by merchants seems inconvenient at times. More than once I wished that I had unlocked a skill at character creation that I can no longer find a trainer for once I discovered that one of my abilities lacked the punch that I expected of it.

This is not a game for everyone, most people will probably find the experience frustrating. For gamers like me, however, it is exactly the sort of game we've been waiting for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009324789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1390499053}
review: I think it's a steep price for such a simple RPG. The story so far is not the best, but not the worst I have seen. On the bright side the tactical combat is pretty ok. However, the lack of exploration and skill progression/customization is just horrible. You travel from one location to the next with a click of the mouse, and every single location brings a fight, and I mean EVERY SINGLE ONE. There is no wondering if the big axe of the bandit you just slew is something for you. No no, you just get some {random) auto loot that has nothing to do with the fight. Frankly - the game just feels wrong.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971758387', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1394147089}
review: Very refreshing, classic strategic RPG!  In a world filled with games that have RPG elements and say they are RPG's, Daedalic has finally got it right! The story is engaging and, like the old SSI D&D games, lets your imagination fill in the rest!  You earn what loot you get and the character development is in depth almost to a fault.  Battles are turnbased and fun and you have to manage your resources.  This game will not be for everyone, though.  The demo is coming, so try before you buy.  Well worth the investment, if you love traditional cRPG's!

author: {'steamid': '76561198068417037', 'num_games_owned': 255, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 812, 'last_played': 1388176141}
review:
Great mix of tactical gameplay with RPG elements. Don't get fooled by simplistic approach, your tactical battle skills will be tested here, as even a single mistake can turn your assumed victory into a devastating defeat. It's really enjoyable and gives me that "oh, man, this was intense", whenever my party barely makes it through yet another battle, which I thought will be a futile attempt.

The UI may be little overwhelming at first, but it packs some clever concepts that you will appreciate in te long run. Developers came with a great idea and the execution is just beautiful. I bought it when it was still an Early Access game, but even back then it was so polished and well balanced, that I doubt EA can ever make BF4 that shiny.

If you like turn-based tactical gameplay and fantasy RPG, this is a definite must-have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018508362', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 11501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10981, 'last_played': 1390712690}
review:
Blackguards is a turn-based fantasy, often dark and frequently humorous, RPG.

While still a beta product it is polished and one of the best RPG's I have played in a while. It is a good feeling to catch myself laughing at the well voice acted humorous dialogue, which I haven't experienced to this degree since way back in games such as KOTOR and Jade Empire. Daedalic Entertainment might just be the new old pre-EA BioWare we all fondly remember.

Probably the only frustrating thing I experienced was the questionable stated odds of a spell succeeding, but I am also not sure if that percentage was meant to take into account the defender's resistances.

I give it a 9 because it is hard to me to envision a better RPG without my mind drifting back to old BioWare. So this is a real user score, not an artificially inflated rating meant to preemptively fend off the incoming 0's from reviewers that found fault in this product.

I eagerly await the Chapter 5 release...

author: {'steamid': '76561198002951956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1392265502}
review:
Wholeheartedly recommended for anyone with a love for tactical RPGs. I found myself addicted to the ease of the turn based combat and was pleasantly surprised by how easily I got into the swing of things.
	

For those interested in the Dark Eye setting this game is a great introduction that plunges you directly into a story that is intriguing with characters full of personality who I have become attached to and want to know more of.
	

Strategically speaking while you have to pick one of three classes at the beginning, the game gives you the opportunity to either mix and match from the beginning or to develop a character along the lines of what you would like to play. The battles are a good mix of duration, long without being tedious and short enough so that restarting is not a chore.
	

All in all I say this game is well spent that gave me my money's worth and then some, and I can certainly see why The Dark Eye setting is so popular over seas.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970288473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 776, 'last_played': 1390849451}
review:
Quality SRPG, that is both strategy AND real RPG. Xcom fans will appreciate the turn based style of combat, but be amazed at the depth of character customization and talen trees. RPG fans will appreciate the sensible approach to letting you move about an over world map with freedom, and continue moving in dungeons via a map of rooms.

And lastly, strategy fans will love the character devolpment, voice acting, and over-all attention to detail that is lacking in most SRPG games.

While there might not be anything stunningly "new" or unseen before in Blackguards... there's so much that's done exactly as you'd want it done, that it's easy to overlook what few missteps they made.

A solid reccomendation for fans of turn based strategy games, RPGs, and fantasy gamers. A no brainer for pen and paper fans!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030360062', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1390602240}
review: Game gets boring really fast. VO/story/atmosphere is terrible. Loot is forgettable and combat is tedious. Basically the game is series of scripted encounters that you can only lose if you made the wrong choices when choosing new skills/lvl upgrades. 80% of the skills/stats/abilities are useless, so the main challenge is guesstimating which skills will be useful in future encounters. I doesn't feel like a RPG at all. It's more like a tactics game with levels to beat (think Elven Legacy with 4 troops and fixed turn order).

review: Ein sch√∂nes DSA Abenteuer, wie man es sich vorstellt. Tolle Geschichte, abwechslungsreiche Charaktere, gro√üe Vielfalt bei der Charakterentwicklung, wie man es aus den anderen alten DSA Spielen (DSA 1-3 und Drakensang) gew√∂hnt ist. Dieses Spiel legt den Hauptaugenmerk auf die fessenden, taktischen Kampfget√ºmmel. Statt Schachfelder gibt es Hexfelder, teilweise zus√§tzlich mit benutzbaren/zerst√∂rbaren Gegenst√§nden oder aber Fallen gespickt. Anstatt stundenlang und f√ºhrungslos auf eigene Faust in der Gegend rumzulaufen, bewegt man sich auf der Landkarte zu vordefinierten √ñrtlichkeiten, die wiederum ein paar weitere Bewegungsm√∂glichkeiten aufweisen k√∂nnen. Wer also Spiele wie Gothic und Drakensang nur gespielt hat, weil ihm das Erkunden von jedem Winkel einer virtuellen Welt am wichtigsten ist, der wird hier entt√§uscht. Daedalic hat hier seinem Namen als einer der f√ºhrenden Adventureentwickler unter Beweis gestellt. Neben einer toll erz√§hlten Geschichte bekommt man anstatt der ansonsten anzutreffenden R√§tsel halt knallharte Rollenspielaspekte geboten, die angesprochenen taktischen K√§mpfe und das gesamte Regelwerk zum austoben. Ich finde es ist eine gute Mischung geworden. Weiter so!

review: Sehr gut!  Jedenfalls f√ºr old school RPGler und Taktiker. Die √ºberwiegenden taktischen rundenbasierten K√§mpfe auf Hex-Feldern sind teilweise sehr fordernd. Jedoch nicht unfair.  Rollenspieltechnisch  wird fast das gesamte DSA Regelwerk aufgefahren. Auch wenn die RPG-Elemente etwas zu kurz kommen, mal abgesehen von der opulenten Charackterentwicklung machen die, das gros des Spiels ausmachenden, Taktikk√§mpfe einen Heidenspass und fordern das allerletzte aus den lieb gewonnen Helden.  F√ºr DSA Fans, die auch schon den einen oder anderen Heroes of Might and Magic oder Vandal Hearts nicht verschm√§ht haben ein Pflichtkauf. Gerade f√ºr den Kurs. Und auch nicht unbedingt etwas Halbgares wie andere Versuche Aventurien in anderen Spielen aufleben zu lassen.

review:
Un buon rpg con un ottimo sistema di combattimento per chi ama i turni.
Lati postivi: Combattimento a turni ben fatto e molto tattico, tante armi e skill dei personaggi, trama intrigante, molto difficile.
Lati negativi: Gestione delle skill e dell inventario piuttosto caotica, non ci si puo' creare il proprio party dall inizio, molto difficile.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042327282', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1396945614}
review: While I have only played a few hours I really like this game. The best way I could describe it is if Dragon Age: Origins and XCOM had a baby. The graphics are not stunning, and there are a few glitches, but all in all well worth the money. It is challenging has a great economic system, the equipment seems pretty balanced and more based on your skill and strategy than anything else. I also have to add that I like the characters a great deal, some of the dialogue has even given me a chuckle or two.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970321753', 'num_games_owned': 1022, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 669, 'last_played': 1446384955}
review:
[b]Blackguards[/b] ist endlich mal wieder ein Rundenstrategiespiel, das mich von Anfang an fesselt. Es macht Spa√ü, die Geschichte mit seinen Helden zu durchleben und wichtige Entscheidungen zu treffen.

Als Early-Access-Spiel macht [b]Blackguards[/b] auf mich einen sehr sehr guten Eindruck. Wenn ich es nicht w√ºsste, w√ºrde ich denken, dass ich bereits die Release Version spiele. Bisher sind mir keine Bugs oder Fehler aufgefallen. Ein klein wenig st√∂rt mich, dass einige Sprecher ihre Sache (noch?) nicht ganz ernst genommen haben. Sie klingen gelangweilt. Vielleicht sind das aber noch Platzhalter, die in der Release Version ersetzt werden(?).

Ich habe den Kauf des DSA-Ablegers nicht bereut und kann es kaum erwarten, bis die Release Version erscheint. So lange spiele ich auf jeden Fall die Early-Access Version weiter... :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198029646908', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1014, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1391881531}
review: One of a kind.... it sticks to the dragon age origins formula but improves it in many aspects. I was truly amazed by how big the world map was when i first looked at it. Still, it could use some optimization ( my fps is everywhere between 10 and 40 regardless of what happens - i.e nice smooth fps during big fight with spells low fps in town ) but overall this issue can be completely ignored considering what this game is. Keep up the good work guys! :D We need more games like this. Offers 5x more than most 50 euros  AAA games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049254534', 'num_games_owned': 764, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8025, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8025, 'last_played': 1399493404}
review:
[b][i]Daedalic Entertainment[/i], √† qui l‚Äôon doit √©galement de nombreux [i]point‚Äôn click[/i] ‚Äì dont Deponia, Les Cha√Ænes de Satinav et Memoria, d√©cida de continuer dans sa lanc√©e de l‚Äôexploitation de la licence de l‚Äô≈ìil noir. Mais, cette fois-ci, le studio a fait le choix de s‚Äôapprocher davantage du jeu de r√¥le papier en d√©veloppant un [i]tactical[/i] RPG, ce qui l‚Äô√©loigne √©galement de son savoir-faire historique, sans pour autant renier cette exp√©rience. Alors, que vaut Blackguards premier du nom ? C‚Äôest ce que nous allons voir ensemble. C‚Äôest parti ![/b]

La particularit√© de l‚Äôunivers de l‚Äô≈ìil noir ? Il est sombre, sale, glauque, et les vrais h√©ros sur leur blanc destrier au sourire [i]ultra-bright[/i] n‚Äôexistent pas (... ou alors il y a un truc salement louche derri√®re !). J‚Äôen veux pour preuve vos compagnons de route : un nain col√©rique et cupide, un mage flirtant avec le satyriasis, une demi-elfe toxicomane, et un esclave gladiateur psychotique. Quant √† vous, apr√®s avoir cr√©√© votre personnage, vous vous retrouvez en prison, amn√©sique (... damn !)  apr√®s avoir √©t√© accus√© √† tort du meurtre de votre amie et princesse, [i]Eleanor[/i].

En r√©alit√©, cette derni√®re s‚Äôest faite d√©vorer par un myst√©rieux loup. C‚Äôest d‚Äôailleurs dans cette prison que vous ferez connaissance avec deux de vos compagnons de route : [i]Naurim[/i] (le nain) et [i]Zubaran[/i] (le mage). On se retrouve alors de facto sur une alliance de circonstance, avec des bras cass√©s qui vont bon-gr√© mal-gr√© enqu√™ter sur ce meurtre. J‚Äôaime.

Pour √©voquer rapidement la cr√©ation du personnage et ses caract√©ristiques, vous aurez quelques choix sommaires vis-√†-vis du [i]look[/i] global de votre avatar, mais √©galement un choix d'arch√©type parmi la trinit√© classique : guerrier, mage, et voleur. Il est √©galement possible de faire fi de ces mod√®les, et de finalement cr√©er le profil que l'on souhaite. Il pourrait √™tre tentant de cr√©er un personnage hybride, tel que voleur / mage, mais je vous le d√©conseille, car cela n'en ferait qu'un personnage moyen √† tous niveaux.

Il faudra donc judicieusement r√©partir les points disponibles parmi les attributs (force, intelligence, etc...), les armes, les capacit√©s et r√©sistances, la magie, et des comp√©tences li√©es √† la classe du personnage. Am√©liorer l'une de ces caract√©ristiques ne pourra se faire qu'avec des Points d'Action, que l'on r√©cup√®re apr√®s un combat. Mais nous ne pourrons pas apprendre n'importe quelles comp√©tences √† souhait. En effet, certaines ne seront disponibles qu'√† travers un formateur particulier, disponible dans un lieu sp√©cifique.

Les environnements hors-combat sont amen√©s d‚Äôune mani√®re assez int√©ressante, faisant justement ressortir l‚Äôexp√©rience [i]point‚Äôn click[/i] de [i]Daedalic[/i]. A travers une carte du monde, vous pourrez vous d√©placer d‚Äôun lieu √† un autre. Vous arriverez alors sur un tableau fixe, o√π vous retrouverez des interactions avec des objets, des √©v√©nements, ou des PNJ ‚Äì voire les trois. Cela pourra √©ventuellement donner lieu √† une qu√™te secondaire non-d√©nu√©e d'int√©r√™t. Elles ne sont pas l√©gion, mais permettent d'asseoir une certaine ambiance. A ce sujet, en ce qui concerne les dialogues, ils sont relativement bien √©crits, et les doublages ne sont d'ailleurs pas en reste. Quant √† l'intrigue, elle est plut√¥t bien men√©e, avec un rythme assez lent qui correspond finalement aussi bien au rythme global du jeu, qu'√† l'univers qu'il emprunte.

Mais, qu'on se le dise, la principale force de [b]Blackguards[/b] reste ses combats tactiques au tour par tour. On se retrouve sur une grille avec des hexagones, o√π chaque personnage disposera d'une certaine distance de d√©placement. Deux choix s'offrent alors au joueur : se d√©placer (ou pas) jusqu'√† la limite visible pour ensuite encha√Æner avec une action, ou bien de se d√©placer plus loin sans possibilit√© d'agir apr√®s. Cette derni√®re possibilit√© permet par exemple de pouvoir se mettre √† couvert afin de ne pas √™tre trop expos√© aux attaques √† distance des adversaires. Quant aux actions, il sera tout autant possible d'interagir avec un objet tel qu'un levier pour ouvrir une porte, qu'attaquer les ennemis. Mais, nous aurons diff√©rents moyens de passer √† l'offensive ; via des comp√©tences d'arme ‚Äì qu'elles soient de m√™l√©e ou √† distance, de la magie, ou bien encore via des objets tels que des bombes aux effets divers et vari√©s.

Une fois le type d'attaque choisi, le curseur de la souris, point√© sur l'ennemi d√©sir√©, laissera appara√Ætre le pourcentage de chances de toucher. Ce param√®tre varie en fonction de votre ma√Ætrise de l'arme utilis√©, ainsi que de la comp√©tence martiale associ√©e, mais √©galement vis-√†-vis des d√©fenses et r√©sistances de l'adversaire ‚Äì sans oublier le fait de savoir s'il est √† couvert ou pas. Et les interactions avec les objets ne sont pas en reste ! Pour donner un exemple concret √† travers un des premiers tableaux, un lustre est suspendu au dessus d'une pi√®ce ; lorsque vos adversaires passent en dessous, il suffira alors de couper la corde qui le retient pour faire un carnage √† peu de frais ; √† vous d'√©viter les dommages collat√©raux en ne laissant pas un de vos personnages dans la zone du pi√®ge !

Si vous utilisez de la magie du feu sur un tonneau en bois ou un buisson, ce dernier s'enflammera et pourra provoquer des d√©g√¢ts lorsque vos ennemis (... ou vous-m√™me !) passeront dessus. Pour rester dans la pyromanie, si lors d'une de vos ballades dans un marais vous croisez un nuage de gaz, vous pourrez l'exploiter afin d'embraser tous ceux qui seront √† l'int√©rieur. Si vous n'arrivez pas √† trouver √† l‚Äô≈ìil nu les diff√©rentes interactions disponibles, appuyer sur la touche V les r√©v√©lera toutes.

Vous l'aurez compris, [b]Blackguards[/b] fourmille d'interactions diverses et vari√©es amenant le jeu sur un plan tactique d'excellente facture. On retrouve √©galement certains objectifs particuliers pendant ces combats : trouver le moyen de d√©livrer une nana attach√©e √† un poteau, en un certain nombre de tours, avant qu'elle ne soit ex√©cut√©e. Cela rehausse finalement le [i]challenge[/i] sans que la difficult√© n'en devienne r√©dhibitoire, car il ne s'agit en effet que d'objectifs secondaires. Mais, certains esprits chafouins me r√©torqueront que oui, c'est bien beau tout √ßa, mais il n'y a pas d'exploration, et les choix / cons√©quences sont franchement [i]lights[/i] !

Le jeu √©tant compos√© de tableaux fixes, il n'y a effectivement pas d'exploration possible, mais la curiosit√© peut parfois amener notre √©quipe de bras cass√©s vers des lieux cach√©s autrement inaccessibles. Quant aux choix et cons√©quences, il est vrai qu'ils sont relativement [i]lights[/i] et n'iront pas jusqu'√† bousculer la trame principale. Pour ma part, tant que cette derni√®re √©tait de qualit√©, cela me suffisait pour que j'en oublie son c√¥t√© lin√©aire. On pourrait aussi noter qu'il n'y a pas des tartines de textes √† lire au kilom√®tre, mais encore une fois, l'existant est tr√®s bien ficel√©, assez pour que j'aie encore envie d'y rejouer.

[b][i]Daedalic Entertainment[/i] a r√©ussi d'une main de ma√Ætre a concilier son exp√©rience des [i]point'n click[/i] avec son amour de l'univers de l‚Äô≈ìil noir pour concevoir un jeu tactique, bien que ce ne soit finalement qu'avec des √©l√©ments RPG assez l√©gers. Et en mati√®re de [i]tactical[/i] au tour par tour, il s'en est clairement sorti haut la main, puisque selon la classe de personnage, on se rendra compte de la rejouabilit√© du titre ‚Äì plus d'une centaine d'heures au compteur pour ma part. Les adeptes de [i]tactical[/i] RPG √† la difficult√© relev√©e ne pourront pas s'y tromper : Blackguards est un tr√®s bon jeu ![/b]

review:
Bereits ind der Early Access version sehr stabil und ausgereift.... vorbildlich.

Das konzentrieren auf die K√§mpfe finde ich klasse, die St√§dte und die gut vertonten Gespr√§che dienen nur zur Geschichte, zum Ausr√ºsten und um die gut gemachten Talentb√§ume zu verfeinern.... perfekt.

Die K√§mpfe sind fantastisch gemacht, sehen gut aus und geben einem gutes Feedback was gerade geschieht. Allesamt nicht einfach. und einige muss man mehrmals spielen, um sie "optimal" zu beenden :-) 
Welche Ideen man hier eingebracht hat ist schon unglaublich.Das sollten sich andere Entwickler ruhig mal anschauen, was in der "totgesagten" Rundenstrategie alles m√∂glich ist !

Ein absoluter Kauftipp f√ºr alle DSA und Rundenstrategie Fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023487637', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 3474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3046, 'last_played': 1391002170}
review: Not doing a lengthy review, just want to give this game a thumbs up. Awesome turn-based RPG, troubled only by a handful of frustrating fights (frustrating for all the wrong reasons). I wholeheartedly recommend it, though!

author: {'steamid': '76561198024663331', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1133, 'last_played': 1391055592}
review: Difficulty spikes when trying to rescue the Baroness. Balancing needs alot of work. Really feels Alpha. The potential is there but at this stage, the balancing issue with the characters just being a couple levels weaker than the NPCs and with maps designed with strategic challenge in mind, just makes a frustrating experience. Feels harder than XCOM on the hardest difficulty. Really doubt I will try another game in development stage. It's in "Beta" for a reason. At the current "Beta" stage I would not recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031026148', 'num_games_owned': 183, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 2169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2169, 'last_played': 1390498941}
review:
90% of battles are cheese pushover, the other 10% are needlessly difficult and frustrating. You go from boredom to frustration without passing through fun.

They gave you dozens of skills, weapons, stats and spells, but a good half of them are completly useless and you HAVE to min/max your char if you want to see the end. So the asctual viable choices on char customization is a very narrow path, all the rest are just cosmetic.

The story is the usual, boring, orcs&dwarves fantasy setting. The narration is monorail linear with ZERO choices and consequences. EVERYTHING is scripted. Dialogues and npcs are childish and clich√®.

With so many good turn based games out there, Blackguards can, and should, be forgotten. You have been warned.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978024377', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 2753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1718, 'last_played': 1411547781}
review:
By far one of the best Fantasy RPG turned based strategies to come out with the sudden revival of strategy games in the last 2 years. 

Indepth story and side quests keeps this game responsive and replayable. The AI has it's elements which makes you think and at sometimes hate that again your team fails...

I highly reccomend this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197992986985', 'num_games_owned': 558, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 6410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2868, 'last_played': 1394341019}
review:
Great turn based tactical combat RPG.  The non-combat parts of the game are really just "interface" and story board.  Kind of like a Dark Eye based XCOM.  Combat is great.

Character development can be frustrating at first if you're not familiar with Dark Eye rules, but once you figure out the basics (focus entirely on a skill or two to start until you're competent at them before branching out), it's a smooth progression.

Not at all loot based.  Combat is pure character build and tactics based.  Pay attention to the environments, they are key.  Some battles will seem impossible if you didn't pay attention to the commentary leading up to it and use your "V" key to highlight the interactive objects.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036089852', 'num_games_owned': 528, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 5783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5410, 'last_played': 1395098809}
review:
(Terminado en modo dif√≠cil Al final a√±ado ep√≠logo a √©ste primer an√°lisis)
Este an√°lisis es parcial pues s√≥lo llevo  unas doce horas de juego pero de momento pinta todo muy bien.
Lo primero de todo: SE TRATA DE UNA BETA ESTABLE, JUGABLE Y BALANCEADA, vamos, hoy en d√≠a y en steam casi una excepci√≥n.
Segundo: hablamos de estrategia por turnos de gesti√≥n de escuadr√≥n, mi g√©nero favorito y en el √∫nico que gasto dinero en productos no rebajados. 
Tercero: es un RPG por turnos de tem√°tica fant√°stica medieval con encuentros absolutamente fijos y marcados y con una buena historia, de las que te hace fijarte en los di√°logos. Al ser los encuentros marcados y consecutivos realmente es un juego de estrategia de resoluci√≥n de escenarios. Hay tres clases (mago, guerrero y ladr√≥n) t√∫ eliges la de tu personaje inicial (hasta ahora te viene con unas skills fijas de inicio que no tuneas hasta que logras XP), el resto que se van incorporando son personajes fijos, NPC que se convierten en PJ tuyos. Los dos primeros que se incorporan (siempre ser√°n estos dos) son un guerrero y un mago (yo, hasta ahora s√≥lo he jugado con este trio, mi PJ, una picara, el guerrero enano y el mago humano).
Cuarto: Hay tres niveles de dificultad, yo directamente he comenzado a probarlo en el m√°s dif√≠cil y hay encuentros que son realmente duros. -los primeros pasos son facilones, despu√©s se complica. Al ser los encuentros fijos siempre puedes recomenzarlo o repetirlos para enmendar errores cometidos. Realmente cada encuentro es como un puzle con la presencia del factor suerte, algo habitual siempre que hay tiradas de dados, pero lo que te hace ganar o perder es enfocar correctamente la estrateg√≠a de cada uno de los encuentros.  Eso resulta muy divertido y retador.
Quinto: El juego tiene unos buenos gr√°ficos, no a nivel del X-COM, pero es de los juegos de estrategia de escuadr√≥n por turnos m√°s cuidados que existen a nivel gr√°fico. 
Sexto: El tema de mejora de personajes y adquisici√≥n de skills (habilidades) est√° muy  trabajado y es b√°sico para la resoluci√≥n del juego. Esa es la salsa del juego, lo que puede diferenciar una partida de otra, el como orientar tus personajes y en que talentos y habilidades especializarlos.  Tener muy claro cual va a ser el papel de cada uno en cada encuentro.
S√©ptimo: Las voces, que son muy buenas, est√°n en ingl√©s, pero ya en la beta hay subtitulaci√≥n, y francamente buena, al castellano. La banda sonara tambi√©n est√° muy cuidada.
Como corolario: A√∫n trat√°ndose de una beta y siendo por tanto todo an√°lisis parcial, de momento me est√° pareciendo un juegazo cojonudo y con muchas posiblidades para convertirlo en saga o permitir su desarrollo v√≠a mods. No es un juego de gesti√≥n de escuadr√≥n por turnos abierto, est√° muy guionizado y teledirigido pero cada encuentro tiene mucha chispa,  mucha estratateg√≠a y se hace realmente retador, al menos en el modo dif√≠cil. Y mucho cuidado al legir en que os gast√°is los dineros y como subis el personaje, es importante. 
Disfrutadlo y celebrar que estamos entrando en una nueva edad de oro de los juegos de estrategia por turnos.
PD: Ya voy por el c√°pitulo 2¬∫ en modo dif√≠cil y el juego contin√∫a pareci√©ndome fabuloso.  Una enorme sorpresa.
PD2: Acabado el cap√≠tulo 3¬∫, iniciado el 4¬∫, esto sigue siendo una pasada, una aventura de rol cl√°sico como hac√≠a tiempo que no jugaba (desde la √©pocas de rol de papel o del  primer Dragon Age, el Neverwinter o el Baldurs, rol del bueno y adem√°s con combate por turnos). Lo estoy "gosando como una perra".  Sigo en modo dif√≠cil, porque me da vidilla y me supone un reto. Alg√∫n combate lo tengo que replantear hasta dos o tres veces, un par incluso cuatro veces, pero siempre acabas encontrando la t√°ctica adecuada, de verdad que me est√° pareciendo un juego con muy buenas mec√°nicas.

EP√çLOGO: Terminado en modo dif√≠cil todo el juego. El √∫ltimo cap√≠tulo es duro de pelar con rivales jodidos de verdad pero siempre hay un modo de lograrlo (aunque a veces el modo puede llegar a consistir en que la AI no tome la mejor decisi√≥n). Me ha gustado mucho, reconozco que no es un juego para todos los paladares, al menos en modo dif√≠cil  es un juego para estrategas veteranos, con paciencia para probar el ensayo/error y capacidad de an√°lisis del tablero. Vuelvo a repetir que lo he disfrutado un mont√≥n y que no me importa para nada la linealidad de la historia (es un modo de plantear un juego como otro cualquiera) ni lo limitado de las cinem√°ticas. Espero que saquen segundas partes u otros juegos ambientados en ese sistema/mundo. Gracias a los desarrolladores por acordaros de los estrategas de la vieja escuela y devolvenos las fe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072832053', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 842, 'last_played': 1416462493}
review: ce jeu n'est absolument pas jouable , ni faisable :  d'abord pour du rpg , les ennemis ne r√©apparaissent pas , ce qui fait que vous ne pouvait en aucun cas booster vos personnages , le jeu vous offres 6 zones de combats en ligne droite (imaginer un jeu de l'oie ) , vous gagnez , vous d√©penser votre exp√©rience et vous avancez sur la carte ( case suivante )   ) et l√† vous arrivez devant un bos , pas moyen de gagnez , vous n'√©tes pas assez fort , mais c'est l√† qu'est le probleme , vous ne pouvez absolument pas faire d'autres combats pour √©voluer ,on peu retourner en arri√©re dans les villes mais plus de combats ,  on se retrouve donc bloquer devant un boss ou un gros combat sans pouvoir rien faire , c'est incomprehensible !!!!!!!!!! de plus vos personnages ne touches quasiment pas les adversaires , chaque coup normal √†  25% de chance de toucher , quand aux coup sp√©ciaux , on descend √† 20 , voir 15% , donc vous ne les faites  jamais , on se retrouve parfois avec 6 adversaires , vos trois personnages font leur coup mais aucun ne touche un adversaire , mais eux par contre ne vous loupe pas .bref jeu essayer en facile , meme chose ,  dommage car le jeu est tres beau , tr√©s bonne musique , combat g√©nial et tr√©s tactique , beaucoup de comp√©tences √† d√©bloquer ( voir peut etre trop ? ) mais sans un syst√©me de combat √©quilibrer , comment y arriver ? c'est le seul mais gros probl√©me du jeu .

author: {'steamid': '76561198002802406', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 710, 'last_played': 1398236409}
review: I just started Chapter 3 and so far the story if fairly Linear, However the characters are pretty interesting (as of right now though not much character depth) although some very interesting events have occured so far. So considering its early access so far the game has not dissapointed and is very fun. The gameplay is great and a refreshing experience compared to most games today. However there is not really much exploration. The most you can expect is in deciding what places to go or skip in some dungeon like stages. I am having fun with the game and recommend it to Avid RPG fans and fans of strategy games (specifically the new X-COM game)

author: {'steamid': '76561198006645306', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1397838652}
review:
A very cool game. I love the gameplay and the setting. I'm not sure that the character are the best written character ever but it's competent enough. 

Seriously, I don't understand early access very much (as a dev myself) but the beta is great, very stable. You will have fun. For the price, it's great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003325820', 'num_games_owned': 998, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 659, 'last_played': 1389626582}
review:
Very nice tactical RPG. Characters reminicent of old school bioware characters and the combat is very thought-out. Each battle map is very different from the last in the way it impacts the battle, the developers seem to have spent a long time designing different terrain and objects that have effects. For example in one map there are fire braziers which you can have your characters knock over and they set large patches of oil on fire. In another there is a huge crate hanging from a crane which is operated by the enemy and it moves to block off your advance and knock your characters into the sea if they are in range.

Overall if you are looking for an RPG with smart combat and a non-generic story, you could do no better then Blackguards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022693904', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2899, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 523, 'last_played': 1391823263}
review:
reccomended, by now very fun.
the good
1)  turn based combat, for me a plus. 
2)  not totally idiot IA, sometimes  battles could be rough..
3)  by now nice story, not something to drop jaw but solid.
4)  for a beta they worked a lot and well.. 
5)   items cost, and one have to sweat to gain them 
the bad
1) almost no exploration, (would be perfect normal movement on maps and hex only for combat, is a nice world and the way is implemented is  a bit simplicistic.. (a mix between this and eg baldurs gate would be the perfect game for me) .
is a pity is a nice world.
2) by now only 3 char to choose, and by now (remembering is a beta) few customization.

A game to buy at a fair price, hope Daedalic will continue on this road, maybe watching a bit  the past glory, (black isle/obsidian/bioware)  to catch the good of them and put the  good work they have done by now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012802380', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 921, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1406120664}
review:
I'm enjoying it. There are parts that need tightening up, like seeing the console commands on screen, but aside from that it's been a smooth experience for me.

The story is interesting, the world is intriguingly dark and the characters, so far, are all interesting (my favourite being Niam the crackheaded half elf). Combat plays out on small, hex based maps that keep the action from getting bogged down or boring. And, while in combat, that's all you focus on; you can't loot corpses, for example. All of that happens afterwards which I like a LOT. 

The combat system is simple, really, but it works. There are enough special abilties to keep it all interesting and to give you a wide variety of tactics (at least when you get the right people to suit your style) but they're not exactly trying to break the mold here. Basically, you've probably seen this all before. It didn't bother me, but I could see it boring some people.

The graphics do their job, though they're nothing to write home about. The voice acting has been surprisingly good for the main characters, although I find the NPCs tend to fall into stereotypes (villains sound like they're about to go "NYAH I'M EVIL"). It's not really distracting, since their lines are short and to the point, but it was something I noticed so take that as you will.

Which is really the best way to sum up this game; to the point. There are side quests and the like, but this isn't an open world game like Skyrim where you can spend a fair amount of time just walking around. You move from battle to battle, taking breathers when you need/want them, and then get right back into the thick of it. It is for this reason that I recommend this game. It's fast, fun but not short. Buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067290624', 'num_games_owned': 888, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 1554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1546, 'last_played': 1391893126}
review:
Full Video Review here - http://youtu.be/G5S2mAGsoKA

As an avid RPG player, and one who is all about story, I hold any RPG story I play to a high standard. Daedalic have been great storytellers in the past and blackguards is no different. The game is dark and mature, just what I like. Often in RPG's the more morally grey characters are the most enjoyable, relate-able and overall liked characters of a given game. In Blackguards this the type of characters you play, instead of a group of moral paragons, you play a band of rogues, trying to get by in the world and dealing with events that have been thrust upon them.

You start the game as your chosen character hovering above the corpse of princess Elenor who is being eaten by a wolf, after killing said wolf you are blamed for her death, but the strange thing is, you can't quite remember what exactly happened before you saw the wolf. After being tortured and being questioned for a name you know nothing about. Enter the fire loving, fight craving, elf hating dwarf Naurim and you‚Äôre soon on a prison break with the intention of finding out just what the hell is going on here.

The Battles in blackguards are very addictive, they tend to be relatively short but by no means easier. The great thing about blackguards combat is its difficulty, some battles require real thought and careful planning. The game is very challenging but by no means overly difficult and while it can be unforgiving at times, the game auto-saves after every battle and even if you die you have the option to start the battle over at any point from the pause menu. Fans of tactical turn based Rpgs will really get a kick out of the challenge blackguards provides. One of the star features of combat is the interactive environments. In certain levels you will have objects placed around that you can use. You can cut a rope causing the hanging chandelier to crush the enemies below it, ignite flammable swamp gas to burn opponents and more. There are over 190 beautifully crafted battlefields in blackguards, these are no mere random maps, these are hand drawn, carefully thought out maps that not only feel unique but really leave a lasting impression. 

If your an RPG fan, a turn based strategy fan or you just love a bloody good story, I cannot recommend blackguards enough. It is one of those rare games that I literally lost track of time playing. The story telling is good and engaging. Battles while not lengthy have great solid mechanics and good depth to them. The world is fantastically immersive, Daedalic have envisioned southern Aventuria beautifully. Check out the full video review for a more in depth look. 


http://youtu.be/G5S2mAGsoKA

Cosmic.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970733409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1389345718}

author: {'steamid': '76561198096843310', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 561, 'last_played': 1397920662}
review:
"Back in the day" this would have been called "a thinking man's game." If you are looking for "fast paced" look elsewhere. EVERY thing that you do NEEDS to be carefully considered and thought out. The Manual says to "save often." And it is spot on because you WILL have to go back and retry battles.
The biggest problem that I have (had) with it is that while it is billed as non-linear, in the begining it IS. And some of the begining quests are out of balance with the character's abilities. Now, I will readily admit that I am not an especially intelligent person. I'm not stupid, but i feel like it when i play this game. Sometimes I can figure out what i need to do... but i can't figure out HOW to get it done. (Like i KNOW i need to lure the Wood Troll into the swamp gas areas and then blow them up, but it moves too far for me to get him where i want him.)
Some games do a very good job of designing a variety of difficulty levels so that anyone can play them at whatever level of difficulty they want to. (ex: The King's Bounty Games, the Witcher games, and the Elder Scrolls series.) some - like this one - do not.
If you LOVE a real challenge and don't mind the frustration of failing and having to re-start a game... buy this. If you want a game that you can just play even if you aren't a chess Grand Master... don't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006681532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4204, 'last_played': 1480080730}
review:
Looking back at this review a few years later and I see that its still valid:

Not an easy game but very fun. 
Bought the game around Xmas and spent most of the time efter Xmas playing it.
(this to give you an idea how "complete" my version was of the game)

I exited the game more than a few times with the thought "yea right..." based on the difficulty of a fight.
Yet somehow I returned a while later with a few ideas on how to possibly beat an encounter. 
Completed the latest chapter (nr 4) yesturday. Has to say its been a long time since I've played a game this addictive.

As far as the "beta" status:
No crashes or any kind of freezing problems for me
There was only one dialogue screen in a trivial discussion that was in german while the rest was in english.
The audio was still in english. So I have really nothing to complain about.

If your a fan of turned based RPG games and used to playing them on other than easy/normal I'd recommend this.
But if you always choose the "easy" setting when you play: This game is all but "easy".

author: {'steamid': '76561198086574314', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2050, 'last_played': 1390863912}
review: This game is such a tight experience.  Combat is refreshingly good, and it offers a healthy amount of customization for your characters, with multiple viable builds.  The story is sufficient to get you to keep moving, but it's no Planescape: Torment (which is fine by me).  With all of the other RPGs on the horizon and in Early Access, I took a bit of a flyer on this one, and I'm really glad I did.  I don't know who these devs are or where they came from, but they have created a really good game here.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993541581', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 6211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 709, 'last_played': 1660247649}
review:
I have only played Blackguards for a couple of hours at this point. But the game brings me back to the old pen and paper Dungeons and Dragons (tm) nights with the boys. If you ever played a Kick-in-the-door style game, where the focus was on combat and the story, though good, only was an excuse for rolling the combat dice, and enjoyed it - then Blackguards is a game for you. The focus in on combat and character advancement in classic RPG style. Towns work as a supply hub, and the story advances in cutscene in between combat sequences. 
All in all a very enjoyable game - that I will recomend to people that like RPG combat like in the  old Baldurs gate series. 

Keep in mind that, at the time I write this, the game is available as early access (still in development), and your expectations should be set here after.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990857866', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1416442924}
review:
Un excellent turn-based RPG dans le monde le l'oeil noir. Ressemble un peu a Baldur gate.

-Graphiques et FX excellente.
-User interface simple et efficace
-Combat tactique, require de la strategies avec environnement destructible ( ex: les joueurs peuvent couper la corde   retenant un chandelier pour qu'il tombe sur la tete des adverssaire)
-Mecanique de combat simple a utiliser mais complexe (offre plusieurs facon de combatre un ennemis)
-Histoire, quete et exploration sont nombreuse et interessantes.

Le jeux est presentement en phase terminal et 4 episode sont deja termin√© (env 40h de jeux) d'autre episode vont suivent a tout les mois (rajoutant ainsi de la duree de vie a ce jeux)

author: {'steamid': '76561198062034331', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4997, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1410, 'last_played': 1390784109}
review:
I really recommend this game to anyone who likes tactical games.

This game is great fun when you like a bit of a challenge. Intriguing story with compelling characters and solid combat mechanics make this game one of my favourites at the moment.

If like me, you are looking for a well-thought-out tactical RPG, look no further. However, if you are looking for some mindless bashing and instant gratification, look elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986709525', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1391035733}
review:
I've played through chapter one and this took me approximatly 10hours. First of all I really enjoy the game even if I sometimes feel the desire to hammer the game against a wall.
Classes: 
-Mage
I've started as a Mage and even if it is really frustrating at the beginning, because your spells miss all the time (one 7times in a row...(This needs to be fixed!)), at the end of chapter one I have no clue how you would survive without having main char mage + the story-mage that joins your party. The story-mage is even worse at castin than your main-char and sometimes next to useless but for a few heals now an than...if he manages to cast them...My main char-mage now casts some spells with 99% accuracy but I'm not really sure why this improved...
-Warrior
So far my warrior is pretty useless besides sucking up damage, of course this is his main aim at the moment, but it is still frustrating that just 1 out of 5 attacks succed because the parring/evasion rate of most enemies is pretty high.
So far my warrior only fought with axe and shield, so maybe that's just an unfortunate combination.
-Archer
Nothing much to say here, I think this class is pretty good balanced at the moment, or a bit too good if Mage/warrior are taken as standard.

A few pros and cons:
-Until chapter one the game is quite linear, besides a few flashbacks. You can't explore any areals or wander around between cities you just leap from to the other most of the time.
-I really like the difficulty of the game, even though I'm playing on "normal" is quite demanding at times, but as mentioned above it's a bit up to luck in hard mission weather you succed or not depending on if you miss the first few hits or not...
-I would really like it if after you explored a city there would be a Sign above the city on the world map indicating what kind of trainer you found in this city, because otherwise you got to go through the cities to find them again.
-The skilling system is nice but sometimes a bit annoying because I don't know when I'll find the next trainer or which skills he can teach me so I end up not really knowing where to invest my points.

I'd like to state again that I think it's a great game despite a few issues and I'm having quite a lot of fun playing it.

review: This is an adventure RPG. The writing is good. The game system they use (the dark eye) has a bit of a learning curve but is excellent. If you are interested in tactical combat and deep character building then pick this up!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971339609', 'num_games_owned': 505, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 3712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2258, 'last_played': 1390760215}
review:
Blackguard is difficult. Blackguard is long. Blackguard is fun. 
The game forces you to utilize your envirounment on the maps of the different battles you will fight. The Mano a mano approach often leads to defeat or severe injurie. There's a lot of thinking, planning and retrying involved (when a strategy doesn't pan out), especially since you can only save before and after a battle, not during it. It's great though, makes the feeling of accomplishment that much stronger once you beat a battle while achieving all optional goals.
The length of the game is very refreshing. 40 hours can very well be exceeded, depending on how often you fail ;) 
All said and donde, Blackguard is a real treat for all fans of tactical round based gaming. The story is kind of nice, but the gameplay is what kept me glued to this game for hours since I started.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993314611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1011, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 936, 'last_played': 1390052438}
review:
I'll add on to this as I play more but for right now I have the following:

The first thing I have to say about this is I really, really like these types of games. I really enjoy games like Fire Emblem & Onimusha Tactics on the GBA and XCOM on the PC, which are specifically turn-based games. Blackguards also gives me the vibe/atmosphere of old school RPG games I love like Baldur's Gate I & II, Path of Radiance: Ruins of Myth Drannor, Icewind Dale and Neverwinter Nights + expansions + mods (The old bioware game, not that new MMO). While the games I just listed are not turn based, they do have pause button tactics, and they share the fantasy setting and RPG skill allocation, feats, that sort of thing. The most recent game of this genre was Dragon Age Origins but it has been a while since that came out. To me , Blackguards feels like a true merger of those two types of games I listed above, the action is turn-based, but the environment and customization is very much just like old school RPG.

Anyway, since then, I have been waiting for another game to grab my attention the same way all these massive titles did. I decided to pick up Blackguards, and I will admit that I was scared because it was Early Access. I will tell you now this game has not disappointed me in the slightest, even though it is Early Access. The characters are fun, the gameplay is exactly what I wanted. I have to say they won me over pretty quickly. I wrote down a few pros/cons that were most apparent for me.

Pros:
-I personally love the turn-based gameplay/combat system
-Nice artwork and environments
-Plenty of voiced dialog
-Fun characters  
Cons:
-Kind of easy even on hard difficulty, but I like these types of games so.....yea
-Graphics are a tad dated so this might bother some
-Some features are kind of buggy but it is still Early Access so calm down (using bandages ect...)
-I would like some cooler / more tiered armors and weapons
-Seeing the reference tags on characters/objects is distracting
-No in depth character customization (but it is to be added later!) 

Verdict: 
YES pick it up, if it is on sale (erm Winter Holiday Flash sale) even better. This is a fun game to play even early access. I am glad I did it and I think the RPG community will come together to love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081378641', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1430914571}

It brings back memories and a chill out game without you getting mad or mashing buttons to get a kill. A good rest from all the games that requires lots of keys to win. Let your mind do the playing! Can't wait for its release.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036614969', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1851, 'last_played': 1405472665}
{'steamid': '76561198008674217', 'num_games_owned': 272, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 488, 'last_played': 1390456528}
review:
Game is fun, very thought through and have tons of detail put in to every aspect of it. Trully an amazing rpg, the story is great as well which is a huge plus as story kills games for me, if they are bad. 
Pros- Incredible RPG aspects
Lots of costumization aspects
Lots of equipment(weapons,armor, ect) 
Fun spells that make you feel rewarded
Lots of fun, difficulties are perfectly tuned
Story is actually really good, with lots of fun twists. 

Cons- Some of the technical aspects of the game still need work, such as the mouse isn't locked on the screen, so playing this game if you have multiple monitors is a pain, as you constantly have your mouse go off to the other screen. 
I would like a few more ranged weapons
Some battles are a bit repetitive and could be done with out. (though this is minor overall) 

In the big picture, this game is very much worth it, and a great project that this company has done! I hope if Blackgaurds 2 comes out, they will expand on the universe even more, and a few more costumizations to the character looks/skills ect. I will def buy it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198095397378', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4965, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1393611151}
review:
It's a nice concept and i like it very much, i hope that you will make a great improvement before you release it, a multiplayer feature would be amazing and i wish there was some kind of possibility to grind somewhere, so that the battles wouldnt just end, like random encounters when you walk between cities or quest by guards to hunt bandits etc.

The character customization and the dialogue needs an improvement also, laughed a little at how silly it seemed at some points, good luck and hope u do something about the things i listed, i look forward to the official release!

review: Lame game.. Took away my strongest character by drugging her and killing her in the toughest fight.. Then making me protect an NPC with 15 health while fighting loads of enemies who self-destuct and a boss.. I played on easy and had to restart and restart and restart and restart and restart.. You call this EASY???!!! Get dragon's age or xcom ppl.. This game is frustrating.. Tutorial is bad.. Dice rolls usually favor the computer.. Can't farm to make my characters stronger.. Lame equipments with no stats.. Constantly strip you naked and put you against retarded odds.. If I can't complete the game on easy unless I have to replay/restart the whole damn game and build my character strictly based on some cookie cutter build to progress the game past the tough fights, then this game is dead to me..

author: {'steamid': '76561198008999222', 'num_games_owned': 823, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 8328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1385, 'last_played': 1520714395}
review:
Actuellement en Early Access, BlackGuards est un RPG solo dans un univers heroic fantasy avec des combats en tour par tour. Le jeu est assez sympa, graphiquement correcte, pas trop de bugs (des trucs tr√®s l√©gers qui ne d√©rangent quasi pas l'exp√©rience de jeu), au jour d'aujourd'hui 2 ch√¢pitres de la campagne sont disponible, soit environ entre 3 et 6heures de jeux fonction.
Niveau difficult√© c'est assez bien dos√©, les combats sont simples et tactique mais une erreure peut rapidement retourner l'issue.
L'histoire/le sc√©nario est assez dirigiste, on n'a pas trop le choix sur la direction √† prendre actuellement.
Des arbres de talent et de comp√©tences assez bien fait et diversifi√©. Idem pour l'inventaire, fid√®le au RPG.

Je conseille ce jeu.

review:
This is probably the most fun turn based RPG i've played since Baldur's Gate 2/Icewind Dale.  Not very far into it yet, but I'm enjoying the shit out of it.  The events are challenging, but there is a "retry" button for when you wipe and need to go at it from another angle.

Can't wait to see more.

Update:  Ok...best RPG I've played in 10 years.  It's unbelievably fun.  I wish there was more with gear upgrades, but I guess I'm still pretty early on in the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018106356', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2145, 'last_played': 1393910444}
review: This is my first early access game.  I had reservations, but so far I put in a few hours into it. It's fun, there are some mechanics that are not as intuitive, and I'm early on in the game.  For instance buying weapons.  Would be nice when buying a new sword, that it would list all the characters that can use that sword and their +- stats if they were to buy that sword. Hoping for more weapon variety in upcoming patches.  The game is sufficiently challenging.  Gold is hard to come by so items you purchase can be frustrating at times. If you spent all your money on an axe, you just happen to find during the next battle for instance.  But that's the nature of the beast I guess.  The battles are a bit more like HOMM vs xcom.   Overall, I would recommend this game! Good turn based strategy games are hard to come by so lets support them!  btw Bellarita mission =  Worse most frustrating mission ever.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013686480', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1387840445}

author: {'steamid': '76561198012210441', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1391036325}
review:
WASTE OF MONEY! Wait for the full version and hope they add in more stuff. 
No character customization, you get 5 hair & face options to pick from, which is unacceptable. Sorry but not everyone wants to be "white guy with an epic beard". Blond hair & beard? Short brown hair and beard? Stylized brown hair & beard? Way to limiting for my tastes. At least give me the option to get rid of the beard. Especially with WAY better games out there like Fire Emblem or Dragon Age: Origins, this is a bad choice. Combat: While I do enjoy the combat, you miss WAY WAY to much which will flat out turn players off. I thought XCOM has some bad RNGs but this takes the taco. I got this on a flash sale for $12 and I pretty much want my money back. With games on the way like Divinity Original Sin, Wastland 2, Leige, and Dead State, this will be passed over and flat out forgotten. I may go back to it after they release a patch or two but right now, playing anything over $10 is a waste of your money. You're better off saving that cash for Wasteland 2 or Divinity.

review:
Game offers very little tactical possibilities. There seems to be lot of choice, but basically most of the choices are useless as are mage and hunter class. Especially mage is very weak and requires astral points to cast spells that most of the time miss the targets anyway.

RPG elements of the game are poorly made and feels very clumsy. I usually like RPG games and especially turn based tactical games, but this was a huge dissapointment and I would not recommend this to anyone who expects certain quality from their purchases.
