author: {'steamid': '76561198008843538', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1234, 'last_played': 1390041873}
review:
An interesting RPG game with some strategy that was initially sold to me by referring to it as being in a similar vein as Shining Force (still one of my all time favourite games).  It does have to be said that the premise and characters aren't as dark as you would initially expect, given that this game promises something close to flawed dark 'heroes', but does make a nice change to the usual knight in shining armor.
Am only in the 2nd chapter so am not sure how the slighly repetative layouts and fights will play out as I progress, as do feel that it may grow stale after anothter 10 or so hours.  Also the inability to grind to gain AP (like EXP) does irritate in a game where every point counts and you feel as though you have never levelled up the right stat/skill/spell.
Bug-wise tha game has been fine thus far.  One gripe I do have is that I expected the bonus from equiping a set of armour to be more obvious and worthwhile than it currently is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060869806', 'num_games_owned': 272, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1392541725}
review: sch√∂n zu sehen das es wieder solche games gibt ...macht einen riesen spass und suchte es ..sch√∂n erz√§hlte story klasse k√§mpfe #8bin noch nicht so weit kommt mir stellenweise etwas leicht vor)

author: {'steamid': '76561198004553771', 'num_games_owned': 515, 'num_reviews': 218, 'playtime_forever': 2764, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2722, 'last_played': 1395426483}
review:
Ein gutes Spiel, die Mischung finde ich sehr interessant, allerdings fehlen doch noch ein paar Inhalte wie zb mehr Waffen/R√ºstungen, Helden, besserer Charaktereditor usw. aber ich bin mir sicher das dies nu nachgereicht wird.

Auf jeden Fall ist das Spiel ein "must have" f√ºr jeden DSA Fan ;)

Nachtrag: So da das Spiel nun vor ein paar Wochen ver√∂ffentlicht wurde erstelle ich nun ein zweites Review √ºber das Game:

Das Spiel treibt einem, umso weiter man kommt, immer mehr zur Frust, die Gegner weichen und blocken mit leichtigeit die Attacken meiner Gruppe aus und ab, ausserdem treffen sie meine Gruppe genauso gut wie sie eben meine Attacken ausweichen, obwohl ich so manche Fertigkeiten schon auf Stufe 18 habe und obwohl ich auch schon die Talente K√∂rperbeherschung und Selbstbeherschung auf 18 habe fallen meine Leute um wie die Fliegen, also das Balancing stimmt momentan ganz und gar nicht, wie soll man da gewisse Missionen die eine Rundenvorgabe haben schaffen ? 

..... auch die langen Ladezeiten nerven, vor allem wenn man sich in gr√∂√üeren St√§dten von einen Stadtteil zum n√§chsten begibt, h√§ngt man eine Gef√ºhlte Ewigkeit im Ladescreen, das nervt vor allem wenn man schnell von einem Stadtteil in den n√§chsten will um dort eine Quest abzuschlie√üen oder bei dem H√§ndler etwas kaufen m√∂chte ....

.. auch die Itemsauswahl ist seher klein, man findet kaum was besseres, mein Zwerg und mein Zauberer laufen immer noch mit ihreren gleichnamigen Items rum ... 

.. und die Gef√§hrtenaufteilung/Wahl ist auch schlecht durchdacht, man verliert im Laufe des Spiels einen sehr guten Begleiter und dieser wird dann durch eine sehr sehr nutzlose, schwache "Hexe" ersetzt, hier w√§r mir eine freie Begleitauswahl ala Dragon Age, Mass Effekt oder Drakensang  bei weitem lieber und auch Sinnvoller gewesen .....


... wie ich am Anfang schon sagte ist das Spiel nicht so schlecht, aber es braucht halt noch ein paar Updates um es Spielbarer zu machen, ich bin auf jeden Fall noch gespannt was da noch kommen wird, falls dies nun alles schon geweisen sein sollte, sollte man das Spiel nur dann kaufen wenn man ein gro√üer DSA Fan ist und man auf Herausforderungen steht ;D

author: {'steamid': '76561198035158750', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 11184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1926, 'last_played': 1481303331}
review:
this is a fantasic game.plenty of variety in how to build your char.but i do have a few problems with points distribution.what is good for one fight can basically get you killed in another.there is some type of balance required imo.alos major abilities only drop by book.i got one or possibly 2 and i,m on chapter 2.given that this game will only have 5 chapters i think i dont possibly see how you can come across the spells for major abilities.there must be 20+ of them.
its early in the day for this game but it is very well polished and playable and imo well worth the money..my 2 cents.

review: Veteran player from the first RPG MMO genre launched, this game has the feel of a final fantasy tactics with much more depth for character customization. author: {'steamid': '76561198017109742', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 899, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 882, 'last_played': 1419713413}
review:
A fun game. The tactics are pretty basic so far; there isn't much you can do to manipulate the battlefeild after the first few fights. The leveling system is intresting, though they need to improve the explanations of the various abilities. Also nice gear selection. The characters and plot are intresting so far, and the art is lovely. 

I think this game will be a lot better as it is polished and finished, but I've been enjoying it so far. Basic, but fun if you don't want to think to heavily.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026626109', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 6796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1188, 'last_played': 1392172436}
review:
I bought this because I was bored. And WL2, did pospone their Beta.
And man Im happy.
Its not really my style to play the bad guy. I'm always nice in computer games.
The game has so good npc, they are so colorful. (The dwarf remind me of the dwarf Khelgar, or Wrex from ME.)

The game is hard and sometimes unforgiving, but they never cheat, and there are no scripted events, there is always a possebilety to save an npc (Even if it is microscopic.)

If you like turnbase, fantasy, love a good story, want a laugh or two. This is your game.

review: Blackguards is still in "Early Access" but is turning-out to be a very enjoyable light RPG/tactical combat game. The mood is somewhat dark, as opposed to "We are the Good Guys!" we see in so many heroic fantasy games, with all of your companions -- and yourself -- having a "shady side." For example, a central theme to the story is that you were falsely accused of murder but, as the story develops, you are starting to suspect that maybe you DID do it. . .

author: {'steamid': '76561197982687976', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2175, 'last_played': 1390619530}
review:
I mentioned that I would edit my review once I had played more of the game, and I've finished most of Chapter 3 at this point, and wanted to weigh in again, now that there is more content available. Once again, I really enjoy the gameplay. X-Com fans will appreciate the turn based strategy. My earlier concerns regarding the limitations of the trainer system which inhibited true freedom in character development have been lessened however. I still would prefer true freedom to spend my experience points, but the additional content gives you plenty of fights and quests with which to expand your characters, as well as more trainers with the important abilities available to train for. If you are looking for cool loots though, prepare to be disappointed. The emphasis is really more on the characters themselves. As you progress through the story, upgrades of weapons that are marginally better are available, but using merchants to upgrade your characters gear doesn't really feel as fun as beating some monsters or bad guys and finding a cool weapon or magic item.

Overall, I feel the additional content pushes this game from 'not recommended' to 'recommended'. I am particularly excited for when they add more depth to character creation, as this will allow me to pick some starting skills that will more coincide with how I want to build my character. For example, warriors start with the skill that improves your attack when using a shield. If you want to build a 2-Hand sword wielding warrior, this skill is just a waste. But with the new system, hopefully you can skip that in favor of another cool skill.

review:
Love the game so far and can't wait for another chapter to open up the story line. The whole thing has and old school-cool, well rounded feel, and the turn-based fights have always been my favorite!

However, a bit more variety in the character customisation at the start would be nice - so deciding in the beginning if my melee fighter should start with sword or spear skills - just giving the player a bit more of a choice... I don't know if that point is coming across correctly. But all in all, I think the developers can be very proud of blackguards: smooth, solid gameplay, fml-moments, loveable characters, face palms and lols - all included! ^^

I really, honestly like it a lot! :D and if I had any game-playing friends, I would definately recommend it to them! XD

author: {'steamid': '76561198009306306', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 5931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3610, 'last_played': 1395955427}
review:
Great game all around. It is based on the Pen and Paper game The Dark Eye (TDE or DSA in German) and follows the latest edition rules pretty closely. The combat is turnbased and already (despite early access) very well animated. 

The difficulty of this game is rather high. I know the ruleset from my P&P groups and am a very experienced player of turnbased games and I found several battles quite challenging, yet fun. It is not a Fire-Emblem kind of challenge where one wrong move means that your favourite charakter dies, but it is the self-motivation "Hmm if I do this a little different I COULD save the Baroness".

Also this game shows several great ideas and aspects I am missing in many other games. Interactive environment (Cut a rope so a chandelier smashes some guards), diverging story lines, and the possibility to fail (sometimes) and still continue with your story.

Overall this is a great game that I can recommend to everyone with love for Pen and Paper games as well as challenging turn-based games.

review: I really like this game, the graphics and animations are tight, very fluid, the engine behind the battles is great, very roll of the dice feel. The game is hard and challenging but at the same time very relaxing and good for a quiet night of gaming.  The only problem i would have with it is that the inventory weight is shared between all the heroes and the fact u cant equip items mid battle, i get why you cant but its still bothersome when i need a certain item and cannot get it, or am thrown into an unknown battle without prep time, otherwise this game is sick. The way you level and gain skills/spells for each character is very neat too! I realy enjoy the story, you feel for the characters and when u get hit hard you cringe and rethink all your stratagies for that fight.  This game is fantastic i recommend that everyone try this at least once.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002870741', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 882, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1397411097}
review:
Updated impressions to Full Version below:

Blackguards is the first Early Access game i really want to recommend!
First it¬¥s quite well developed already (but surely not without some roughness, especially regarding balancing, texting and bugs), second
because they did two things very well:

Second it actually is a good game in the Realms of Arkania/Das Schwarze Auge universe, since the last ones (Demonicon, Schicksalsklinge HD) were poorest crap.
Secondary it brings a new genre to this rpg system - the strategy (yeah i know, they also did two adventures already, but imo adventure and rpg are not that different).

Also they try to bring a bit of a more grey atmosphere to the normally strictly black and white world of Arkania, you play as a convicted murderer, your party also consists of the strangest fellows like addicts, fanatics and so on.
Though this all Daedalic manages to stay true to the typical rpg feeling as well as presents it with quite some bit of humour as well.
You are somewhat limited in creating your character (three classes only, race and sex are fix) but the skill system (which represents the RoA rules surprisingly well) offers quite some flexibility to process all the characters the further the game progresses.
This mixture of freedom and linear story telling, continues throughout the game, while you visit the locations to progress the main storyline, you have always some options for side quests, which offer a variety of goals.

The battles themself remind me for one of Expeditions:Conquistador, where cover and strategically well placement of your characters is as important as choosing the right means of attack.
They also try to keep the battles different with traps, different obstacles as well as victory conditions.

As the game is still in development i can¬¥t ultimately write about the story, but so far the characters are well done and the development is quite interesting.
So if you either like the realms of arkania universe or are a strategy fan, you can give this one a try.


Update:
In the full version Daedalic has implemented kind of free character generation, since many players wanted this and not only the pre made classes.

Well.. the plus is, Daedalic tried to give the fans what they wanted..
the minus is that they implemented it very half heartedly, it¬¥s an ugly, short creation process, with nearly no explanation about classes or whatever (the only choosing here is a single mage yes/no button?!)
Also you kinda notice that the game was made with a hunter class in mind, if you create some very different hero, you may not find the best stuff/make the most out of it.

Also i still get some stuttering issues/cut off ends of cut scenes, so they didn¬¥t improve this much.

All in all, this may be small points, but they damper a good first impression..

author: {'steamid': '76561197971481700', 'num_games_owned': 2192, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 1712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 934, 'last_played': 1430263837}
review: I'm really enjoying this game, even in early-access. It still needs some polish, but it is very impressive at its current stage. The characters, while not very deep during Chapter 1 (only chapter available yet, of 5), are still very fun and you get a good sense of their personalities through their dialogue and opinions on the situations. I see a lot of potential with this game. The combat can be a little shallow at the moment, ending up with just moving across the battlefields and attacking/healing as necessary, but I also have not acquired many of the bountiful skills available. Plenty of skills available, but the game does not hold your hand; acquiring and saving the necessary points is definitely part of the challenge and not unwelcome. While it definitely isn't paced to have you being dragonslayers within the first few hours, it isn't overly difficult either. A few battles required multiple tries from me, but only because I was trying to reach bonus objectives in the alloted time. I've burnt through other SRPGs and got bored within the first few hours of playing, but this game has just enough flavor and interest to keep me coming back to the well for more. It is not a AAA title by any means, but an impressive soundtrack, very believable voice-acting and dialogue, and earnest, hard work prove to be more than any flash and bang a mainstream title would use. Once again, very impressed with the quality of this product. I am in it for the longhaul now, and very interested to see where this (and possible future titles) go. Bravo.

review: I was looking for this kind of game for a while. Really nice turn-based rpg with depth and class. Not a console port, crippled rpg game like Dragon Age 2. Even though it is based on TDE as well, its not like "Shadows over Riva", but its definitly a great game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197996847709', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 554, 'last_played': 1390849775}
review:
Very nice ideas, even if it lacks in graphics, something oldschool soaring through gameplay. The battles are well balanced and P&P* smoothly combined with turn based initiative system, like in jRPG or Kings Bounty. Nothing more nothing less, the towns are just interactive scenes with available hot spots, side quest, healer, tavern, shop. And this lets you concentrate on pure turn based combat. Mostly I enjoyed the tactic spots on the battlefield, like slippery mud, burning wood and bushes, shooting chandelier and so on. And the voice over is great, such racy accents!

* Updated thanks to the [onkelkarlie] firstly I thought that this game uses D&D ruleset, but it uses the P&P rules from german "The Dark Eye"
